3.description: The staff are nice and pleasant very respectful and kind. The food is good also I would come here over and over again.

1.description: crappy, crappy service. good pancakes. terrible orange juice... the chorizo skillet was full of potatoes with not nearly enough of anything else.

0.description: For what the area has to offer for breakfast, this place will do the trick. Nothing was bad, per se, but everything was your standard breakfast staples. Prices are cheap-moderate, being $6-$8 on average per plate. I ordered the YOYIS special (i have no idea why they call it that. there's a YAYO oand a YOYIS...idk) which was 2 pieces of bacon, 3 eggs, and pancakes. i added hashbrowns for another $3The pancakes had this weird sour after taste. They were large and fluffy, but it was like a baking soda flavor i couldn't get out of my mouth. I took two bites. They perfectly cooked my overmedium eggs. Hashbrowns had  a light crisp, which I like. The bacon was stick-straight and paper thin, which made me wonder... but tasted fine.service was acceptable. atmosphere was clean, but very outdated. green, plastic-like booths. it was dark inside with dark wood paneling, i believe.... not very cozy or welcoming. if i had to have a breakfast spot, this place would do. but really, i don't think I'd come again, and wouldn't think to go out of my way to come here

2.description: Worst place to work at. 2009-2010.Kitchen staff would drop food and put that right on the plate.Found a hair in my soup, but I brushed it off because I was an employee. Disgusted, definitely.I also saw things in the back I wish I could take back. Don't ever go here!!

5.description: Standard diner stuff. A lot of Hispanic dishes (it's in a predominately Hispanic neighborhood). Fast service and the best, crappy diner coffee I've ever had.They have some really nice specials that come with a lot of food. The owners and staff are really friendly as well.

6.description: This place must have changed, considering all the reviews I've seen.  Let me sum up my experience with one word, or sound rather, "Ewwww!"  We arrived on a Saturday moring around 11am, we were told to sit wherever we liked, so we did.  We sat at a booth, which was by the window, it also had three used butter packets in the butter dish, with only two new butter packets, weird...but I let it go.  Then, the waitress gets our order, (all american skillet and peach  pancakes with a Coke) the food arrives and the waitress is very nice and says, "Enjoy your food!" Awww very nice of her, and maybe we would have enjoyed it if she would have given us SILVERWARE, or if the food was fresh, or maybe a little if she didn't forget my friend's  Coke!  So, when I finally got a fork, I took a bite of the WORST skillet I have ever had! The bacon tasted funny (like keep eating this you'll end up with the runs funny). The potatoes were greasy and hard (not hard uncooked hard, but old, they've been sitting for hours hard). The eggs smelled and were blotchy, serious blotchy eggs? Anyway, do I really have to go any further? Never...ever...again!

7.description: Nothing all that special. Bacon & eggs kinda place. Had the corned beef hash straight outta the can. Weak coffee to round out a wholly unmemorable breakfast

8.description: Your typical neighborhood diner ,fast friendly service ,huge portions ,consistenltly good food .The place can get pretty packed on weekends for brunch but have never had to wait for a seat .Try their breakfast skillets .

9.description: This diner has been here aprox. 20 yrs.  The menu is huge and the prices very reasonable. I highly recommend the potato pancakes .

10.description: Great place for breakfast or lunch. It gets pretty crowded on sunday mornings...but the restaurant is big enough to hold a good amount of people! Cheap prices and hearty plates make for a tasty breakfast diner!

4.description: Went for easter and it looked decent but smelled like unclean wet rag.  I went with my family for breakfast (so there is no excuse to have a dirty rag, as its still the beginning of the day).  I actually got sick a few hours later.  I had the omelet. I would not go back again!

3.description: Its really hard to fine a good taco spot in the north side but man so worth it and just a $1 for a taco everyday can't beat it

1.description: Good tacos, not great. Very good refried beans, terrible rice.Very cheapClean divey joint.

2.description: One question.  Will I ever be hungry again.  Look, we questioned the location, once inside we almost left.  The place is clean and comfortable, our interaction with the server/hostess was just awkward.  Once at the table it all got good.  No alcohol is served (sigh) but every single thing we ordered was tasty, fresh and Jurassic in size.  The guacamole app was enough to serve a family of 8...and their friends.  SO good.  The burrito and quesadilla were equally as large and flavorful.  Seriously, what a well kept, well hidden venue of goodness.  Come here hungry...

9.description: Shrimp tacos were fresh and well seasoned. I'm definitely a fan now. I've lived over here 3 1/2 years and saw the reviews and decided to do carry out. Staff was REALLY nice, energetic and made me want to come back for more.  Wish I had gotten more and wish the tacos were a bit bigger. My ONLY complaint.  I most certainly will be going back soon.  I'm hooked.

10.description: When I walked into this fairly new restaurant there was a group of people huddled around the bar area and everyone looked surprised I was there, including the waitress who didn't know what to do.  Finally the chef came out and told me to sit wherever I wanted.  I suppose they must have thought I was an inspector or something. The waitress, who was a pretty Mexican girl, was fairly attentive but never smiled and spent most of my meal looking at her shoes in what appeared to be agony at being there.  I ordered the queso fundido w/ chorizo and the enchiladas suizas rojas.  The food was really outstanding.  The queso fundido came swimming in its own fat and the flour tortillas that came with them were obviously toasted on a greasy griddle.  At first I balked, but then I remembered my culinary training and the adage "Fat equals flavor", and oh was this dish delicious.  I think the calories could have kept a basketball team fed for a week but it was yummy.  The enchilladas were also delicious mainly due to the wonderfully intricate rojas sauce that it was served with.  The chef said he toasts the five different chiles that are used in the sauce giving it extra flavor.  The chicken itself should have been shredded to make it a little more tender and easier to eat but the dish was good.I have high hopes that this restaurant will get over its birth pains and find a way to get the waitress to develop a more friendly demeanor.  The food here is worth a try.

4.description: Simply amazing!  Their tacos are a must have and smaller than other places so you can try a variety without feeling guilty.  Just by tasting them, you will be able to tell that the owner, Guillermo, really takes pride in his food.  I was so impressed that I also hired a taquero guy from them for a fundraising event I was having.  Everyone had nothing but great things to say about them.  You can easily pass up the place if you're not looking for it so keep your eyes peeled.  Go in and check them out today, you'll thank me later!

6.description: This is a very small hidden restaurant but a MUST go to. The service is unlike any service that is given now a days. Its a family owned restaurant with one cook and one waitress. She is very attentive, polite and very nice. To top it off, everything is delicious and very cheap! We have ordered them for two Taquizas and we will continue to come back. We recommend to all of our friends and family and they are never disappointed.

12.description: Today was my first time coming to Memo's Tacos. My fiancé, brothers, and brother in law have been raving about this place for the longest time and I finally decided to give it a try. Don Guillermo is the owner and knows almost all my family. He gets his business from word of mouth and it travels fast. Today,  I had a super torta, which consists of mayo, grilled chicken, ham, cheese, and bacon topped with lettuce, avocado, tomatoes and onion on French bread and it's HUGE. The portion was enormous for the price and it included fries. Like most Mexican restaurants, we were served fresh crunchy tortilla chips with two homemade salsas. We were also given a small portion of beans with nopales (cactus) and fresh cheese and it all tasted amazing. Don Guillermo asked for suggestions and constructive criticism, as his restaurant is very new and he's looking to gain popularity. I wish him the best and I hope his restaurant gains great success. He cooks the food himself and with great pride.  You don't get that at most restaurants where stuff is pre-made the night before. This food is made fresh off the grill and the atmosphere is one of a family restaurant. I look forward to trying more of his menu items soon.

5.description: Stopped in a couple of weeks ago to try these $1 tacos.  They were delicious but small, which you can kind of expect at that price. The salsa and hochata was good. The waitress was nice.  The place is a simple restaurant and they have a great menu.  When I'm in the area,  I'll return.  I'm interested in trying the burrito.

11.description: We stumbled upon this place as we got tired of waiting for the freight train on Narragansett and boy I am glad the train stopped us.  Memo's Tacos has great authentic Mexican food and it's BYOB!  They have lots of traditional dishes and some unique taco combinations that are definitely worth trying.  The salsa changes every time we go there, and we have never been disappointed by any of the salsas, they are all delicious!  You can tell that the cook loves his restaurant by the way he cooks his food, with passion and innovation.  The waitress there already knows my usual order and always greets us with a smile as we walk in.  I highly recommend Memo's Tacos to anyone looking for a quick bite or a casual night out.

8.description: So nasty!!!! Coming from Los Angeles where we actually do have genuine food, this place is a waste of money!  The meat in the "tampiquena" was raw! & the "caldo de pollo" was literally only chicken no vegetables no flavor just boiled chicken! Yuck! The burritos have no rice or beans inside so be advised to ask for some! Their salsa is way too spicy, bottom line dont waste your time coming here!

0.description: Let start by saying, "I love tacos". I have been here twice now and each time my experience has been consistently great. My rating is primarily based on their tacos, salsa and service.  First, they start you with freshly made chips and 4 salsas, each one better then the next. Be aware, they all range from hot to really hot, but I'm cool with that. Most of their tacos sell for $1 each. They are a bit smaller but are crazy good. The meats are fresh and seasoned perfectly. The pollo el pastor is the bomb. The beans are great and the rice just average, but I don't go out for Mexican to eat rice. The staff are all friendly. The physical environment looks a bit aged with no trendy ambiance, but screw that, I'm here to eat tacos. I talked to the owner/cook who was genuinely concerned about my experience. He informed me that at 3pm everyday they have a taco bar, $1 a taco, not sure how late it goes but I'm definitely checking that out next time. I would like to finish this review by saying, "I love tacos". ¡buen provecho!

7.description: I just got back from eating at Memo's. It's a place you could easily pass up if you don't know what to look for. We did a tasting for a party my friends are having and our table ate quite a few tacos.I had the pollo al pastor tacos which were probably the best chicken tacos I've ever had in my life! I had three on my plate and could have easily eaten an entire extra plate of them. My friends had a steak one with chorizo which they absolutely loved too. The owner was super nice. To top it off, his catering prices are super cheap! As for a meal, where else can you get excellent tacos for $1 each? I will definitely be going back there.

3.description: this location is smaller compared to the one in north riverside but its closer to my job so i stopped in here. i love tonys cuz they have a lot of ethnic foods that i cant find anywhere else.  sometimes ive asked for help while im in the store & nobody speaks english so they werent able to help me. not cool. but i still like the selection and prices of the food so i"ll come back eventually.

1.description: I have a love and hate relationship with this store.  I hate the parking and the other shoppers. Most of the people that shop here are just rude and ghetto. I guess that's why they make people use that quarter system for a cart like they do at Aldi's. It's always packed in here and the lines are long,  but the prices are amazing. I find almost everything I need from ethnic groceries to fresh baked French bread.  They are pretty good at keeping the shelves well stocked.

2.description: First, They need to train the people at the Deli counter how the number system works as the guy with number 49 was serviced before me with number 42.Second, there was nowhere telling you what number they are on. They have a new electronic number machine and there's a  CRT screen but it was blank, Either it was broke or the employees don't know how to work it. If I get number 42 and they are on 21 I can do some shopping and come back But not here.Third, If you don't like shopping with family's that bring all their young children hyped up on sugar with them this is not the store for you as they are all running around like its a Chuck E. Cheese'. you have to be very alert so you don't hit em your  cart, or they run into you.Forth, The Parking lot is a Zoo. and you need a quarter for a cart

9.description: An extra star because the recently renovated the entire store.  They've expanded their selections and widened their aisles.The parking is still horrendous, and they now require a deposit to use their carts.  Sadly, these two reasons are why I probably wouldn't bother coming back unless it was a total emergency.

10.description: Cheap Food!  What more can I say.  The deli guy is great.  If you get something, he'll tell you "Don't get that, this one taste better and it's cheaper."  I love that.  They always have what I need stocked as well.

4.description: This place is a zoo on the weekend but can't blame the store for it. They have everything at the best prices. Ladies at the checkout are fast.

6.description: 2 Stars for Parking! 3 Stars for Customer Service! 4 Stars for food quality.I love coming her for my latin spices and food item they have very delicious desserts for VERY low prices.....They parking here is horrible....you have to put a quarter in to use a cart and some people are just so serious about getting their quarters back it's almost embarrassing.besides that eh it's ok....sometimes not sure if it's worth the hassle.

12.description: Wow. both times I've been here I have been super wasted. Poor Tony's employees; they're probably sick of crazy drunk people stuffing burritos down their throats!Anyway, from what I remember, this is a totally decent burrito place. Anything like what you'd find in the mission of San Francisco? Or little Mexico in Modesto, CA? (I heart El Rosal) Um, No. Definitely not. But will it suffice when you're starving and need something cheap and quick to eat? Yes, it will. My appetite was appeased after my Tony's burrito and they were totally sweet! They put up with us and had great customer service.I mean, I don't plan to frequent Tony's but they do a good job at what they do. Cheap. Better than decent. Quick. Mexican food.

5.description: Parking lot to this place is a pain in the butt! Very small and always filled with traffic!.  However as a store it had everything I was looking for even if I couldn't get an associate to really guide me in the correct direction I needed to go.Cashier was eh so so didn't smile nor really greet with much energy needs some improvement but otherwise its a great Tony's in the city!

13.description: Been shopping here since they opened about 15 years ago. They have great prices on everything but the meats. Always overpriced, I prefer to shop fresh market across the street for meats half the price. Best French bread fresh out of the oven early in the morning. Look out for the drunks and the residents from the nursing home down the street their always in the lot begging for money. Best time to shop early morning, this store is a madhouse after 3 PM every day. They recently added new shopping carts the kind you need a quarter to unlock, very annoying if you don't have a quarter and have to wait in line to get change.

11.description: Vomit inducing burritos. Cold enchiladas.BUT they deal with drunk people well.

8.description: Imagine a grocery store where the hipster clique meets the slightly less than well off.  Tony's offers a great selection of "finer foods" at really competitive prices.  I often visit this place as for the mainstays and off to a, well, undisclosed location for other quality items.  The pricing at the meat counter makes you question what you're really getting ($4.99/lb for ribeye... really?) but you get no complaints from me - everything I've tried has been great.

0.description: I like to mix it up a bit in terms of where I grocery shop. I like fresh produce and i'm always looking for the best deals. Tony's has pretty low prices but they don't have the best deals. Kudos to them for having a pretty good poultry section since most stores just offer chicken breasts and ground turkey. An extra star for Tony's for having Materva (popular soft drink among Cubans). I haven't seen it anywhere else so I was excited to find it here. I also noticed that they had a lot of items that are from places like Columbia, Puerto Rico, etc that you may not be able to find at your local Jewel. I think some of the reviewers may have the wrong Tony's in mind because while this place has a prepared food section it's not a restaurant and it's a family area so not many drunks stumbling in.

7.description: I'm not particularly fond of this place. It's overpriced, it's always packed and the cashiers aren't the brightest bunch so actually I dread coming here. The butchers have no idea how to cut a piece of meat so why do I return? Convenience. It's so close and they're open fairly late so that's the main reason that keeps the customers coming back. Fresh Market closes at 8 so all the people that work late come here for last minute shopping.Piece of advice...NEVER come here on Thanksgiving. It's a madhouse that not even Jewel can describe.

0.description: Most of the clients that come here probably do not use YELP!!!  I have been getting my hair cut here since I was a baby!!!  It is a great place...hard to break tradition!!!

Karyn had incredibly unique and high quality gifts.  We had a mix up on an order that Karyn helped walk us through (not sure the order was made properly on our end).  She was patient, helpful and a true professional.We will continue ordering our personalized minky baby blanket gifts through Karen in the future !

28.description: The only good thing about this place is that they deliver. But WHAT they deliver negates that one good thing about this place.The guacamole was brown and not the least bit fresh, nor did it come with any chips! The carne asada in the tacos was more like ground beef. There was no cheese on the tacos and the cilantro on them was old and wilted. The red salsa was made with a louisiana hot-sauce base (I like louisiana hot sauce, but not in mexican salsa). Since I was hungry and I'd spent $31 on all this I ate what I could...until I got halfway through the second taco and found a long hair in it - NOT mine. DISGUSTING.Never again.

1.description: Food was crap! Even though the delivery wasn't too bad (as in didn't take too long), I ordered a ham skillet and it was so dry and the potatoes were black and burnt. So Gross. In total I ordered two ham skillets and a side of pancakes and had to dish out $30 for meals waaay under par.

39.description: Food-tastrophe! This is what happens when you come home, find a flyer stuck in your door, call the place and order. I can get dirt cheap anywhere so when a new place is looking for a spot on my go-to list for delivery I only have one request: MAKE GOOD FOOD! This place definitely fell short of my low expectations. I had chicken tacos and while they were very flavorful, I kept finding tons of fatty chunks. Nothing kills an appetite like biting into a squishy piece of fat bursting with oil...yum right? The rice was flavorless and the beans were average at best. My boyfriend had the steak tacos and he said they were pretty good but agreed with me on the rice. I also feel it's necessary to mention that the salsa tubs they include with the tacos were spicy but lacking any flavor and terribly oily. Delivery was quick but I will not order from this place again. I was left feeling disgusted with my meal and that's not cool.

9.description: Never ever ordering from here again. Ordered via Grub Hub, chocolate milkshake, can of soda, and an Italian sandwich (Italian sub). The location is 15 minutes away from my house. Took them AN HOUR AND A HALF to get here. For a sandwich that requires no cooking. I kept calling the restaurant and all they could tell me is that driver left 20 minutes ago and will be there shortly..this happened 3 times. Absolutely ridiculous not to mention I had to call Grub Hub and have my funds refunded to my credit card. Even after Grub Hub hub canceled my order they still delivered it..again an HOUR AND A HALF later!!! The best part is my milkshake was warm and soupy. And the rest of my order was completely wrong. Would never recommend this place and I certainly will not be ordering from here ever again!!

29.description: What do you do when you don't want to cook, tired of pizza and too poor for GOOD Chinese? El Ranchito! We ordered here around 10:30 at night on Grubhub. The menu was huuuuge. I got my usual chicken flautas while the other ordered the three taco plate (steak) and we also ordered the super nachos. Since we ordered over 20 or 25 ( can't remember) we got a free 2 liter which is nice. I gave the driver the correct address but the wrong apartment number. I didn't notice this till about an hour and fifteen minutes after ordering. (the time estimate was a little under an hour) I called and they corrected it pretty easily and the driver came about 3 minutes after I called them. So the food was twenty minutes later than expected but the wrong apt number may have to do with that. The flautas were good, the beans and rice, even better! Mike loved his tacos, the fresh avocado was nice. We barely touched the nachos, we were way too full! I was kind of annoyed when the nachos were bad by the next afternoon. They were not edible at all and went to waste. Other than that the food and prices were good.

23.description: I love the daytime waitress and who can beat a $2 Margarita on a Friday afternoon? I can't imagine why anyone who love authentic Mexican wouldn't adore this place. It has a loud night club scene which I avoid but all the food I've had and my dozens of guests has been amazing.

5.description: I was there  last  night  December 5 about  12pm with 6 more  people  really  nice atmosphere live music  we didn't  eat. I ask the price  for a bucket of miller  light  a waitress  told me $20  so we order 3 buckets  we stay  there  for about  3 hours  we went  to the register  to pay  and they  charge me $75 for 3 buckets  of miller  ligh $15 more  I was confused  about it  and there  was a guy  before  me who was trying  to complement  one of  the ladies  at the register  I'm an educated  person so I walk away  but stilling  from customers  is not ok I will make sure that  an  Illinois  inspector have the chance to go there and experience  how they take money out  of  your  wallet. I will  never going  back and I recommend  to double  check  before  you  pay your check. For the Illinois liquor  administration  they don't  card anyone  so if you  are under age you can buy alcohol  there.

31.description: I order from this place a lot. It's not because it's such a great place, but due to a lack of options. Here's a bullet pointed run down:The service: I've never really had a problem with their service, although I've given up on them trying to get my last name right (fair enough, it's not a common last name, but it's Spanish!) . Their attitude ranges from polite to indifferent. I just figure if they're curt with me, it's because they're extremely busy. They're usually more polite when I order in Spanish.The menu: Huge. You can order pretty much anything. And it's actually a pretty good value. The food: I'd say it's fairly good. I generally order it for delivery, and while it has always come in a timely manner, it will have cooled down significantly by the time it gets to my house. I've gotten used to nuking it for thirty seconds after it comes to the door. I imagine if it was delivered hot it would be a lot better. Personally, I'd rather wait an extra twenty minutes to ensure that it comes to my door hot rather than have to throw it in the microwave.The verdict: If this place didn't deliver until silly o'clock in the morning, I probably wouldn't bother with them. If you live in their delivery area, and you're feeling hungry and lazy -especially if it's late at night- then go ahead and give them a call. Otherwise, you're better off going to Taco Burrito King.

25.description: Disgusting. Me and my girlfriend couldn't finish our food. This place fell off. My steak chimichanga was filled with pieces of fat. One of the sauces they gave us had a dead bug on the lid. My girlfriends taco salad did not have much meat and her avocados looked real old. Obviously we didnt finish our food. A couple of friends also toolsl told us that they stopped ordering food from there as well due to there decline in quality.

12.description: Ordered the food Sunday. After an hour and a half, I called in to see why it was taking so long, delivery time was 45 mins. to an hour. Lady answers and says the driver left, I add "he left an hour and a half ago? my order is 30 minutes late already." She says she will contact driver and call me back. 15 minutes later, she says he is 10 minutes away. I wait. 20 minutes pass, i call again and refuse the order and explain I want a full refund. She asks "if i give you a discount will you accept the food". I am hungover and know the food will be cold, tacos taste bad reheated. I refuse, she sighs and places me on hold. Comes bak to the phone and says "what if I don't charge you delivery?" I say "no, i want a full refund". She says sorry and we are done. 10 minutes later, the driver calls that he is outside. WTH?!?

37.description: Sure, you can get better Mexican food at other restaurants, but the amazing thing about El Ranchito is that they deliver until 4 in the morning on weekends and they take GrubHub orders. Seriously, who can complain? When you're having a late night and you want that late-night taco, this is the place to order from.And the food is good, after all. It's not spectacular, but it's good. In addition, the menu selection is HUGE. Tacos and the like are sort of bland (the beef usually seems a little tough), but their dishes like ceviche and chiles rellenos are surprisingly tasty. Their guacamole is decent, though it's packed with shredded cheese and has an . . . interesting smoky bacony flavor. Not sure what that's all about. The guacamole also appears to be immortal. I can fish it out of the fridge three days later and it's still brilliant green. I'm not sure if that's a good thing, or whether or not there's some correlation with the bacony flavor.Definitely order via GrubHub; ordering over the phone is painfully slow. The delivery guy always gets lost in Oak Park, but we forgive him because he comes all this way. :)  (One caveat: they have on occasion forgotten to bring a bottle of Coke when we order one.)

21.description: Food took FOREVER to arrive, and when it did, one entree was totally inedible (the fajita dinner smelled like they had pulled it out of a dumpster, from other reviews this seems to be a common thing) and the other entree (chili rellenos) was mediocre.  The dessert we ordered was missing altogether.  All around bad experience.  We will never order from this place again.

16.description: Yikess. I worked late, so that meant my food choices were limited. My boyfriend and I ordered from here through Grubhub around midnight. Grubhub kept sending us updates about our order. Our estimated delivery time was around 1 A.M.. It said it was out for delivery around 12:30 AM. We were excited that we'd get the food earlier than planned. It meant we could eat and go to sleep sooner. El Ranchito apparently had other plans. Our status stayed like that for about an hour.We ended up contacting Grubhub. They had to refund our money as the food was still sitting in the restaurant. They were apparently just going to deliver the food after they closed at 2AM.... Uhhh not okay. They did end up bringing it after closing time, which was such an inconvenience. We had to stay up and wait for it. The food wasn't very good once we got it. It was pretty cold by then. I was a little nervous about eating my tacos since they had been sitting out for so long, especially since they had sour cream on them. All in all, I wouldn't order from here again.

17.description: Food was not good and unfortunately was cold on top of that. Maybe I caught them on a really bad day? Also I almost called grub hub cause the delivery took nearly 2 hours

10.description: really dissatisfied. I ordered Caldo de res, Horchata and a mini burrito plate. They sent my Horchata inside a bag along with the soup and guess what? spilled all over! when i called the The restaurant I was on hold for 10 minutes and when she finally came back she asked me if I wanted to place my order! she came back completely forgot i was on hold. after telling her again, she spoke to the chef and the delivery driver and they said my order was fine really?? poor service. said i'll get a credit for the soup when i order again.. i think not.

11.description: My boyfriend sister and I ordered good from here one night. While the delivery was in the time frame given, the food was disgusting. I ordered the enchilada dinner, and, being Mexican, I'm not stranger to spice. I almost started choking on how spicy it was. It was extremely spicy but had no flavor whatsoever. The pork burrito tasted like the meat was cooked in beer and the pork was fat chunks rather than meat. My boyfriend said the quesadilla was alright, however, and I ended up eating French fries for dinner because that was the only thing palatable to me.My advice to anyone looking to buy food from here? Don't.

26.description: YUCK! This is why i never go out and eat Mexican food. I am up late, my family works night shifts and i am strapped for time. It was 12am and everyone wanted tacos. I ordered from here. My tacos were mucky if that's even possible.... the avocado and cilantro were brown :( and my tongue was undercooked..... now that can get someone sick... i ahd the poopsies the rest of the night.... my food was cold when it arrived as well and there were hardly any rice and beans. I gave a coupon for a free tamale and told the man when i ordered it that i had the coupon, they brought the one tamale i ordered seperately but not the one for the coupon and insisted that they brought it -_- never happening again. I'd rather take some time and make my own tacos which ar eat least half-way decent.

27.description: We ordered two pizzas from El Ranchito.  When I got them from the delivery guy, I smelled exhaust, but just thought it was him or his car. My mom noticed the smell as well, while we were eating and then smelled her pizza she was eating and said "This smells like gas." She passed it around and sure enough, it did. We looked at the bottom of the pizza box and saw they were wet and smelled them closely and they smelled like gas. That's not the worst part -the worst part was when we called to inform them of this. Both my husband and I called the place, spoke with the manager who is apparently also the owner. He handled the situation extremely poorly. I was livid because my 6 year old daughter was eating this pizza with us and possibly consuming gasoline! He sent the delivery driver back out to "smell the pizza and pizza boxes".  When the driver did not show up for 15 minutes I called back and spoke with the owner. He could not have cared less for our situation. I told him I wanted our money back, all of it and did he know how serious this could be. He said "If you get sick, go to the hospital."  I said "And you'll pay the doctor bills?!" and he said "Yeah". I will never order any food from here again. All of us had headaches that night, either from the smell and possible consumption of gasoline or having to deal with the owner to get our money back (he offered us another pizza - no thanks.) Our pizza box bottom was wet with gasoline and the owner could not have cared less. I strongly recommend getting food from somewhere else!

35.description: It's california type mexican food, which i LOVE, being from California and all.... Its perfect because they deliver, it's cheap, and its TONS of food,The nachos are awesome!! If your a fan of mexican food definitely try this place!!

8.description: What can I say the worst food you can possibly have in your entire life.  Thank god I got this meal on groupon which won't do it any justice at all.  This place isn't even worth a groupon priced bargain deal.  I would never want anyone to go through what I've just experienced.  I ordered 2 tacos and the Alfredo pasta what was I thinking.  It came with the most poor excuse of a salad and the garlic bread was disgusting.  The tacos dry meat with no flavor with tortillas you'd want to puke.  The pasta was horrible and after 2 bites I was done I couldn't take it.  I got it delivered which took 1 hour in anticipation I was in for a real treat yeah right.  The packaging was even untidy as the Alfredo sauce was all over the bag.  If you are thinking about making this a late night meal please order a cab and go through a McDonald's drive through.  I've now warned you what you do from here on out is only on your own wrongful on doing.

0.description: Burrito Suizo Dinner is the BOMB. If you really care about how long it takes to make and the nutritional value...you're not in this for the right reasons. El Ranchito should be ordered for the following reasons-1. It's late...like wayyy too late 2. You're starving and NEED Mexican food3. You need a good diet cheat4. You don't want to get groceries for the next 2 days (HUGE portions, bang for yo $)5. MunchiesSo don't waste your time reading these reviews that complain about the quality, or the delivery time. You're ordering take out for a reason...stop being so pretentious. Also all the delivery guys are really nice! Throw them some nice tips, they work hard.

38.description: Somewhat milder than I like, but they deliver til 4am some nights. :)

20.description: Burrito Suizo Dinner is the BOMB. If you really care about how long it takes to make and the nutritional value...you're not in this for the right reasons. El Ranchito should be ordered for the following reasons-1. It's late...like wayyy too late 2. You're starving and NEED Mexican food3. You need a good diet cheat4. You don't want to get groceries for the next 2 days (HUGE portions, bang for yo $)5. MunchiesSo don't waste your time reading these reviews that complain about the quality, or the delivery time. You're ordering take out for a reason...stop being so pretentious. Also all the delivery guys are really nice! Throw them some nice tips, they work hard.

19.description: Order at 8:30p.m didn't get food until 10:10 way to long . We order 4 steak dinners which  all of them were cooked different and chicken enchiladas . The steak dinners were all cold and none of them were written on to tell which one was well done med and med rare . Chicken enchiladas were grizzle piece of chicken went to garbage. Never order again gross .

33.description: It was 11:30 on a Wednesday and I had some friends over. We were all about half in the bag and this place was the only one open for delivery. The guy on the phone was friendly, the food arrived faster than they said it would, and the driver was friendly.We all ordered super nachos. They weren't very good and for some reason they had mozzarella sauce on them. We all dug in because that's all we had but we were pretty disappointed.

2.description: This place is garbage and should be shut down. I ordered a couple of days ago from here and the delivery was super late . On top of that the dumb ass timmy looking driver left with my change as if I didn't want it back retard ran to the car and took off as I was yelling at him to come back (thirsty) . I ordered a bacon double cheese burger which wasn't even cooked right the meat nor the bacon,  & cold fries. I also ordered a taco dinner which was also cold , steak was disgusting and extra salty rice was cold horchatas tasted generic as if it was out of a packet. NEVER AGAIN . FOR THOSE WHO WANNA ORDER FROM THIS PLACE DONT EVEN BOTHER WORST EXPERIENCE EVER.

34.description: Ordering from this place is horrible. I tried to order from the Milwaukee Ave. location yesterday. So last night, I got home around 5:30 and decided to order food. I called here because they have delivered to me previously and I had a menu of theirs in a drawer.  The guy that took my order asked me for a last name and then asked for my phone number and proceeded to take my order.  I told him that I would like to pay by credit card and he ran the transaction and told me it would take 45 mins.  I called back after an 1:15 minutes had gone by and asked where my order was?  This girl picks up the phone and abruptly puts me on hold...then she asks for my address and puts me on hold again...when she gets back on the phone she says that I don't have an order there and tries to explain to me that I have called the wrong location.  I asked her if each location has their own phone number and she stated that they do and then I told her well I just called the same number that I originally called to place my order.  Then the guy that I ordered from gets on the phone and asks me what I ordered, so I tell him the order and he quickly gets off the phone and the girl gets back on being apologetic but the guy in the background is saying that I gave them the wrong address.  I never gave them an address, because they didn't ask, so I figured I must be in their system.  I tried to explain this to the guy who then got on the phone with a rude demeanor and he gave me attitude.  I told him, dude, why wouldn't you confirm the address with me in first place and besides that, if the delivery guy is 30 mins late shouldn't he call? I then told him I want to cancel the order and then his tone quickly changed with, "well I can have your order out to you in 10mins" and at that point, I really had enough and told him to reverse my charges on the credit card and that I was cancelling the order.  (Seriously? I had been on the phone with them for about 10 mins)Seriously not the way that you should treat the customer...on their menu they have a seperate phone number for compliants, which I called because I wanted to make sure that my credit card wasn't charged but I got voicemail.  the complaint line is right in the middle of the menu, so I image that I am not the first or last one to complain about this joint.

32.description: They make a decent veggie taco, my kids love their horchata, and they deliver. Sometimes they forget things like straws, or sauce, or my drink, but that's okay! They deliver! =-) I haven't eaten in the restaurant in awhile, but we enjoyed our dinning experiences when we went.

18.description: They have a tendency to not get your order completely correct but the food still tastes really good! If you are a stickler for precision this is not the place for you. They make mistakes. Food is always yum though.

13.description: This has to be the worst customer service  ever,  I order through grub hub and my order was wrong when I called the lady at the restaurant  was arguing  with  me and hung up the phone.  I will definitely  never order from there again. On top of that the order came late on a Monday night.

4.description: THE WORSE EXPERIENCE EVER! I ordered a few days ago here and the Delivery was over a hour late. The manager only took off the delivery charge and said that's enough. Ordered at 1:10pm it didn't show up till 3:20pm. Food was cold and soggy and the bags were ripped open and the horchata we ordered was spilled inside the bag. NEVER ordering from them again it was my first and last time. Don't get me wrong I like salt but the tacos and torta were loaded with salt it tasted like. the delivery guy even called me before he got there and was like I just got caught by a train do you still want your food, like wtf I've already been waiting this long. I asked is it cold he said no.  They need to be taken off of grub hub asap!

24.description: Food poisoning, twice!... I know, kinda' my fault for going back, but I gave them another chance. I will never eat here again.Eat at your own risk.

6.description: Very low par for Mexican food.  The burrito was dry, and the guacamole tasted like it was out of a package.  Not only that, they immediately added my phone number to their text marketing, and I've gotten quite a few texts from them, even after opting out.  Don't order from them.  There are WAY better places.  I won't make the mistake again.

22.description: Terrible all around!Ordered food at 12:50 am was told it would be here at 2:15 am. Way to long for a restaurant a mile away from me at that time. When my food arrives it was 2:45 am. The restaurant closes at 2 am. Not like it was their rush hour.****Driver pulled up to my house honking his horn. Again at 2:45 AM!!Then waited for me on my steps which required me to go outside since I have along front porch.Guacamole tasted like plain avocado. Chips were clearly store bought. Cilantro on tacos was bad. Had to scrape it all off. Paid extra for sour cream, didn't get it. Horchata tasted funky, like it had gone bad. Could not even drink it. And Flan had a funky film on it. If the restaurant had still been open. I would have taken it back!Only good part was the free delivery for ordering 20 bucks worth of food!NEVER EVER AGAIN!!

15.description: Just ordered off GrubHub. Got my order before the time it said it would come, but the food is VERY sub-par. I got a steak burrito, which you can tell the meat was cooked and put into a container to sit all day and re-heat. It was edible, I guess; but nothing I would ever eat again. Also tried a tamale, which was super dry on one end and had to be cut off. The Guac was more onions than anything... I think there was more onion than avocado, which is not appetizing. And the prices are pretty high for such crappy food. Never again, enough said.

40.description: Ok, coupla good things about this place.  ONE, they deliver!  Which is unheard of for Mexican restaurants.  TWO, they stay open to an unGodly hour like 4 am or something.Traditional mexican fare.  Ownership seems to change and whenever that changes so does the quality. At one point their steak burritos, tacos were so greasy I couldn't stand it so I stopped ordering for a few months.  Then started again and the steak was normal again.  Chicken tacos, burritos always seem to be consistent.NEVER order the tamales, they must store them in a bread box cuz thery're consistently DRY!!!!  OK...so my recommendations:  Chicken nachos supreme are always dependable, order em with the works.  Tostadas with steak or chicken always dependable.  And actually they do a pretty good Mexican breakfast..huevos rancheros etc....AND the best part...they deliver it!!! LOL

7.description: My wife and I placed an online order at 7 pm Thursday night , they promised to deliver within an hour which is way to long to start off with . We called back at 8:30 pm and were told the driver was on his way, at 10 pm my wife called and complained aggressively (where the f### is my order , did you guys #### eat it !) . Our food was finally delivered at 10:45 pm - but its cool we got a free two liters..We won't order from there again .

36.description: Maybe it was because I tried to order on Valentine's day but I have been waiting 2.75 HOURS for my food to be delivered and I am still waiting.  And I know that the driver left 45 minutes ago.  The lady who took my order was extremely rude.  I did speak with the owners son who said that many people had already canceled their orders and that they are so busy that it can't be helped.  I would have been happy to order my food from somewhere else but now it's too late.  Bad Bad Job this time.  I have ordered from them a lot and it is usually very good but this time they really blew it.  Update:  My food was delivered after 3 hours.   It was cold, bland, and not really edible.  I was so hungry though I had to eat some of it.

30.description: They charge 1$ extra if you use a credit card. They don't tell you this when they give you the total and the receipt has the description of the charge blacked out. I called and asked what the random 1$ fee is for and the person answering the phone said the owner made them charge it. This is against Mastercard policy and I have reported El Ranchito for this. Check your receipts!

3.description: Took 2 1/2 hours to get my food delivered. The food may as well been cooked yesterday it was so cold

14.description: , the only reason I go here is because it's close to my house and they have menudo 7 days a week everything else is overpriced and barely average everytime I call for a call in order they tell me 10 minutes and I have to wait an additional 10 minutes

12.description: The food is good. Torta de milanesa, tacos de al pastor and tacos de tripas are all on point. The main reason I like this place is because the first time I stopped by, it was on a random night, 10 min before they closed. I wasn't even going to go in once I saw they were nearing their closing time, but the guy waved me in. I appreciated the gesture and asked him what he had readily available, since it was so close to closing time and I didn't want him making any last minute stuff just for me. He said not to worry, to order whatever I wanted off the menu, he'll make it right away. That alone has made me a return customer. Most places either turn you away at that point, make you feel uncomfortable for walking in so late or tell you they only have certain items available. The fact that the food is very decent will also make me go back of course, but the customer service definitely won me over.

7.description: When we first got there it was inviting it was our first time there so it took awhile to figure out what we want (menu is in both English and Spanish servers also speak English) the waitress would just hover over us even though we asked for a minute making it a bit awkward. The reason for the high rating is because it serves delicious food. Also has good portions. Caution there are no refills unless its water. Its one of the few authentic Mexican restaurants in the area.

3.description: I was visiting a friend around the area and decided on grabbing dinner and asked if she knows of a good Mexican place. She brought me here and I am glad she did! I had my standard order which is chicken nachos, which were great! i wasnt able to finish it bec there was a lot. The girl on the register was really friendly and was very accomodating. She made sure we got everything, even to the last condiment. Loved this place! Thanks for the great food and service, guys!

1.description: Soon to be moving to the area and thought I'd check it out. Pleasantly surprised. Friendly staff and great food. Not the best tacos I've ever had, but it's a good authentic Mexican restaurant!!

2.description: for some reason the waitress can not follow simple directions and messed up my order . I will take my business somewhere else . She wrote down everything right in front of me . How does someone forget rice and beans? Smh

9.description: Garbage. My waitress was rude and inattentive. Food was wasn't even that good. I will not be going back to this place.

18.description: been here at lease 20 times over the last year it became the place to get lunch after school with a couple of friends, Its cheap normally we spent around 5-7 dollars each, Rima is out of her/his mind, the service is ok, they are always very friendly, and the food is good for a local taqueria.

10.description: Torta de Milanesa is actually pretty good.Agua de Horchata is okay. Nice people, I always order takeout so I cant really comment on the atmosphere.

13.description: Everything here is delicious! Salsas, sauces and soups are made from scratch. Come try you won't be disappointed!

16.description: This place started out decent but quickly declined. The prices are way too high for the quality of food...the steak tacos are very fatty. Everything is extra: cheese, avocado, etc. The one waitress is semi rude. I won't eat here again.

17.description: It's good, it's close to my house and it's not expensive. The people are really nice, the place is really clean and the amount of steak they put on their tacos gives me tears of joy. Topolobampo it's not. But it definitely satisfies the need for the all aforementioned things.

15.description: This place is a dump it gives Mexican food a bad name. My friend said she had never tried worse food in her life. The rice, beans, orchata, and tacos absolutely sucked. The orange rice was hard and stale difficult to chew and finish. I cook better Mexican food than these people. The staff was rude.  I will never come back here. No wonder it was empty when I was inside.  I wonder why the person below gave them 5 stars.

0.description: First time here. I live in the area and am constantly heartbroken at the lack of options for quality Mexican food. While they're not the absolute best tacos, they do fill my (constant) need for tacos. Good food, friendly staff, and the restaurant is quiet and comfy. I'd come back again.

5.description: Very good neighborhood Mexican food place - clean, quiet family atmosphere, casual & comfy. Staff is friendly, makes you feel at home without being intrusive and everything we have had here has been well-prepared & delicious.I especially like that their food is prepared with a lighter touch than some other neighborhood Taquerias, lots of crisp fresh veggies, not dripping with grease, and not covered with 3 inches of cheese and sour cream.Sauces are all fresh and homemade, guacamole is yummy and prepared to order. Favorites are their steak tacos, the veggie Tostadas and the Chile Rellenos tacos. We do take out as well as dine in - and have never had a bad meal, a neighborhood gem.

11.description: This place used to be really good big portions perfectly seasoned food not sure what happen food size got smaller less meat in tacos an burritos i dont think ill be going back any time soon

8.description: When this place opened up it was actually pretty good. Went back yesterday and it was absolutely horrible. The waitress did not greet us, she just came to the table a minute after we sat down and asked if we were ready to order. We hadn't even taken off our jackets, so no we were not ready! She seemed annoyed and walked off, she did not come back for another 15 min!!!! We finally ordered, but the food was pretty mediocre. She did not come back to check on us until after we were all done. She was more interested in watching the novela on the tv. The food is not good enough for us to come back and deal with the rude service.

4.description: Stopped in last night with my boyfriend to grab something quick to eat - we were hungry and we were in the area. We passed by this place so many times and never walked in, and I'm so glad we finally did. The tacos were amazing! I had the ribeye steak and ground beef tacos and he had the steak ones. Genuine Mexican tacos, incomparable to Taco Bell or any of that other crap that tries to pass as Mexican food. The place is very clean and inviting and the staff extremely friendly and helpful. Just walking in you can smell the amazing cooking and you automatically know that you will be able to get something delicious to eat in here. I will most definitely be back and will recommend to anyone I know! Thumbs up!

14.description: This place blows away the other Mexican Food Resturants in the area - Tacos are large and the taste is awesome - You can have a taco with anything you want on it only extra is avacado which is every where - Cooks and Waitresses are awesome Buritto is also large and great the Carne Asada is exceptional and really everything I have ordered here is great and the portions are great and the cost is very low.

6.description: Tired of going to this restaurant, getting overcharged, and getting my orders wrong. This is the last time I'll go there. The food is good, but the service isn't so great.

1.description: excellent service, high quality flowers that last for weeks. Highly recommended.

0.description: Great service. Did a walk-in and also ordered over the phone for a delivery downtown.

58.description: Good food, good service, good people. The location is incredibly small, though.

56.description: I came here looking for a nice switch from L'patron, and boy was I happy! This place is run by (what I assumed) was a family. The mom came out and greeted me and was very nice. I must say that this place is was a solid 4.5 stars, but I bumped it up to 5 because of the SALSA. The salsa is thick, rich, and has just a bit of a kick and dances on your tongue - it's fantastic. I ordered the chorizo con papas pambazo and a carne asada gordita (pics included of each).So - the pambazo. If you read through the reviews of this place, you know that there's some serious hype about this sandwich. It's delicious - maybe not 5 stars delicious, but still amazing. However, it's such a unique dish that I haven't seen at a standard Mexican place, so I highly recommend it just so you can experience it! It's simultaneously soft and crunchy. The bread has a bit of crunch on the outside - the guajillo chili pepper rub is a nice addition. The bread is unbelievably soft and perfect. The carne asada was probably the thing I enjoyed more. To be honest, I wasn't ENTIRELY sure what a gordita was, so I googled it. What did I get? stupid pictures of taco bell's gordita - not very helpful. The gordita is kinda of like hybrid quesadilla and taco (refer to my pictures). It was delicious, and freshly homemade (like legit, since I got there right as they were opening, the mom told me it would be a bit longer because she was just in the process of making the gordita).Do note that this place is cash only, but it's pretty cheap!

29.description: Absolutely loved the food. Had ordered chilaquiles con huevos with salsa verde. Boy will I be feeling the heartburn later but totally worth it. The coffee had a cinnamon taste to it sooooo good.! Very comfortable atmosphere as if at a family's house.  Giving the hint it's family owned. Awesome service

42.description: I used to live down the block from this restaurant. The food is above average. I really enjoy the veggie burrito and the horchata. What really kept us coming back, though, were the owners and family. They are so kind and provide great service. I think the only thing that would improve this restaurant is if it were byob or served alcohol. Also, it is cash only, fyi.

23.description: This place is amazing.I had great experience from the moment I walked in - clean and nice, mexican music was on and greeted from the friendly staff. The delicious different one of a kind salsa and chips was on the table right away. The staff is great, they recommend me great vegetarian dish. The chef, also owner of the place, come to my table greeted me and ask about how a like my food.I definitely recommend this place.

47.description: I've been to this place about 6 times now. The first 5 times were fantastic! However, last night was horrible. We walked in at around 645 and it was DEAD. Not a soul in the place and the entire front fridge was cleared empty. This seemed strange to me. Went for it anyway and was utterly disappointed. But this place was good enough my previous visits that I may return again.

8.description: This place is great. The salsa is delicious and very addicting. I've also had the guacamole - yum! It's also very reasonably priced and the service is good. I like how it's a family-run place. One time the owner came out and spoke with us and told us about his business. Very nice place. Will be back!

31.description: The owners were very nice and pleasant. Enrique the owner said he buys only the best skirt steak. But we were disappointed in the meat.We ordered tacos with Asada meat. It was very very chewy.  My wife couldn't finish her tacos. The rice and beans were tasty. The place was very clean, but because of the poor meat quality, we won't be going back.

34.description: This restaurant is an absolute gem. The food is always delicious and the atmosphere is always welcoming and comfortable, but what truly outshines it all is the amazing service. When you go to a family restaurant, you're not just another customer. You're greeted with a smile, a hearty handshake, and a pleasant and warm experience that feeds your soul as much as it feeds your stomach.

16.description: Delicious food and friendly service! Best salsa I have ever tasted and I don't even like salsa!  I can't wait to go back!

13.description: Small family oriented place....came in and ordred chilaquiles dinner which consisted of green chilaquiles with cecina eggs rice and beans..very big plate i ate half of it...very authentic and delicious...their agaua de horchata is the bestHad a guacamole as an appetizer which tasted greatMy friend orderd a pambazo which tasted good as well not too soggy or greasyDefinetly will come back hereU get complimentary chips and salsaParking was also easy to findOnly con:NO CREDIT CARDS...but its ok because there is a Walgreens right next door

11.description: The sopes are absolute perfection!  This is our favorite place to go for Mexican food. The salsa is the best salsa I've ever had. Inexpensive and cash only.

39.description: El Habanero is pretty much your run-of-the-mill Mexican taqueria.  The salsa is tasty, and the first time that I've had a paste-like version (similar to pizza sauce).  They had a similar sauce on the enchiladas rojas.  The food was pretty good and a great value for the amount they give you.  We only managed to finish half of our meal, but all left STUFFED.  I also liked my horchata - it was concentrated, but not too sweet or cinnamon-y.  We were expecting some sort of specialty made with habanero, but they didn't have anything nor was anything too spicy.  Safe pick, but there are many options that are similar.

37.description: LOVE Habanero. Delicious and authentic Mexican food, and some of the best Al Pastor I've ever had.

0.description: Had heard good things and so I stopped in for dinner with my girlfriend.  What a find.  The place looks a little divey, and certainly feels that way, but it is a must go in an area filled with great taco spots.  For starters, the staff appears to be the family who owns it and you gotta love this charm.  They give you salsa and chips to start  and this might have been the best part.  The salsa was chunky and delicious and I could not get enough.  I got the pambazo and a couple tacos(I was pretty hungry).  The pambazo was good but I think I'll stick with just taco's next time, as these were some of my favorites in Chicago.  This is a must go, either to dine in or get carry out.

38.description: I've been to a lot of Mexican restaurants and I must say for a little place that doesn't stand out, The salsa, is the best I've ever had. The chicken fajita was delicious! Full of flavor! I defiantly would come back here.

51.description: Real people serving real homemade food. Family vibe. Food comes in big portions and served with big smiles. Proprietors kids work as servers also when off school. Love this place. Reminds me of sitting down and eating with my family.

27.description: Place was clean. Nice music playing that soothed the baby to sleep, quick attentive service, the gordita with steak was awesome, the meat is tender and of good quality. My daughter enjoyed all of her tacos chicken and steak, she usually doesn't finish and this time around it was gone. Not a fan of the 'salsa' they give with the chips, heavy on garlic and pasty , but to each his/her own, I simply used the verde sauce. Overall nice ambience and it wasn't too expensive. May return for some steak gorditas on the run!

32.description: This is a great place!  Nice, friendly family place, geat quality and great prices! Love the picadillo burrito and Al pastor taco! Horchata is legit and delicious too!

54.description: Great local Mexican. Probably the best of that Fullerton corridor from Kedzie to Polaski.

48.description: BEST horchata in Chicago! Hands down! The older woman who's always there is so sweet. Foods great; comes out quick. They use garlic paste in their salsa, which gives it a stronger flavor. It's a little too thick in my opinion, but regardless, still good. Overall, it's one of my favorite spots in the city.

44.description: Small family oriented place....came in and ordred chilaquiles dinner which consisted of green chilaquiles with cecina eggs rice and beans..very big plate i ate half of it...very authentic and delicious...their agaua de horchata is the bestHad a guacamole as an appetizer which tasted greatMy friend orderd a pambazo which tasted good as well not too soggy or greasyDefinetly will come back hereU get complimentary chips and salsaParking was also easy to findOnly con:NO CREDIT CARDS...but its ok because there is a Walgreens right next door

24.description: This is place is by far my favorite Mexican restaurant . We had green Pozole, pambazo, gordita and burrito, all were absolutely delicious and so savory. Their agua de horchata is the best I ever had. The restaurant is beautifully decorated and very clean. The owners were very attentive and super friendly. We will definitely be back.

7.description: I love this little spot. I've been here twice now at the recommendation of my Acupuncturist Ryan down the street at Holistic Five Point. This is a family owned restaurant with authentic Mexican ingredients. I have only had the salsa and chips (texture of the salsa is so awesome - I really enjoyed it), and the pozole (soup with hominy and chicken and topped with lettuce, cilantro, onion, oregano, fresh lime wedges, and hot pepper flakes.) It is so damn good. Like "yaaaaaas" good. Like now you don't have to worry about high sodium levels and shitty ingredients in canned soups cause you don't feel like cooking good. Only things that would make this soup better is if the lettuce were cabbage and the pepper flakes were fresh chopped jalapeños (or maybe I'd keep both). A lil avocado and a touch of sour cream... Yes lawd! Clearly this will be my next bowl! I didn't even think to ask for all of these extras until writing this all out right now. I'll report back next week with my findings. While the soup and salsa are all I've had, all of the other dishes look great but with the chilly weather all I've been wanting these days is a good homemade soup - which has been hard to find, until El Habañero.

49.description: This is one of my favorite places in the neighborhood. Everything I have tried has been delicious.  It is not your normal Mexican restaurant, everything has a twist. The pambazos are amazing.

40.description: Delicious! I've had the pozole and a steak torta and they were both tasty! I wasn't digging the Horchata, but the Jamaica was refreshing. The place is small, but I've never had to wait longer than 5 minutes. It's a family joint and it feels like it, you feel welcomed!

53.description: Great service and delicious food. I like that they give you a mild salsa and a spicy one without asking. Cash only

30.description: The best Mexican food I've had since moving to Chicago and the Midwest. You must try it. Everything on the menu is delicious!

46.description: Very dissaponited at the Lack of professionalism and business ethics at this taqueria. When I first walked in a guy told me that they close at 9 like he didn't want coming in there .it was only 8 pmThen he starts standing in the middle of the restaurant and staring at a group until they felt uncomfortable and asked for the check . The food is fresh and large portioned . I had the taco dinner and ordered two chicken and one steak .after eating the first chicken taco, I wasn't please because it was dried up and lacked any flavor what's so ever ..even the salsa Verde didn't help it . After telling the lady there manager or who ever she was ...She acted surprised ..really?Gimme a break. I told her I didn't want the 2nd taco and that I wanted another steak taco to substitute The steak tacos were very tasty and ad I was planning to bring some people next time , My mood had to be disturbed by viewing the check. Yep you guessed it ,She charged me for the chicken taco that I never ate or wanted to keep on the bill. The argument she used was that she would end up paying for it. I've never been to a restaurant where someone forced me to pay for food that I was returning and didn't eat.I'm Not coming back out of general principle

1.description: El Habanero is located at 3300 W Fullerton Ave.  when I walked in it was fairly empty.  I met my sister there for lunch.  The woman who was serving us is also the owner.  Her personality makes you feel very welcome.   The restaurant is fairly small maybe 20 seats, but the food is very good. She told us that she has been open about 18 months.  To get 177 reviews in such a short time says a lot about the restaurant, the owner and the food.  She brought us chips and salsa.  The salsa had the consistency of a tomato paste.  It was very thick and loaded with garlic (I love garlic).  I ordered the enchilada verde with chorizo.  It was good, but the chorizo was salty.  My sister ordered the taco plate that comes with 3 tacos.  She got 1 chili rellanos, 1 lengua and 1 al pastor.  I liked her dish better hen the one I ordered.  The horchata was very good and served as a palate cleanser between different food items.  Overall the service was excellent and the food was very good

55.description: Love this place.  The service couldn't be better.  Super friendly and cares.  Had the pambazo......what???? Yeah this is really good and a little messy.  Might not make the take out home.  Better taco than anywhere around here and red salsa is between salsa and pasta sauce.....its great.  Will be coming back

9.description: The steak pambazo here did not disappoint. It's a huge messy delicious sandwich. Great house salsas and homemade horchata too. My order was to-go, so I didn't interact much with the staff, but did see them chatting at length with their patrons, which was nice to see. Would definitely make a trip over to eat here again.

26.description: One word: horchata. It even looks delicious. It's not white but almost like a creamy cinnamon color. Tastes home made. The best I've had.  Second word: pambazo. You see, the art of achieving the delicate balance between a salsa-dipped bread and still being able to retain its crunch is anything shot of amazing.  Best pambazo in town. Now the salsa. I don't know what that is. But that's not salsa it's tomato mush. I almost feel guilty by not telling them. Everything else is superb, but the salsa?? I'm baffled. I'll just smuggle my mommas salsa next time I'm there.

25.description: Best Mexican Food I've tried in years. Food was so delicious ! Everyone there was so welcoming and Lorena explained to us how her green pozole is her mother in laws recipe. I loved it so much that I will be back this weekend.

12.description: Not your typical Mexican fare for sure But that's why we came here!!! We came to sample the famous, one-of-a-kind Pambazo. After reading countless Yelp reviews raving about this "sandwich" we had to give it a try. And sure enough, it's unlike anything else I've ever eaten. But in a good way! Simply put, it is AMAZING. Everyone was right. It's so worth the trip. These things come in three varieties - asada, pollo, or chorizo. We did the asada and it blew us away. So tasty! Just thinking about it makes me want another one right now. Fabulous. We also tried a selection of tacos and they were ok. I wasn't really expecting much from them. If you want world class tacos go to L'Patron. Seriously.  But if you want to stretch your culinary range into uncharted territory, come to El Habanero and hook up with one of these Pambazos. You won't regret it.

59.description: Excellent food with even better customer service! I'd recommend the Enchiladas Rojas with chicken. Lorena is extremely friendly and makes wonderful food!!

21.description: Visited tonight for the first time and I was treated like family! Great steak tacos! The horchata is probably one of the best I've had. What sets this place apart is the service...we will definitely be back!

17.description: Just a short walk away from our apartment is this little gem.  Atmosphere-wise, it ain't much; it looks like someone decided to open a Mexican restaurant in their living room with whatever they had on hand.  But the staff are super-friendly and welcoming, and the food is terrific -- good solid Mexican, with no pretense of ultra-authenticity but with just enough realness to let you know they care in the kitchen.  The horchata is divine, and the al pastor is delicious (and both, like most things at El Habañero, are very cheap and with hugely generous portions).  The one drag is that they're a cash-only business, but otherwise, this is a solid meal stop whenever you're nearby.

10.description: The best Mexican food I have had in my life. The woman serving it was part of the reason. The food was made with love and she passed the warm and loving feeling to her customers with her excellent service and delicious food. I have a crush on her.

5.description: I came here looking for a nice switch from L'patron, and boy was I happy! This place is run by (what I assumed) was a family. The mom came out and greeted me and was very nice. I must say that this place is was a solid 4.5 stars, but I bumped it up to 5 because of the SALSA. The salsa is thick, rich, and has just a bit of a kick and dances on your tongue - it's fantastic. I ordered the chorizo con papas pambazo and a carne asada gordita (pics included of each).So - the pambazo. If you read through the reviews of this place, you know that there's some serious hype about this sandwich. It's delicious - maybe not 5 stars delicious, but still amazing. However, it's such a unique dish that I haven't seen at a standard Mexican place, so I highly recommend it just so you can experience it! It's simultaneously soft and crunchy. The bread has a bit of crunch on the outside - the guajillo chili pepper rub is a nice addition. The bread is unbelievably soft and perfect. The carne asada was probably the thing I enjoyed more. To be honest, I wasn't ENTIRELY sure what a gordita was, so I googled it. What did I get? stupid pictures of taco bell's gordita - not very helpful. The gordita is kinda of like hybrid quesadilla and taco (refer to my pictures). It was delicious, and freshly homemade (like legit, since I got there right as they were opening, the mom told me it would be a bit longer because she was just in the process of making the gordita).Do note that this place is cash only, but it's pretty cheap!

3.description: I'll keep this simple.The food is phenomenal, Lorena was an excellent Host/Server, and the music was elegant and complimentary to the dining experience.  If your looking for quintessential and authentic Mexican cuisine, look no further than El Habanero in Logan Square.

35.description: Sweet mom and pop restaurant that makes delicious food. Ever had a Pombazo? Have one, okay screw it have two. The enchiladas verdes were pretty killer too. Ascend my girlfriend was a big fan of the bold flavour of the salsa.We will make a trek back. Welcome to Logan Square El Habanero.

19.description: This is my New Mexican restaurant favorite! The owner was so nice! My boyfriend and I used to go to l'patron but after having these tacos we quickly replaced it. Nothing beats the service and food here!

28.description: My kids are very picky but I took them to this restaurant and they loved it I was very pleased they are so friendly and the food is delicious

45.description: Not your typical Mexican fare for sure But that's why we came here!!! We came to sample the famous, one-of-a-kind Pambazo. After reading countless Yelp reviews raving about this "sandwich" we had to give it a try. And sure enough, it's unlike anything else I've ever eaten. But in a good way! Simply put, it is AMAZING. Everyone was right. It's so worth the trip. These things come in three varieties - asada, pollo, or chorizo. We did the asada and it blew us away. So tasty! Just thinking about it makes me want another one right now. Fabulous. We also tried a selection of tacos and they were ok. I wasn't really expecting much from them. If you want world class tacos go to L'Patron. Seriously.  But if you want to stretch your culinary range into uncharted territory, come to El Habanero and hook up with one of these Pambazos. You won't regret it.

33.description: The food here is absolutely amazing! Everything is freshly cooked, great flavor well presented, it is a family owned business, they are all very nice welcoming people. The green enchiladas, were the best I've ever tasted! the green chili sauce is more like a Mole verde sauce. It's spicy!! I also tried the green Pozole, also very delicious! The orchata is made with a creamier base, also wonderful

43.description: I have never been disappointed coming here. My family and I come here at least 2x/week. I have tried almost everything on the menu a few times as my family and I share plates. They have the greatest al pastor tacos I've tasted this side of 26th street, and I've gotten 2 friends hooked on their chilaquiles. A family fav is the pambazo- you must try! Also i am super picky with horchata and this one makes the cut- fresh! Plus it's family run and they are super friendly! Neighborhood spots that are family run AND great quality/service are hard to come by these days.

2.description: I love this place. The owners are wonderful, welcoming - just amazing, warm people. The food is tops. The pozole. Oh the pozole...

18.description: El Habanero is so worth reviewing. The most adorable family runs this delicious gem. I always bring my friends and family in addition to ordering pick up all the time. The red and green salsas on the house are superb. The horchata is perfectly creamy but not overly sweet. My favorite dish is the pambazo de asada -- a crispy soft saucy creamy meaty chopped steak sandwich. The pambazo is not a burger but almost replaces cheeseburgers for me because it is even better than any burger I've ever tried besides Five Guys, which is an actual burger place. Thank you, El Habanero!

41.description: -Friendly, down-to-earth service-Warm and inviting atmosphere-Delicious, heart-warming foodWill go back, will order the chorizo i papas pambazo again

52.description: Update: I've been back! Still delicious, cheap, and with excellent service.I ate in this time, and ordered the pambazos the classic way -- with papas y chorizo. Unbelievable, truly. Seasoning on the chorizo was perfect, the potatos had a great balance of crispiness/softness, and the bread. Oh man, the way they prepare the bread gives the outside a thin, crispy, skin-like texture, and the inside is toasty, moist, and buttery. Lettuce was fresh and light, adding a nice crunch, and the crema helped tie all the textures in together.Also had a chance to try the chips and the pico de gallo. The chips were satisfyingly crunchy and weren't too brittle -- perfect for dipping. The pico was (interestingly) sort of blended, but I could taste the jalapenos which provided a very nice kick. It was also refreshingly NOT too sweet! Nothing bothers me more than when a Mexican place puts too much sugar in their Pico -- PICO AIN'T SUPPOSED TO HAVE SUGAR. Habanero nailed the balance. Sweetness comes naturally from the tomato, heat from the jalapeno, and acidity from the lime juice.The woman who took my order was incredibly friendly as well, and the atmosphere was very pleasant.

50.description: Came here for the first time with the family and fell in love! Ate a Pambazo with chorizo con papas, Pambazo de asada and the  Enchiladas verdes. Excellent food and the service was great. Will definitely be returning!

4.description: One word: horchata. It even looks delicious. It's not white but almost like a creamy cinnamon color. Tastes home made. The best I've had.  Second word: pambazo. You see, the art of achieving the delicate balance between a salsa-dipped bread and still being able to retain its crunch is anything shot of amazing.  Best pambazo in town. Now the salsa. I don't know what that is. But that's not salsa it's tomato mush. I almost feel guilty by not telling them. Everything else is superb, but the salsa?? I'm baffled. I'll just smuggle my mommas salsa next time I'm there.

6.description: Huevos rancheros y café con leche. I highly recommend it. The lady of the restaurant made me feel right at home. The prices are right on & the cooking reminds me of my mother's. If you're ever in Chi, stop by for good food & reasonable prices. Gracias!

22.description: For years we were dying to find a Mexican food joint we could call our go to place - this is it!!! Food is consistently excellent and fairly priced. Family owned and operated. Cash only.  I recommend the burrito, taco dinner or chicken enchiladas (green is best but be prepared it's really spicy!) If I had to give one piece of constructive feedback, the service can be a little slow. But it's so worth it!!!  Proud to be a regular here.

15.description: Love this place.  The service couldn't be better.  Super friendly and cares.  Had the pambazo......what???? Yeah this is really good and a little messy.  Might not make the take out home.  Better taco than anywhere around here and red salsa is between salsa and pasta sauce.....its great.  Will be coming back

57.description: I've only had the Al Pastor tacos from here, and the Horchata. Both are delicious. The Al Pastor tacos are some of the best I've ever had. They really load them up, too. The salsas are also both delicious. Just remember they are cash only - I don't carry cash often, but when I do, I usually make a stop to El Habanero.

20.description: I love their tacos... Their hot sauce is the best... Service is great n the owner is really friendly
