36.description: The best Pozole I have ever had. The Chicken Fajitas were great. The horchata was delicious. The carne asada burrito was really delicious too.  Everything was fresh and tasty. I have a leftover Gordita that I am going to eat today for lunch as well as left over pozole. The portions are huge and the price is right. The owners are very nice and attentive. These two really, really care about their customers and want you to leave satisfied. I will definitely be back for the chilaquiles and the pambazo, which I expect to be some of the best in the city.

14.description: Went here Sunday afternoon and it was amazing food and such nice friendly staff. I am definitely coming back.

3.description: definitely one of my favorite Mexican restaurants in Chicago!I dine-in and/or pick up & I never get disappointed. their staff is also very friendly. every time my dad visits from MICHIGAN he asks to go there. & he loves the green salsa so much he always asks for a side of it in a reg. cup to go. ha! sucks that's it's cash only though.

1.description: Good, fast, reliable, tacos. It's a good go to for Craigin. Cash only but $10 buys a lot of food!

2.description: Really nice place, good food. I had beef Fajitas here and I really like it. Wasn't the best ever but at least 4 stars :)Best thing about this restaurant is you are able to see the kitchen, who is cooking your food.Only thing I didn't like it is they accept ONLY CASH. So if you are planning to eat some good Mexican food at this place, just make sure that you have enough cash in your pocket.

9.description: The food here was okay but the real Taconazo on North Ave beats it by a long shot. They only take cash and they were very cheap about the avocado. My friend got super mad how little avocado they gave us. I recommend the Taconazo on North Ave.

10.description: Hole in the wall with the most amazing salsa and crema. Steak tacos are so on pt not  even funny. U get ur food asap. My friend got pastor she loved them. Their mexican rice is the only mexican rice I will eat from a restaurant. Tastes like mexico.  Cash only

4.description: This WAS my favorite taco spot!! I legit went there every week religiously. Until one day I ordered the regular, two steak tacos. Slammed my first taco and as I'm taking a bite out of the second I literally see a baby cockroach on top of my taco!! ON TOP! A COCKROACH! Not on the side, not on the floor, on top of my taco that I was just eating. I wanted to vomit. I complained to the waitress and I'm assuming she felt embarrassed because all the did was laugh and say it's because of the weather. She comes back and tells me she will only charge me for one. They literally still charged me for the other taco knowing that I almost at a roach from their kitchen and could've caused huge trouble for their full Restuarant. I hate that this happened. I have yet to find a place that I like better. But I think about this living nightmare every time I pass by there. Beware! And check your food!

6.description: One of my favorite restaurants! There food is always on point! Waitresses are friendly. They are quick too. Sometimes its tough getting in because theres always a line of people picking up orders so its a lil annoying trying to get in or out the door. Parking can suck too. But food is fabulous!

12.description: Great! Amazing food. Staff is friendly. Bring your cash because no credit cards accepted. Womp.. Womp.. However, my favorite Mexican restaurant for food.

5.description: Oh, how I love Taconazo. If you are in the mood for some authentic Mexican cuisine, look no further. It is a small restaurant, with about 5 small booths on one side, and 4 small tables on the other. Every time I come here there are always at least two cops getting their grub on; honestly, this is all the validation one needs.My favorite item on the menu is the steak torta, but I'm just a torta-lovin' chick. It is cash only (-1 star for this) so make sure you bring your dinero, comprende?And don't forget to get an horchata, grande, with easy ice. Super yummy!

11.description: This place is a cash only but oh so good. .. It taste like home cooked and it's my favorite "fast food" place if you get hangry

8.description: The food is authentic here! This is more of a carry out place, since it is a little hole in the wall. I always get the steak sope and chicken tacos. Good stuff! There horchata's are delicious as well. This place is always packed for good reason. The only downside is that it's CASH ONLY!

0.description: Love this place!Their location is really small and crowded, and they do cash only. However it looks like they're gonna be moving directly across the street into a larger building. The signage is already up!!!All the other Mexican restaurants in the neighborhood suck D... compared to this place!! Taconazos' carne asada tastes great!! The burritos are awesome!!!Who cares about all this BS people are making up about cockroaches. I don't believe it. This place always looks clean to me, they are extremely busy at all times, I trust them 100%!! And if it did happen just flick it off your food. It is well worth it to look past an errant cockroach. The food is that good. I would rather get food from here and deal with a cockroach than eat the BS from any of the other Mexican restaurants around here. If you want to see a dirty mexican restaurant go to belmont/austin or diversey/laramie. This place is like the white house compared to those dirty ass restaurants.I usually place a phone order, and it's ready by the time I get there thanks to their simple menu. Love this place, F the haters!

7.description: The Al pastor is the bomb dot com! Can't get enough. Steak Fajita dinner is delicious as well ! This is my go to taco joint !

1.description: Family owned business. My family and I go as often as we can since we found out by word of mouth they opened. Food portions are excellent, prices fair and good service. Family friendly and definitely kind family and staff. Clean bathroom which is always a plus. Help support this new business. Seating is limited and requires some patience on the weekends but they do get the food out. My only comment is hire another server and open earlier on the weekend, maybe 8am. I can't wait to go back.

0.description: Ecuadorean - Delicious home cooked meals, family owned. I had the goat stew and it was delicious

3.description: I just moved to Chicago from LA and was looking for a good Filipino brand that carries longaniza, tocino, chicharon and lumpia. My buddies who grew up in Chicago recommended a local brand they all grew up on-Oscar's Foods. Oscar's Foods is carried at a lot of the big Asian grocery stores like Unimart. I found out that they also sell cooked lechon. It was better than Goldilocks and Red Ribbon in LA!  I highly recommend buying Oscar's Foods!  Must haves: Tocino, Longaniza, Lumpia and Lechon!Oscar's Foods-773-622-6822oscarsfoods.com

1.description: Oscars - we you - from your delicious tocino and longaniza to your lumpia you're the best!!! We will keep smuggling your goodies with us back to Cali until we can get treats out here

2.description: Oscar's, you still exist?!I'm surprised I'm not entirely "taba" (translation: FAT) from the stuff my family would buy from you....but then we got lazy, sort of stopped cooking and hence why I am now an avid Yelper!I remember being as tall as a top-lid freezer when I would come with my parents to buy frozen meat here. We would always get tocino (sweet pork), longanisa (sweet sausage), lumpia (eggrolls), atchara (pickled papaya) and chicharon (fried pork skin) here. I also recall that Oscar's was the only place that sells lechon (big, honkin' roasted pig. Yes, the entire pig). I think we stopped buying from Oscar's directly because Oscar's also distributes to the local Filipino grocery stores. Oscar's, I'd give you more stars, but I haven't been to your store in over 10 years so it's hard to say if you're still the same. But you're a loved fixture in Chicago!

5.description: The only words that come to mind when I think about Oscar's Foods are "Yum, Yum, Yum."  Oscar's Foods has been a household staple in my family for many many years.   I look forward to Saturday mornings so I can enjoy a true Filipino breakfast with tocino, eggs, and rice just like my parents did when they were growing up in the Philippines.I always bring packages back to my brother since they don't really have any Filipino stores where he lives.  And during the holidays, they offer special bulk packages that you can give as gifts!  It's such a great idea, especially when I have a lot of family that don't live in this area.The love for their product really shows in the flavor and quality of this friendly family business. I would definitely recommend Oscar's Foods to anyone, especially those who have never had Filipino food before.  Sure there are other brands out there, but don't be fooled! Oscar's Foods is the best.

6.description: Oscar's food is a well known brand in my family. We would buy their longanisa, tocino and chicaron for the last 20 years. I highly recommend trying their lumpia too, it's very tasty and easy to make!!! Also what's great about them is that if you don't live close to the Belmont location you can find their longanisa, lumpia, chicharon, and tocino in your local asian/filipino mart.  Also, their lechon (roasted pig) is the best in the business because of the meat has so much flavor, very tender and the skin is crispy. I would recommend it for your next party, you won't regret it!!

7.description: My family has been eating Oscar's Foods products my entire life. Tocino, longanisa, lumpia and of course the lechon, can always be found packed away in my mom's freezer or served up and ready to eat at our many family parties. The quality and taste of their products have always been consistent and delicious, which is what keeps my family loyal to Oscar's!

8.description: I'm married to a Filipina and love to cook. Tried many other frozen Filipino foods from local markets but none as good as Oscar's! Their longanisa, tocino and lumpia shanghai are the best I've ever tried. Easy to prepare and tastes delicious! Their prices are great too. I highly recommend their foods. Masarap!

0.description: Gotta love this place. It's about as basic of a "Grocery store" as you can get. I am pretty sure this location is just the distribution center for Oscar's around Chicago. Reasons being, for one thing the inside of the market looks more like cubicle'd office space and there is pretty much nothing that looks or feels like a traditional grocery store. Also, you have to ring a buzzer at the front door to even get them to let you in. No big deal. And finally, once inside the grocery store pretty much consists of a over sized freezer against one wall. All that being said the inside of the freezer has the tastiest Filipino sausages, lumpia and other assortments (I've yet to try them all) I've come across. The gentleman will grab whatever you are after and write you up a sales ticket and he is always very friendly and will chat you up if you take a minute to ask him how he's doing. I'm pretty sure this is a cash only establishment fyi.If you are a fan of Filipino foods this is a place you have to hit.

4.description: one day after waking up at a friend's house after a night of partying I woke up to the smell of sweet tocino and tapa. I couldn't believe my friend was cooking some authentic filipino food. After eating three servings of tocino, tapa and rice I had to ask him where he got it from. He said it's from this place in Chicago called Oscar's foods.  I asked him if I can get some delivered and he said they deliver. So whenever I feel like having some good authentic filipino food or when a family party is coming up, I'll place an order.The longanesa is off the hook - not like others where its almost all fat. The taste is sweet but not too sweet - just sweet enough, perfect. I recently just tried the lumpia, also good but I still prefer the classics - tocino, tapa and longanesa.So if you're not from Chicago and you want some authentic, good, bring you back to the days when you were young filipino food - I suggest you order some tocino, tapa and longanesa from Oscar's Foods.

12.description: Awesome place to go to. The first time we went I ordered camarones empanizados I got six of them with rice, beans, and a salad. I was satisfied with the shrimp cause they were huge, unlike some other places. The price for the shrimp is good. My bf ordered a bistec ranchero, it was served with a good amount of tortillas, other places give only like three or four tortillas. The second time we went was a few days ago and I ordered flautas which came with guacamole and rice and beans on the side. The tortillas for the flautas were bigger than regular ones which is good because I got full. The horchata was delicious wasn't too sweet and had a good amount of cinnamon. The rice and beans have a good taste, the food is authentic mexican food. The customer service is on point, waiters were both really nice and would come see if we wanted anything else. They weren't annoying coming every 2 minutes or like other places that waiters don't even bother to see if customers want anything else. Service was fast both times. The first time was a Saturday morning there was plenty of people when we got there and more people kept coming in. The second time was in the night time around 10PM there was barely any people. Haven't been there during peak hours but service must be somewhat slower. From outside the place isn't attractive but the inside is well decorated I love how it's colorful and alive. I recommend Taco & Burrito House it's worth the $, I'm pretty sure I'll be back to try more food and try out their drinks.

3.description: Great prices and great food. Steak sopes and chicken enchiladas are my go to. I love that they have a kid's menu, and that they always refill our basket of chips without charging us extra. Parking is great, they take cards, and they serve alcohol. What's not to love?

1.description: Oh my god I'm so disappointed with myself for not stopping in here before. I came in here last night with my wife and son.we were greeted immediately by 3 beautiful ladies. The interior of the establishment is beautiful,clean,organize. We started with the free chips and salsa they bring to the table. We ordered (2) Carne asada plates with rice,beans,salad and (3)steak tacos.Everything was succulent,fresh,and very tasty. I highly recommend you give them a try.it won't be long before this place gets extremely busy. The waitresses are great,attentive,friendly and are spot on. Holy shit this place is a diamond in the ruff

2.description: Im here today on Mother's day with my mother and there are people celebrating birthdays and graduations as well, I usually bring my wife and kids here to enjoy some good authentic Mexican food,and let me tell you that you would be disappointed if you pay them a visit. Order the arracherra dinner with a Coronarita and you will be one happy camper. The owner is also very friendly and is always making sure your visit is a satisfying one. If your in the Belmont Cragin area stop by and be a believer of my 5 star rating

9.description: Can never go wrong with the Chicken Mole!!!!

10.description: I've ordered more times than I can count and will continue to order. There are a lot of restaurants in the area (even within a few blocks) that offer the same kind of food. What separates their food is the QUALITY. Non greasy. Lots of vegetarian options. The tortillas are fresh and possibly made in the restaurant. I work in the area so I'm always trying to find a close pickup location. The service and environment:They are extremely accommodating to special requests. The staff is helpful and extremely polite. I've met the owner before and he is also great. If I lived in the area, I would probably dine-in and have a few drinks. The restaurant is very clean and is nicely decorated. I've gotten food poisoning from a few Mexican restaurants before so I'm really picky about the appearance of them now.The food:The only complaint I have is that the sauteed veggies are kind of watery for my liking and it can make the burrito soggy if you wait too long to eat it. The veggie burrito and veggie quesadilla are still very delicious and satisfying. I simply prefer my veggies somewhat cooked but not mushy. Guacamole is also very good. Pico de Gallo is very spicy but I love it.

4.description: Realy nice selection of meals at fair prices.The staff is very Friendly.Huge bar and Super size Margaritas. Best of all they are not cheap with the alcohol in their mixed drinks

6.description: This place gets 2 stars for their great service and 1 for their very delicious margaritas. No stars for the food. I really had high expectations, due to all the 5 star reviews. The food was lacking in taste. I had the enchiladas suizas with mole. My husband had the enchiladas poblanas. I made him switch cause mine were horrible. He's a bit less picky than me. Maybe we tried the wrong thing. The margaritas alone is enough to go back and try it again. I am willing to give them another chance. The service was amazing. our waitress was very friendly and attentive. Oh and we loved the soft playing mariachi music in the background. I love mariachi music in a restaurant. It gives it that authentic feel to it.

15.description: Just went for the first time and this place was awesome. Everyone was very friendly, and the food was soooo good. I will definitely be going back. The prices were not bad at all and the food was fresh and absolutely delicious. Worth checking out!

0.description: I take my parents here many times and they love it. We've ordered the carne en su jugo, taco dinner, torta, steak dinner, cocteles de camaron, caldo 7 mares and many more! I've also ordered certain drinks: margaritas, Pina coladas, White Russian. Nice atmosphere, good service, great food.

5.description: Went for dinner ,had the steak jr. burrito w/ rice and beans . Over all food was good , beans needed some dalt. Service was good and quick.

13.description: Dropped by here for dinner and drinks last night with some friends and had an absolute blast. The place was nicely decorated, but resisted the kind of kitschy and gimmicky nic nacs a lot of Mexican restaurants clutter themselves with. Our waitress was pretty polite, and the service was really quick. They weren't that busy, but I don't get the impressions that the service would suffer during peak hours.As for the food, I had the milanesa suiza, which was excellent. I'd prefer that they didn't drown the meat in a red sauce, but the sauce was good. The rice and beans were tasty, and everyone else I was with seemed to enjoy their meals (as well as their pina coladas). I look forward to coming back here, and to bringing a few more friends.

11.description: I always go here for mexican food.  At one point, it was every friday.I usually get the Carne Asada and sometimes delve into the other dishes....and nothing disappoints me! I  highly recommend this mexican restaurant to anybody traveling into this part of Chicago!  They also have huge margaritas and GREAT customer service!

8.description: The hubby and I love this neighborhood Mexican place! They really seem to cook as if for family. They recently got a new cook/chef who has brought this place from a 3/4 star to 5 star. Their fish tacos are on point!! My fav! We have ordered the chicken milanesa, tacos, all the different burritos and enchiladas and I can honestly say everything here is fresh and delicious. We always order the fire roasted jalapeños for hubby since he likes it hot--called jalapeño "torido" I think?? They deliver now!! Clean place with very friendly waitresses!! Chips with pico de gallo and a green concoction that's so spicy, while you wait! Comfortable booths! I love this place!

14.description: yum yum yum, love it. good food,good customer service. good food,and not to pricey.

7.description: If you have not been here,then you have been missing out. I just love it here.clean,reasonable prices, friendly  staff.oh yes the best food you want to eat.yum yum.

3.description: I love it when eric and vanessa works in the pharmacy they are so attentive and so nice they just deserve more thn 5 stars i cant stand the indian guys he is so rude and lazy never wants to submit a prescription he is so RUDE they need to get rid of him and claudia  thanks eric and vanesaa u guys are the best

1.description: Pharmacy sucks! always only 2 people working they always have "caca faces" I understand short staff is a problem but maybe they need to hiremore people asap......

2.description: The people that work in the night shift are rude and very disrespectful. I saw a rat running around the isles GROSS!! Dont buy at this location. Not recommended at all!!

5.description: This Walgreens looks fancy but the service here suck royally!!! The Pharmacy here is slow, rude, and ignorant!  The Pharmacist (Some Indian Man) is just as rude as the mostly latin staff here.  The lines are unnecessarily long (there is enough staff), when you wait for your meds to get filled they tell you 15 minutes and then you have to make another trip to the counter 15 min later only to find out that it's not ready.   After my second trip to the counter she says, "Oh, I'll fill it now" really? because I was hoping you would fill it tomorrow so I can spend the night here waiting.  When I put in a complaint to the pharmacist, I was told very dryly, "What happened" followed by a, "I'll have a talk with her" code word for, fuck off lady.  I've heard of lazy but damn the pharmacist is an ass too?  Walgreens you need to do better and send someone out to your stores to investigate the pharmacies!!  These people are lazy as hell and getting paid for it!!  I not only did a Walgreens survey but am also doing this Yelp review. I don't need the headache so I'll just go elsewhere but this Walgreens is notorious for bad service and it's still in business?

6.description: Quite possibly the worst Walgreens pharmacy ever.  I have used this Walgreens quite a few times because they offer a 24 hour pharmacy....no more..no thanks.  Filling a script here is a joke...they always ask for at least 2-3 hours before your script is ready.  What is the point of having a drive thru...and why oh why does it have to be such a hellish ordeal?  Most other places can fill them in less than 20 minutes!

7.description: This happened a few years ago...during a thanksgiving football game my husband broke his leg and had to have surgery the following week. When we were on our way home after the surgery I decided to stop by this walgreens to get his pain meds prescription filled. Went inside dropped it off at the pharmacy,. Had to wait half an hour so went back out to the car to check on my husband to see if he needed anything. Went back in and went to look for what he requested and I noticed a couple of the employees eyeballing me and making stupid comments. One of them said in Spanish "there goes the thief", and I'm just thinking they cant be talking about me, cause I'm not. I was 6 months pregnant and because I walked in and out  I suppose they assumed I was shop lifting. A manager approached me and said "May I help you find anything" and I said no thanks...made my purchase and picked up the prescription. If they really thought I was stealing something why didn't the manager say anything directly instead of having his employees make stupid comments, I would have gladly unzipped my jacket, lifted my shirt and showed him my big belly. Just rude ghetto people working in this place!!!!

0.description: The photo of the security guard tells the story, customers and the people that hang out in the parking lot are a bit on the ruff side (spelling on purpose). Had to go here to pick up a script for my mom, she had a visit to the ER for her asthma and her Walgreen's was closed. So this was a must have purchase.Because this is one of the 24hr pharmacies it is busy, but it's disorganized. Signage isn't done well. Everyone goes to the main counter, and then they send you to the other window, when they do this everyone takes it as a que to try to jump in front of you in line. After going to two other Walgreen's I was in no mood for this at all. A woman that was much taller and at least 100lbs heavier decided she was going to give it a go, people this size get away with this sh*t all the time, I'm not petite, so I know she stepped in and almost stepped on my foot, she thought I was going to back down. She learned otherwise, I'll leave it at that.I had no choice but to wait, so I sat down in one of the chairs, a set of three. I should have thought strategically and sat in the middle, but I took the end seat. Leaving the other two open for two people that must have have been there for hearing aid batteries, because they were shouting at each other. I know if I were on a plane, I would have asked to be moved, or now I'd be in fight number two. I will admit, I'm one of those nuts with overly sensitive hearing, so I thought it was me, but no other people were giving these two the stink eye also. I just got up and walked around the store, I have had enough excitement for one night. So why three stars when it could be a one star experience? Well, other than a bit of poor signage, they got me out of there under the estimated wait time, they took a moment to explain to me what was and wasn't covered under my mom's insurance, and if I wanted to go over how the meds need to be administered. In other words, they did get the job done. They can't control the fact that it's location challenged and that some of it's clientele could be roller derby contestants, with truck driver mouths.  I'm embarrassed to say, if necessary I can lower myself to their level. I am a product of the west side, yo!

4.description: Had wax build up in one of my ears. Went to the clinic was in and out within 45 min. The nurse that took care of me was excellent! Professional and clean!Had to eliminate stars....I will have to update this once I see how the clinics decides to handle.....

1.description: Perennials is a great place for gifts, cards, and a multitude of things for the house. Everyone there is knowledgeable, friendly, and they make Perennials a great community location.  i always find interesting gifts for people here. I go here every few months.

0.description: Perennials is a great store when you don't know exactly what to get for someone but know you want it to be classic, but not too serious and a good value.  Definitely mostly gifts for Women, Mothers, Mothers to be and some smaller children. (and gay men!)  They find classic but not ordinary gifts and things to give you a lift.  The staff is friendly and so helpful without ever being pushy.  They are a special place on Central Street.

58.description: I was very disappointed. Hours of operation said midnight and when I tried to open the door at 10pm it was already locked. Honor your hours!!!

56.description: Before I begin, this place is CASH ONLY. Don't need much cash though, it's a "$" restaurant after all. I'll admit that I have never been to Mexico or even the southern US, but if I ever do I hope that "authentic" Mexican cuisine is something like L' Patron. My first time there with friends, I had no idea that this was such a well-rated restaurant, but I remember thinking, 'man this is unusually good' (I had a torta, as well as the guac/chips) and vowed to return. I did so 3 months later, and my guests were absolutely amazed at the flavors emanating from their burritos. I had their shrimp and fish tacos (among other things) and wanted 10 more, except that the line was really long and we didn't have time to wait. Generally Mexican food is hard to screw up since it is so tasty, but this restaurant took the tastes to a new level. I have been back several times since, leaving each time with great impressions. Even the guac and chips here were great. The chips were perfectly salted and crispy, while the guac contained chunks of fresh avocado with some craisins (which some are not a fan of, but I certainly welcome them). The atmosphere is very casual, with music blasting in the background, no table service, and nothing fancy about the decor. The prices reflect this low-key ambiance (but not the quality of the food) - under $6 for a wholesome burrito. The tacos were just over $2 each but are quite small. A few more logistical notes: since orders are taken fast-food style, even a very long line may only indicate a 15-minute wait. However, once you order the wait can be a bit lengthy, especially at peak times (20-30 minutes). Thus I recommend getting a side order (like chips) first while waiting, since they are prepared much more quickly. Also, no credit cards, which I mentioned already.

29.description: For the prize I say to expensive for a taco or small burrito. $2.39 for a taco too much .Ordered a rajas taco n it was mostly grilled onions, plus .39c extra if I wanted extra cheese or sour cream.Was really expecting to buy a stuff bell pepper taco and pay same.The burrito was just an oversize taco not close to an actual  burrito $5.49.

42.description: An old friend brought me here and it changed my personal "Best Tacos I had in Chicago" list. LOL so I can say this place is one of my top 3 now.I've also read an article "10 Best Burritos in Chicago you must try"Quite honestly I didn't like the burritos, however, I enjoyed the carne asada tacos! The guacamole is a must try also! There's only about 5-7 small tables here in L'Patron, so I recommend to take it to go!

23.description: Omg the chicken here is AMAZING! Whether it's in a taco or torta, whatever. Get the chicken, you won't be sorry. Ever since eating here I haven't been able to get chicken tacos anywhere else. Only downside is no delivery, and it's usually packed no matter what day or time of day. But so with it!

47.description: The BEST tacos in Chicago. Must try Al Pastor. Very crowded at all times of the day but well worth the wait. Haven't had a bad dish here yet. Fresh made drinks such as Horchata, Cucumber water and a variety of Limonadas top off this must visit! Be careful as they only accept cash!!

8.description: I've come here many times. It's the same every time.... Awesome. Today I tried the vegetable of the day - grilled beets. This is what prompted my review, finally. The beets were so good I could have eaten pounds of them. Then they topped the beets off with a granola dressing. Do yourself a favor and do not pass this up when you see it available.

31.description: Seriously, I can't think of a thing to ding these guys on.  Some people don't like the wait; if the food wasn't spot in, there wouldn't be.  Some complain about the shrimp and fish being greasy; they're fried in oil, and on the occasions we've had them no complaints here!  Great steak and horchata!!

34.description: Tacos were great, prices were good and would easily get a five star rating if it wasn't located in an area with so many great taco options.  While I will never turn down L'Patron, I won't be choosing them over the other options nearby.

16.description: Very disappointing. I'm teetering between 1 and 2 stars and 1 it is. I'm confused how this is considered one of the best burritos in the US? Maybe if you're drunk off your ass and don't know any better. Food was what I would classify as inedible. Bland tacos and burrito that literally tasted like nothing with huge chunks of chicken breast (tendon and all) with copious amounts of lettuce.  I could see the unsanitary kitchen waiting for my to go order and the voice inside my head whispered "don't eat don't eat code red" but I ignored it and ate some of the food anyway, hopefully no issues later on.  What unsanitary thing could you see you may ask? Just a bloody knife used to cut raw beef put back against the wall after cutting then removed again to I can only presume cut more items I couldn't see. I've worked in enough restaurant kitchens in my youth to know this was unsanitary. The schmear of blood on the wall in plain sight from the cash register was very appealing, not.  Also there was trash and junk all over the floor, place could use a good deep clean in my opinion.  Really wish Chicago restaurants could go with the letter system LA and NYC are using.I'll never be back. There are much cleaner and tastier taco joints in this town and I'm perplexed as to how this is rated so highly. I also question some of patrons here. It's a fair mix of seedy, vagrant, and Logan square hipster frat boys. Maybe good for people watching in that regard I'll give them that. The ladies who take your order are nice, it's not a service issue its a food quality and cleanliness issue.

13.description: Best horchata I've ever had, EVER. I'm not even joking. Completely creamy, sweet, and everything horchata should be like. You won't get a watered down version here.  If they sold it in a jug, I'd take that sucker home with me.My other love. the TACOS. The guys ordered la gringa and el gringo which looked amazing... but i opted for my usual two tacos. One al pastor, one carne asada.  The pastor with pineapple was a really nice combo to provide sweet and savory in every bite. The carne asada was exceptional quality.  You won't questions that it's steak here.  This is the real deal, and you'd only wish there were more!  Tacos are prepared authentic, so expect the cilantron and onion toppings here. I added sour cream and avocado for my liking.Note. They do NOT serve complimentary chips and salsa, which only must mean that their chips and salsa are completely on point! I checked the prices too. You can't even order chips and salsa without dropping $5 on it. I'm sure the guac is even more bomb-dot-com.  The tableside salsas were something serious, and aren't your standard, run of the mill, verde and rojo. They do mexican different here.I love that they're open late. I dislike that it's cash only. But seriously.  For their food, it's become the gold standard of quick Mexican fare, in Chicago. If I ever have the opportunity, and I'm ever in the area, this is my top pick for tacos.

11.description: L'patron is king. Bow down b*tches. Signs that a taco place is legit:-Tacky neon paint-Blasting banda music-Lines at any and all times-Bomb ass foodL'patron has all of these, therefore making it the epitome of legit mexy food. Every visit, I've have always left with a happy belly. The rajas, veggie tacos of the day are just mind-blowingly flavorful, the chips/guac and elotes are sweet/salty perfection, and horchatas are addicting. Hubby always loves their carne asada as he describes it as fajita-seasoned strip steak in a taco/burrito. This place is pretty much heaven. If you haven't been, be patient in line, order everything and eat up!

39.description: Solid first experience. Got the steak burrito + chips & pico, and have no complaints. Really delicious steak, awesome tortilla, and even though I don't love avocado, it worked really well in this burrito. Can't wait to go back and try the tacos, and maybe a gringo/gringa.

37.description: Great, authentic tacos! We tried the al pastor, beef, and chicken tacos, horchata, and chips and pico. Fast service, hot food, and good portion size (great value!). The chips and pico were a bit pricey ($6), but were delicious. Wish I could have tried the chorizo taco, but they were out. I especially loved the horchata. Can't wait to return.

0.description: The food here is amazing. I had carne asada tacos and the corn in the cup. The meat was very tender and the corn was delicious. My husband had a burrito which they grill after it's been put together. This place is cash only. I didn't see a sign regarding that; maybe I missed it, but the woman taking our order was nice enough to submit our order and let us run to an ATM. Lines were long both times we came here and it does take awhile to get the food but definitely worth it.

38.description: Al pastor burrito is the jam best flour tortilla I've ever had I eat here once a week UPDATE 1/8 holy cow tonight's was so good whoever was on burrito duty was killin the game

51.description: Finally made it here. I declare, this is my new favorite taco joint. Best pastor tacos in the city. Just amazing flavor.  Lunch time was pretty packed but the line moved  efficiently. The guacamole was a bit strange in that it had craisins in it. Next ill ask them to hold them.

27.description: I just had surgery and I'm getting out of bed to go get a carne asada burrito. That's how good they are. If only they delivered I'd be in heaven.

32.description: The burrito here is the best I have ever had in the Chicago area. This place gets crowded and for a handicapped person like myself the best option is to park at the Walgreens next door. Make sure you go inside Walgreen's and buy something or else they will tow your car. I ordered a carne asada burrito. The burrito looks small compared to other Mexican eateries but this filled me. The steak was just outstanding quality and wonderfully seasoned. Usually dry burritos like this are not so flavorful but not this one. It was delicious. They also fry the tortilla , giving it a nice crunch. The red salsa here is fantastic. It has a thick texture , its hot but not overpowering. It's a cash only joint. You must try this place it's simply the best.

54.description: I used to always see this place packed in the summer with a huge line. I knew that one day I would want to try it out because if a place has so many customers all the time it must be good. So this past Friday night my boyfriend and I wanted to go eat at Garcias at Western and lawrence in Lincoln Square. We usually go there for our mexican food cravings. But it was super busy with a decent wait to get seated so because we were on the go we decided to try another mexican restaurant. L'patron popped up in yelp app so we decided to go there. When we arrived there was a long line to order but the line moved fast. The seating area was all packed. My boyfriend and I both ordered two steak burritos both suizo on top and cheese extra inside. With a horchata. The horchata was pretty cheap and it tasted amazing. Luckily while we were waiting for our to go order, some window seats opened up. It took awhile to get our food. Once we opened up our to go boxes we were super disappointed because we paid extra for both to have cheese on top and neither of them did. We told a worker that was cleaning up the seating area when she asked us is everything alright, we told her that our burritos didn't have cheese on top and we paid extra. She then rudely said you're gonna have to talk to someone else. So we went up to the cashier and he was very nice and took the burritos back and they fixed it right away. After that we tried the burritos. It was kinda weird that the burrito had these big chunks of steak in them. The taste was only ok. I was expecting it to be amazing but definitely not close to any of the other burritos I've had in chicago. the workers were mostly friendly besides the one rude girl. And the food was only ok. I feel like people haven't tried better mexican restaurants to think this place is 5 stars.

48.description: Hands down, my favorite tacos in the northside of Chicago. When I get visitors, I gotta bring 'em here. Their staff is friendly, their music is fun, and their food is OUTSTANDING. I could eat myself into a food coma. Tips:-Go with time! It's usually full of people any day of the week.-Cash only. There's a convenient atm in the Walgreens next door-It's BYOB! beer and tacos? what more could you want?-Order the tacos al pastor and steak tacos. Holy. Crap. You'll thank me later-They have a rotating veggie option every week. They're all amazing.Can't wait to go back.

44.description: I had to check the place out after all I'd heard, as well as the reviews on Yelp. Unfortunately, it was just Hipster-hype and bandwagon fans IMO. I wanted to be fair so I waited on giving my 2 cents. I've been here 2-3x's. Each time was the same thing. Steak- tacos or tortas always overcooked and charred like it was made on that one neighbors grill who never cleans the grates and is always flaring up. The Horchata was meh. The salsa was ok but it tastes like it was made w/ketchup like at El CID, but not as good. I did like the atmosphere,and thought it funny how they play salsa, and country music at a Mexican Restaurant. The highlight of each visit was the guacamole. I grew up in Logan Square and try to support small business whenever I can, but I think the Hipsters of the Uber-gentrified Logan Square will keep this place going. I on the other hand will drive an extra 10min to Pueblo Nuevo and get real mexican food

24.description: Best steak tacos in town!!! They take a bit long to serve but the food is definitely worth the wait. You could also ask for your tacos to be served on homemade tortillas.

7.description: I know what I'm about to say might stir controversy but I think that there is a strong possibility that this is the best taco place in Chicago. The tacos leave a greasy residue in the bottom of your tray but the taste is absolutely amazing! The day we came, they had ribeye tacos for ONE DOLLAR! So I got one of those and the poblano taco. The ribeye taco was pretty good but the poblano taco was AMAZING! It was really rich but well balanced with other flavors. They also give you a little container of pickles if your taco needs a little bit of extra freshness. This place was so good, we even tossed around the idea of coming back for dinner :Doh yeah, CASH ONLY!

49.description: Been here a few times and was like aaaah. Don't see what's so special.  Had the pastor and Assad taco. That's the way to go. Burritos suck and gringo or whatever its called was mediocre.  Get the tacos jack.

40.description: L'Patron is a great little taco place with really delicious al pastor.  Don't want to wait for al pastor at Big Star?  Do yourself a favor and get your butt over here.  The carne asada was also very flavorful and for my charming vegetarian companion, they have interesting veggie taco specials.  The other details:  counter service, cash only.  GREAT TACOS!

53.description: I am glad I don't live far from them, the best burrito I can find!!! I get the Carne Asada with just cheese, cream and avocados, AMAZING!!!!  Since the meat is grilled, at times I gotten a few crispy pieces but over all still good. My wife loves their guacamole! Same price as a burrito though. Their drinks are also good! There is really no complaints only that its cash only, so we have to run into Walgreens buy a pack of gum(you will need it afterwards anyways lol) and request cash back.  I love the fact that there is always a line because you know the food will always be fresh. Best spot to eat!!

30.description: I've been reluctant to review this place because I was worried that I'd never be able to go there without a huge wait. Well, that fear was realized long ago. The secret is out, this has got to be the best taco spot in the city. I know this is blasphemous in these parts, but I think their Al Pastor is better than Big Star's. I usually go with two pastors, a fish taco and the veggie taco of the day. Throw in some of their pickled veggies and an horchata and it's a perfect meal.

46.description: By far the best tacos and burritos in Northside!!! Although is always a line, is worth the waiting.The staff is friendly and if you are not sure what to order, they will help you out! Great place for lunch and dinner! BYOB and CASH ONLY!

1.description: The food is fantastic. The prices are great. You should go if you want to. If you don't want to, that's OK too. As good and reasonable as everything is, I don't think it's quite worth the wait. It's good Mexican. Really good. There's a lot of really good Mexican in Chicago. So. You know. If you're close and there's no wait... go for it.

55.description: So happy that I live a few blocks from this place.  My family gets food from here a few times per month, more since they doubled their space and added seating area.  The Mexican food is some of the best in Chicago, which is saying something. Coupled with their decent prices (cash only), and that's why we're regulars.  I'm a big fan of their Gringo/Gringas.  My kids love their pastor and pollo tacos.  My wife usually gets their pollo tortas.

9.description: Found this place through yelpThe prices are decent and the food is good hahaCashier ruined the surprise me drink by telling me what it was but it was still deliciousI don't recommend getting it to go Eat it fresh :)

26.description: Came here on a whim because I wanted to see what the hype was about.... The hype is REAL!!! Amazing. We got the fish, chicken and steak tacos, quesadilla, guac and horchata. The fish taco has so much flavor, the chicken is big pieces seasoned beautifully and we can literally taste the sear on the steaks. The guacamole is delicious and they have dried cranberries on top that give it a unique flavor. Homemade tortillas with amazing chihuahua cheese for the quesadilla. And horchata that you can tell they took time and effort to make - authentic! The music is lively and great and the atmosphere is awesome.Only bad thing is the parking and there is usually and but its so worth it!!!

25.description: Great taco joint. Always busy. Straight forward goodness. Al Pastor with chunks of pineapple make it great.

12.description: Love this place! Best steak tacos in the area, hands down. I've also had the shrimp and fish tacos, both good as well. Definitely my go to taco spot right now.

59.description: My favorite restaurant in the entire world. And I have eaten all over the world. Home made tortillas, fresh chips, guac with cranberries, two salsas to choose from and they're both unreal. I could eat this every day. El Gringo is the best and get extra meat if you're starving!

21.description: They Forgot 2 shrimp tacos I ordered and u can't call them because their phone don't work. Bad service. And even after I asked them to make sure they marked what each taco was.

17.description: For the prize I say to expensive for a taco or small burrito. $2.39 for a taco too much .Ordered a rajas taco n it was mostly grilled onions, plus .39c extra if I wanted extra cheese or sour cream.Was really expecting to buy a stuff bell pepper taco and pay same.The burrito was just an oversize taco not close to an actual  burrito $5.49.

10.description: Holy cow! This place is awesome. Came here on a Saturday night, there was a line, but it was so worth the wait! You place your order at the counter, either for to-go or to eat there. If it's to-go, you wait up front around the counter for them to cook it and they'll call your name when it's ready. If it's for there, you can find a seat and they'll bring it to you (at least that's what it looked like. We ordered to-go).I was really craving a burrito, so my husband and I came here for a bite. The steak in my steak burrito (for under $6!!!) tasted like steak you'd get in a steakhouse. I was so so so happy. I'm practically drooling just thinking about it right now. It was, hands down, the best burrito I've ever had in my life. My husband got a shrimp taco and a steak taco and, again, the steak tasted like steakhouse steak. The shrimp taco was great as well. He also tried an apple soda, which I was not a fan of, but he liked. They serve horchata as well, we didn't try it, but lots of people ordered it and it looked delicious. It's a little cramped inside when there is a line, but my word the food more than compensates!!!

5.description: 12:42 just missed the long line. Poblano tacos,ribeye taco, Cameron taco on homemade tortilla with side of rice and beans, to add to my ever growing food belly, will  power Susan will power.. Smells great, sweet cashier. only Limited parking . Excellent flavor packed with Caramelized  onions in ribeye and poblano taco. A little to greasy the food was great but afterwards I felt a little queasy from the grease. I will order one homemade tortilla next time they are corn very tasty but a little heavy . The ratio of meat to vegetable worked out nicely. Not as much meat as they show in pictures but was very tasty. I will come back and try other things.

3.description: Cash only meant that we had to be strategic how to spend our $20 for the two of us. If I had only $20 next time, I would make certain to get the fish taco, horchata, and try some other tacos. I would skip the gringa and elotes, sadly enough. Elotes were watery and felt like it came straight out of a can, overburdened with cheese. Wish they traded out the excess cheese for some crema, valentina hot sauce, mayo, and butter. I thought I would love the gringa but it didn't really wow my taste buds. I didn't love the homemade thick masa, and the meat/cheese combo was just a little flat.

35.description: I decided to give a try based on 4.5 stars on Yelp. If this is the best taco in Chicago as some suggested, then that is really sad. I recently moved from LA where you can find plenty of authentic Mexican places, this is NOT one of those places. Carne Asada for one, was marinated way too salty. Shrimp taco had barely any taste, so plain without any kicks. The only good food was guacamole with chips, I should have stopped there...

19.description: Best steak tacos in town!!! They take a bit long to serve but the food is definitely worth the wait. You could also ask for your tacos to be served on homemade tortillas.

28.description: Another great cash only establishment that can pull it off because it's so good.  Amazing staff that handle the crowds with a smile.  Prices are great and the food is as well.  Home made tortillas makes it a true contender.  A+

45.description: Literally everything we ordered was burnt and over salted. This place definitely pays for fake Yelp reviews. I'll be surprised if this review stays up! Make the trek south and go to don Chema or taqueria Moran.

33.description: The best tacos I've had in Chicago. The best al pastor that I've ever had. It definitely lives up to the hype, and I feel silly for doubting all the people who told me it's better than Big Star (it definitely is). I recommend the gringa for a front row seat to chunks of delicious pork and chihuahua cheese.

43.description: I know what I'm about to say might stir controversy but I think that there is a strong possibility that this is the best taco place in Chicago. The tacos leave a greasy residue in the bottom of your tray but the taste is absolutely amazing! The day we came, they had ribeye tacos for ONE DOLLAR! So I got one of those and the poblano taco. The ribeye taco was pretty good but the poblano taco was AMAZING! It was really rich but well balanced with other flavors. They also give you a little container of pickles if your taco needs a little bit of extra freshness. This place was so good, we even tossed around the idea of coming back for dinner :Doh yeah, CASH ONLY!

2.description: The food: 4/5. I've only had their tacos and they are consistently delicious. Best tacos in Chicago? Probably not, but the best Logan square has to offer. The service: 4/5. Never ate there, but the takeout if usually very fast.Overall: 4/5. A no frills Mexican spot that serves good tacos.

18.description: Once again Yelp hooked me up with a winner! Since I officially became an L'Patron regular today, I owe this little gem a review. I'm not sure I've had better tacos anywhere & they win hands down on value. At $2.39/delightful taco it's seriously the best bargain you can imagine. There are many more items on their menu that look really great, but I'm sticking with the tacos!The Al Pastor marinated pork with grilled pineapple, onions & cilantro tacos pack an incredible punch of flavor & messiness that's worth licking your fingers so you don't miss anything. They wrap them in paper with twisty ends that helps to hold it together but it's a battle you're destined to lose to sticky fingers. The Carne Asada Steak & Pollo Adobo Marinated Chicken are very close 2nd favorites to the pork. Which one wins would clearly be a matter of personal preference. The fish taco was a little too tartary for my taste but that's literally my only minor critique. Their guacamole is made with dried cherries & who knew that would make it so delicious - but it does. They are generous with homemade chips and their red & green salsas are available at your table. Green is way spicier!You order at the counter, cash only. They call you over a loudspeaker for dine in or takeout when your food is ready and it's efficiently done. There's always bumping Mexican music that adds to the dining atmosphere. It's fun & delicious here. You should go!

41.description: Everyone says"Its the best". Most of the time it's the best to you. This time, they are right. Best Carne Asada and Pastor tacos I've had in Chicago. There is a Taco Stand on every corner of  the city, but when I want GREAT tacos, not at a Gold Coast price, I'm coming back. Great price for what you get and the service is great. Rare in Chicago.

52.description: Cannot believe I've never eaten here before. The steak tacos are phenomenal! Actual pieces of meat- it's not shredded up and burnt. Juicy large chunks of delicious meat! The flavor was on point!!!! They give you free MexiCAN escabeche if you like it- I highly recommend it it's seasoned deliciously. My kids had tacos and my friend has ride and beans. I tasted the beans and they were great! Overall delicious food at a great price- 5 of us ate for $27 with drinks! Can't wait to go back and try more food!!!!CASH ONLY!

50.description: Our go to Mexican spot. The tacos are great and the service is nice and fast. The shrimp tacos are a must try here, but don't forget the guac and chips.

4.description: L' Patron on Diversey just west of California & Kennedy exit.  How do you say amazing food.  I went there yesterday with my sister around lunch and just beat the lunch crowd.  I ordered a total of 5 tacos, 3 for dining in and 2 to carry out for my wifey at home.  I heard they also have homemade tortillas so I got them on all 5 tacos.  I didn't know they charged $.80/piece extra for them.  They were good and worth trying, but I wish I only got it on one of the homemade tortillas.  I got 3 of the homemade tortillas, but they were really thick and very filling.  1) Camaron topped with roasted Serrano aloli dressed cabbage and fresh pico de gallo (delicious)2) Al Pastor/marinated pork w/white onions diced, caramelized onions and green onions chopped fine.3) Ribeye and caramelized onion (where's the meat). In spite of not having very much ribeye in the taco and having it smothered by a ton of caramelized onions the flavor was amazing. I also ordered a horchata that was very tasty and served as a nice way to clear my palette between the different tacos.I will definitely be back to try some of the other items.  Their Tortas and burritos look amazingThe food is very reasonably priced and very good

6.description: L'Patron is a great little taco place with really delicious al pastor.  Don't want to wait for al pastor at Big Star?  Do yourself a favor and get your butt over here.  The carne asada was also very flavorful and for my charming vegetarian companion, they have interesting veggie taco specials.  The other details:  counter service, cash only.  GREAT TACOS!

22.description: Best tacos around. Fun place. Cheap. Go now!

15.description: This is without a doubt the best stake burrito I have ever eaten and I am definitely addicted. BUT I have to give one star till they turn the music WAY DOWN! It is STUPIDLY LOUD!!! I regret every time I stay to eat.

57.description: One star for the good service. Another star for the horchata. But good God does this place need a good scrub down. And the tacos were so bland and boring i didn't finish them.

36.description: Still pretty good street tacos. If you want to avoid the lines and a 45 min wait, I recommend calling in for pick up. Also, son't confuse this place with El Patron in Garfield Ridge. They are different, unrelated restaurants.Carne Asada - Smokey flavors, very fresh and simple. Definitely a classic.Pollo Adobado - A bit dry but the seasoning was good.Lengua - Tasted a little gamey this time.Pescado - Just skip the fish taco. The black pepper made it a bit more interesting but overall, way too mild and soggy.Chorizo - Delicious but too greasy.Lomo Encebollado - This was the crowd pleaser out of the bunch. I could eat this all day.Poblano Rajas - Pretty good if you want veggies cooked in possibly a chicken or beef stock.Camaron - It was fine. Seafood can be hard to do well in the Midwest.The pico de gallo had some dried cranberries or raisins mixed in to give it some sweetness. I didn't mind but my partner wasn't into it. Overall, I'll be coming back for more.

14.description: Now I see why this place is always crowded and they have 5 Star Yelp reviews out the wazoo.Everything is on point. Is it life changing? No. Is it the best Mexican street fare in the area?Definitely. Great service too.I tried the fish taco, shrimp, al pastor, and steak. Honestly I should have picked fish or shrimp but not both because the toppings on each taco were the same. Ooo but the toppings were good. Their slaw with the seafood tacos is definitely above average.Of the tacos I tried, the steak taco was surprisingly my favorite. Steak can be hit or miss (often chewy) but this steak was super tender. If I went back I'd prolly get 2 of these bad boys and try a burrito. I saw several people eatin them and I was jealous.

12.description: Had a party there for Halloween 50 people and let me tell you these people know how to take care of you. GREAT SERVICE, GREAT ATMOSPHERE, GREAT FOOD & GREAT DRINKS! what more can you ask for? We will be coming back with and having more partys there in the future! Thank you playbook for making our event a success! And thank you Maggie for making sure everyone had a drink at all times;)

3.description: My favorite place! Actually I work here , but when I have a day off , we are coming here with my friends. They always have something going on Friday nights, dj's, events, bands are coming and good specials (8-10 pm 2$ any drink you want). Saturday is Always great party . And Sundays..mmm... Retro music from 80's and more 5$ drinks all night. What can be better? Not everyone likes to go to their job on day off. But I do! I enjoy this place, it's like home, everybody is friendly and you really have this "Relaxing feeling ".

1.description: Went in on a Saturday night, made it before 10 and avoided $10 cover. It was pretty quiet at that time, but a good time to chill and listen to the music before it gets busy. The place is a decent size. There is one long main bar, 2 side bars and another one in the back room that is sort of like a lounge and away from the dancefloor and loud music.Sound system sounded very good and it wasn't loud to hurt your ears and leave them ringing. The light show was nice. Classy with cool lasers above the dance floor. Even the bar tops were lit up. Great atmosphere. The music started out more lounge like and then as it got later and busier transformed into club and house music. Well mixed by the dj also. I only remember hearing one mix that wasn't that smooth.As far as the crowd goes...I think 98% Eastern European. Only a handful I thought were not. Most people were dressed to impress. Some guys had t-shirts on, which I thought was against dress code as well as some with sneakers (gym shoes as some call them here). Most of the girls were dressed nice also. It's to be expected in a place like this.I have to say, even though there was no hip-hop, sans a few reworked house mixes of songs, it was finally a club that I didn't feel one ounce of ghetto-ness in. It was refreshing. The 2 girls dancing on each side of the dance floor was not as slutty as one would usually assume. They sorta blended in and were easy on the eyes.How could I forget about the drinks, bottled beers...$5 and most other mixed drinks seemed to be $8. Not too bad. Didn't see the bottle prices. There were booths for bottle service on each side of the dance floor.Free parking is a big plus! If you cab it, bring the receipt and everyone will get free entry. Not a bad idea.In all, I like the place and would go back.

2.description: Killer early 90s dance music. Very Eastern European and that's cool with me. Drinks were fairly cheap although not a great selection of vodkas.Went there for a few hours on a Friday night and had a great time until I realized maybe some of the girls there were strippers? I dunno. They sure we're dancing like they worked there and off tips...so totally changed the dynamic of my evening.I'd go again but don't know if I could handle the crowd or strippers...

9.description: Bunch of spoiled fat chicks that think there hot. Otherwise the service was excellent.

10.description: This is one of my favorite clubs.  I really like that there are a lot  of space and large dance floor, so there is a really good place if you like dancing) the music pretty good as well, it starts with the lounge music, so you can chill first and have some drinks and then it  changes to club , house  music. They always have pretty good special offers on bar and you can find there wide choice of different liqueurs as well as beers and any other different drinks at an affordable prices. Parties there are always fun!

13.description: went a couple weeks ago on a sat night. get there before 10 for no coveri'm 38 and marriedmost people are in their 20s and speak polish

16.description: While I can't say I'm a hardcore clubber, I was looking for a venue to throw my birthday party and have some dance floor fun. One of my friends recommended Stereo, so I checked out their website and facebook page, looked at the photos and decided to find out more about booking my birthday. I spoke with one of their hosts who explained the birthday packages and booked the party. Also found out they don't serve any food, but they do allow you to bring in your own. Overall, I really enjoyed it there and have since been back quite a few times. In a way, Stereo seems out of place. It's not downtown, but looks like an Vegas style club with a modern décor and amazing lighting effects. The cold steam jet explosion is just wild! The music was just right, and the DJ even dug out one of my favorite old dance songs and did a happy birthday shout out. I would have given them 5 stars if only the place was easier to get to. It's far from the L, so the best option is driving.

6.description: Had an awesome time out here. It's a pretty good place, watch out for Bollywood Nights out here. The crowd was good and drinks were priced pretty well. There was an entry fee of $10 (which is reasonable) and stereo system was really good too. I would definitely come back here when there is another Bollywood Night for sure. :)

15.description: warm club atmoshphere that brings some serious heat when the lights go down. Jakob and his crew have done it again.

0.description: I like this place a lot actually! It's very euro so be prepared for that! Myself being Polish I fit right in LOL! The music is good the vibe is good the drinks are good! Was pretty packed , the parking kinda sucks but overall really enjoy this place!

5.description: This club is for European people, if you don't know their culture so... for you will be kinda annoying. I like to go in this night club, cause I like the music and the people which are going there.

11.description: This is my favorite club in Chicago by far.  I am Polish though so perhaps that's why I like it so much.  I have been going here with my wife for years even back when it was the old Jedynka.  When Martini club opened up they took all the Polish business from Jedynka.  Well Jedynka remodeled and re-opened as Stereo and now Martini Club is all Mexican.  Stereo is now the place to be.As for the club they have several bars, a nice dance floor, laser lights, tables and VIP bottle service.  They also have the best music - all dance and NO rap.  There are no ghetto people here, everyone comes nicely dressed and they draw a nice hot crowd.  My Polish and European friends love this place but my non-European friends don't like it as much.  If you are European or come with Europeans you will have a great time here and I highly recommend you check it out.  It almost feels like Poland.

8.description: This club probably has the best dance quality music in Chicago. I have been here on Sunday and Friday nights. Retro music on Sundays brings back many good European memories. My recent visit was to see Bandoleros band. We had a terrific time dancing, they play a unique mix of Spanish and Arabic music. The owner is really nice, we were greeted at the door and offered a free cd of Bandeloros sample music. The service is quick, waitresses are always pleasant and polite.

4.description: I came here yesterday for the Halloween costume party and I must say it was very nice to see all different races of people coming together to have a great time. The place has been transformed back to life. The music is good ,the interior design is beautiful. Employees are all nice people,very friendly and attentive to your needs.I came with my wife,daughter and her boyfriend we had a great time.   The positives  1)free parking 2)free cover charge before 10pm 3) clean establishment .  I'VE  been coming here for 25years way back when this was the 123 nightclub and it just keep getting better. I want to say PETE and his family   have been providing the local community and everyone in chicago a safe,clean and affordable place to have a great time  god bless them.

14.description: I have been in this club just ones, but i really like it. This club has great music, a lot European people.

7.description: This place is absolutely amazing. Definitely will be back again! Cute European guys, great DJ, light show and tons of CONFETTI!! Even the bartenders are having an awesome time. This place is so full of energy!

3.description: I've been coming here with my family ever since I was a little girl. Don't be fooled by the appearance of this place, I know parking is a pain and it may look shabby but the food is excellent. I wish they had more business because they really deserve it. They do take a long long long..time to serve the food, but that's because everything is getting ready fresh. If you don't feel like waiting so long, I suggest you call your order in ahead of time, that's what I always do, so it's almost ready when I get there. Please give this place a chance, you won't regret it!

1.description: I've realized that many locals don't typically explore other neighborhoods in Chicago.  Well, Rosa J. is a freak of nature and enjoys being on foot or using public transportation to find great, affordable eats and shops in all kinds of neighborhoods (certainly safety first).  However, when her laziness calls, she jumps on hubby's work vehicle. They headed to "La Flor De Acapulco," on the corner of Grand and McVicker, near Austin Ave.  I found this place via Yelp when I was scouting what was around by one of the properties I was looking at back in June 2015.  We prepared with enough cash (cash-only establishment) and kept an empty stomach (because Mexican food will get you stuffed).  Street parking is free on the weekend, so let's go!  This place is pretty hole-in-the-wall, but that means awesome food is to come, isn't it?  Menu is surprisingly extensive, so narrowing down to one (1) entree of my choice was rather difficult.  I saw a picture of pozole verde on Yelp.  As I was trying to finalize my biggest food decision for the day, hubby shouted out "pozole verde" to the server.  That was alright because Rosa J. also had "tampiquena" in mind.  I was impressed by the condiments that came with the pozole verde: a large piece of chicharron (pork rind), half avocado, a tortilla, diced radish and other usual components that other Mexican restaurants would offer (diced onion, diced jalapeño, and lime).  I sampled some of it with hubby's permission: hearty, delicious, satisfying. Nevertheless, I believe I've made a wise choice to have tampiquena instead.  Although I wish the skirt steak could be made a bit more tender, I was glad I didn't fall into the Mexican-food coma if I consumed that big bowl of pozole verde.  Service was friendly.  If you need anything, ask because the servers will be concentrating on watching "La Rosa de Guadalupe" or whatever soap opera or variety show that is on at the moment.  Once again, "La Flor De Acapulco" is cash only, and our total after that crazy Chicago tax was about $25.  Based what was posted on the front entrance, their hours are Sundays to Saturdays, 1100 hour to 2200 hour.  I will have to come back for their pozole verde when I experience an extreme starvation.

2.description: I love their lunch specials during the week! You get a whole plate of fresh, quality, home cooking for 5 or 6 dollars. I love their rice and their beans are really good, too. The decor isn't impressive and its definitely a hole in the wall, but if you happen to be in the neighborhood, its worth stopping by.  Keep in mind, they are CASH ONLY!!!

5.description: . The service is slow , the ambiance is nothing to glamour about but the soup...ohhh my its the best damn soup in the world.

6.description: One of my favorite places to eat lunch though usually I'm the only one there or one of a few.  The amibience is ok and the staff speaks so little English that it took me several weeks to get them to understand that their smoke detectors required a battery.  Try eating in peace while smoke detectors are beeping at you.  The food on the other hand makes it all worthwile.  They also have some cheap lunch menu items that include a beer or margarita wth them.  My favorite is the Enchiladas Cancun which are chuck full of tasty shrimp and crab, also the Queso Fundido is excellent.

7.description: Even though it looks like it's in the middle of nowhere for such a great restaurant, IT IS WORTH IT! Their food is very delicious, I tried their Camarones al Moho de Ajo. DELICIOUS!!! The only bad thing is its kind of pricey for the quantity they offer. A family of four easily spends about $80. Overall the seats are classy, and they have a big plasma TV. If you want, they'll offer you a drink called EL COSCORON for free. I like it though.

8.description: OK,so it is not the prettiest restaurant and the decor needs major updating...but I would not change a thing....This place has the most amazing soup...La Costena...it is the best and the owner will not give a hint of the recipe :(.The soup is a shrimp and crab combo and very spicy (u can order it non-spicy but what's the point?)....and yes it is on the pricey side  for soup I believe it went up to $13 but I can be mistaken and it is well worth it.Also you may want to pre-order it at least 30 min before you get there. They make it to order and can take awhile to serve but again well worth it. Their steak taco's are also yummy and their beans stew is awesome! worth to check out if you like spicy,seafood and soup....

0.description: Great service, menu, value, and SUPER DELICIOUS. I think we found our new favorite Mexican restaurant in the entire city...

4.description: Their mole is very tasty.  I always get the mole enchiladas and they make them exactly the way I like.  With onion and queso cotoja!  None of that mozzarella cheese, but you have to ask for it that way.  The seafood cocktail is very tasty too!

3.description: First!So I only go to DDBR for their MilkShakes, and every time I find myself driving down Fullerton I fall into the same trap with the place. Its like they can never hear your order, your waiting forever in the drive thru, and the product is just bad. Milkshake was too runny and not think at all, the cup was sticky like it was not wiped before handed over. I have made my last visit to this place, never again!

1.description: Ice cream is good...but why serve breakfast when it is done so incredibly bad...hash brown...burnt and oily, sausage egg croissant...top 10 on the worst thing I have put in my mouth...the "egg" had the texture of powder...which it probably was...even the unsweetened iced tea tasted sweet...probably because they filled with sweet iced tea and then realized it should have been unsweet and instead of pouring it out, they just added to it...such attention to detail...NOT.Did drive through and had to check order twice because of missing items that were paid for...but still feel bad for clerk, probably new and just need better trainers.

2.description: This Dunkin Donuts is beyond rude.  The older woman at the drive thru consistently tries to haggle you into a larger size or more food.  No, I want what I ordered.  This happens on a daily basis and then she's rude when you say NO.  She also barely reaches outside the window to hand you your food or get the money.  They always forget to put cream and sugar in the coffee.  I am so over this place and done giving them my money.

0.description: Good Lattes. Good Bagels with cream. Costumer service is decent.  Did I mention there's Baskin Robbins like right there, so great ice cream.

3.description: BIGGG Mistake!!!  My daughter needed a specific $20 maternity belt to support her pregnant belly while working long hours. I went to NMNB and had a helpful saleswoman. They carried two at that price so I  was going to wait to ask my daughter which one she had requested. The saleswoman insisted that I take both to give her the choice. I asked about the return policy and was told that up to 14 days they would refund my money and after that I would get a store credit. I thought that was very fair so I bought both. My daughter chose the one she wanted immediately not opening the 2nd one. I intended to return the other one but forgot about it. The day after her baby was born, I was in her home and came across the other belt. I immediately took it back thinking I would exchange it for many other items as she needed everything and being a first time Grandma, I wanted to buy out the store. When I walked in, there were two woman sitting behind the desk on the phone. I placed the belt on the counter to get their attention and so they didn't think I stole it. I then walked around gathering items and patiently waiting for someone to acknowledge me. When one of them finally hung up, (never gave me the just a minute sign), she looked at the receipt and practically threw the belt back at me stating, "This was bought 6 weeks ago!!! I can't take this back!!!" With a tone in her voice that was more of an accusation. I said I did not expect my money back. I knew I exceeded the 14 days so a store credit would be fine. I had about $200 worth of items I was prepared to buy. She held the belt out and said I could not have a store credit as that was only good for 30 days which I also exceeded. Funny, no one ever mentioned the stuck forever after 30 days part or I would never have bought it. I literally begged her to apply the credit to the many items I was about to purchase. I reasoned that the maternity belt was a staple item that they carry all the time with no expiration date and will never go out of style. It was also untouched, unopened. Needless to say, I dropped the merchandise and walked out. I almost never went back but coming across the belt again, I tried one more time a few months later thinking reason and good business sense may help. Same story different month. I am now officially done with that store forever. What a foolish thing for a small business owner to do to a customer over a $20 sale for an item you stock all the time. Their competition was happy to have my business.  BIGGGG Mistake!!!

1.description: I wish I had known about this store 7 months ago when my daughter was born. NMNB carries everything I have been looking for at other big name stores that I could never find. Medela, Aden & Anais, SkipHop, Zutano, etc... They have a lactation room and lactation consultants to help with BF. I wish I had also known about this as well. A large offering of both maternity and nursing clothes. Their prices were reasonable and even lower than other privately owned new baby stores. I will definitely be returning for my baby needs.

2.description: I've had both bad and good experiences at this place, lets start with the bad to end on a high note...BAD- I had just found out about this place when my baby was a few weeks old.  I thought, wow, what a great resource in my area!  Went in, and had the unfortunate experience of working with a woman was obviously too high and mighty to deal with my post prego, new baby gross wardrobe and droopy eyes.  I wanted to take a class, and she pretty much told me no.  Same thing with lactation consultation...  She literally said "If you don't have it down by now, then you're never going to get it".   Um, ok?  So I left in a huff, but I really wanted to take a class before I had to go back to work.  GOOD - So I tried again.  New staff person, super friendly, super helpful, got me all signed up even though my baby wasn't quite at the level she should have been for the class.  It was a great class (Baby Development 4months - 1yr) and reasonably priced ($50).  Instructor was super awesome with lots of suggestions.  Store itself has great toys and lots o stuff for mama and baby.

5.description: I have so much to say about this wonderful place, I do not even know where to start.  My love for New Mother New Baby (NMNB) started about sixteen months ago, when I was six months pregnant.  I was a mom-to-be, and never had I felt more clueless and overwhelmed in my life.  This store came to my rescue, and I want to share some of these experiences with you.  I was five months pregnant and it was time to register.  I went to BuyBuy Baby with my husband.  The store employee handed us a five page list and a wand, and told us to zap away.  After an awkward hour, we left the store with four items on our registry.  We felt overwhelmed and decided to go home, do some research on the internet, and give it another try.  A few weeks later, we made the same attempt at Babies R US.  My friend told me about NMNB.  I finally decided to give it a try.  What a difference, finally a store that cares!  I walked into NMNB  and was immediately greeted by knowledgeable staff that gave me insight on what I need, why I need it, what to buy now, and what to buy down the road.  The store is about 95% smaller than the big box stores, but has everything that you need.  Truly a wonderful shopping experience.  Everybody that works at NMNB is extremely knowledgeable and a great source of information.  Gail is one of the owners of NMNB.  She is also a lactation consultant.  If you are planning on breastfeeding, this is the only store for you.  They do breast pump rentals, sales, and sell everything and anything nursing related.  Gail was always available to me for any nursing questions that I had.  I also found my lactation consult with her tremendously helpful.  NMNB offers a ton of classes from breastfeeding to music to infant CPR. I enjoyed all of the classes I took. The New Mom's Group I joined was a great experience.   This was the perfect way to connect with other new moms, and also a great excuse to get you and your little one out of the house.  I would strongly recommend New Mother New Baby to anybody who is expecting or just had a baby.   It is also a great place to buy a baby gift!
