0.description: I've been wondering about New Mother New Baby for awhile now since its next to my daughters dance studio. Now that I'm a new mother with a new baby ( for the 3rd time) figured it was time to check it out. I originally visited with the hopes of buying some new parts for a friends hands free pump. However, I left with a hospital grade pump (rented it for $70/month) and some craft projects for my kids. Overall, very impressed with this store and would have really appreciated it after my first baby. The two women who helped me were nursing pros and just had a wealth of baby knowledge in general. They have everything you need and more for nursing moms, but also...lots of cute maternity clothes (which I hope to never wear again), all sort of baby necessities (priced a bit more than what you'll find on Amazon but you're shopping locally here) and even toys/crafts for kids of all ages. If my 5 yr old discovered the toy/craft section I would never get out of her dance class without first stopping here. For those who do need to bring older kids while they shop they do have a small playroom area with a small kitchen and other toys.They also have lots of baby classes here. Everything from new moms playgroup (amazing for first time moms), breastfeeding classes and even baby/mom yoga which I may sign up for. A fantastic resource for new (or even experienced) moms in the North Shore!

4.description: The concept of this store is nice but nothing new. Small and gloomy with a "tight space" feeling.I actually received a gift from this store for Mother's day. As a mom-to-be you need to try several different items as some do not sit well with you...especially scents that you would like pre-pregnancy...but during pregnancy OH NO!My husband attempted to return an item ($20) with a gift receipt. They said they wouldn't give him a refund because I opened the tab. All items were still sealed except the actual tab of the box was open.He then asked for store credit but was denied. He explained to them that pregnant women cannot tolerate all scents. They did not want to hear what he had to say. No refund and no store credit. They actually walked away from him!I want to also state that there is no return policy listed on the receipt...so how was I to know that I am not allowed to open a tab of a box that can be easily sealed?Needless to say, I will not be shopping here EVER nor will I recommend it to any of my fellow yelpers or personal friends.

1.description: Cool place to get some drinks. They always have great specials here and it makes a good stop for the few BYOB spots nearby.  They have a large selection.

0.description: The owner is very accommodating and helpful. It was great to see him stocking shelves. I was looking for some Bloody Mary mix and he only had one mix on the shelf which looked old so he gave it to us for free and said he would order more. We also got a great vodka choice for a very reasonable price. We will definitely be coming back here again.

3.description: I LOVE THiS PLACE!!! Some of the best gyros around.. I come here with my family all the time and finally got the chance to review this spot. I recommend getting the gyros personally but you can't go wrong with the Philly steak either. Great food and great vibes, glad this place is in the neighborhood it's definitely become one of our new spots. I recommend this place to everyone!!

1.description: I went to Endis to get ice cream for my 10 and 8 year old. That was the plan just ice cream, until i saw the cook walk out a Philly cheese steak sandwich to a customer and it looked amazing.Well you know how the story ends. It was so good and fresh defenetly going again .nice benches to sit outside also and enjoy not only good food but the nice weather also.The inside was really nice and clean and cool temperature

2.description: Yesterday, I stopped to try this place out for the first time. I ordered a hotdog and extra order of fries. As I stood near the counter and watched the the cook prepare my food, I noticed he was not wearing gloves. I was horrified that he was touching bread and other food with his bare hands, I requested my money back immediately and brought it to the owner's attention. Instead of trying to make his customer happy, apologize ......anything....He defended the man and said that they are not required to wear gloves,. EEEEEKKKK! That is so unprofessional and plain gross. I don't know where his hands have been or if he's even washed them. GROSS! I'll never go back there again and to make matter sworse, he didn't give me my full purchase back. He refunded me for the hotdog but not the fries. I smell a health inspection coming on.

5.description: I started going there a few times a year in 2011 for their really good beef sandwiches--Then there was a new owner--still really good beef--Then in 2014 another new owner--Apparently he had changed beef suppliers because this beef was stringy and full of gristle--I won't be going back

0.description: Love this place! I've had almost everything here never a dull moment everything taste amazing !

4.description: Philly steak and fries is the was amazing. Can't wait to get back try something else on the menu. Great food and awesome customer service. I definitely recommend this place if you are in the area.

3.description: We used to eat at Ody's when we were desperate for some grease. We were surprised when we drove past one day and saw it had been remodeled to Tommy's. We stopped in one day to give it a try and have since been there so many times. Food is great. We're working our way through the menu. Service is always friendly even when they are actively training people. Great place in our area for diner food.

1.description: Great food place is clean heats blasting.They did a great job remodeling. Now you can eat inside. Owner greets you at the door. Portions are good!

0.description: I am a fan of this place!Second time ordering delivery. Prompt nice delivery peopleGood food (great fries and milkshakes!) and fair prices. Will definitely be ordering again

2.description: This place had great reviews! Too bad I can't give one. First off we ordered a delivery for my job and were stoked to to try a new place. We ordered a double cheese burger which was not cooked right or seemed like it was old. We also had a chicken parm sandwich which was dry. I also ordered a maxwell st polish which was not really a maxwell st since it was not on French bread. I also wanted to try a chili but unfortunately it didn't make it on my delivery and I had to call them to deliver it for me since I paid for it. The chili was probably the best part of lunch but the chili wasn't that great either. I guess I have to still look for a good delivery fast food place for work.

5.description: I love that they remolded what used to be odys to what it is now, Tommy's. First of all, thank god they finally have a walk in (indoors) instead of what was a walk up (outdoors). Food is good, typical of similar hot dog places.

6.description: Been here a couple times. Everything we have gotten taste good and  service was great.

7.description: Ok so I just ate at the new Tommys on Grand and it was great! My kids Had a couple char dogs which were great! I had the el jefe burger which has bacon, pepper jack, and avocado. It was fantastic! We also all shared some of their fresh and hot chicken wings which hit the spot!  The staff was very nice and helpful with the big menu which has something for everyone, the owner lady was greeting everyone at the door and was very personable! I would recommend Tommys to anyone in the neighborhood to check out and make your regular spot!

8.description: Came a couple days ago for take out, Chicken Pita was a lil soggy , but ok flavor. Today Gyro salad was good.

9.description: Everything's great! The menu has SO many items to choose from- you won't leave hungry or disappointed!

10.description: They used to be ODYS & remodeled telling the area they were gonna bring better food! Well it's not I couldn't wait until this placed opened to check em out I ordered ribs & a Italian beef the ribs taste like skin & the Bbq sauce was nasty! The Italian beef was seasoned well but dry the fries & garlic bread were very good tho. Very disappointed

4.description: I pass this location almost daily on my commute to work and excited when they remodeled and brought this new restaurant.  On opening week, I stopped in to see if I could find something tasty but hopefully somewhat healthy. I chose the grilled chicken breast sandwich hold the mayo, it cost about $6. It was very tasty and juicy, almost like it was marinated in lemon juice and oregano. I came back over a week ago to order the same but it seemed a tad bite flavorless the second time around.  I hope it was a bad day, I'll give them another chance. Overall, the place is clean, the cashier was friendly, the prices are reasonable.

3.description: Great location and great price for the quality Gets very busy but if you find the right time for your schedule and their down time you hit jack pot Four vs five stars just due to the waiting area very small for how busy they get.

1.description: I have only been here a few times. They are well staffed , have plenty of no chip color options and regular as well . My technician did a good job on my toes , he got right to it with my ingrowns ! That seriously what I look for in a pedicure . Instant relief ! I didn't went in for a no chip but of course was up sold .Again he did a pretty good job as well. It is a lot pricier than what I pay

2.description: Idk but today was just not the best experience my nails are not to my liking I got a pedicure and I walked out basically with my feet in the same shape except for now I have polish.  The pedicure was over before it began she barely did anything to my feet. Gave quick buff and that was it. Polish all over my toes and They are still rough and no smoothness to them as I normally expect. Extremely disappointed I won't be trying any one else except for the guy I always go to. I hated my experience today and I'm such a fan of this place. Might go back to have them do it over

5.description: Mani-Pedi are done great here. They always do a good job! I decided to have a no chip manicure which it was done nicely but the next day it changed color! I had orange nails, instead of pink. I did go back and they repainted them. But it was  inconvenient to go back the next day.

6.description: When I walked in I saw every employee booked so I assumed I'd experience a wait which I didn't mind. The gentleman who greeted me asked me to pick out a color. After sitting for a few minutes I was asked to step over to soak my feet where I waited for about 30 minutes before anyone took care of me. The water was lukewarm when I first sat down and 30 minutes later it was cold. Disappointment.I felt like the guy doing my foot was on a mission to scrub off my skin and his foot massage was all but enjoyable. Clearly he has not learned the art of touch. Painful.I've come here three times and each of my experiences has been disappointing. At this point, regardless of how close in vicinity this place is to my place I will not come back.

7.description: Easily the most painful pedicure that I have ever received.I felt as if they used a cheese grater on my foot instead of a loofah.  He seriously scrubbed my foot so hard that I was sure that there would be no skin left.  I winced, I cringed, I grit my teeth, you would have thought that I was in the midst of giving birth. It hurt like a mofo.  Thankfully, he did not pull out that potato peeliing foot thing.I also had my fills done immediately afterward.  I am a glutton for punishment.  I seriously worried that the dremel tool was going to go through my finger.  I was really scared. He cut into my cuticle in one spot and I think that my eyes rolled backward when he hit it first with the gel activator then with acetone.I had thought that I was going in for a relaxing mani/ped.  Instead I received what could be interpreted as an impromptu S&M session, only I didn't choose to be on the receiving end, and I received absolutely zero pleasure.On a side note, despite the pain, they do a beautiful french manicure.

8.description: I will NEVER come back to this place. I went in for a pedicure and no-chip manicure.  The pedicure started off very rushed, with basically being pushed into the chair. The lady I had proceeded to inflict so much pain on my toe nails that I said, rather loudly, "what the heck are you doing???"  In Illinois, it is illegal for a nail salon to 1. cut your cuticles...they're only supposed to trim the dead skin away. My nail tech proceeded to pull and trim that I started bleeding. 2.Use a credo blade to remove calluses. Another big no no that they do at this place. I couldn't get out of there fast enough. Go there at your own risk.

9.description: Would never go back again, that's for sure.  I was there at 11am on a Sunday, the guy who took care of me had a terrible demeanor. I had a  $24 full set done, unpainted because I was annoyed with the situation.  To make matters worse within two days I had to have my nails done elsewhere and spend an additional $18 to fill in..When I asked him to change the channel he said he couldn't so we had to sit there and listen to the Sopranos, which doesn't seem appropriate tv for a business.  Nevertheless terrible experience will not be returning save your money and go elsewhere.

0.description: I'm not to happy, I went in to get pedicure and gel no-chip nude color. The guy that worked on my nails was gentle not to hurt my nails but he cut my skin and rushed to finish but me and my friends were the only ones there plus her daughter. There is even a tiny hair in my nail. I even had gel on my finger! It's not the best work, but if I wanted it how it is I could've done it myself. They're ok but I certainly won't be going agin.

4.description: I've gone here on and off for years. Your service truly depends on who takes care of you, the lady owner is ok. I've looked for other salons because I felt rushed here, I am no longer a regular client. The last time I had a no chip done it looked like small globs of clay.. yea that.BAD :( they wax well there, eyebrows and mustache. . Hung and min are solid tech' s. If you want a design tho, ask 4 someone who is good bcz not all of them are. Older polish selection, they will tell you they have a specific color..when they don't !!The guy owner is nice and very good at his job.  One thing that keeps me from giving a higher rating is thst I've been left soaking so longe the water has gotten cold. That's wrong.

3.description: I dont like mcdonalds but go once in a great while I go. Horrible always gets my order wrong, I've been there four times in the 3 years I've lived in this area and every order wrong! Went back told supervisor no apology, serious crabby face and just gave me right order. I will never again go there. pass this one right up trust me!

1.description: Im not a big fan of mcdonalds. But once in a great while I'll go. The four times that I have gone there in the 3 years I live in this area they have gotten every single order wrong. The last straw was today when I was in a hurry and got home only to see a wrong order. I checked it when they first gave it to me all wrappers look good get home open wrappers and they aren't the right sandwiches!  I drive all the way back ask for a manager told her this happens every single time, she got me the right order but no apology. As of matter of fact she said nothing at all!  Never again. Don't go to this location

2.description: It's McDonald's so I don't expect a lot.  As this location is on my route to work,  I stop in every so often.  The drive up is a nightmare so they lost a point.   Whether it's morning or night,  there's always a long line.  I normally park on the residential street and walk over. Inside it's been newly remodeled from a few years earlier. Everything is affordable and there's even a dollar menu.  I've found the customer service here just average.  My last incident the supervisor was rude about a request I made to my order so they lost another point there. I get that they are unpaid and overworked,  but I didn't pick this job for you hun and not everyone eats the same.

5.description: This McDonalds has the worst service of any that I have visited in the world - and I Mean that quite literally. Cold food, incorrect orders after long wait times, prices on their own menu not even being honored, the list goes on and on. In fact, they automatically upcharge you unless you specify that you only want a small or regular, you will be paying almost $10 for a large meal that you didn't even want. While this sounds like an easy fix, if you aren't fluent in Spanish, good luck communicating with any of the employees who work here.

0.description: Ooh All nightALL nightooh every nightso hold tight...hold tight...oooh baby hold tight!Any way you want itthat's the way you need itAny way you want itthat's the way you need itany way you want it!Sweet FUCing Chili sauce!  That's what inspired me to break into Journey songs and rave about this particular 24 hour McDonald's.  I did a serious U'ey when I saw the sign boasting that the new sweet chili sauce was here.  Deliciouso!I smothered that sauce all over my Southern Style Crispy sandwich.  It was amazing!

4.description: I visited this store many times and This store has completely changed compared to a few month a go. The food is super fresh, and their staff is so kind. I am very satisfied with their attitude and smile. They are fast, clean, delicious, kind. Almost perfect Mcdonald's store!! A new sheriff in town!!!!!

3.description: I was recommended by my mom to come here. They have previously done her, and my sister's, hair. I went for a haircut for my five-year-old daughter. Patti treated her great, spoke to her like she was a human, and did a really nice job on her hair. She was cautious of temperature while washing and made my daughter comfortable. They had child boosters and special seat for them.  I explained what I wanted and asked how much we needed to take off for it to be healthy. She cut off exactly what she said with no surprises, and did an amazing job on the cut. My daughter, who was nervous about cutting her long (but dead) hair, is sooooo happy with her cut and keeps asking to go back to Patti and cut it even shorter. Tips are cash only and I never carry cash so I didn't tip and she said it was fine........ I DID tip her a few days later because I'm not a horrible person lol.. But all in all it was a welcoming place. Very fair pricing and very clean. My sister went to the other hairstylist and was just as happy. I will be returning once somebody watches my two kids for me and I have a chance. I 100% recommend this place.

1.description: J'Adore is a terrific, modern, super clean, well  staffed salon. Blond Patty is a natural born talent. She really has the knack for a good haircut. The owners are friendly professional and the prices are reasonable. Love J'Adore

2.description: I went here for the first time a few days ago and I love it! I told Pati what I wanted and she immediately knew what I was looking for - I received balayage/ombré. This is the first salon that did the job right. Customer service is amazing here. I will definitely go back.

5.description: I am extremely picky about hair salons as you'll see by my other reviews. I just purchased a home which has put a damper on the "looking good" budget. I was happy to find a place that uses top of the line color products for reasonable prices. Ela is amazing. I waited a month to post this to see how my color held up and how my cut grew up. Ela gave me exactly what I asked for at a very reasonable price. I would highly recommend J'Adore if you are picky about your hair and want to get the style/color that you are asking for! I brought a picture in but wasn't 100% on what color to do for the winter and Ela recommended a color that I absolutely love.

0.description: Great service  great price I love the place    I love my hair Paty. Is  amazing   She did    My hair  she take her time    I definitely recommend this place  I can't wait to go back. And. she give me  free Moroccanoil  mask

4.description: Ela is amazing. My gf referred me to her and I couldn't be more thankful. I've also sent two of my friends there. She does my blonde hair perfectly and that is extremely hard to find! Very affordable and has a flexible schedule. I drive about 40 mins to get there and it is entirely worth it. I will not go anywhere else.

0.description: Airbrush review: It was the worse, i've ever gotten. It was uneven! I'm dying for it to fade! The salon itself was dirty. If you decide to give this place a chance, please be aware that you should specify if you want a male or female sprayer.

58.description: Outstanding service,  food is really delicious. Clean restaurant.  My glass was never half empty, that is the number one observation I look for.  They also have flat screen tvs, great place to bring the family.  :)

56.description: Hate doing this, but 2nd time eating here n still not impressed.  Smoothies r the best item on the menu.  After reading plenty of reviews n suggestions, I decided to order the Spicy Orange chicken, Beef fried rice and Crab Rangoon.  Spicy Orange Chicken was alright, but for the 2nd time in a roll, the rice had no flavor.  None.  Even after adding Soy sauce the rice still needed help.  I did enjoy the Pad See Eiw I had ordered once before, but not enough to return.  Place for me is just Eh! Will not be returning.

29.description: I started going to Jess cafe about 7 years now. And the reason I give them a 5 star is because they deserve it. Sometimes if a try Chinese food from different places and sorry! But, they are not like this place. Mongolian chicken isAmazing, jumbo shrimp fried rice #1 Everything we have tried is yummy!!! And I love how they treat you at your service.

42.description: I must say, the best wonton soup I ever had! Shrimp pad Thai, Beef Basil, Amazing. Coconut Shrimp terrific. The service was outstanding!  I would Higly recommend this place. They also deliver and do party trays. Ending with a great bubble tea!

23.description: Tried the beef brisket wonton noodle and it is delicious. Much better than Li Hing's wontons.

47.description: Thai, Chinese and Korean? All at one location? Amazing. Upon entering, you could already tell that the food was going to just be some good old comfort Chinese food. The restaurant was pretty full but we were seated very quickly. All of the staff were friendly. I must say that the vast menu kept me pretty occupied in trying to decide what I was feeling like eating. There were so many choices that looked and sounded so appetizing. I just couldn't make up my mind. My roommate ordered a Thai tea along with a beef kimchi soup noodle while I ordered a taro slush with an order of Thai green curry shrimp fried rice. The drinks came first, I would say that there tea and tapioca were pretty average. Boba was a little on the underdone side and tasted like they hadn't been soaked in sugar. Thai tea was cloyingly sweet but that's Thai tea for you. Taro slush was a little icy and not as smooth as I would have liked. First came the Korean beef noodle soup and all I can say is YUM! Nice broth with huge kimchi flavor. Only thing I would have changed was the noodles. Didn't really care for those too much. Great dish anyways. My fried rice took a little longer and wasn't as tasty as I expected. I was hoping for that strong coconut creamy taste that you get from Thai curry but this didn't have it at all. It was just a little spicy, green in color and has some curry flavored. The shrimp were on the smaller side also. Tasty nonetheless. We both left stuffed and satisfied. Excited to try the other dishes. Don't be shocked if I become a regular here! Haha

8.description: I'm unfortunately sorely disappointed with my latest experience. I was expecting the typical mushy pad Thai, but there was an off-tomato flavor that was completely off putting. I spent the opening to Up trying to pick out the sparse serving of meat and egg and came up with a small bowl. The noodles are really inedible for me so I'm unfortunately throwing it in the trash. While tasty, like almost every stir fry dish, it's generous with onions and peppers. I've come to realize there is little variety in the vegetable department. Those same peppers and onions make an appearance in the meat-light Singapore chow fun. This place has lost its luster for me.

31.description: Excellent clean food. The server was excellent with describing food based on our dietary restriction. Great flavors. I highly recommend this place.

34.description: Love the food, the Orange Chicken is good and many other plates, the staff is great and very nice always attentive! Get the almond cookies for dessert

16.description: Ehh this place has huge portions which is good but food is very bland.When coming here I had the padThai , though it looked delicious wasn't the best. Their smoothies on the other hand are pretty good.

13.description: I've been going to this place for 7 years now but lately was so disappointed!  Customer service sucks!!!  One time me and my kids came on a Friday night and the place was crowded no table available so we were asked if we will just order for take out which I agreed so I sent my older daughter home and ordered, then I was told that it will take 45-60 minutes.  I noticed more people coming  to dine in and was seated right away since few tables were vacated already and their food was served right away after 10 minutes of waiting only, while my order was placed ahead of them.  Again tonight I ordered for take out, order was placed at 7:13 pm and only got a call ready for pick up at 8:10 pm, since there's no parking I asked my daughter to go inside and pick it but she was told that they don't know anything about my order, which I already paid when I first came in.   This is so ridiculous - it was just complete chaos as if workers don't know what's going on!  Honestly food taste good but not like it was before.

11.description: This is ridiculous. My husband just waited more than an hour to pick up the order he phoned in. There was a crowd of people waiting - and other people told him they had been waiting more than an hour, too. It's now 9:15, and I cannot tell you what the food is like. BECAUSE IT ISN'T HERE YET.I understand that things can get hectic, and that sometimes people don't show up to work, or whatever. But in that case, stop taking orders. Don't hold your customers hostage for more than an hour waiting for food that shouldn't take more than 15 minutes to prepare.

39.description: I'm unfortunately sorely disappointed with my latest experience. I was expecting the typical mushy pad Thai, but there was an off-tomato flavor that was completely off putting. I spent the opening to Up trying to pick out the sparse serving of meat and egg and came up with a small bowl. The noodles are really inedible for me so I'm unfortunately throwing it in the trash. While tasty, like almost every stir fry dish, it's generous with onions and peppers. I've come to realize there is little variety in the vegetable department. Those same peppers and onions make an appearance in the meat-light Singapore chow fun. This place has lost its luster for me.

37.description: First off the restaurant is clean which tells me that someone's watching over things.  I tried the hot sour soup and Korean short ribs with white rice for lunch.  Both were very good and and I look forward to going back to try more.

0.description: This place is like Joy Yee's but smaller and they have CRISPY PATA!!!We came here for christmas eve dinner, not too busy but there were quite a few people dining in and picking up.We ordered crispy pata, salt and pepper squid beef cubes over tomato rice and japanese fried tofu with mushrooms.EVERYTHING WAS SO GOOD!!! the tofu was amazing, whatever sauce it was in was bomb.Some of us ordered smoothies as well, definitely up there with Joy Yee's.The staff there was so friendly and nice, we even talked to Jess herself! she gave us a little christmas present as well!thanks Jess! we will be back soon!

38.description: The variety of the offering is huge. So huge that can be intimidating.. In a good way. Big portions, fresh and delicious!

51.description: Chinese food and Thai iced tea?! YESSS!! I'm soooo happy to have found this place! It's definitely become one of my regular spots for a delicious meal and everyone is always so friendly!

27.description: Good Chinese is hard to find. This is the best I've been to by far.

32.description: This is my favorite asian restaurant since moving to the area. I love love their boba smoothies. Their service is good. The menu is large with many different types of food to choose from. The portion size vs price is good. My favorite so far is the wonton soup and the least favorite is the chicken with tomato rice (doesn't taste tomatoey).

54.description: ultimate fave! small little pan asian restaurant that gives off a joyyees vibe w their food. I love the fact that they serve filipino food and desserts like halo halo(which was not bad at all for not being a filipino restaurant) The variety of food and drinks is great but also large and over whelming. I personally enjoy their smoothies (bubble tea) more than the ones at joyyees. I always order the passion mango with tapioca. my go to dish seems to always be the traditional korean beef and vegetables over rice with extra beef. That extra beef does take you a long way. The food portions are huge and I'm always left taking home leftovers but I'm not complaining at all because, the more the merrier! Delivery service is also great, faster than jimmy johns! haha. Definitely my go to asian comfort food kind of place.

48.description: By far the best restaurant I've ever been to. Compared to Joy Yee's but Jess has a larger, more diverse menu. The owner Jess is the sweetest woman, her and her husband do what they do simply because they love their work despite they work extremely hard. You can't go wrong with practically everything on the menu, and their smoothies and milk teas are delicious. You want to have an event there, they are very willing to accept reservations. Go, try, and enjoy!

44.description: Very good place.  The staff is friendly.  The food is fantastic. Their smoothies are fresh fruit. I had their Vietnamese iced coffee and Thai coffee, both were superb.

24.description: I know some people are so caught up with what "type" of food a restaurant serves.  Just like an individual isn't obligated to identify his or her race and ethnicity on a job application, I feel that we should do the same on food.  Jess Cafe chose not to identify what kind of "Asian" food they bring to the table; describing Jess as "pan-Asian" is pretty accurate.  Their menu is beyond extensive.  I browsed through page by page like a novel, yet I only had one (1) thing on mind this evening: halo-halo with taro ice cream.  Hubby thought it was safe to pick an entree containing a variety of vegetables.  However, their tofu veggie noodle soup might have made with the pork-based broth or flavored with pork by-products.  For those who aren't fond of the piggy friends, ask for the dish to be made with the veggie broth.  Hubby wasn't able to foresee the consequence and was happily slurping the entire bowl of noodle soup, but he experienced what he was afraid of soon after.  On the other hand, my halo-halo was great.  Jess' halo-halo is heavy on coconut milk and ice, so it shares a strong resemblance to an Asian-style shaved ice.  I know halo-halo at some other places would be drizzled with caramel sauce, but the taste of halo-halo at Jess was similar to a fruity taro ice sundae.  In order to meet the $15 minimum purchase to use our MasterCard, we added the veggie lumpia Shanghai (spring rolls).  They were quite decent.  Many patrons called a head of time for their pick-up orders, so the phones were ringing non-stop.  Jess is close to the new neighborhood I'm moving into.  If I ever have cravings for anything Asian, I know Jess Cafe, on the southwest corner of Menard and Belmont, is within walking distance for me.

7.description: Best in Chicago!!!!! We live all d way from woodstock but we drive juz to go here!!!!

49.description: Eh. The food here was just meh. Nothing special. Dont understand why everyone raves about it so much. We got shrimp with lobster sauce, egg rolls, fried rice, & crab ragoon. All average, nothing amazing. Kinda disappointed.

40.description: Really delicious reasonable time frame for really great food! Staff very nice and attentive, accurate descriptions and timing for preparation and all service in general. Highly recommend!

53.description: Food cannot get any better..its that good. The prices are great for the huge amount of food they give you. Also, the workers are nice and kind and definitely take their jobs seriously as well as workers making the food.

30.description: SO AMAZING. I've been coming to Jess Cafe for the last 7 years and so far they have yet to disappoint. The food tastes amazing and you get your money's worth with the portion size they give you. They also serve really good fruit smoothies made from fresh fruit. Even if I'm not too hungry I'll stop there for a mango smoothie. If you're going to dine in, they have never been super busy where I would have to wait to be seated. They staff is really nice and always assures the diners are attended to. Also, they have an amazing owner, Jessica. She has always been so nice, friendly, and helpful. I always suggest this place if someone is looking for a good Chinese restaurant in the northwest side.

46.description: Seriously, Jess Cafe is my favorite Pan-Asian restaurant on the Northwest side of Chicago. Jess has a knack for creating perfectly seasoned dishes. The staff is always attentive to your needs and are always on their toes, serving you hand and foot. Although the menu is quite large and some items can be pricy, there is so much to enjoy, which makes this place exciting every time. Favorite Menu items: Beef cubes over tomato sauce rice, beef short ribs, thai green curry chicken chow fun,  large order of wonton soup (super good, super inexpensive, two meals worth), tarot smoothie and extra coconut with tapioca balls, vietnamese iced coffee, oh, spring rolls, and wonton wrapped shrimp... it's all so good.

1.description: We've been waiting for our delivery for 1.5 hours!! When I called in to ask what the hold up was they said we should receive it any minute.  I asked if they can give me a discount because normally it's only a 45 minute wait. They said no because grubhub doesn't factor in if they're busy or not but we ordered from their website. That's complete BULL!The food there is great otherwise but this just pissed me off.

55.description: Ordered chicken fried rice, Mongolian beef, orange chicken, egg roll and wonton soup. I didn't like anything except for the fried rice to be very honest it just was not very good. The orange chicken was over cooked, Mongolian beef wasn't good quality had a lot of fat, found bones in the beef of the wonton first for me and egg roll had too much seasoning perhaps basil or cumin. Overall wasn't too happy spent around $50-$60 Which I wouldn't mind if it was good. Have two stars because customer service was good and the rice was fresh. I recommend to try the place ling hi across the street they seem to have the same menu and I ordered the same thing it was very very good.

9.description: I absolutely love this place. Delivery is always on time, and the food always taste amazing. The only downside is that some foods don't come in size small or medium. Chicken lo mein, orange chicken, green curry fry rice and wonton soup taste amazing. Cheers enjoy!

26.description: Number one orange chicken and chicken fried rice place in my book! You wont be disappointed.

25.description: Used to love this place until I broke my tooth on a piece of iron flying pan that made its way into my food

12.description: I'm a big fan of Jess Cafe! This spot is way better than your standard local Chinese spot. The food is fresh (as you can observe from seeing the chefs at the long table taking the ends off of mountains of fresh green beans) and really tasty. Also, their lunch special is a great deal--you'll spend ~$9 to get a soup, appetizer, and great dish.

59.description: I ordered food from this place. Upon getting the food the fried tofu was soggy and bad tasting. Contacted the restaurant about it and all i got was attitude and a laundry list of excuses about me being wrong. Their reasoning behind the fried tofu being bad was "well it's a delivery order" I've had delivery from other places before and it tasted a million times better than this restaurant's food.

21.description: Best Chinese spot on the northwest side of Chicago, and everyone knows it.   It has been years since I've been here, and I walked in yesterday and Jess totally remembered me.  She has had a lot of the same employees for years now.  Keeps the place looking  nice, and very comfortable. The beef is some of the best I've had at a Chinese restaurant.   Love the veggie combinations they put in their dishes.  Thumbs up!

17.description: I've been here about 3 times now and each time I leave there full and satisfied!! There food are amazing, the prices reasonable, and there entree/appetizer size are huge!! I literally have to pack whatever is left over cause I just couldn't finish it all. I highly suggest their fried rice!! :)

10.description: Thai, Chinese and Korean? All at one location? Amazing. Upon entering, you could already tell that the food was going to just be some good old comfort Chinese food. The restaurant was pretty full but we were seated very quickly. All of the staff were friendly. I must say that the vast menu kept me pretty occupied in trying to decide what I was feeling like eating. There were so many choices that looked and sounded so appetizing. I just couldn't make up my mind. My roommate ordered a Thai tea along with a beef kimchi soup noodle while I ordered a taro slush with an order of Thai green curry shrimp fried rice. The drinks came first, I would say that there tea and tapioca were pretty average. Boba was a little on the underdone side and tasted like they hadn't been soaked in sugar. Thai tea was cloyingly sweet but that's Thai tea for you. Taro slush was a little icy and not as smooth as I would have liked. First came the Korean beef noodle soup and all I can say is YUM! Nice broth with huge kimchi flavor. Only thing I would have changed was the noodles. Didn't really care for those too much. Great dish anyways. My fried rice took a little longer and wasn't as tasty as I expected. I was hoping for that strong coconut creamy taste that you get from Thai curry but this didn't have it at all. It was just a little spicy, green in color and has some curry flavored. The shrimp were on the smaller side also. Tasty nonetheless. We both left stuffed and satisfied. Excited to try the other dishes. Don't be shocked if I become a regular here! Haha

5.description: Once again this place is the #1 and consistent place for Thai & Chinese food .... The Taro smoothie is absolutely delicious (a must try) ... The wings are outstanding !!!! Best of all, it's a BYOB!!  Be aware it gets busy on the weekends ...

3.description: Jess Cafe, a pretty cool pan-asian spot right in my neighborhood. No matter what asian food you like Chinese, Japanese, Korean, Fillipino, Thai, etc they got it. Whether you want rice, noodles, meat or veggies they got it too. Everything is fresh and quick to order. Never have I had a bad meal here. In addition to their food their smoothies usually shake things up with an extensive array of flavors and combinations. They even have Durian Smoothies, which smelly like sweaty socks covered in moldy mushrooms but tasty so deliciously soft and succently sweet. You cannot visit without having one of those smoothies.Their service is impeccable. I swear they must of had the army come in and train them. When it's busy they all stand a little spaced out and watch the customers like a hawk. If you take a sip of water they are in your face filling it. If you drop your fork even before you pick it up a new one is already on the table. To be honest it's a little creepy, sometimes I like to not be bothered. But I appreciate the attention to detail. My only quaff is they sometimes fail to show any personality as if they are robots doing what they are trained to do. I gotta laugh at it sometimes.This is an extremely well run organization that wants their customer to have a great meal. Good food, good smoothies and sometimes an impersonal relationship with staff makes this a place I can go to on the regular.

35.description: I'll make it short and sweet.  Everything is good!!  I'm not kidding.  Order it, eat it, love it!  Staff is super nice as well. Jess is the best, she always says hello to us when we go in and my girls love the smoothies there.

19.description: Food is great. My dislike is $15 min on card. My total was like $9. The guy took my card but acted like he did me a favor. Also they told me it would be 25 minute wait for beef soup.Really?

28.description: Jess Cafe has never let us down! HUGE menu and everything tastes different and delicious. I don't know how they do it! They have excellent bubble tea. The Japanese potstickers are great. I almost always order salt & pepper tofu. It's incredible! Their soups are all great, especially egg drop. Like a hug in a bowl. We do delivery which can take long, but that's because it is so busy. So know that going forward. I would skip grubhub and just call your order in directly. The dine-in experience isn't very charming, but the food and service always make up for it.

45.description: The food is ok I wouldn't say great.. The prices are good so I see the point right most customers are happy

33.description: Jess Cafe is one of my favorite restaurants, I usual come here five times a month or even more to eat with friends and boyfriend. Service is great and all the employees are very friendly. They serve the food on a reasonable time, I never have to wait long for my food. Most especially the quality of food, it is just the best. The smoothies too are the best too, one of the best smoothie/bubble tea. I highly recommend this place to everyone. I brought and introduce this place to my friends and boyfriend and they all love this place.

43.description: I love the crispy salt n pepper smelt!

2.description: This is a gem! My husband and I were shopping at Babies R Us and wanted to catch dinner around the area since we are hardly up here. We found Jess Cafe on Yelp and had good reviews, so we came here. They are super busy on a Friday evening. It took about 5-10 minutes before we got seated..they have a LOT of take-out orders and delivery. This place really remind me of Joy  Yee's. In fact two of the employees who work at Jess Cafe are from the Chinatown Joy Yee's. I remember them when I dined there many years ago - looks like they ventured out and opened a place of their own! The menu is big - just like Joy Yee's and they have all sorts of Asian food from Chinese, Korean, Japanese, Thai, etc. It's an Asian Fusion place. They also make the fruit freezes with tapiocas like Joy Yee's. In fact I think it might be the same lady who made them at Joy Yee's who make them at Jess Cafe. My husband and I ordered few dishes - I forgot what they all were, but they were really good. Only thing I would complain is that it took more than 30 minutes before our food was served from the time we ordered. There were few police officers eating there, and obviously they all got served before we did. We also heard their meals were free - on the house! That is nice!Overall, we like it here. Good food, and wish the service was faster, though.

18.description: Best pan Asian food in the area! Sesame chicken is awesome! The staff is great! Honestly very nice, kind hearted, caring people own and work at this establishment. My mother is retired and handicapped, but also stubborn and goes walking about to her favorite restaurant,  Jess Cafe =) and the owner always offers to to give my mom a ride home and has done so a few times. She honestly cares about her customers and people in general. I have nothing but great things to say about this establishment from the service, to the food, to the kindness they show for others. I highly recommend this restaurant!!

41.description: My husband and I love trying new restaurants because you never know when you'll come across an amazing place like Jess Cafe.I've already been there three times this past month and LOVE IT HERE! The menu is quite large so it can be overwhelming at first, but they put a little thumbs up on their most popular items which helps. The MUST HAVE each time I go are their egg rolls. I am always on the hunt for delicious egg rolls and theirs is probably the best I have ever had, especially with their unique tasting sauce. My husband doesn't even like egg rolls but can't wait to go back just for theirs!WARNING, they serve family style so pay attention to how much you are ordering because they will not tell you! But other than that I HIGHLY recommend this place.

52.description: The chicken pad Thai was AMAZING! One of the best I've ever had. I dined in for lunch and had the lunch special. Which included miso soup, crab Rangoon or egg roll, and a huge portion of pad Thai for only $6.25. The service was a tad bit weird. They would come up to us every time we took a sip of our water to fill it up and were watching us the whole time. Which I thought was super odd and didn't have much privacy for conversation. More of a takeout place.

50.description: The bubbletea is beyond a 5 star. It is the best I have ever had by far. Ask for extra tapioca, they're perfectly chewy and soft-so good. The fruit is so fresh it's like you picked it right off the vine! However the service blows and the food is just okay and extremely overpriced. I have waited so long for my check the past several times I've been there. Get it to go for sure. The egg rolls are a must crispy and good tasting. I would only recommend the egg rolls and bubbletea the rest of the food is bland and just okay. I will say the pictures look delicious which is what made me try the wonton soup, Singapore noodles, sesame chicken, and the lo mein-def not as good as they were pictured. Again way overpriced for what you get. Bubbletea all day though. Yum.

4.description: I know some people are so caught up with what "type" of food a restaurant serves.  Just like an individual isn't obligated to identify his or her race and ethnicity on a job application, I feel that we should do the same on food.  Jess Cafe chose not to identify what kind of "Asian" food they bring to the table; describing Jess as "pan-Asian" is pretty accurate.  Their menu is beyond extensive.  I browsed through page by page like a novel, yet I only had one (1) thing on mind this evening: halo-halo with taro ice cream.  Hubby thought it was safe to pick an entree containing a variety of vegetables.  However, their tofu veggie noodle soup might have made with the pork-based broth or flavored with pork by-products.  For those who aren't fond of the piggy friends, ask for the dish to be made with the veggie broth.  Hubby wasn't able to foresee the consequence and was happily slurping the entire bowl of noodle soup, but he experienced what he was afraid of soon after.  On the other hand, my halo-halo was great.  Jess' halo-halo is heavy on coconut milk and ice, so it shares a strong resemblance to an Asian-style shaved ice.  I know halo-halo at some other places would be drizzled with caramel sauce, but the taste of halo-halo at Jess was similar to a fruity taro ice sundae.  In order to meet the $15 minimum purchase to use our MasterCard, we added the veggie lumpia Shanghai (spring rolls).  They were quite decent.  Many patrons called a head of time for their pick-up orders, so the phones were ringing non-stop.  Jess is close to the new neighborhood I'm moving into.  If I ever have cravings for anything Asian, I know Jess Cafe, on the southwest corner of Menard and Belmont, is within walking distance for me.

6.description: This restaurant is a good alternative to when for some crazy reason you cant find youre way to going to Chinatown or the restaurant you intend to go to in Chinatown is closed when youre craving some chinese food, The chefs here once worked at Joyee's so it kinda feels the same with lots of options quite similar and in price but it just doesnt measure in taste...We tried the mango peach bubble shake with tapioca, crab rangoon, house special sesame fish fillet, beef cubes over tomato rice, and pepper and salt smelt/squid. Brian was our awesome waiter!

22.description: Had the spicy chicken and string beans, was okay but pretty sure they use MSG in all their dishes since even the soy sauce has it, also had the vegetable noodles and they were literally like gum, that's how over cooked they were. The only reason I gave them 2/5 was their Thai iced coffee which was absolutely the best I've had in a long time.

15.description: Seriously great Chinese food. Don't let the store front decor and simple dining room setup deter you. Couldn't care less how the place looked after I tasted the food. Fantastic service as well.  Worth a trip even if you are not from the area.

57.description: Love their food! Walnut shrimp and fresh pineapple fried rice for me everytime. A must when I'm back in town visiting family! Their bubble tea selection is awesome and hasn't disappointed!

20.description: If I would have written this review about two months ago, I would have given it three or four stars. We always have gone to jess cafe  because the kids like the sweet & sour chicken and we've had decent spicy dishes. We always pick up because delivery takes forever! However the last two times that we had food from jess café it was awful. Basil beef was disappointing and the general's chicken was over fried batter with small bits of chicken. Really bad.

36.description: We moved to this neighborhood a year ago, and went to Jess Cafe on a whim when we were walking one day. It was a really pleasant surprise. We now order from them at least once a month and it never fails. Deeeelicious. I'm writing this review because I'm having yet another new dish and it's wonderful. I think it's called yellow curried beef (my fiancé ordered, so I'm not sure). Anyway, the taste is consistent, the service is good and the smoothies are also awesome. I definitely recommend this lovely family business.

14.description: Best Chinese spot on the northwest side of Chicago, and everyone knows it.   It has been years since I've been here, and I walked in yesterday and Jess totally remembered me.  She has had a lot of the same employees for years now.  Keeps the place looking  nice, and very comfortable. The beef is some of the best I've had at a Chinese restaurant.   Love the veggie combinations they put in their dishes.  Thumbs up!

3.description: Been Coming Here since 06'. Best place i been to cut my hair. I moved to the suburbs and I make the drive just to get my hair cut here. Everyone is friendly and the atmosphere is awesome. I dont even know why it took me this long to write a review.

1.description: Today I had the opportunity to visit Final Cuts for the first time. I had the pleasure of getting a haircut by Joel who was nothing short of professional from beginning to end. With this being my first time here, I truly felt welcomed and appreciated. The attention to detail is truly remarkable. I'm pleased to say that after such an experience, I will definitely be returning to Final Cuts to get my haircuts. I encourage anyone whose on the fence about giving these guys a chance, to come experience a barber shop like no other. As a man, it's hard going to a new barber after you've established a relationship over the years. I'm happy I decided to make the move! Keep up the good work fellas! Thank you again!

2.description: Best barber - period! Every barber is operating at the highest level - you will not be disappointed!

5.description: Great service everytime have been coming here for a few years now. All the employees are very nice.

6.description: Many fresh styles available from the barbers at Final Cuts!Reasonable prices for quality work. Not just another fade shop for sure.

0.description: Hands down best barber shop in the city. Very chill & family oriented atmosphere. The staff are all very qualified and the barbershop is run in a very organized manner.It gets very packed on weekends so make sure you make an appointment if not they do take walk-ins.I recommend my Barber Red. Best barber in the city! cuts it exactly how you ask for. If not you still have a variety of very good barbers.

4.description: I brought my son to this shop to get a haircut. It was really hard to find a place that didn't mess up his hair . I decided to give this place a change. I loved it !!! The guys here were very friendly and very nice. They took care of us right away. The guy that did my son's hair took his time and did a great job. while I was there I was looking around and I've noticed that everyone there does a great job. If you're looking for a place to get a haircut I really recommend this place. This was my first time there but I really love it.

0.description: Family style restaurant...for 100 years.  If you have ever eaten here, leave a review now!!!  Forever LIVE 2443!

28.description: Going into this place gives me the hives.Don't get me wrong, I'm all for cheap stuff, but I just can't deal with shopping here.Here's the kicker: we went in here to buy a Christmas present (Trump: the Fragrance.  Yes, it was a joke) which we had seen here a week prior, but the place was super busy, so we thought we'd stop by later.  We get there, and I search through every inch of the perfume area.  I only found one box left that was beaten to shreds.  So I tracked down an employee and asked if there were more in the back.  She came back with a newer looking box.  Wonderful!Well, gift exchange time came, and our friend opened his gift.  He thought it was so funny he had to open it up and smell it right away.  Once he took the cellophane off, we realized it was THE SAME BOX!  They just re-plastic wrapped it and didn't even give me a discount.  So wrong.

1.description: This is another typical TJ Maxx, which doesn't have much to impress me.  However, it was able to find k-cups for the Keurig and they were well-stocked with many varieties.  In addition, they also had pretty massive selections of food items.  I found the sesame salad dressing for $2.99.  Unfortunately, women's ready-to-wear department is always a hit or miss.  I've been struggling to find some quality merchandize for work at any TJ Maxx.  Every once awhile I find some stylish pieces, but often times clothes were just picked over by human traffic.  The location of this TJ Maxx is conveniently located by the Bed, Bath and Beyond and Wal-Mart Express.  There's also a plenty of shops since Broadway, Diversey, and Clark run into each other.  With that being said, CTA bus 76 (Diversey), 22 (Clark), and 36 (Broadway) will take you there.  It's also within 10-minute walking distance from CTA Diversey Brown, Purple line station.

9.description: I came in here today to look for a Jersey to wear toour upcoming Elite Event on Wednesday Night...Dont wanna go to Jersey Jam without a Jersey...However.. I had no luck finding said Jersey today..T.J. Maxx did not have much variety..And.. I am not dissing T.J. Maxx.. because comparedto the Marshall's I went to last week this store lookspretty good..A nice, neat layout, no visible merchandise thrown on the floor,and decent variety just not in the sports apparel department!I did find a Brian Urlacher Jersey in Orange but..I dont do Orange so that was a negative!But from what I could see the store was definitely well organizedand the majority of the merchandise looked pretty good..But.. Yes.. I was disappointed not to be able to find my Jerseytoday, so I will continue my quest tomorrow..And.. I am determined to find my Jersey!Just sorry I could'nt find it at T.J.Maxx..:(

29.description: This is the worst TJ Maxx in the world.  Yes, I said in the world.  Usually you can find a few good deals on shoes or home decor items at TJ Maxx stores, but not at this one.  Everything in this particular TJ Maxx looks like it's been worn or used about 12 times over and then returned and put back on the shelf.  I go to the TJ Maxx off of Fullerton if I'm looking for a deal.  For whatever reason, they have much better inventory.

23.description: This TJ Maxx is very close to my apartment and I needed to do some last minute Christmas shopping so I stopped there. They have a decent selection of different stuff for the small size of the store. The one thing I really liked though was the customer service. I needed gift receipts and the gifts were for more than one person so I needed more than one and the only way they could do it was through separate transactions. The cashier was very patient and offered to ring up 4 different transactions so I can get all the different receipts. I was very appreciative. I will definitely go back to this location.

5.description: where is the best place to have a patio party in chicago? tjmaxx. just supply your own cocktails and grab a scarf from the rack.love, juston

31.description: The fitting room attendants here were nasty!  They were always bellowing in their ghetto-ass voices and giving me dirty looks as if I were an intruder.  They never failed to be rude every time and they'd make me wait forever until they finished goofing around, so during my last few times there, I'd just walk in the fitting room without getting a number card from them.  They didn't even notice or care!  My advice to T.J. Maxx: save yourself a few bucks and improve your reputation by firing these incompetent fools.With that said, I think the store's pretty dirty and cheap.  Yes, it's T.J. Maxx, but it's the most ghetto T.J. Maxx I've ever been to (and I'm from Brookfield!).  I would always find bras in the pants department, shoes in the luggage department, women's blouses in the children's department, and so on.

25.description: This TJ Maxx is definitely one of the better discount stores in the City.  I've found a Catherine Malandrino dress for $150, a Theory dress for $100, and an Andrew Marc leather motorycle jacket for $300 all at this location.

12.description: Very Handsome Boyfriend and I go out with friends for cocktails and he is wearing the soft, warm, new charcoal sweater I bought him.  The ladies around the table each proceed with A. You look GOOD! B. Nice Sweater!C. Where did you get that Sweater?D. All of the Above (with petting action)Boyfriend glares a little skeptically at me, because, let's face it, I am Italian and entirely capable of bribing the girls with drinks into complimenting the sweater he was initially not-so-excited about putting on... except I didn't. This time anyway. Then The Guys noticed and got jealous, They wanted this sweater and the feminine appreciation (and light petting) it garnered! After a few two many drinks, Boyfriend said "I want 3 or 4 more of these..." pulling at the sweater and swiped the ground with his foot (I swear!) Cutest thing ever. So Yelp, did you know T.J. Maxx has Cashmere and Lambswool Ralph Lauren Sweaters for half-retail or more? EW, Not the gross, ghetto sweatshirts with logos bigger than a house plastered all over... those are grosser than the go-to predecessor: a stained Bears T-Shirt with holes in it that "I SWEAR I do not know where it went! Where did you leave it last?"  Oh, No. This is the soft, subtle, warm sweater with the tasteful tiny little embroidered polo rider and horse on the chest.  Because, collect all the Macys coupons you can clip- you still won't be able to score this deal. And my friends won't either...Because I told them all I bought it at Saks. Ha. Shows them. But I'll tell you because you are extra-special to me. I bought four (Charcoal, Blue, Black and Gray) at TJ Maxx for just over $100.00. They retail individually at Saks for $185.00. Have a couple cocktails and you can still do the math, I did!

37.description: Lots of good deals here.  This location is a little less busy which makes shopping nice.  Great prices on linens and home accents.

21.description: I like this TJ Maxx. It's large and there's a good selection of stuff. I usually go here for home furnishings rather than clothing. The clothing selection can be a bit thin, but this is probably due to its location and the heavy flow of traffic through the store. I bought a nice wood elephant here.

16.description: The Max rules.Brazilian soccer team track jacket - $19.99Sweet army style brimmed hat - $5.99Bamboo utensil holder for my kitchen drawer - $5Looking pimp while putting my 3 forks away at home....priceless.

17.description: TJ MAXX is awesome. Unfortunately this one is in the middle of the gayborhood (I'm not hating- I'm family!) so should you be a size Medium or smaller and a male (who doesn't cross dress) you should be aware that these sizes tend to disappear and disappear fast. Now I'm not saying you'll walk inside and all that will be hanging on the racks will be in size large and above, oh no. Much worse. You will find racks half full and instead of Ed hardy, Puma, True religion or whoever you searched for hanging delicately off it's hanger- you will find a fabulous new UIC t shirt or perhaps if you're lucky a cubs t shirt (very possibly a jersey sporting a team members number that hasn't played for at least a season).I'm not a hater- I'm just saying.If you are these sizes, you see something you want, GRAB IT. It will be gone in minutes.Happy hunting!

10.description: I had a routine.  Trader Joe's for groceries, World Market for anything i couldn't find there and a quick dash into TJ for a bauble or something to freshen up my look. What happened? This used to be a great TJ--well-stocked, logically designed. Now, NOTHING. There are two racks of blouses and one rack of pants & skirts.  The previously huge clearance section is tiny now.  They have had the same dresses all summer. Speaking of the dress rack why is it over in the junior & plus department? I LOVE accessories and the last time I visited there were two hats and a few of those hideous infinity scarves.  The purse section was well-organized but again, mini. Hodge-podge housewares, you get the idea. It looks like they are closing!On the plus side, the store is always clean.  The staff does a great job merchandising what they do have.  The manager is really nice--welcoming and helpful.  Seems like they could really use some support from corporate.  You'd think with the traffic here-BBB & Walmart in the same building this place would be stuffed.

11.description: I've got love for the Maxx and I'm not embarrassed to put it in writing.So, the story goes like this: I run into TJM a couple times per month since it's close to my gym. Today, I found a pair of Saucony running shoes for $35. They're grey, trimmed in magenta and totally cute. The pair I actually wanted (they didn't have an 8.5, unfortunately) was on clearance for $21! I already completed my run so I can vouch that they're extremely comfortable with tons of shock-absorbing padding. Seriously, you can't beat that price for gym shoes. And a couple of weeks ago, I found a pair of to-the-knee flat, slouchy black boots (complete with expensive-looking detailing) for $50. Yep, fifty freakin' bucks! I've also found yoga mats here for $10, and earphones for $3.99.Sure, the sunglasses selection is really kind of miserable compared to other TJMs and most of their dresses are last year's rejects. But if you make a commitment to come in consistently, you're bound to stumble upon a fantastic deal or two.

26.description: This TJ Maxx blows.  I find the one in my hometown of Peoria, IL to be about 100 times better, even though at that one I once witnessed a little boy puke inside of a purse and put it back on the rack.  The one on Broadway looks as if something like this would be a regular occurence, but I do not actually have proof of it ever happening.The clothes are majorly picked over.  They have hardly any decent brands of shoes and the purses aren't so hot either (the ones that are decent are usually severely overpriced).  The perfume boxes have all been ripped open which is pretty standard at Teej, as I refer to it, but at this one it is a bit excessive.  Plus all they ever have is leftover Britney Spears Curious and some bottles of Chloe that appear to have been salvaged from 1982.  The had a short period of time where they brought in designer jeans and other designer apparel and had it displayed on separate racks, but they have apparently stopped doing that.  Even when they did have that stuff, it was usually still too expensive for me to buy and I could get a better selection of it at Filene's basement.  This place is dirty and after being there I feel like I just picked through someone else's hand-me-downs.  I think that the only luck I've ever had here is in the housewares department which is halfway decent- I got a couple of throw pillows that I thought were pretty nice.  I lived across the street from this one for an entire year and that is probably all I bought- this speaks volumes as I am a very heavy shopper.  Definitely try a better location if you can.

27.description: Selection is awful.  Is this the last stop before clothes are sold by the ton to Africa?  I swear I saw a kid from a  Unicef ad wearing something from "Juicy" that was on the remainder rack last year. That's just wrong, stop hurting third world nations and the eyes of conventioneers across the midwest in unventilated meeting rooms papered with Parisian scenes circa Cirque du Soleil- wait....is that what they are selling...wanna be costumes for the haute couture crowd on a budget? No one looks good in trapeze dress except trapeze artists!

35.description: Decent home goods, but for clothing it's hit or miss (not the store, ack!).  Accessories are OK.My stepsons were looking for dress shirts and found some in packages; they were not allowed to try them on!!  They said they'd measure the boys, but please, you're freaking TJ MAxx, now OFF the high horse.

8.description: This is the poorest TJ MAXX I've ever been!Unfortunately most items are broken, empty shelves, very disorganized and stuff seems that has been sitting there for years. Also, they don't restock often enough.

0.description: They have a weird layout, but I found some real gems in there nonetheless. Love their clearance rack. I walked away with some awesome finds and will definitely be back to slow stroll the clearance isle.

20.description: TJ MAXX is awesome. Unfortunately this one is in the middle of the gayborhood (I'm not hating- I'm family!) so should you be a size Medium or smaller and a male (who doesn't cross dress) you should be aware that these sizes tend to disappear and disappear fast. Now I'm not saying you'll walk inside and all that will be hanging on the racks will be in size large and above, oh no. Much worse. You will find racks half full and instead of Ed hardy, Puma, True religion or whoever you searched for hanging delicately off it's hanger- you will find a fabulous new UIC t shirt or perhaps if you're lucky a cubs t shirt (very possibly a jersey sporting a team members number that hasn't played for at least a season).I'm not a hater- I'm just saying.If you are these sizes, you see something you want, GRAB IT. It will be gone in minutes.Happy hunting!

19.description: Not the greatest selection compared to other TJMs in the city, but it's never as crowded and the other customers are less sketchy on average.

33.description: Not as good as Marshall's or the other TJ Maxx on State Street.

2.description: As retail has become more fragmented, I look to different stores for different things. TJMaxx is my go to for a couple of categories. I love their discounts on high end shaving creams and moisturizers; the stock varies so I check every time I go to find the best deals on brands like Zirh and Strivectin.  I love their selection of luggage as well. I've bought Tumi and Mandarina Duck luggage here at crazy low prices. I also like their underwear, winterwear and athleticwear discounts.Mostly, however, I like the new housewares section in the back right of the store where you can find pillows, dishes, picture frames, dog beds, and decorative items including lamps. I've found cute gifts for friend and great things to perk up my house.

34.description: I usually shop at the loop location, where I have found great dresses, shoes, and handbags.   I don't really like the new layout of the loop store...it is constantly changing and the same kinds of items are spread out throughout the store...not just one area for skirts, for example.  However, I am a dress junkie, and I have gotten some great deals on Max Studio, Adrianna Pappell, Nine West, etc...here.  Great knit dresses, wrap dresses, sundresses.  Did I mention that I was cheap?  I want to spend no more than $40 on a dress, and here I can do just that!  Also treasures can be found among the clearance shoes.  I coveted a pair of Nine West olive ankle straps for months...$40? I'll wait.  $30? I'll wait.  $15? Sold!

32.description: Probably my least favorite TJ Maxx location. Not a great selection of shoes, womens clothes or handbags. TJ Maxx if you can't get the basics down what good are you? Get a clue or hire someone who has one or  even better...close down so a nice New York & Company can open up.

18.description: When you can actually find clothes your size, then it's a good deal. The selection is miniscule here...

13.description: This TJ Maxx is A-Ok for sure in my book.  As with any store that gets new stock in daily, frequency is key to finding a bargain.  As is buying it when you see it because it probably won't be there next week.  I've gotten some great designer dresses here for a steal (To the Max, Laundry).  If you are in need of a particular basic, this is the place to look first and get it at a great discount.  This TJ Maxx in particular is great for kitchen products.  If I need something specific (spring foam pan anyone?) I check here before going downstairs with my coupons.  9 times out of 10 I have found what I need for half the price of other store in the building.Sure the store sometimes looks a little messy, but sometimes it doesn't.  The employees aren't overly friendly or helpful but the register line goes quickly.

4.description: I am so glad T J Maxx is just couple blocks away for the last minute new shirt or clothing you may need.Upon entering the store, you will notice the store is very well layed out.  To the left, is more of the limited household items are such as furniture, cookware, bathroom items and bedrooms items.  It is definitely a hit or miss if you are looking for a certain item.To the right of the entrance, you will notice the jewelry and clothing.  I can't speak out the jewelry or women's wear - so I won't.  However, regarding men's wear, the selections are pretty decent.  The prices are very reasonable.  Always plan to leave with more items that you originally went in there for.  Quality of clothing various, however, I've always been happy with my purchases.  Granted, there are times the store is a little unkempt but nothing really to complain about.Deena, Customer Service Representative, was very courteous when I was looking for my items and then at the checkout counter.Overall, happy with this department store.

24.description: The Max rules.Brazilian soccer team track jacket - $19.99Sweet army style brimmed hat - $5.99Bamboo utensil holder for my kitchen drawer - $5Looking pimp while putting my 3 forks away at home....priceless.

6.description: Not bad, not bad. I come here frequently when I'm in need for a little retail therapy. With good prices not only can I not complain, my pocket book can't either.I frequently have luck with finding good quality name brand items and on occasion have seen said items in big name and boutique stores around the the city for much more $$$$. If TJ Maxx is saving me money, I am a fan. Also, as a side note, my sister and I went shopping here for my nieces recently. There were SO many cute clothes for kids at this location. I think this is due to the fact that the neighborhood isn't really a kid friendly environment and those families that live in LP probably aren't shopping at TJ Maxx.

22.description: best. tj maxx. ever. huge, great selection, lots of designer stuff (think everything from bcbg to ralph lauren to michael kors) WAY discounted, and they restock constantly. one catch: clothing and shoes often stocked in the wrong size section. but let's be honest, that goes with the territory.

15.description: Worst service ever at return section. If you tried to return something. Wow good luck they are not happy about it and they will come back and tell you Didnt get at TJ Maxx which I did!

7.description: I shop TJMaxx for a variety of wants and needs. I was at this store last Thursday to get gifts & supplies supplies for that weekend's graduation events. Until I had returned home, I didn't realize I had lost my wallet In one the stores I'd visited that day. This TJMaxx returned my call to let me know the 'dressing room attendant' found my wallet, and put it their safe for my pickup.  I returned to the store, collected my perfectly fine wallet, and went home to find the hairs I'd lost because of my foolishness and to reflect on my experience with their RockStar customer service.  I will return, and return, and return again.

36.description: They have a lot of great handbags and stuff for your home here. I especially love the linens and home decor items. However like any other store of its kind, it can be hit or miss. I love this location though as compared to the location on State near Washington. The loop location is too insane for me.

30.description: The place is messy and the workers are some-what rude. I don't have luck finding clothing here, but every time I have gone in I came out with a good purse for less. It must be luck because I always get compliments on the purses I buy from here. I have had good luck with Kenneth Cole purses the most.

3.description: 2.5 stars for me.  TJ Maxx hasn't really impressed me as a discount retailer and I always feel like their Maxxanista commercials always are better than what I've seen in the actual stores.  Or, maybe this one just doesn't have that great of a selection compared to other locations.  Anyway, it seemed like the whole store could have used a quick straightening job.  The merchandise wasn't displayed nicely and certain areas were just a mess.  I mean, granted, it was a Sunday evening so I get it.  I've worked retail before.  Also, another gripe I have about the merchandise is that it just seems somewhat old and dirty. Nevertheless, my boyfriend found two Nike Pro workout tops, which were a steal at $15 a piece instead of $30.  We also picked up two huge coffee mugs, which amused us.Would I come back?  I suppose, but honestly, we were just in here to use the bathroom and ended up buying things anyway.  Oh, and another gripe - I really hate it when bathrooms don't have toilet seat covers!  Those should always be filled!

14.description: Don't get me wrong you'll find some great bargains in here, but what a mess. The store is always disheveled and the employees are not the friendliest bunch.  If you're able to find what you're looking for then you'll love this place.

3.description: I went in recently and was incredibly disappointed.  The cake selection was very poor, the cupcakes are very overpriced.  They no longer make a lot of the treats they used to because they lost their old baker! I BOUGHT a 6" cake, when I picked it up it was the 8 inch, I speak Spanish that was a deliberate I upgrade! Then I wanted to order cute baby shower cookies, they don't make them anymore..¤PLUS THEY charge ten bucks to decorate a cake!!!what a joke. there's a new bakery called viva on central and diversey (ACROSS FROM ALDI). You Are Better TAKING Your Money AND BUSINESS there!!!!

1.description: Super cheap tasty Mexican pastries! Churros are my favorite here :) friendly family owned business, so I'm all for supporting the locals...

2.description: Terrible. I ordered my mom and boyfriend A joint tres leches cake. The lady wrote "decorated nice for man and woman" in Spanish. It cost seventy dollars for a half sheet with strawberries. I almost fell over, I paid ahead. Went to pick it up the next day and they showed it to me, it was the most God awful tackiest thing I ever seen. It was mostly pink with SOME blue in it and had little rings on it (mustache purse) then a shoe and a top hat. I wanted to throw it, but of course since I paid ahead like an idiot and since they spoke no English and I didn't have the patience to think in Spanish I took it. The car ride back I had it in the passenger seat so when I got home my boyfriend went to pick it up and it was so full of milk that it Soaked through the cardboard box it was in. What a joke, never again!

5.description: Well I tried again to get the tres leches cake. I called after work and someone who did speak English answered. He said they always had the cakes in stock, I could get one any time. I asked if he could hold a 6" one for me, and I'd be there in a few minutes. I got there, and the same non English speaking girl was there. She brought my cake out, but it was wrong. It was the 8" She couldnt understand what I was trying to say at all. How do people run a business when no one speaks English. This is still the USA. Another couple came in wanting something for dessert. Well, that didnt happen because they didnt speak Spanish. They were as appauled as me. I ended up buying individual pieces of the cake. It was good. The bakery did seem to have a good selection of pastries and breads. However, I cant shop there because no one speaks English.

0.description: I've passed by this place several times before finally deciding to drop by to get some churros.  Walking in I was pleasantly surprised by the smell of cake, which was nice.  They had a nice selection of cookies, cakes, cupcakes, churros, donuts and also had a number of different drinks as well.  I only tried the churros, and that's the main source of my lack of stars.  I was really excited to get churros since I hadn't had them in a while, but was disappointed when I actually saw them (kind of...not-so-good looking).  I thought I'd give them a chance anyway; maybe they'd taste better than they looked?  Unfortunately they didn't taste all that great.  The texture wasn't bad, it had just the right amount of chewiness, but it lacked enough sugar on the outside so it was like eating a fried dough stick that wasn't very sweet.  Good for preventing diabetes, but not so good for my taste buds.

4.description: Don't let the other bad reviews keep you away from this place. But let this one do it for you! This place absolutely sucks. I speak spanish so it worked out with communicating with them. So I ordered a birthday cake and everything went well ordering wise. I went to pick it up and the cake had a tag on it.
