Literally on the cake! I asked why was that on their and the chick said it was to identify who's it is. She went to take it out and literally dug her fingers in the cake and tried to sell it to me with finger holes and everything (it had smeared frosting from I'm assuming it rubbing against the box). I told her I didn't want it and she didn't understand why. I ended up going to Mr. Cake which is absolutely awesome and I bought a ready made cake there.

1.description: excellent little hole in the wall greek bakery.its been there forever, the little greek owner tells me. the spinich pies are made right there, cheap and awesome, as is everything i tried including baklava and these white powdery cookies. support these places! they deserve it! and check out the amazing polish food culture all around this ethnic neighborhood.

2.description: This is such an amazing bakery that will fulfill all of your Greek pastry needs! Zorba's Pastry Shop has high quality Greek pastries that are made with fresh and delicious ingredients. Zorba's is the true definition of an authentic bakery and has provided remarkable service for over 30 years. One bite of their spanakopita (spinach pie) or baklava will give you a taste of Greece right here in Chicago!

0.description: Very authentic no frills Greek pastry shop. The owner is a very friendly man who really knows his stuff. Perhaps even better food than my YiaYia's...dare I say. Cash Only!

3.description: I always called for a pick up ahead of time since I don't want to wait 20 to 30 minutes for my pizza and ICB. I get to Little Caesars line is all the way outside the store and have to wait 10 minutes after already waited for the 10 minutes was told in the phone when placed my order. Cashier was dry and cold, "NEXT" So I tell the lady, "I call ahead for 2 Pepperonis and 1 ICB". She left to check in the back comes back and tell me, "They getting it ready". I asked, "but is it ready, right". She then reply, "They have to put the pizza in two separate boxes and the ICB goes in another box". I look, pause, and told her I know the preparation behind making and packing a pizza but that's not what I asked you. Right? Don't disrespect me talking to me like if I was 5 years old". The manager step in didn't apologize but instead tried to hurry up, rung me up so I can get out of the store faster. Well the magic of the internet with yelp, google reviews etc... is wonderful because allow you to vent out without being rush. Hoping someone in headquarter in Detroit MI sees this review and take action. I rate your customer service a 0.

1.description: Only reason why I came here is because I had a two year old Giftcard I won from a baby shower and it was late and lord knows I was too tired to cook anything.The Pizza itself isn't so bad but the customer service here is ridiculous!. Cashier had no expression not friendly not approachable, you couldn't ask her anything with out her copping a damn attitude and It just wasn't great.  I don't see how none of the bread sticks or garlic breads aren't served with marina sauce period and why it's extra and COLD!!! ugh just disappointing. Half the time I go in there the workers are texting and joking and just not setting a good example for the business. I DEF WILL NOT BE RETURNING.

2.description: Never hot and ready pizza. Takes at least ten to thirty minutes every time. Poor organization on the staff behalf. They could have a better system  to get this pizza out. Don't even bother at dinner time. Faster to go to another pizza spot..oh and one if the staff members tried to say my order disappeared after another had literally just repeated it to me...

5.description: I know what you're thinking. "This place is still around"? Yup. So I was in the mood for a pretty good frozen pizza....so we went to Little Caesars :)no yay or nay here...it is what it is, a $5 pizza that warded off starvation today.I would never choose this place over a local pizza place but today I lowered my standards, i'm full but not necessarily satisfied ...if that doesn't make you want to run out to your local Caesars, I don't know what will.

6.description: The pizza itself is okay, but the place is a DUMP. Not to mention the service here is the worst I've seen. Seriously, the way the cashiers talk to the workers and cooks is just unbelievable. Little Caesars definitely needs remodeling, and better service.As for the pizza? Meh. It's alright. For $5, what do you expect from a pizza? It tasted very flat, and didn't have any flavor. The cheese wasn't gooey, the sauce never dripped, the crust didn't have that greasy zest to it. It was just very subpar.As for the crazy bread? Again, pretty cheap. It's about three bucks. And again, it's nothing too special. Very greasy to the point where it's soggy.All in all, don't expect much from Little Caesars. It's a place meant if you're A) on a budget or B) if you're in a hurry. Like Cici's pizza, this is a significant step down from typical chain pizzerias such as "Pizza Hut" and "Sbarros". And I'm not just talking about the pizza.

7.description: These people know how to make a pizza! $5 ready cheese, sausage, or pepperoni pizza! and $6 mushroom, onion, or what ever flavor you want. That gooey cheese, flavorful sauce, and crispy non greasy crust...oh I need a pizza now!

8.description: For 5 bucks the pizza was good.  My beef is with the idea of the pizza being hot and ready.  We had to wait about fifteen minutes, which in my standard is not "ready".  I would recommend calling ahead because the place is popular.

9.description: skimpy toppings, just iok at best

0.description: I really don't know what everyone's crying about, the pizza was good and the service was great. They even told me on the phone that it was going to take ten minutes and it did take that long. The people there were so nice and friendly. And people, this place isn't some wealthy restaurant, your pizza is worth 6 dollars and will taste like that. The people here however made it taste like it was double the price. I would honestly recommend this place to anyone looking to get some Little Caesars.

4.description: The Pizza is a great deal as a last resort to getting a quick dinner on the table. The Service though is HORRIBLE. I don't mind waiting for Pizza that is fresh and hot. I don't mind the dry stares from the workers there looking like they wish they were somewhere else. Hell I don't even mind not being looked at when they take my order. What I do not like is how they ignore the customers to talk about how shitty their lives are amongst each other, how the employees take out their check stubs and interrupt taking pizza orders or making pizza to complain about their pay. There is no sign of supervision or management in this place at all.

3.description: They have awesome homemade salsas and their veggie tortas are really good. Truly a place that's not cheap with ingredients. Orale!

1.description: This place was really interesting... First, the food. Standard chips and salsa to start that included a spicy avocado. It was 8am on a Sunday so naturally I had the basic chorizo and eggs. Fairly flavorful rice, but the chorizo was meh. It wasn't as greasy as V&V Supremo brand, but it lacked flavor. I'm not sure if it was homemade or a grocery store brand, but it just didn't satisfy my post-Halloween hangover. Which brings me to my next comment. We were the only ones eating but almost all the tables were full. Everyone else was either still drunk - I'm not even sure if they ate. If you ever imagined being in the Mos Eisley cantina, I can tell you from my experience here, it's terrifying and exciting. There were a couple guys who were not together and on the verge of fighting the last 10 minutes of our stay. A full coffee mug was sacrificed to save our skins.We only ate there since they were open early on a Sunday near Portage Park... I'm imagining they could do a decent lunch takeout order, but I had all the adventure I needed from eating in one morning.

2.description: This is another 24/7 neighborhood Mexican joint here in the city.  I'm glad that it's a ten (10)-minute walking distance from my house.  Yes, "wall-in-the-hole" is exactly what Thaly's taqueria is, but it wasn't a shabby place to meet up a friend that you haven't seen for almost ten (10) years!  Everything from complimentary salsa/chips, chilaquiles con huevos, to the pozole was quite decent for a place that never closes.  Did I have better elsewhere?  I would say absolutely.  However, let's be realistic.  When Rosa J. is hungry, she immediately becomes incapacitated, both mentally and physically.  "Yelping" for a top-notch restaurant that may require a significant travel time (on public transportation especially) isn't going to be a practical solution to dealing with her great hunger.  Therefore, she has found a reliable joint on the southwest corner of Austin and Belmont.  For two (2) bowls of pozole, one (1) large horchata, one (1) small horchata, one (1) large agua de tamarindo, an order of chilaquiles con huevos, and one (1) tripe taco, the total was $36.  Just like every other Mexican restaurant, we all left with "Full," with a capital "F," stomaches.  They do accept most major credit cards, so there's no need to locate an ATM.

5.description: Salsas were excellent (one a lightly smoky rojas with good-sized tomato chunks, the other a creamy verde), al pastor was pretty good (no spit in sight though), carne asada was very light on seasoning/flavor. I'd give the food 3.5 stars, rounded up to 4 stars for being very good value for the money.

0.description: Best taco place for me! Idk if it is 24/7 but I have been to this place every hour of the day almost and they are always open! Love eating here!

4.description: Love the fact that this place is open 24 hours. The food here is very good and very affordable. The amount of meat on the tacos is very generous. The staff is friendly and they always try to treat you like family. Recommend this place for anyone in the Dunning Area, Portage Park and surroundings.

3.description: Went in for breakfast with husband, based on a recommendation from a friend. Service was very good & prompt, everyone was friendly & welcoming, coffee was refilled promptly, atmosphere was very family style - clean, quiet.Now for the not-so-good.Weird cheapie mismatched & bent flatware.. does that sound nitpicky? I dunno, but I do know that eating eggs with a thin rough tinny tasting aluminum fork is downright gross. My teeth hurt even thinking about it right now. Uck.And weirder... One of the featured items at the top of the breakfast menu were biscuits & gravy breakfast specials. Husband & I both ordered these - not even thinking twice about it, as biscuits & gravy are a breakfast staple at most Chicago diners.Breakfast arrived - quickly.Our eggs & sausage were fine.But the biscuits & gravy were bizarre.(Should have taken photos.. but I will try to describe)They arrived.. five flat brown roundish things in a sea of yellowish -- almost nacho-cheese-yellow -- 'gravy'. The gravy had a skin on it.It was tepid - bordering on cold - and had pieces of onion, burnt bacon and sausage in it. (The gravy part of biscuits and gravy is supposed to be a white gravy - like a bechamel - made with sausage crumbles.)And it gets better..On closer exam, the very flat brown biscuits turn out to be burnt-on-the-outside, raw-on-the-inside PANCAKES!? I am not kidding or exaggerating - they were pancakes, plain and simple and BAD pancakes to boot.I decided to eat this mess - and the weird yellow gravy also tasted of raw flour. It was gloopy & awful - and on top of raw burnt pancakes?!?Just ick.Now - we did notice as we ate that most patrons were Hispanic, so perhaps we should have ordered something that was not Southern American comfort food -- but biscuits & gravy were FEATURED as specials on their menu... why would anyone feature a dish that they apparently never tasted (or saw) in their life? We probably will not eat here again.The people were nice - but the food (& forks) were so wrong, that it isn't worth a return visit for us.

1.description: This place is a nice gem in the city. When we come home to visit my inlaws, we like to try new places and this place had good reviews. The staff was wonderful; the coffee was hot, fresh, and kept coming. The special was a great deal and they had no problem with a small substatution. The food was fantastic. We would highly recommend visiting.

2.description: Is soo delisous..! They are so friendlys and the food yummy .!El lugar es muy Amigable y la comida esta riquisima y yo lo recomiendo

5.description: My wife and I went here while we waited for our car to be fixed. We were seated right away and the waitress was extremely attentive. She came by regularly to check on us and top off our coffees and always had a smile on her face. We both ordered a simple breakfast of 2 eggs, 2 sausage/bacon, french toast/pancakes, and hash browns for five bucks. There was nothing "amazing" about any of the them, save the pancakes which were a lot bigger than you'd usually get at these types of places. The coffee was pretty good as well.All in all, I'd recommend this if you're looking to grab a quick bite to eat at a good price and don't expect to be wowed by gourmet meals. We're definitely going to stop by again.

6.description: I just tried this little spot on the corner or Fullerton and Central this past weekend and I was pleasantly surprised. I am a fan of Golden Nugget, but my bf is not, so we tried this place. I will start with my only complaint and that is that I wanted breakfast, (we went around 9pm on a Sat.) and although they serve it all day, I was not given a breakfast menu.Now, for the good stuff. I ordered a Chicken Ceaser Salad Wrap which was served with a large bowl of Cream of Broccoli Soup and french fries. The soup was really good and homemade (I think). The wrap was large and TASTY! I was not able to finish all of the soup or my wrap because I was too full, but it made for great leftovers the next day. The woman who waited on us was very nice and made sure we never had to ask for water, which is important to me when I dine out. My bf had  a steak torta and said he enjoyed it. The prices were good and the serving sizes were good too. This was a great little spot that is family owned and everything is homemade and cooked on site, as we were told.

7.description: I ate at the "Central Starlite Family Restaurant" in Chicago, IL on 10/20/2011. It was my first time there.  I was waiting to go see a football game at nearby Hanson Stadium.  I tried some of their Mexican food which was very good.  The service was good as well.  They didn't rush me out after I finished my meal either.

8.description: Wow!  I do not know what has happened here over the last 6 months, but what a dramatic downfall.  Took my family here for a Sunday dinner today, and literally everything was terrible!  I ordered the meat loaf and mashed potato dinner.  The 'meatloaf' was more like a formed patty of bread crumbs with gravy on top.  My mashed potatoes and corn were both literally ice cold, like they took them out of the fridge and forgot to warm them up.  The rest of our meal was pretty much the same story.  What used to be a nice mom & pop diner, has become a nightmare of frozen, reheated, reconstituted, roach coach food.  Talk about driving a restaurant into the ground!  YUK!!!!

0.description: I was surprised I did not know about this place given I live a few minutes away. The food was awesome (had a skillet) and everyone at my table also said their food was good. The waitress kept the coffee coming while we were there until I told her to stop... lolPrices are very affordable compared to other diners so I will be going there again whenever I am in the mood for breakfast food :)

4.description: I've never had a bad experience here. They are a great mom and pop shop with great food at good prices.

3.description: First time here today! I've been living in this area for 7 years and didn't know this was here!! Now that I'm moving to the far suburbs this summer, I'm only going to get to experience this place for a short time. I picked up bbq sticks and palabok today and it was yummy.

1.description: Very small Filipino mart. Usually when I shop for Asian staples, I head to bigger stores that sell all types of Asian fare.  Here at J&A, it's Filipino all the time. Most, if not all of the items, are Filipino brand--vinegars, fish sauce, soy sauce, dry spice packets (to make Sinigang, etc) snacks, and every item you'll need to make halo halo (win!). I saw some fresh produce, but not very many items to make it worth the money. J&A also sells hot food, Turo-Turo style, but maybe half of what you'd see at Ruby's or other Filipino stores.The day I visited they had 4 dishes available to order to go. I was there for the BBQ sticks.  Every Filipino knows what I'm talking about when I say BBQ sticks. For the uninitiated, it's pieces of marinated pork, skewered on sticks and grilled to perfection. Pork BBQ like this always evokes fun summer memories.  It's sticky, sweet, salty and has the perfect off-the-grill flavor. J&A's BBQ sticks does not disappoint.  There were some fatty peices, but otherwise very flavorful and worth the visit. The only thing to note is that the BBQ is freshly made, but wasn't very hot, so expect to re-heat when you get to your destination.I also brought home a small container of chicken caldereta--a chicken stewed with tomatoes, potatoes, red peppers and peas.  It was really good and rivals my mom's cooking, not heavy on salt either which sometimes befalls restaurant Filipino food. Friendly service; they have a catering menu too.

2.description: Hole in a wall filipino food in chicago. Visiting from the bay and we know our filipino food and this place just had one of the best food ive tasted. Its a point point joint and servings are huge

5.description: Located very far away from where Filipinos normally reside and shop, J&A is a tiny, nondescript store that happens to sell the best Filipino barbecue on a stick. For those familiar with this type of barbecue, J&A's version is made of pork, without sauce, and comes in 4 nice big chunks on wooden skewers. It goes great over white rice and is best complemented with a side of apple cider vinegar or atchara (pickled papaya, which I think they stopped selling).I've been ordering from here for years and I've seen the that meat portions are growing smaller and more expensive. However, I keep coming back because for me, I've been raised on their barbecue, the barbecue is great for parties and guests and it lasts a long time as leftovers.J&A also sells other types of warm Filipino food although you should call ahead to ask what they have and if they have enough. This includes the barbecue, for which, I also suggest you call ahead a few days in advance to place an order for pickup. They tend to run out of barbecue when it is offered as a daily item. In addition, J&A sells some standard Filipino food store wares such as white rice, air fresheners, snacks, rice flour, and calling cards.

6.description: If you're in the neighborhood, don't feel like cooking, and want deliciously cooked Filipino food then this is the place for you.  It's a small grocery store with a back section that has an opening where you can order/pick up food.  Some of their bests are the BBQ, menudo, and sisig.  I grew up with having our parties food catered by them as well as occasionally ordering their smaller portions when no one in the house has cooked.  You need to come early though otherwise the choices will be minimal.  They give good sized portions at a reasonable price.

7.description: Purchased from this mart for 20 years! Love the lumpia's! Theyre the best in town!!! Everything is terrific here; definitely a gem in the neighborhood!

0.description: Their BBQ pork skewers are amazing - perfectly grilled to perfection, juicy, perfectly seasoned, meaty, and awesomely conveniently on a stick, it's great just to eat it right away, or eat it within the next couple of days as your leftovers to snack on.  Each stick is $1, so it's a little pricey, and they don't give you discounts if you buy in bulk - however, it's great to get their kabobs catered for an event.  Make sure you request the non-fatty ones, as their quality of the meat can sometimes be inconsistent. Stick with the pork kabobs!+pork skewers :D

4.description: Best sisig in the whole of Chicagoland! I'm surprised this has not been mentioned in any of the previous reviews. Whenever I bring their sisig to any party or gathering, all I get are praises and raves. I am tempted to tell people I made the sisig myself, but I'd rather get the word out and let everyone know that one of the best sisig in America is here in Chicago. The one bad thing about the sisig though is that you can only purchase it in a big party tray and you have to call in advance to place an order. Although they sometimes sell half orders of the party tray if you request for it. And a very important thing to remember, they sell their sisig cold. So heat before serving! Definitely the place to go to for awesome home cooked Filipino food. They also have some Asian grocery items but are very limited.I would give them 5 stars for the quality of their food but I just have to take away 1 star because of their not so friendly customer service when taking orders over the phone. All the times I have called in an order, the person on the other line is always curt with her responses almost to a point of sounding rude. It's street parking and if you're lucky you can get a spot right in front of the store. If not, there's almost always space on the east side of the block. Their store may not be in the most "strategic" side of town but their food is definitely worth the trek!

0.description: The ladies are gorgeous and do an excellent job. Ania and Ilona are the best of the bunch.

1.description: I came in here the other day and I have to admit, this is the nicest Dollar Tree I've ever been to. They are so clean and organized, I think they may have recently opened or remodeled. They had everything you could think of for a $1. I originally went in for a ballon and a card and walked out with some beautiful pinwheels for my garden (at Menards I would have paid at least $5 for just one vs $1 each). I definitely plan on returning back soon to check out what other goodies they have.

0.description: My favorite dollar tree was the huge one on Fullerton but this NEW store takes the cake.Frozen foods and EVERYTHING you could imagine for yes a BUCK. I bought storage bins and tube socks that were originally marked $6.99 at a different store.

3.description: I don't care if lattes are .99. It tastes like they use coffee grinds instead of espresso beans. Gave it a few tries because I can't pass up a good deal but I think I'll pass next time. Blah!

1.description: these assholes (the guy with the locs)  closed the doors about 30 mins before closing.they never have to worry about me again

2.description: All I wanted was a simple iced tea with lemon and sugar.What i received was an iced tea with some sort of artificial sweetner crap that made it tast like coffee. Oh and no lemon!Disgusting. I threw out most of the iced tea with a hint of coffee away.

0.description: Pretty average DDs but what makes it lose stars is the drive thru. The sound is too low and the attendant is pretty much hating life when you decide to swing by for some tea after hours. They also never have decaf. You'd think that after all my griping to them they'd have a pot ready for me but they can care less about my coffee jitters. I guess complaining everyday about their lack if decaf is just like saying hello.The clerks change quite frequently so I've encountered the dreadful ones and the pleasant ones but lately they've been zombie like. they take your order like a machine...whatever works.

58.description: I literally live 2 minutes away from this place, and I like it! It usually has a few people in there eating in or ordering out. Its not anything insanely special but it's good for genuine Mexican home cooking. the staff is pretty friendly, and straight and to the point when ordering. As for food, I know they have a pretty wide variety on the menu but I've only ordered the tacos (al pastor, flank steak, and ground beef), my favorite by far is the al pastor! Remember this place is CASH ONLY!! if you forget there's a Bank of America across the street. all in all the prices are very reasonable and you can get a lot of food for a little cash.

56.description: I love this place, but they can never give you a total until they show up. Often, the order is not accompanied by a receipt, and the totals don't seem right. Tonight, our delivery guy showed up and told my husband he owed $40. To make a long story short, he just brought our money back after I threatened to call the cops. He actually tried to keep the tip, too. Moron. This kind of thing has happened too often with them. Bye bye, Traspasada.

29.description: Great tacos. A bit pricy for a cash only joint the place is really small so don't expect to sit and eat. A good place to stop by and pick up. Not always open

42.description: Yo, this place is the truth! You can't go wrong with any choice and the ambiance kills. I been driving around my city turning my nose up at all my local Mexican restaurants since I visited this one. I'd caution against the cow brain taco unless you know and like it. It's like boiled gizzard. I was feeling adventurous and added it to my order. The preparation was amazing, like everything else, but I was bummed I didn't order something different. That's no knock on the spot, though, I'm just an idiot. Peace from Akron, Ohio.

23.description: Definitely the best Mexican food in Chicago

47.description: I'm astounded by the other reviews I've read of this place. Best pastor you've ever had? Amazing carne asada? Incredible hole in the wall taco joint? I pity you, friends!It might be great drunk food and I admit I was dead sober, but I ordered al pastor, carne asada, and suadero tacos and each was as bland as the last. The al pastor had a slight hint of what could have been flavor, but that was the extent of it. I could write a book on my love for al pastor tacos, but I'd leave this place unmentioned. With the ridiculous amount of taco places in the area, I'll cross this one off the list and peep the next block.

8.description: Steak burrito with everything is slightly tastier than Dona Natys & El Taco Veloz but $2.50 more expensive. I'd go here if the other two places were closed. One star off for the price, the other for the cash only policy.

31.description: This place used to be just OK. After Renae took the reins they have improved in all ways. The steak tacos are amazing. Make sure to only get cilantro and onion with some limes on the side. The fish tacos are great too and come with a special sauce. Their new manager makes this place tic. I come in on a regular basis and it never disappoints.

34.description: So since Taqueria Moran was a huge failure I said I was going to check out a new place for Mexican food so I wanted to check this place out.  Been thinking about it for a while. They are a bit pricier then Moran but OMG they are so tasty. Ordered both steak tacos and ground beef tacos. I can't decide which is better.  I ordered my mom the chorizo torta and she was happy with it.  The service was great and quick. It's definitely my new go to place at this time.

16.description: This is my go-to taco place. It is conveniently close to me, but I would come here anyway if I were to move away. The food is authentic, as well as the experience. They have great vegetarian options. The food is always delicious and made to order. The service is fast and friendly. Rene always asks how your meal is once you get your food. They don't have much seating, so take out is always good. But it is fun to stay and sit inside sometimes if you are alone or with a smaller group.

13.description: The Al pastor burrito is good here.  The fajitas and street tacos are also very good.The manager is also really good and the service is quick and friendly.

11.description: Awesome place, a true Authentic Mexican joint in the Chi-Town area.Most restaurants look to be "fancy" and "overpriced", well not Taqueria Traspasada, it's stuck to it's tradition of a small Mexican joint with AWESOME authentic Mexican food.The Carne Asada taco was beyond good! I also really liked the Chili Relleno taco.If you want amazing Mexican food and don't care about going to some crazy fancy place, then check out Taqueria Traspasada

39.description: My third time here and it's always great service.  Cash only joint, but they do have an ATM.  Small restaurant more for take out but if you're lucky to grab a stool, it's always clean.  Today I had the steak Chimichanga which is hard to find these days on the westside.  It's a fried burrito.  Perfectly fried, soft crisp, topped with cheese.  The steak flavorful, not salty but even better with their brown salsa.  My husband likes the green salsa because it's spicier.  So if you prefer hotter get the green sauce.  Oh and the horchata is so good, no fountain fake stuff here.

37.description: Service was good, despite the small inside area of the restaurant. The guy at the counter gave us free samples of a soup/stew with our meals. He came back and checked on us a couple times. The food was pretty good, too. I wouldn't say it was amazing, though. I had the taco dinner, brother had the enchiladas, wife had tacos as well. No complaints. Horchata was also REALLY good.

0.description: Lengua, cabeza, barbacoa and pastor tacos are amazing.  My favorite taco place near downtown Chicago.Also the enchiladas are pretty good.  Everything is good!

38.description: best pastor in the city--- go burrito over taco

51.description: I went for the birria hoping it would be good. I regret to say that it was average at best. Also had a suadero taco which was ok.  The four is because it does seem like the rest of their menu is pretty good and its a pretty authentic place. Worth to check it out.

27.description: Tacos were just ok, nothing special, al pastor tasted like chorizo, asada tacos were very bland. prices were high for these small ass tacos, people that say these are the best need to get out more an taste some real shit.

32.description: Definitely my go-to place after I get late night beer munches in the city. It's cheap, authentic, and the guy at the register gives you one of the best freaking service you'll ever have. One night my boyfriend was walking up the counter to ask for some salsa and he somehow read his mind and gave it to him without having to ask. Another time I was supposed have 9 cents back after paying but he gave me dime instead cause he knew how much of a pain in the a** it is to have a nickel and 4 pennies in your wallet. I know its not much but these little gestures really stand out to me when I receive service of any kind. It lets me know that they're working above and beyond their expected responsibilites.

54.description: Only reason they get 3 is because their other food is decent. Stay away from the posole.

48.description: Very good quick eat tacos and the goat soup was fantastic.  I can't wait to try everything on the menu.  They have a variety of salsas - try them all.

44.description: Loved the fajitas I got here! The guacamole was a delicious addition. Best of all, the staff is really nice and attentive. It's a smaller place so going with one to two people max would probably be best. The steak taco was a bit chewy, but my chicken fajitas were the perfect consistency. I would come back here for sure!

24.description: Another great taco place with awesome negro salsa the steak tacos are tender not fatty , small place but never over crowded and the guy taking your order is always friendly... customer for life

7.description: Equivalent to a taco stand that's how small the inside is, but it works for a spot to grab some tacos at a cheap price and get them quickly. Must remember to bring cash, no cc accepted. Service: I called my order in and was told 5 min (super quick). The service over the phone was exceptional as he was patient and very nice. Food: I wish they labled the tacos bc when u order so many you want to be able to easily identify them. I ordered a chicken quesadilla and 7 tacos. Below are my reviews on each:Barbacoa taco - not impressed. Won't order this again. Beef taco - not bad, not great, no complaints. Fish taco - a really great grilled taco with pico de gallo. Was my favorite taco of the bunch.Pork taco - 2nd best taco. I would order it again. Steak taco - not much flavor, but was tender. Slight tweekn and this taco could be good. Glad I tried their food and if I lived closer would probably come back, but I don't live close by so probably will have to stick to pilsen area for my occasional taco fix. I still recommend anyone in the area to try it if looking for a quick, cheap bite to eat.

49.description: Three words: chicken taco saladLiterally the best thing to eat, especially after a night of drinking. Their salsa and chips are yummy too

40.description: Total grab and go taco joint. No frills, but none needed.   The food is cheap, tasty and quick.  Guacamole is really fresh and perfect smooth consistency.   The tostadas didn't  travel that we'll but they tasted great so that's all that mattered.   The steak was flavorful and moist, pretty much all you really need in a taco spot.  I'll be back!

53.description: I like it.  Friendly staff, low prices but quality food.

30.description: My favorite local taqueria! I live a block away and don't know what I'd do without their steak tacos.

46.description: This cash-only place is my go-to for authentic, tasty Mexican food. The first thing I noticed about this place is that the steak  had a slightly charred, fresh off the grill taste that elevated my burrito. You can see them cook up everything fresh right behind the register, too. Al pastor is also really good here. Most underrated part of this restaurant--the sauces. Definitely don't forget to put the green and red salsas on before you take a bite (I always regret forgetting this).

1.description: ProsAuthentic tacosGreat al pastor; has an extra smoky taste to it.  Delicious!NeutralDelivery starts at 11amConsNo pineapple Overall: will recommend to a friend

55.description: Guacamole sucked.  Tomatoes, onion lightly mixed in very little avocado. Tacos were good. Horchata good.  Salsa good

9.description: I love this place. This is literally one of those hole in the wall - I hope there's room for me to walk in- places. So flavorful super authentic - love the torta ahogada or the enchiladas are #offthechain also! The rice and beans is ok, not the best but definitely a goodie. (Refried beans)I've been here a few times and they have never failed me!! There's usually street parking and most people pick up to go orders so if there's room- I suggest staying a while!Also, good sized portions- I always eat with my eyes :)

26.description: I've checked out a decent portion of the menus at the various Mexican joints in the area.  I go here if I'm feeling like something with steak in it, which is usually in burrito form.  This place has what I think are the best Carne Asada burritos in the area.  Lots of meat, good balance of other fillings, cheese is nicely melted.  I tend to find my staples at certain restaurants and stick with them... so for their steak burritos alone, I give it 5-stars.  I go elsewhere for tacos though.  Pastor is my go-to for tacos, and there are better to be had, plus the corn tortillas aren't always the best.  They do have a lot of meat options, and tend to generously fill them, though.  Lots of other things on the menu as well.  Open late.  Cash only.

25.description: I love them! Always so delicious and the service is killer! I've been going for 8 years!

12.description: I don't know how you fuck up such a simple order. I ordered one chicken and one pork tostada. What do I get? Two steak tostadas. That with a can of Squirt cost 9.47.........Not worth it to me. I can get much better at Authen taco and La Pasadita.

59.description: This is a little hole in the wall place to grab some reasonably price Mexican food to go. I came here for a late night bite after going to Beauty Bar down the street. It was pretty crowded, but the line moves fast.  I ordered the Carne Asada taco with cilantro and onion. Steak was cook good and flavorful, taco size was decent, and price point was okay. Definitely a late night bite stop when I'm in the area.

21.description: Equivalent to a taco stand that's how small the inside is, but it works for a spot to grab some tacos at a cheap price and get them quickly. Must remember to bring cash, no cc accepted. Service: I called my order in and was told 5 min (super quick). The service over the phone was exceptional as he was patient and very nice. Food: I wish they labled the tacos bc when u order so many you want to be able to easily identify them. I ordered a chicken quesadilla and 7 tacos. Below are my reviews on each:Barbacoa taco - not impressed. Won't order this again. Beef taco - not bad, not great, no complaints. Fish taco - a really great grilled taco with pico de gallo. Was my favorite taco of the bunch.Pork taco - 2nd best taco. I would order it again. Steak taco - not much flavor, but was tender. Slight tweekn and this taco could be good. Glad I tried their food and if I lived closer would probably come back, but I don't live close by so probably will have to stick to pilsen area for my occasional taco fix. I still recommend anyone in the area to try it if looking for a quick, cheap bite to eat.

17.description: This place used to be just OK. After Renae took the reins they have improved in all ways. The steak tacos are amazing. Make sure to only get cilantro and onion with some limes on the side. The fish tacos are great too and come with a special sauce. Their new manager makes this place tic. I come in on a regular basis and it never disappoints.

10.description: There's a ton of taco places near hear along Ashland and Chicago, but this tiny place has the best tacos I've had in the area.

5.description: Meh. I admit I'm a little biased when it comes to taquerias, but this place really didn't do anything for me. I've had their steak tacos twice and they're fine, but I know plenty of other places in the city where they're 10x better (and cheaper).

3.description: Amazing authentic tacos... and bottled coke to top it off! The guys were very patient as we decided on our lunch as they have an expansive menu. Definitely coming back. CASH ONLY.

35.description: I wanted to try a steak chimichanga so after reading many reviews, decided on Taqueria Traspasada. Mann I was disappointed. I didn't like the flour tortilla cuz it was too thick, almost like bread.  It wasn't crispy yet soagy.  Steak had flavor but a bit tough for me. I also tried Al Pastor taco, was aight. Beef taco was ok.  Customer service was good, better than my food:/

19.description: So since Taqueria Moran was a huge failure I said I was going to check out a new place for Mexican food so I wanted to check this place out.  Been thinking about it for a while. They are a bit pricier then Moran but OMG they are so tasty. Ordered both steak tacos and ground beef tacos. I can't decide which is better.  I ordered my mom the chorizo torta and she was happy with it.  The service was great and quick. It's definitely my new go to place at this time.

28.description: Food is great.  Tacos carne asada has a great char to it.  Fish tacos are beautifully tasty.  The manager (guy at the register) is the reason I keep coming back.  Owner should feel grateful to have him at the helm.

45.description: I love this place. This is literally one of those hole in the wall - I hope there's room for me to walk in- places. So flavorful super authentic - love the torta ahogada or the enchiladas are #offthechain also! The rice and beans is ok, not the best but definitely a goodie. (Refried beans)I've been here a few times and they have never failed me!! There's usually street parking and most people pick up to go orders so if there's room- I suggest staying a while!Also, good sized portions- I always eat with my eyes :)

33.description: This place is really good and the staff is quick and organized with their orders love going there once in a while for a quick taco and the prices are really good too.

43.description: By far this is one of my favorite authentic Mexican restaurants in Chicago. Every time I come here I make sure I have a dinner here

2.description: everything we tried here is just amazing, a lot of exotic stuff, tripes, pig brain, etcwe come here every week, it is such a hidden gem, my favourite so far is the tilapia tacomust try their home made horchata, it has a rich rice taste to it, unless some other places which fill it with sugar...this place's horchata feels more flavourful and natural

18.description: This is my favorite taco place in the area and there  are tons including la pasadita. I eat here at least twice a week and almost always seem to get the steak tacos. They really load them up too. They also have a rather full menu of stuff outside of the typical tacos and burritos which I've been meaning to try. Always very friendly here too.

41.description: Once again this place has done it again.  Quick tacos and awesome taste. It has a 2 car loading zone for a quick pick up.  CASH ONLY.Taco are reasonably priced.  I guess their dinner menu could be priced better.  They do have a dine in option for a few guest.Customer service is good.

52.description: A very classic, take-away style taqueria. The only seating is a handful of barstools, but the food is delicious. Probably the best Torta Ahogado I've had outside the southwest. Staff was also friendly, and I think they threw in some soup just because it was cold out.

50.description: We love this place!! It is our go to taco joint where you can walk in order exactly what you want and walk out. We normally keep it simple with steak or chicken tacos with cilantro onion and add some cheese. I have thought about trying something new, but it's such a tough decision when our go to items are so good! They only take cash so make sure to come prepared.

4.description: Tiny little place, but the best tacos I've had in a long time! An excellent choice for 2am tacos or any time tacos really. Gauc is fantastic as well! A must when you are there, I've a variety of the different tacos here and have been yet to be disappointed. So yummy!

6.description: I went there today for lunch. I had the burrito, carne molida, like I typically get at these taco joints. I have to say, it was quite tasty!The cheese that was used was really good. Cash only and it was just south of $10. Which I have to say is quite expensive for a burrito. But worth it and filling.The chips looked pretty good too so maybe split the burrito with someone and get the chips. While waiting, someone was eating a Cuban, that looed really good too! I will be back and try some new things. Of the options around, it is one of the better ones, especially better than one that starts with a C and the ending rhymes with bone.

22.description: Place kicks ass.  Great tacos, awesome salsa. And they have birria on the weekends. Highly recommended.

15.description: One of my go to spots for authentic carne asada tacos in Chicago.

57.description: Late night mexican food that is as tasty as this???? Really it was a dream come true and a dream I hope I get to have again very soon!Really though, if I am ever back in this area, even if I am not hungry, I will be coming here to get at least one al pastor taco or quesadilla or something. That al pastor was so so good! And that quesadilla was grilled to perfection with just the right amount of cheese and fillings, I didn't want to share any of it with Matt J. at all, but I knew it was the nice thing to do. I pretty much wanted to order one of everything on the menu there and you could tell that this place has it set of regulars too, since people would walk in and all of the staff would say hi to them, give them food hook ups, it was like being at cheers but instead being at a late mexican taco spot that felt as happy and homey as cheers. It is small inside, but hey, you don't need much space to enjoy food like this. Everything was so flavorful and it isn't as cheap as some places were in CA when I used to live there, but it was worth every dollar hands down and I will definitely be back. Maybe tomorrow.Taqueria Traspasada, will you be my friend forever?

20.description: I love late night food and tacos, they have both with many different proteins including goat and chile relleno.  The service was quick and friendly.

36.description: Awesome place, a true Authentic Mexican joint in the Chi-Town area.Most restaurants look to be "fancy" and "overpriced", well not Taqueria Traspasada, it's stuck to it's tradition of a small Mexican joint with AWESOME authentic Mexican food.The Carne Asada taco was beyond good! I also really liked the Chili Relleno taco.If you want amazing Mexican food and don't care about going to some crazy fancy place, then check out Taqueria Traspasada

14.description: Super flavorful great speedy service and undeniable Mexican quality. New go-to in Ukrainian Village

12.description: I have been here twice and so far so good. The staff is pretty friendly and the salon is nice sized, not ghetto. The pricing isnt too expensive, but its definately not cheap.

3.description: 12/4/2015 Luxury NailsShop Owner(s)2640 N. Narragansett AveChicago, Illinois 60639Dear Shop OwnersOn December 3, 2015, I had my eyebrows, eyelashes, manicure and pedicure done at your facility where I received poor services by your owners/employees. While  getting my pedicure service I received a rushed job for what was suppose to be the top of the line pedicure which included sugar scrub and heated rock massage. The gentleman cut my cuticle using a  motorized file: now it is causing me discomfort. I also had your services for eyelashes which I complained while I was there.  I was  serviced by an inexperienced technician who burned my eyes by repeatedly by letting the glue and acetone (her words) drop into my eyes and on my face. She also had me holding her supine string me she is lazy but she was taking her time so they would last. However her asking for my assistance caused my left thumb nail, right pointer finger and my right big toe(she stepped on my toe) to become damaged. When I informed her she said not worry it will be repaired.  When she was done she told me she as only going to charge me $60 don't tel them she took off money for me and for me to come next week she would fix the lashes she took my credit charged me $60 I signed and thought all monies owed was compensated for. Afterwards I was asked if she could take a photo of her work; I agree. She the returns and tells me they said I have to pay an addition $10. Then I was asked to sit to have the nails repaired a woman I assume to be the owner or owners wife sat down to assist me. I thought she would have easily removed the nail polish and re-polished the nails. She chose to dip her finger in acetone and smooth the damaged  polish(which left bumps and ridges) then proceeds to clump more polish on top of the nail. Told me to sit under the dryer. She never came back to apply a top clear coat. This same woman comes over to the drying station and rudely interrupts a conversation between myself and another patron to tell me I'm dry I can leave. The woman I was holding the conversation with was even taken aback and stated why was she trying to rush me out of the shop?  After being in the facility for more than 3hrs (waiting for the excessive polished nails to dry. I began to try to gather my belongings, my shoes were no where near me as usually they are. So I had to wait as they located them. As I was leaving I was asked for additional money by the rude and lazy technician who I am assuming is the owner or owners wife. I informed I was not going to give anymore money. She asked why with a very nasty tone and I replied firmly yet politely due to poor customer service and that I was trying not to make a scene. In which she pursued. So I told her your technician did a halfway job on my pedicure and manicure (he didn't even get all the nail polish off nor did he use cuticle remover, he only used water. The eyebrow and lashed lady almost blinded me by dropping chemicals in my face and eyes and asked for help doing her job. To top it off the nail repair she did was shoddy. A few derogatory words were exchanged where she told me not to come back and I responded I hadn't planned on it.   I went home and my eyes, eye lids and eyelashes were still irritated. Later that night I woke up to my eye swollen shut.  I had to go to Urgent Care the following  day to receive medical attention. Where I was informed I had a chemical burn and was infected.   I have been prescribed antibiotics I am in severe pain and anguish.  Please do not patronize the establishment. I use to go at least 2-3 times a month spending $40-$70 each time. Loyalty and customer services suck!

1.description: I use to come here all the time because I was in love with their work.!! Today after a year not getting my nails done I decided to go back , same staff different colors to chose from ! How exciting !  Unfortunately the service has gotten bad  the lady that did my nails was working as if they had a giant line of people waiting ! 2-3 nails didn't have gel all around the color was all bumpy ! The shape makes me look like a ratchet hood rat  I'm discontent  upset I called her out on it and she just kept applying top clear coat like that was gonna fix everything !! I just wanted to leave as soon as I could ! I got the price lowered obviously and I'm sure she knew why. But regardless ! I'm the kind of person that has paid 70+ for a well done set Traumatized and upset in afrAid this is the last time I'm getting them done again until who knows when ! Not going back

2.description: A few things to know:-Cheap nail polishes (diluted)-Poor customer service and job performance. The staff is pushy to the point of discomfort. They offer a service and continue on insisting until you finally give in.-Very rushed. When I went the sides of my nails weren't painted.Also, they don't soak your hands and push back your cuticles, they simply file them off with the electric file.Again, I would never go back to this place. I felt very uncomfortable the entire time I was there and I was not at all happy with their work.

9.description: Love love love the service and the customer service. I never miss my biweekly visit for my manicure and pedicure. If you haven't already tried them, you should :)

10.description: Regular manicure is very badly :(

13.description: the lady that did my no chip manicure asked me to pick my color so I did, then she found it in the distance and im guessing it wasn't enough in the bottle so she tried to convince me to use another color. anyway I chose another color then she gave me a 6 sec hand massage with a pea size amount of lotion. then I got a pedicure which she did the same a 6 sec rub on my leg and foot with hot rocks and it was over. I will never go back there again because for a full hour while getting my nails done the workers were having full conversations in their language very loud. I think that's poor customer service.

16.description: I arrived here to get my nails filled in and a eyebrows wax. I walked in the man was very pushy and hurryed me when there were no other clients waiting and it was 11am on a weekday. The girl that did my services was nice but screwed my eyebrows up its been a month and still haven't grown right till this day I am upset and hoping my brows grow back correctly. Do not go here. I will never return.

6.description: I have never posted a bad review, but there is much reason to do it today. After many years of going to this nail spa, I'm saddened to see such poor service From employees & owners. My service began for a pedicure & quickly terminated to serve another client. My feet were left in the water to soak. It was supposed to be mani/pedi for my daughter & me. Sadly, I was even overcharged for her pedi, but refunded the difference. Bad business, no humbleness.

15.description: So I took my girl friend there for her birthday, and I wish I never did. They jacked up my girlfriends eyebrows and nails, they overcharged her, and the owner had the nerve to yell at her because she didn't leave a tip. Her poor eyebrows look like pizza

0.description: It's a tiny little place right next to the Chipotle. If you blink, you might miss it actually. I went in to get a mani, eyebrows waxed and a pedi during my lunch. The woman who attended me was very nice and took care of everything quickly and with ease. Prices are affordable. Atmosphere is relaxed & it's CLEAN!

5.description: This is the nail place next to Aldi's. Very unimpressed. I came in here because it was convenient. The nail tech was rough and the manicure hurt more than usual. The manicure came out bubbly and while he was willing to fix it, he said he didn't see anything wrong. He fixed one nail, but the others didn't look great either. I didn't want to seem pushy so I just left. Needless to say, I was very unhappy. A little overpriced too.

11.description: Pretty okay for the price. I had my pedi/manicure and liked the service.

8.description: I use to go here all the time and remembered why i stopped. Today i went in for a full set and a pedicure, the pedicure was fine and the gentlemen that did it was friendly just like the other staff, however, when it came to doing my acrylic nails the women literally man handled my nails and fingers. Don't get me wrong shes as sweet as can be but holy crap my nails are in so much pain. Not only that when she was filing my nails down she cut three of my fingers and made them bleed and put some liquid directly into the cut that burns. Then when it came to actually applying color she gooped it on and i have noticeable bubbles in ALL of my nails. I came home today and cried my eyes out. I have prom on friday and messed up nails.

4.description: I went here for years. Today was the last time. I went in for a mani pedi, they left me soaking for so long.. the water became cold. Then they tried to do my nails sans table..yes mid air while I soaked. .. you cannot possibly shape and cut nails properly. I said something paid for my mani, and walked out.. no thank you :(

14.description: I've been lax in taking care of myself these past few years.  Now that I have free time..I no longer have an excuse.  I just had my nails done here.  I've driven by this place many times, and I have attempted to use them before, but they were always busy whenever I was in the neighborhood.  I started going to nail salons about 10 years ago when I realized that they really do a better job than going to a spa or hair salon.  The prices are half of what you would pay, so with the savings you can actually get both your hands and feet done for the same price.  My American manicures always look 100% natural, the curvature is natural, and it doesn't end up looking sloppy.  I've had sculptured nails done at spas that looked like a 2 year old did them, bumpy, uneven, and completely hideous.I thought that their prices were fair and reasonable.They don't advertise their prices, they do list them in a pamphlet.They offer mani/spa peds for only $35.  Minh did an excellent job.  It wasn't a rush job, he took his time to insure that I would be happy.  It was also nice to be able to chit chat with him and I learned things that I never even knew.This nail salon is like most others..but what makes this one stand out is the fact that they are OPEN 365 DAYS A YEAR!  That's insane, and that's incredible!  Especially for anyone who runs out of time and needs that last minute mani/ pedi on Christmas Day!

7.description: Been coming here for years, they do a pretty decent job. I only come for acrylic nails now because I'm a cosmetologist and I do my own mani pedis. The workers are pretty nice but they do like to hold conversations in their language but that doesn't bother me since i think it sounds cool. Lots of polishes to choose from and they remodeled. Gets busy on the weekends, I go around 11am it's pretty slow

3.description: I'm not sure where Fred previously purchased cheaper Chinese food.  I found the food to be very good, fresh and large portions for the price.  I used to go to Hung Hoah in the neighborhood, which was more expensive and not any better except for the environment.  I like the bang for the buck at Star East.

1.description: This place isn't too bad. I ordered a large Mongolian beef for myself, and beef chop suet for my mom, XL beef fried rice for my picky kids, and also egg drop soup and chicken noodle soup. My Mongolian beef is ok, kinda blan and not spicy at all. Maybe next time I will ask for extra spicy. Rice was good and so were the soups. Good portion. I switch off from great dragon 28 and this place. Great dragon has more gravy, which I guess I got used too.  All in all paid $41, and got a free general tso chicken. Not bad.

2.description: I would NOT recommend this place. I went in to place an order and saw one of their cooks picking his nose, not wash his hands and continue to cook!! He saw that I saw him, so he turned his back to me and continued digging in his nose, while cooking at the fryer. Needless to say, I left. I wanted to give them no stars, minus even, but yelp doesn't allow that.

0.description: I have reconsidered and give Star East Four Stars because their rice improved very much from the last time I ordered rice. It has a fresh taste and not so heavy on oil or salt. I really like it and it competes with the rice fron Kim Long.They have parking. A lot of it, its never an issue.

4.description: Upon entering Star East you will be greeted with the familiar site of: a large counter set in a larger window, door to the side, a few small tables, a TV set for eat-in diners, as well as a super huge menu of everything they have to offer a hungry human (in most cases).We've all been here before, it's nothing especially new or exciting insofar as decor is concerned. And - whether this is a positive or a negative quality I will leave to the reader - the food is much the same. It's not bad - actually when hankering for Chinese take-out, it's quite delicious - but there is nothing especially appealing or new about Star East. So, if you are at all familiar with Chinese take-out, you'll know what to expect, taste-wise. That being said, the portions are good, the prices are on par with your standard take-out joint, and the staff is attentive and never rude. I give it four stars because I truly am a fan of the food, but that applies to nearly all Chinese take-out places I've been.

29.description: Only been there once, and I'm never going back. Yes its relatively cheap and they serve you and obscene amount of food in the lunch specials, but jesus, the food is bad, I went there with my friend and we both ended up throwing away like 3/4 of it. You can find better Chinese food at an old country buffet, seriously, stay away.

42.description: I must be a harsh Judge of Chinese food but I tried this joint after reading good reviews and this didnt strike me as anything special. The egg rolls were just ok and the fried rice and sesame chicken were bland and average.

23.description: The happy family seafood item was good, but I can't shake the feeling that I'm unsatisfied. The price was way too high for the amount of food we received and was not worth the price. I would probably dine in hoping it was a really fancy place to go on date (not sure how it looks) but for now the deliver my was way too expensive for a little bowl and five pieces of crab bites that resemble long john silver's hush puppies. For $24 it better look like a fancy restaurant.

47.description: Best Chinese place in the neighborhood.  I have eaten both in the restaurant and via delivery.  Food is tasty and service is friendly.  I agree, definitely a keeper!

8.description: Came here on a friend's recommendation, it was fantastic. The servers were very nice, the pan fried spicy soft crab was out of this world, and we loved the Mongolian beef, it was beautifully prepared served with just a bit of green scallions and served atop a nice amount of pan fried white noodles, yum!!!

31.description: Love, love, love Hong Huah.  I live close by, so this is the only place I order from.  They already know my name, address and probably credit card number.  Sometimes, I get freebies with my order :D  I've also brought friends to the restaurant for dinner and have never been disappointed.  The food is great! Totally recommend.

34.description: Ok, so I went back this week after two years to see if my taste buds were back to normal. I had the Fried noodles and chicken with pot stickers. The food seems to taste a lot better now and I was delighted by the experience of reintroducing Hung Huah to my Chinese restaurant line-up. The restaurant has improved with it's menu items. I'll be back.

16.description: The food I ordered was pretty good, I would've given the review 5 stars but my food got here late. If you want good food then by all means this place is a good start but if you're getting food delivered, be aware that chances are, depending how busy the restaurant is, your order will be late. I was still satisfied with the food and the delivery guy was still very nice so I'll probably still order again in the future

13.description: My family and I have been coming to Hong Huah for as long as I can remember.  I grew up in the neighborhood, so this great restaurant was our go-to place for family dinners or special celebrations.  We came here so often that we became friends with the owner and his family as well.  We happened to return for a visit (the owner John still remembers us!) for my 21st birthday.  He gave me a nice cocktail and also a beautiful lantern decoration to hang in the house as a gift.  These are genuinely nice people serving seriously delicious food.The service is great - friendly, helpful, and prompt.  Food has always been top notch.  Now, I won't claim to be a connoisseur of Chinese cuisine, but ever single dish I've eaten here since childhood has been wonderful.  As a kid I was blown away by the fanciful flowers they would craft out of radishes and beetroot.  Dishes are not overly salted and are perfectly seasoned.  My favorite has always been the Mu Shu vegetables slathered in hoisin sauce wrapped in a delicious thin pancake.  Another favorite is the Happy Family dish of sauteed seafood and vegetables, and also the awesome Crab Rangoon appetizer.  We love supporting local family-owned restaurants, and I'm so happy that this place is still around.

11.description: Egg drop soup bland,but a little salt and pepper and all good,egg roll ok,not bad,sweet and sour chicken was ok but little chicken fingers instead of good size chunks,almost more breading than meat...very o.k. lunch,worth the $5.80 definitely

39.description: Decent chinese food- cheap, delicious- the hot and sour soup in particular is wonderful.Be wary though, ordered chicken stir-fried noodles here and a wayward shrimp came in mine- normally not a big deal, except for the part where I have a potentially fatal shellfish allergy and made a special note in my order through grubhub that they should be particularly careful not to get any shrimp in with my food.Alas, I will have to find myself a new chinese place. But for those of you without unfortunate allergies to delicious food, this is a good choice for decent chinese.

37.description: Desperately seeking a new calendar, I called around looking for the Chinese restaurant that had what I was looking for.  What luck, in business with Hong Huah, free calendar, no minimum order.The hours are great, open til 10, 11 on the weekends, and they deliver.I ordered some egg rolls, shrimp toast, and crab rangoons, and they were greasy deliciousness and didn't break the bank.  The service was very friendly, although the decor was a little dated, a little reminiscent of my great aunt's living room if she had been Asian.I will be back Hong Huah, and probably even before I need another calendar!

0.description: The food is delicious and it seems to be homemade.I like the mirror walls and even my kids love the food.Very nice people and very good food

38.description: Ok, so I've been to Hong Huah two times in two weeks now. I'm really feeling this place. It's super clean inside, the staff is super friendly, the prices are super cheap and the food is super tasty. I ordered the Sesame Chicken and it was delish! The Eggrolls are quite tasty too! But what really does it for me is the size of the Chicken Fried Rice! One order is enough for 3 people.....easily! I won't give it 5 stars yet because I'd like to taste more on the menu. I tried the Mongolian Beef and it wasn't what I was used to (see: Joy Yee Noodle) but it wasn't bad.

27.description: Pot Stickers!!!!This is Chinatown quality food in your own hood.  Even though they're far from my house they still deliver to me in Jefferson Park.  There is nothing in the area that is even as close to good Chineese as this.  Mongolian Beef is top notch and the Pot stickers, mmm...  If there is 4 or more of you get two orders because these little crack dough balls are amazing.

32.description: Here's a small place that has a friendly atmosphere. I strongly recommend their delicious and hearty Egg Drop Soup. They serve it with plenty of eggs in a chicken broth and a few vegetables. If you go with one or two friends, you will definitely get more than your money's worth. You better all have an appetite to take advantage of their various Chinese appetizers and assorted meals. We tend to order the combination fried rice platter and/or the beef or chicken with peapods platter. Remember, you get more than your money's worth if you go with one or two friends (shhh).

48.description: I have been going here forever!  My mom always worked near by so we would go for lunch all of the time.  The lunch specials are less than $5 and include soup (the hot and sour cures anything, I dream about it), egg roll, fried rice, entree, cookies, and tea.  If you are out that way definitely get there, if not... it's worth the trip.Atmosphere is funny... don't expect anything special.. kinda sleeztastic if you ask me.Stuff to try:  Hot and Sour soup, Mongolian Beef (ask for it spicy if you are into that), Kung Pao Chicken, Chicken Wings, Egg Rolls, Sweet and Sour Chicken.

44.description: I have been eating at Hong Huah's since 2001. Absolutely the best Chinese food around. The mirror decor can be a bit unsettling, but the food has never been disappointing. Personal faves: shrimp fried rice, beef and broccoli, orange chicken, soups (all of them!). Empty on a weekend? Don't fret--if you sit in for dinner you will find out they have a huge delivery clientele.

24.description: Based on yelp reviews I decided to try the Mongolian beef lunch special today. I'm not even finished with it but was so impressed I wanted to review it while the flavors were still fresh on my tongue and mind. It wasn't like any other Mongolian beef I've had before, less saucy, way more flavor. I don't even think I can give proper words. It was just tender, flavorful and delicious. So delicious I want to order it for dinner tonight! The portion was slightly smaller than I'm used to from most Chinese places. That said, it was a perfect lunch portion. I think I've just gotten used to the gluttonous portion sizes at most places. The lunch special came with a scoop (literally) of fried rice, a really good egg roll (the cabbage inside had a little crisp to it) and a small cup (maybe 6-8oz) of soup. I got hot and sour and it too does not disappoint. Service was friendly and I got my food quickly.I can't wait to go back!

7.description: I've ordered from this restaurant a few times now and I have to say, their food is pretty good. My fiance and I favorites are the Sesame Chicken, Empress Chicken, and Hot -N- Sour Soup. The Kung Bao Beef and Beef with Vegetables are also good. It's our top favorite place for delivery :-)

40.description: Love this place, it's hard to find a great chinese spot to actually understand the people along with great food. Around this area their isn't too many great spots to eat where there aren't many thugs, this is a great spot to relax, eat, drink & know that you are safe to be in. (Even when cops aren't there); Food is great, and if there is one particular plate that you don't feel is cooked correctly all you have to do is speak up. The owners are great, friendly and does it really matter if the change goes to the man's pocket, he is the owner, he is the one who deals with the irs, so are the people commenting on this site rating the food, quality or are they the irs, if you are part with the irs then honey you MUST BE STUPID LIVING IN THIS HOOD!

30.description: Hmm, I've been passing by this place for about a year and a half and meaning to stop in and today I finally got around to trying it.  Below is how I break down my experience:Flavor - 3.5 stars  I'd say it's a little better than most Chinese places, but nothing that I'm going to get excited about.Service - 4 stars  The man who waited on me was friendly and I've got no complaints on this item.Cleanliness - 4 stars  What can I say clean is good.Bang for your buck - 5 stars  For $9 I got enough good food to last 2 or 3 meals so I certainly can't complain.Although 3 out of 4 of my ratings are a 4 or 5 for me flavor is by far the biggest factor in rating a place so since that is only a 3.5 star rating I'll give this nice little place an overall 4 star rating.  I'm sure at some point I'll go back and try some other dishes here and if my opinion changes substantially then I'll post an updated review.

46.description: best chinese in the area.  portions are generous and you always get what you order.

1.description: Two word. Delicious and Homemade. (And does not count) Everything was amazing. I cannot think of a Chinese restaurant that I like better than this place and this was my first time. From the friendly staff, homemade sauces (like all the sauces  - soy sauce, hot sauce, and sweet and sour sauce all homemade!!!) and owner to all the flavorful dishes, if you want Chinese food made with love, go here. We decided to stop here for an early dinner and the staff promptly greeted us and showed us to a table. After a quick look at the menu and the owner came by and shook our hand which I loved! We asked what are some good dishes and settled on the following:Pan Fried Pot Stickers - Best Pot Sticker in Chicago! Period, reminded me of my travels to Asia.Crab Rangoon - finally someone knows how to control the cream cheese and leave the top open to avoid too much moistureChicken Sizzling Rice Soup - Amazing showmanship as they brought it out the rice was crackling and then slid artfully into the soup for ultimate crackling. So flavorful and perfect for a cold day.Sesame Chicken - again one of the best I ever hadChinese Broccoli- a must at a Chinese restaurant and this one did not disappoint And the star of the dinner, The Lobster in Caramelized Onion Sauce (secret menu, ask for it and order it!).  Never had Lobster prepared this way and my wife who does not like Lobster, loved this dish.All in all this place rocks!

9.description: The food and service is AMAZING!

26.description: I stopped here on Sunday at 430pm, because of the great reviews posted. First I would agree that the potstickers are delicious. I had the beef chop suey and was not impressed at all.  My date had beef curry and I was told that it was very good.The service was not so great, I don't know if I just went on one of their really busy days but we were the only ones in the dining room and it took awhile to actually get our meal. People who walked in got their orders faster than we did.  I did hear the phone ringing a lot and also noticed a lot of pick up orders come in as well so maybe they are more concerned with their walk ins, delivery and pick up orders more than the dine in patrons. I had to find someone for more hot sauce because we ran out on our table. I had to ask for water because we ran out and were never asked if we needed a refill on our beverages when they were empty. I believe four star reviews have to have the whole picture and not just great food. I myself have had better beef chop suey. This is DEFINITELY not a five star.I would only go here if I call in a pick up order but I probably will not dine in again besides there are an abundanceof chinese restaurants here in Chicago to choose from, I need more attention then what i received here.  I only gave three stars because the staff was very nice.

25.description: Absolutely the best little Chinese joint around. I've been coming here since I was a kid, and the food has stayed awesome. The hot n sour soup is super tasty, and cures my sore throat and sinuses after the last drop. The service is excellent and prompt, and the owner is so welcoming, even after 27 years! There's no place like it!

12.description: Warning to dine in patrons: Their takeout/delivery business trumps yours. I sat in a full disgruntled restaurant with dozens of other people and only one table was served any food over 50 minutes as we all watched the delivery driver enter and leave twice with huge packs of food. Ordering some chicken in sauce shouldn't be a 2 hour experience. If they were understaffed or behind on phone orders, then for everyone's sake, don't seat up your dining room.

21.description: My family and I have been coming to Hong Huah for as long as I can remember.  I grew up in the neighborhood, so this great restaurant was our go-to place for family dinners or special celebrations.  We came here so often that we became friends with the owner and his family as well.  We happened to return for a visit (the owner John still remembers us!) for my 21st birthday.  He gave me a nice cocktail and also a beautiful lantern decoration to hang in the house as a gift.  These are genuinely nice people serving seriously delicious food.The service is great - friendly, helpful, and prompt.  Food has always been top notch.  Now, I won't claim to be a connoisseur of Chinese cuisine, but ever single dish I've eaten here since childhood has been wonderful.  As a kid I was blown away by the fanciful flowers they would craft out of radishes and beetroot.  Dishes are not overly salted and are perfectly seasoned.  My favorite has always been the Mu Shu vegetables slathered in hoisin sauce wrapped in a delicious thin pancake.  Another favorite is the Happy Family dish of sauteed seafood and vegetables, and also the awesome Crab Rangoon appetizer.  We love supporting local family-owned restaurants, and I'm so happy that this place is still around.

17.description: I work around the corner. This place never fails me. Love the orange chicken and satay beef. Combination fried rice is amazing too.

10.description: Excellent choice for fast, inexpensive, non-stodgy, non-dodgy  well prepared Chinese food in the Belmont Cemntral/MontClare area!We've tried so many Chinese restaurants in this area, many are still stuck in the 70s, with overcooked veg, gloppy brown sauce on everything and bland boring flavors.Hong Huah gets it right - they have the traditional favorites, but things are well-seasoned, veg are crisp cooked and abundant, and food is fresh!We use them for delivered dining - super fast delivery & great customer service.

5.description: I always order delivery off yelp. This Chinese restaurant requires a minimum of only $10 (other places req $20 or $25!). I have ordered here twice. Delivery is always prompt (always about 15 mins earlier than the given eta). Food is good for a good price and delivery staff is always nice. Will order from here for delivery in the future

3.description: The decor of the restaurant has the remnants of a 1970s something banquet hall with its floor to ceiling mirror walls, worn down carpeting, awkwardly placed chandelier, and tiny high stool bar tucked way in the back of the restaurant by the kitchen and bathrooms... but who comes to Hong Huah for the decor? Some of the reviews here gripe about the slow service of the place, but when the food is this good... you have to kick back and take the time to truly appreciate the delicious Chinese food this place has to offer. Things you must try here...1. The pork wok fried potstickers  (dumplings). Why are these 8 pieces of deliciousness worth trying? The dough has what the Taiwanese would describe as the perfect " Q Q" texture. Meaning that shell of the dumpling has a chewiness texture that is firm and has a bit of a bounce as you chew. The bottom of the dumpling has the perfect sear, which provides a delicate crunch factor,   hence why it is called a pot - sticker... these are literally just the description of the outside.  The inside of the dumpling is stuffed with a giant succulent pork meatball that is just mouthwatering delicious.  The potstickers are served with a vinegar soysauce and hot chili on the side. Both are a great accompaniment to the appetizer. Note that these are fried,  and as expected will be greasy, but they're not saturated in oil.2. Satay beef ( on a stick). 4 pieces of beef, skewered into a stick.  It's marinated in a Taiwanese BBQ sauce that is called satay sauce (沙爹醬). I can't describe it, but you just have to take my word for it and try it. They're delicious.3. Although I don't have a picture of it cause it was inhaled before it even hit the table... there is a sliced sausage dish you absolutely have to try.  It comes with slice raw garlic and it's just that good. It's one of those appetizers you need with a beer, specifically a Taiwan beer (台灣啤酒). 4. Beef chow fun with pan fried flat rice noodles , bean sprouts, and  green onions. It's a delicious noodle and beefy dish. A bit on the greasy side, but keep in mind it is fried noodles. 5. Hong Huah lobster,  which is literally one whole lobster seasoned with the restaurant's secret spices and coated in drawn butter over a bed of steam broccoli.  I can't quite describe the spices, however it is delicious.  The lobster itself was cooked to perfection.  The spices was a great accompaniment. I would have prefer to have control of how much butter I consume though I will have to make a mental note to ask of it can be place on the side the next time.6. Fish filet with a veggie melody.  Little chunks of white fish coated in what tasted like a tempura batter, light salty sauce, and the veggies consist of pea pods, water chestnuts, carrots, and bamboo shoots. Overall, the restaurant provides delicious and large portions of foods at a very reasonable price. The decor is dated. The service is slow, but the staff is friendly. This is a small family own restaurant for over 25+ years. This place is a small hidden gem in the neighborhood and dare I say, better than some of the places in Chinatown? It's a great place to bring small children out to dinner. Do keep in mind that there isn't a changing table in the bathrooms though.
