35.description: Great Chinese food.  I live in San Diego, but come back to Chicago a few times a year to visit family and friends.   Every trip, it's kind of a tradition to order take out from Hong Huah.  The food is awesome, and the staff is great.   Highly recommend!

19.description: This restaurant has been a staple of the area for a very long, so much so that I would considerate it a real part of the neighborhood. The owner and his son are very friendly and nice people, both of them are willing to go out of their way to make sure that you have a enjoyable and cordial experience. The food came out really fast to the table and each dish came out hot, fresh, and very delicious. Also, the menu includes some the normal Chinese American dishes, they also have the hidden gems of the  traditional chinese dishes. The prices are very reasonable and the portion sizes are pretty good.

28.description: Best Chinese food in the area. If ever I crave Chinese, I order from hong huah. Shrimp fried rice consists of good sized shrimp. Mongolian beef is delicious and served on a bed of fried noodles. Orders are big and plenty, so you get a lot for your money. I recommend getting appetizers because they are my absolute favorite thing to order from here. Eggrolls, potstickers and crab ragoon are some great appetizers to just name a few. Almond cookies and fortune cookies with every order. And not mentioning very friendly, family owners, who been owning the owning for many years. Ambiance is very tacky with mirror walls, but I like that you can get a glimpse of what goes on in the kitchen when looking from a certain angle. Lastly, it's very reasonably priced, it's worth a try, if one has a taste for chinese and in the belmont craigin neighborhood.

45.description: This place was part of my search for a local Chinese spot, and it was crossed off the list before the meal was even served. I didn't know what sort of place this was, so I opted for take out, and am glad I did. I felt dirty as soon as I walked in the door, it was empty on a Friday evening spoke volumes,  and when I paid for my food the owner(?) gave me my change from the wad of cash/coin purse from his pocket and pocketed what I gave him. In the 7 minutes it took me to get home, the paper bag that was containing my food had started to grease through and ended up tearing/falling apart by the time I got inside. They hadn't closed the box holding the egg rolls and the grease from the box had leaked out allover. The Crab Rangoon was hard as a rock, as if it had been sitting under hot lamps since lunchtime the day before. The Mongolian Beef (which was recommended by another Yelper) was medium rare at best. The Kung Bao Chicken was peanuts and hot peppers in a gray sauce, there was no chicken in it. The Sweet and Sour Chicken wasn't cooked the whole way through as the batter from the chicken had merged to a big pile at the bottom of the container. The Salt Pepper Shrimp was overcooked with nothing but salt, the Mixed Vegetables were raw and shoved into a take-out box, and they didn't give us any rice. Don't even bother with this place, you might as well throw your money into the trash.

33.description: This is a big secret that everybody knows. Great food at super low prices. I have been here countless times after was introduced to it by colleagues in 1995! It has been my son's favorite growing up and have held many important meetings here. The food is excellent and I will put it against any Asian cuisine in US and I have been in China! 90% of the times I get the Mongolian Beef and I cannot find it this way anywhere else. The staff is super friendly and sweet and non-intrusive. The space is small and the decor a little bit 'tired' plus they added a TV screen which in fact does not do the place justice. The lunch cannot be beaten for the price, the quantity and the items that are just enough for great satisfaction; tea, cookie, roll, dish and fortune cookie! Enjoy.

43.description: How dare you speak ill of Hong Huah. You are probably just a frothing slut. Hong Huah is the only place to eat Chinese food around these parts. The place is always packed full of cops (good sign), the owner John is the nicest man on this here planet earth, and the food is beyond amazing. I'm actually going to order food right now just to be spiteful of anyone who denounces this gem in the city. Kiss my ass world, I'm going to eat me some FUCKING CHINESE FOOD. Also, They do serve booze here, don't be fooled. AND the mirrors are awesome because it allows me to stare at my fully cultivated beauty. So, eat here or you will be robbed in front of the place.

2.description: Have done dine in as well as carry out here. Always had a good experience.Food was always fresh, no complaints whatsoever.You'll find police officers from the neighboring area dining here regularly, which I would consider a big compliment to the restaurant. Would recommend!!

18.description: Absolutely the best little Chinese joint around. I've been coming here since I was a kid, and the food has stayed awesome. The hot n sour soup is super tasty, and cures my sore throat and sinuses after the last drop. The service is excellent and prompt, and the owner is so welcoming, even after 27 years! There's no place like it!

41.description: To my coworkers and I, this place is affectionately known as "Green Awning", because most of these people seem to have difficulty in pronouncing the real name.  A lot of my Mexican comrads refer to this place as "Green Onion".The food here is excellent.  It is not the best, by far, but for a business lunch outing, you simply cannot go wrong.  For about six dollars (yes, six dollars), you can order a lunch special (my favorites are sweet and sour chicken, chicken w/ vegetables, sesame chicken, and Mongolian beef) which comes with a bowl of soup (egg drop or hot and sour), egg roll, fortune cookie, and cookies.  Hot tea is complimentary as well, and they give you a big kettle of it.  The hot and sour soup deserves it's own paragraph.  This stuff is delicious.  It can be ordered to go, and they certainly don't skimp on the sheer amount they give you.  This soup can sure any ailment, and tastes just as good if you are already healthy.The owner is the nicest guy on the planet.  He personally greets all his customers, and will shake your hand and ask how you have been if you are a regular.  He prefers to use his pocket as a cash register, which I think is pretty comical.  Contrary to many people's opinions, I think the mirror walls are pretty cool.

4.description: We have been ordering takeout  from here for over 10 years. Love their egg rolls, beef fried rice, mongolian beef, even their egg drop soup! No complaints at all

6.description: Every time i have been here, the service has been great! The food itself is phenomenal. I get the mushu beef every time. The owner comes out with the chinese pancakes and makes the tacos at you table with a spoon and chopstickes, not once touching the food with his bare hands. It is quite something to see.

22.description: As a Grubhub Fan calling Chinese restaurants over the phone lets just say has just not given me some of the best experiences. After just commenting on this before calling I was very surprised to have an amazing experience and customer service was impeccable. So we took a ride over to pick up and i decided we both had to go in as we have never ordered from here before. It was very late so im sure they were closing soon but that did not stop staff from greeting us. I mean even the ones from what it looked like doing paper work the cashier who rang us up was amazing letting us know everything we needed to know and also giving us a complimentary calendar!  (sat 14 around 1015). Now to my favorite part of course the food. It was delicious and even better than what we expected. Cant wait to go back and order more. portion size matched the price! we found our new place after tying many lost causes.

15.description: Based on yelp reviews I decided to try the Mongolian beef lunch special today. I'm not even finished with it but was so impressed I wanted to review it while the flavors were still fresh on my tongue and mind. It wasn't like any other Mongolian beef I've had before, less saucy, way more flavor. I don't even think I can give proper words. It was just tender, flavorful and delicious. So delicious I want to order it for dinner tonight! The portion was slightly smaller than I'm used to from most Chinese places. That said, it was a perfect lunch portion. I think I've just gotten used to the gluttonous portion sizes at most places. The lunch special came with a scoop (literally) of fried rice, a really good egg roll (the cabbage inside had a little crisp to it) and a small cup (maybe 6-8oz) of soup. I got hot and sour and it too does not disappoint. Service was friendly and I got my food quickly.I can't wait to go back!

20.description: I think that this place is starting to lose its magic. The food is is not as good as the first few times. The more dishes I tried the more flaws I see. I think I should stop ordering before they get a negative star. I guess that my search will continue for an awesome Chinese restaurant in Portage Park. Dang it, I thought I found a keeper!

36.description: Use to really like this place a couple of years ago, ordered from them yesterday and the food was only decent. Maybe it was an off day for them. Also, they were a bit stingy with the portions on the lunch specials. I remember them being a bit more generous before. None the less, for $5 I guess you can expect it. Definitely will stick to Jess Cafe.

14.description: I stopped here on Sunday at 430pm, because of the great reviews posted. First I would agree that the potstickers are delicious. I had the beef chop suey and was not impressed at all.  My date had beef curry and I was told that it was very good.The service was not so great, I don't know if I just went on one of their really busy days but we were the only ones in the dining room and it took awhile to actually get our meal. People who walked in got their orders faster than we did.  I did hear the phone ringing a lot and also noticed a lot of pick up orders come in as well so maybe they are more concerned with their walk ins, delivery and pick up orders more than the dine in patrons. I had to find someone for more hot sauce because we ran out on our table. I had to ask for water because we ran out and were never asked if we needed a refill on our beverages when they were empty. I believe four star reviews have to have the whole picture and not just great food. I myself have had better beef chop suey. This is DEFINITELY not a five star.I would only go here if I call in a pick up order but I probably will not dine in again besides there are an abundanceof chinese restaurants here in Chicago to choose from, I need more attention then what i received here.  I only gave three stars because the staff was very nice.

0.description: Great place to get your hair done.  Also very cheap compare to other places around that area ($5.00 for a man hair cut) The lady is very nice and the ambient is perfect.  I will come back again for sure.

58.description: Part of the secret of success in life is to eat what you like and let the food fight it out inside. The only trouble I see with eating a Yoshi's is that four or five days later you're hungry again.

56.description: I'm just waiting for the laws to change so I can marry this restaurant.I have been here so many times over the past several years, both for special occasions, and for the we're-just-in-the-area-and-getting-hungry occasion.  I have never had a meal that didn't leave me in love.I think it is very hard to pull off exquisite quality food in a restaurant without it being pretentious.  Somehow, Yoshi's has found the exact ... recipe.  (sorry!)  The food is delicious, so fresh, and beautifully presented.  And yet, the restaurant itself is very comfortable.  Intimate but not fussy.  And omg, try their renowned chocolate mousse cinnamon wafer dessert thingie with berries  ...  seriously a dessert affair to remember!  You will thank me.  ;)

29.description: Had the unfortunate skate dinner, which was soggy and flavorless.  Heard the burger is what you should order here but don't eat red meat.  Oh well, better options on the menu than expensive skate that the chef had no idea how to season & prepare.  Should be taken off the menu.

42.description: I have walked by this place for 10 years and never went: a friend in town was the final excuse!   They don't use the regular booking sites that I could tell, had to call.  On a Saturday night it was quite busy and the people were rambunctious inside (mixed more older crowd, surprising given the neighborhood).  Felt sorry for the waiters who had to dodge drunken guests in a very tight space.  The waiter was adept, pleasant and seemed happy and the meal came out quite quickly: we ordered the Japanese items on the menu: an "advanced" Bento box with fried tofu, green been tempura, various roots, and tuna; also the Korean BBQ plate with a lot of pork.   All well done, no room for dessert!

23.description: I used to live in Lakeview five years ago, and now live in New York.  Yoshi's is always on my list when I come to Chi-town - i usually stop in right after the airport.I usually like to sit at the bar and make friends - in the past it's been a fun gay place (i'm a gay) and i never made it out of Yoshi's without meeting some new people.  Not this time, though.I called ahead and asked for a reservation at the bar, because i know it can get crowded.  The person on the phone said that they weren't taking any more reservations at the bar, but that all the reservations there were very early, so I should have no problem at 8:30 (which is when I was planning to be there - i got there closer to 9).  So I go, the bar is packed when I get there,  90% women.  It takes them over 5 minutes to notice that I'm there, who knows where the host was.   They say the bar is full, seat me at a small table near the bar, which i guess is fine.  They don't give me menu of any kind. Eventually I call a waiter over and order without a menu, just a martini and the cod, which is my favorite thing there.   They're out of the black cod, and suggest a whitefish dish. I say OK, but apparently the non-english speaking waiter misunderstood. 45 minutes later when I notice i have no food still, I ask where it is and he said, "you decided not to get the replacement, right?"  Oops. SO i paid for my drink and went somewhere else.I just remembered Yoshi's being a classy fun gay place with great food, and the servers and owners seemingly happy to be there and having fun with guests. It's very different now, mostly older people, horrible, disorganized service, can't say anything about the food because I didn't get any. They did offer to comp my drink but I just paid for it anyway, I didn't want the waiter to have to pay for it (if that's a thing). I'll do Home Bistro or Veggie Diner next time i'm in the neighborhood.

47.description: I've been here 4 times. Every time there was a problem with the service or the food:The first time they rushed us.  The waiter cleared things the moment we were finished and brought the check before we were ready, without asking.  They wanted us out.The second time I ordered an entrée that came with a sauce.  The plate they served it on was so hot that all the sauce had evaporated by the time the dish was served.The third time they kept pushing drinks.  Every time you finished a glass someone was hovering with, "Can I bring you another?"  Unfortunately my dinner guest kept saying yes.  That dinner cost me a fortune.The last time I was sitting at the bar.  The bar was full, every seat was taken.  Along comes a fellow who would like to sit at the bar.  He could have waited politely.Instead the lady who stands at the entrance took an extra bar stool and literally shoved it into the bar.  Everyone sitting there had to move right or left.  We ended up squashed and uncomfortable.Does the food make it all worthwhile? That's a tough one. The food can be good. My last outing consisted of a tasty chowder with brie, and grilled "scallops" in 2 sauces. But about those "scallops" (plural)--at first blush, it might appear 3 were served, but actually to me it seemed more like one scallop sliced into thirds. And the dish was expensive.This place is problematic at every turn and frankly, I don't much care for it. But others do. The couple running it may know how to cook, but I'm not sure they know how to run a pleasant restaurant, one that treats customers with respect and gives them true value for their money.

8.description: Had a wonderful meal again in Yoshis last night. The snapper is just excellent and the ambience superb. Started with two of the sushi plates and our waiter Dennis ensured the appletinis kept flowing.  Finished with an espresso martini. For me Yoshis is like a home away from home :-)

31.description: Ate there again tonight. As good as it gets! A true classic... food, service, the works. Yoshi again tonight was as gracious as ever. So lucky Chicago has this joint!

34.description: Stellar!   If you want an amazing, service friendly, delicious dinner in a beautiful relaxed ambiance...this is the place!  A true treasure!After first experiencing Yoshi's earlier in the summer for brunch, I returned last night for an incredible dinner.   We enjoyed corn chowder soup, beef brisket, fish combination, and delightful dessert.  Bravo!Also...special thanks to Tim for helping making our experience truly grand.

16.description: Have wanted to go here for 25 years. Due to circumstances I was staying Lakeview for a week and Yoshi's was in walking distance.  Small but lively restaurant with a nice bar in front of kitchen.  Sat at bar and Fernando the bartender was the best!  1/2 price martini night didn't hurt either.  Only had the tuna tartare, mushroom soup and and warm Brussel sprout salad but that was plenty and delicious.  I can only imagine how good the entrees would be.  I loved it.

13.description: My father has one rule for family food outings - he will not accompany us to Japanese places as he says "why would I pay someone to not cook fish for me?"...so....he takes an enlightened approach...thus, I was HIGHLY confused when he suggested we try Yoshi's for din last night - I mean, yes, it's actually mostly French/American, with a kiss of Japanese inspiration, but I figured even that was enough to scare him off...but he met the senor Yoshi himself, who convinced him to try it, so we bundled into the car, and a-dining-we-went.Yoshi's is a Chicago institution - I think it's been open since the mid-1980s, and given that 30y in the resto world is like a billion in human years, I was expecting it to be a bit tired, and while the dim lighting and fake flowers are a bit passe, overall, it doesn't really matter b/c the food has aged nicely. Rolled in on a Saturday night and the place was bustling - note, a) get a reservation, and b) if you're going with anyone who is eligible for the senior discount at the movies, ask to be in the back room, which is a quiet respite from the slightly louder front section.Started with tempura green beans, edamame, tuna tartare, and grilled calamari. Standout was the tartare - tuna was fresh and mild - and the bed of guac on which it was served was a cool, luscious complement - though if you're not a "mush" texture person, make sure you load it onto one of the chips that accompanies it, or else you'll think it's gross. The yuzu/sake/jalapeno/oyster shooter also on the plate was a bit random, but happily slurped by yours truly. Citrusy, spicy, salty. Yum.Grilled calamari had a nice spring to it, but didn't send me over the moon - the balsamic reduction needed more bite and my tentacles were a little overly charred, erring on gassy-tasting. Other starters include a duck liver mousse, hibachi waygu, a few salads, and two obligatory maki rolls...though honestly it's not a place I would order sushi. I'm sure the quality is good, it just seems forced.For mains we went with the bouillabaisse (loup de mer, lobster, cherrystones in a miso butter broth), the skate wing/trout special, and the black cod bento box (served w tofu, hoshimenji shroom rice, cinnamon-y gobo, and miso kampyo) - Stevo loved his 'baisse - and it was an effing monster of a plate - like two people could be happy with it - the fish in my bento box was flaky, moist perfection - and the gobo and kampyo were banging, though the rice and tofu were less flavorful/successful - and my mama was suitably pleased with her skate and trout.I sampled everything - and it's interesting - the flavors that he puts in each dish are really more an amalgamation of Europe (beet beurre blanc, cornichons, etc), with the occasional nod to his country of birth (shiso micro greens, wasabi remoulade) - but it's really not a Japanese place, which is okay - the food was great, the portions are huge, and the presentation is gorgeous in a 1997 way (carved veggies, etc) - somehow, all of these disparate parts come together and the meal was quite pleasant.Save room for dessert - the chocolate mousse w berries was simultaneously light and decadent, as was the ubiquitous molten chocolate cake with espresso.And, before I forget, service was ace - our waiter was the most lovely man - he's been with Yoshi for 22y -  and not only was his knowledge of the menu really helpful, it was pretty cute to see the real love they have for each other.Ummmm din for 3 w/ hella apps, four glasses of wine, three entrees, and three desserts is...idk...pricey...I think you can drop $100/pp here without even thinking abt it - though if you're not throwing down for apps/dessert, most entrees are around $30, so you could get away with doing it more cheaply - probably plan on at least $50/pp, incl tax/tip.

11.description: A friend recommended that we come here. It's a cute little place on the corner of the streets. We sat outside on the patio.They brought out bread with hummus and salsa, which is definitely a step up from the standard bread basket with butter. Both dips were great and the waiter even brought us more as we were finishing the dip.I ordered the Roasted Japanese Kabocha Pumpkin. It's completely vegan. The entree actually was an entire pumpkin stuffed with vegetables. The apricot sauce was very unique and not too sweet or sour, which I liked. The pumpkin was the perfect texture - soft but not mushy.I also ordered the Truffle French Fries. I know french fries aren't hard to make but the truffle oil was super good. They have a wide variety of desserts, which the waiter brings out on a platter to show you. They also offer espresso.Tip: If you aren't vegan or have any dietary restrictions, definitely go for the $24.99 prix fixe menu. It's such a good price for a starter, entree, and dessert!

39.description: A friend recommended that we come here. It's a cute little place on the corner of the streets. We sat outside on the patio.They brought out bread with hummus and salsa, which is definitely a step up from the standard bread basket with butter. Both dips were great and the waiter even brought us more as we were finishing the dip.I ordered the Roasted Japanese Kabocha Pumpkin. It's completely vegan. The entree actually was an entire pumpkin stuffed with vegetables. The apricot sauce was very unique and not too sweet or sour, which I liked. The pumpkin was the perfect texture - soft but not mushy.I also ordered the Truffle French Fries. I know french fries aren't hard to make but the truffle oil was super good. They have a wide variety of desserts, which the waiter brings out on a platter to show you. They also offer espresso.Tip: If you aren't vegan or have any dietary restrictions, definitely go for the $24.99 prix fixe menu. It's such a good price for a starter, entree, and dessert!

37.description: Yoshi's great! The staff is so friendly and precessional. My favorite meal is the waygu burger with fries with the grilled white nectarine salad and tuna tartar. Their always on point with their food and the their deserts. The mullfoi is the best desert if I'm spelling it correctly. Must try! Don't forget to get your free macaroon too.

0.description: Yoshi's is certainly top notch.  For years we walked past this place and really paid not attention.  That was our first mistake, the second being that we don't go enough.  Reservations at times can be challenging but that comes with the territory of really being the only restaurant of this kind in the area.Service has always been spot on and the recommendations/suggestions have never led us astray.  I tend to be a steak person and I have not been disappointed.  The portion sizes are appropriate where you feel satisfied without the need to be rolled down the street in a wheel barrow after.It can be on the pricey side but the meal and service are well worth it.

38.description: Went here with a friend of mine and arrived around shortly before they were to close, we asked the bartender if they would still serve us and he greeted us with a smile and said yes. As we began to sit down at the bar I see out of the corner of my eye a well dressed man who was either the manager or owner looking at us and say 'godd--n it' under his breath and showed a facial expression of disgust. But what he probably didn't realize was that I'm deaf and can read lips quite well. I immediately told my friend we're leaving and saw no attempt from the old man who said the comment to come apologize or address the mater. Leadership at it's finest, but it was 10 so Matlock might be on TV and clearly it was past his bedtime. I wonder if he's saying that comment now as he reads this. BTW every other restaurant was packed so why this one was closing made no sense.

51.description: I have driven by Yoshi's Cafe a million times but never went in.  Had dinner last night there for the first time.  It will not be my last.  The Food was incredible.  I had the Japanese Bento Dinner and it was perfect.  Dessert was fabulous and the French Wine was awesome.  Our waiter Tim was the best!  He was attentive, personable and made the entire evening a wonderful experience.  I would highly recommend Yoshi's Cafe and will definitely be going back!

27.description: Yoshi is a long running reliable restaurant with consistent high quality service and delicious food.  They often change the selection on their menu but same great variety of choices for everyone - meat lover, weight watcher, vegan and etc.  You won't be disappointed. I recommend their special menu, normal with seasonal ingredients.  Give them a try!!

32.description: Derek was a lovely server, despite it being only his third day on the floor. We might have been among the youngest in tonight, but we loved it and will definitely return. Recommend the calamari and the tables ny the windows. And Derek. Thanks for a great evening!

54.description: Yoshi's is a great French-Asian fusion restaurant with a local feel. Just about everything hits the mark and Yoshi takes everything to the next level. The friendly and approachable wait staff treats everyone nicely and if you show up often enough they will remember you. This business rests on people coming back time and again, and they make you feel welcome.The food beats all but the highest-end restaurants with creative choices that make the ingredients better. The full bar serves very good drinks and the wine list covers a lot of the bases. Sake choices abound and the staff can help you if, like me, don't know a thing about sake. Don't be intimidated, though, because Yoshi's has about the best burger in Chicago. You could bring the kids here, but why not leave them at home and have a good time yourselves?

48.description: Overall: A great romantic experience with fantastic food, Yoshi's has been around for awhile for a reason. Great for many occasions!The good: Friendly service, and some good daily specials. A wide menu with a variety of options. The food is absolutely fantastic and filling as well. Our appetizer, salads, and meals were all incredible. The desserts look great, but we were too full.The bad: The prices are a tad high. That's about it!Atmosphere: 9/10Service: 9/10Food: 9/10

44.description: We went here to celebrate my grandmas birthday. The food was great and our server was great. He was very friendly and accommodating. The service was quick! They even gave my grandma a special desert free of charge because it was her birthday. I have nothing but good things to say about this place. I strongly recommend the grilled octopus appetizer. I was skeptical to try it because i usually don't like the consistency of octopus but it was tender and not chewy at all. We will definetly be coming back here again!

24.description: I was surprised how good the service and food both were! I for some reason thought it was going to be kind of a dive but I can't believe I hadn't tried it before. Highly recommend trying this place if you haven't been!

7.description: Cozy place to do work. Service is good and it's nice to support an independent Cafe. Food was a little overpriced and not very fresh. Coffee is good though.

49.description: Food is soso. Our server sucks. Sorry cnt find another word for him. Don't know why so many people like this place. I won't be here again.

40.description: Classy, delicious, unpretentious, good service. Try the whole fried snapper. This place is overshadowed by all the hip new restaurants. It's great for a romantic date or a place to bring your old school parents who might want to try a light-handed Asian twist on traditional french fare.

53.description: After a few more lychee mimosas, brunch bento boxes and pumpkin raviolis, this is still my favorite brunch place in Lakeview. The service is great- attentive, unobtrusive and never hurried- as is the brunch value. Still haven't managed to make it here for dinner, but will work on it ASAP!

30.description: I love Yoshi's!  I use to pass by the restaurant so many times on Halsted and wondered what it was all about.  I have since been to Yoshi's twice, this weekend being my second visit.  Both times, the food has been top notch. To start you off, they deliver each table a basket of bread and two delicious dipping sauces, hummus and a pico de gallo-type salsa. They have an elaborate wine list and an assortment of sugary martini's.  My boyfriend ordered the red snapper which was served on top of a bed of mushroom rice and was to die for! The fish arrived at our table with its head and tail still fully intact, but it didn't stop my boyfriend from demolishing the dish. I ordered a medium-rare, prime sirloin with wasabi whipped potatoes. Very well done. I think next time I go back, I'm going to try the red snapper, because it was so damn good.Solid food, unpretentious setting. The interior is a little homey, but that is part of what I love about it. Very snug and cozy. Not a young hang out by any means, but you can tell that there seem to be regulars in the house. Great service too.

46.description: Wonderful food; even more wonderfuller service.I visited Yoshi's last night for the first time with my husband's family. The service was stellar-- totally professional and knowledgable. The food was also great, and despite it being a classy affair, no one even blinked when I ordered my burger well done (I know, I know). The patrons are mostly a little on the older side and the décor reminded us of a cruise ship dining room, but not necessarily in a bad way. A lovely evening... and who doesn't love to a to-go cookie on the way out?

1.description: We gave Yoshi's another try, mostly because they graciously gave us a generous gift certificate to apologize for our last experience. They redeemed themselves completely. The ambiance in the back room was great and our server was knowledgeable and attentive. Everyone enjoyed their meals and the food was fresh and came out piping hot which I love as often restaurant food is lukewarm. The fluke was perfectly cooked and on a bed of delicious homemade pasta. We also enjoyed the desserts especially the Milk bar and the opera cake. It is a statement to their quality how long this restaurant has been around and now I feel like we had a true Yoshis cafe experience. We will be back!

55.description: Let me start saying ,i had a reservation for new years eve at Henry , a very well and fancy place with a delicious food ,but i decide to change my mind prior the weather condition, really a bad mistake ,soon i get in nobody greet me or anything ,i still want to ignore that and keep going with the dinner ,they give us a table for two close the kitchen it was fine ,we have no option ,but the nightmare start when we was on the four course of the Dinner ,the open several times the door beside me ,Really???? 0 degrees it was freezing , they was taking out tables and they complete ruined our night :( ,we talk with the owner ,and she told us i buy a drink ,a this point i was like this isn't happened to me ,but yes she wasn't kidding ,the food was mediocre but it was the last option ,and i will never return to this place ,and I'm going to make sure my friends and family never return too, she lost a good costumers because she don't care if we get sick ,thanks God i was wearing my jacket ,not even in the cheapest place do this to you ,the owner look a cheap person ,she want a resolve the problem with a drink ,we throw more than $200 hundred for a terrible night :..(

9.description: The food was good, it wasn't great - doubtful if it was worth the price, but it was good.  However, Paul, our waiter, did a terrible job of hiding his dissatisfaction at our party not all ordering drinks and only a handful ordering desert - not a "thank you" at any point in the ordering process, food delivery, etc.  His nonverbals - he would drop the plates back onto the desert tray, his gruff warning that the plate was hot, etc. did not create a hospitable dining situation.  This was my second, and final, time at Yoshi's.

26.description: Yoshi's Cafe. Where do I start? I came here for a birthday celebration back in December... I had a blast!The ambience is nice. The wait staff was friendly. The food most of all was delicious. I ordered the raw oysters with sorbet twice and Yoshi's Cafe Tuna Tartar. A shot with a raw oyster was also included with the tartar. I didn't feel brave enough to try it...but the birthday girl said it tasted good. I got the NY Strip loin steak with the Japanese red wine sauce with wasabi mashed potatoes. The steak overall was really tasty and had a nice mixture of wine taste splashed onto it. Order it rare to enjoy the full effect of the flavor. Allen Brothers supply their steaks and makes for fine quality. The wasabi mashed potatoes was a bit weird for me. It's without a doubt tasty but wasabi and mashed potato doesn't mix well on my taste pallet.Also, my waiter in celebration surprised the birthday girl with a 3 dessert mixture. Yoshi's dessert is sweet and tasty. Overall, I had a great time and would come back. If you are looking for a nice date or celebration venue, you will enjoy Yoshi's Cafe. The venue isn't overwhelming or noisy- just right. You will have an interesting food fusion experience here.

25.description: Met up with friends here for a lazy Sunday brunch. Their menu is pretty decent with egg based dishes and some traditional Japanese fare. We got some mimosas to start with by they were pretty average. We ordered the eggs Benedict with Canadian bacon. That was pretty delicious and so was the French toast. The portion size is big and we ended up with doggie bags. Our friends got the egg scrambler and the burger and both were happy. All in all, a good experience.

12.description: I went to Yoshi's Cafe after hearing rave reviews from a friend of mine.  What initially peaked my interest was that this restaurant has been around for 30+ years, which say quite a LOT for a restaurant in Chicago.Well, it certainly shows!  From initially placing my reservation to being seated at a comfortable corner table, service was fabulous from start to end.  Everyone from the attentive, informative waiter to the busboy that continuously filled our water glasses and changed out place settings without being disruptive of conversation, demonstrated quality service in a restaurant that's been in the business for a while.  The food itself was absolutely delicious!  We started off with tuna tartar, which was the best I have ever had.  The waiter told us that appetizer has been on the menu since the restaurant opened and it shows.  I ordered the fish special, the black cod.  This dish was so delectable and just melted in my mouth.  It was easily one of the best fish dishes I have had in a while.  It was cooked in a tomato-based sauce, linguine, and vegetables.  My husband had the burger that we've heard so much about.  His one word was:  Amazing.  It was described as a Wagyu beef burger with a fried green tomato, pickled vegetables, cheddar or brie cheese, and various other ingredients.  It was huge and he gobbled it up, telling me it was easily one of the best burgers he's had in a long time.  It came with a side of truffle fries.We were feeling adventurous and also tried dessert (although I don't know how we managed!).  We ordered the creme brule and had complimentary chocolate mousse as well.  WOW.  No words can really describe the juxtaposition of both amazing desserts.Drinks were a wide selection of wines and a few unique martinis--yum!PLUS Yoshi himself came and stopped by all the tables to see how the guests were enjoying their meals--if that is not service, I don't know what is!  What a great sign of a quality restaurant!All in all, we DEFINETELY will be back!  We had an amazing dinner that I am still thinking about now...

59.description: We love this place. We love sitting at the bar and being treated like VIP each time when Yoshi comes out to say hello. He's the man! His wife is the Woman of this place and cool as heck.

21.description: Cocktails were on half price which was cool (only $5!) but they weren't really anything super special.Service was welcoming and fast. I had the burger (with Brie) and fries. Was tasty but didn't blow me away. The fries again, were good but nothing to write home about.A solid choice and pretty cheap (all in came to $30) but I wouldn't go out of my way to go there again.

17.description: Service was great, place is very clean and beautiful. I ordered the Wagyu Burger for $17.99. At that price point, I expected a better hamburger. But it wasn't bad. My only complaint is that the fries were gross. They were beneath the level of what you'd get from a cheap hotdog stand.

10.description: My partner and I had a wonderful dining experience...From the steak toThe Rosemary Chicken..it was superb. the Owner(female) was highly attentive. the cocktails were marginal. the waiter Paul had a lot to,be desired,Aloof, cold, non personable and highly inattentive. the previous review of himIs accurate. he was rushed, no communication. the African American busboyWas excellent...He was far more attentive and PLEASANT than the waiterPaul.....Overall, the food is excellent......Service poor!

5.description: My boyfriend and I have been wanting to come here for a while and figured restaurant week was the perfect time to do so!  Seriously delicious and perfect experience from start to finish.  Great service, everything we ate was impeccable.  I would recommend this place to anyone.

3.description: Cocktails were on half price which was cool (only $5!) but they weren't really anything super special.Service was welcoming and fast. I had the burger (with Brie) and fries. Was tasty but didn't blow me away. The fries again, were good but nothing to write home about.A solid choice and pretty cheap (all in came to $30) but I wouldn't go out of my way to go there again.

35.description: I think this place has an identity crisis. But you can expect that from a place that combines "Yoshi" and "Cafe." Is it supposed to be Asian? American? Mexican? I was served salsa and hummus with bread upon sitting down. Okay. I saw a couple of Asian themed items on the menu but already I was a little hesitant. So I consulted Yelp, and found that they're known for their burger. Go figure. So that's what I ordered and it was pretty good. Also good---the service and upscale/pleasant atmosphere. Yoshi Cafe, if I could make one recommendation: please don't give away stale macarons as people leave. You're only adding to the confusion.

19.description: Exceeded my expectations. Delicious and beautifully presented. Tuna tartar is amazing. The mushroom soup was the best I've ever had and desert was so tasty. The Korean steak salad was very yummy as well.

28.description: I had their beet salad, the Japanese Kabocha pumpkin, and the chocolate and raspberry mousse dessert. The food could not have been better, nor the staff friendlier.

45.description: Service here was very professional. That includes everyone, the valet, bartender, waiter, bus boys, and the hostess. The food is good too. I heart Yoshi's.

33.description: My father has one rule for family food outings - he will not accompany us to Japanese places as he says "why would I pay someone to not cook fish for me?"...so....he takes an enlightened approach...thus, I was HIGHLY confused when he suggested we try Yoshi's for din last night - I mean, yes, it's actually mostly French/American, with a kiss of Japanese inspiration, but I figured even that was enough to scare him off...but he met the senor Yoshi himself, who convinced him to try it, so we bundled into the car, and a-dining-we-went.Yoshi's is a Chicago institution - I think it's been open since the mid-1980s, and given that 30y in the resto world is like a billion in human years, I was expecting it to be a bit tired, and while the dim lighting and fake flowers are a bit passe, overall, it doesn't really matter b/c the food has aged nicely. Rolled in on a Saturday night and the place was bustling - note, a) get a reservation, and b) if you're going with anyone who is eligible for the senior discount at the movies, ask to be in the back room, which is a quiet respite from the slightly louder front section.Started with tempura green beans, edamame, tuna tartare, and grilled calamari. Standout was the tartare - tuna was fresh and mild - and the bed of guac on which it was served was a cool, luscious complement - though if you're not a "mush" texture person, make sure you load it onto one of the chips that accompanies it, or else you'll think it's gross. The yuzu/sake/jalapeno/oyster shooter also on the plate was a bit random, but happily slurped by yours truly. Citrusy, spicy, salty. Yum.Grilled calamari had a nice spring to it, but didn't send me over the moon - the balsamic reduction needed more bite and my tentacles were a little overly charred, erring on gassy-tasting. Other starters include a duck liver mousse, hibachi waygu, a few salads, and two obligatory maki rolls...though honestly it's not a place I would order sushi. I'm sure the quality is good, it just seems forced.For mains we went with the bouillabaisse (loup de mer, lobster, cherrystones in a miso butter broth), the skate wing/trout special, and the black cod bento box (served w tofu, hoshimenji shroom rice, cinnamon-y gobo, and miso kampyo) - Stevo loved his 'baisse - and it was an effing monster of a plate - like two people could be happy with it - the fish in my bento box was flaky, moist perfection - and the gobo and kampyo were banging, though the rice and tofu were less flavorful/successful - and my mama was suitably pleased with her skate and trout.I sampled everything - and it's interesting - the flavors that he puts in each dish are really more an amalgamation of Europe (beet beurre blanc, cornichons, etc), with the occasional nod to his country of birth (shiso micro greens, wasabi remoulade) - but it's really not a Japanese place, which is okay - the food was great, the portions are huge, and the presentation is gorgeous in a 1997 way (carved veggies, etc) - somehow, all of these disparate parts come together and the meal was quite pleasant.Save room for dessert - the chocolate mousse w berries was simultaneously light and decadent, as was the ubiquitous molten chocolate cake with espresso.And, before I forget, service was ace - our waiter was the most lovely man - he's been with Yoshi for 22y -  and not only was his knowledge of the menu really helpful, it was pretty cute to see the real love they have for each other.Ummmm din for 3 w/ hella apps, four glasses of wine, three entrees, and three desserts is...idk...pricey...I think you can drop $100/pp here without even thinking abt it - though if you're not throwing down for apps/dessert, most entrees are around $30, so you could get away with doing it more cheaply - probably plan on at least $50/pp, incl tax/tip.

43.description: Have been a few times and meant to update my review...Yoshi's is still consistently delicious with so many unique menu options.Major highlight is their vegan whole kabocha squash, filled w/veggies & tofu in this dreamy broth. They are very accommodating to vegans and have super creative dishes for everyone. My boyfriend loves their tuna tartare tacos, bento box, tempura green beans and basically everything else there. Plus, it has that cozy, friendly, family neighborhood feel with the old-school charm of a restaurant that has been around for decades.

2.description: I came here with a group of friends to try the Thursday prix fixe menu. Although the menu is small, the choices are well thought out and offers up a decent meal, especially because the entree I had initially wanted was on the menu. I ordered the salad, salmon, and apple tart. I do wish the dessert offerings were better for the prix fixe because the regular dessert tray is so appetizing, that I almost ordered a second dessert!I have to say the service was a little slow getting our orders and bringing the various courses. We there there for a loooong time. Plus, the complimentary bread and (random) hummus came out with our first courses, rather than in the beginning when we were sat there waiting for forever. And the bread was just bread, nothing to dip it in, nothing to spread on it. The wine list is nice, but it is quite expensive, especially for such a small glass of it. We each only had one glass and the waiter seemed like he really wanted us to have more. Not for $11.50. The salad was amazing. I've not had such a simple yet such a delicious salad like that. The lemon vinaigrette was the perfect complement to the fresh greens. My salmon was also delicious. I ordered it medium and it was cooked perfectly, and sat on a bed of polenta and tomato sauce. It was a light, yet thoroughly satisfying meal. My dessert of apple tart was also healthy-seeming, as it was made of more apples than tart, and the dab of ice cream on top was small, yet flavorful. Nothing more was needed, in my opinion. I like feeling full, yet not stuffed with the guilt of the type of food I ate.

18.description: Yoshi is a long running reliable restaurant with consistent high quality service and delicious food.  They often change the selection on their menu but same great variety of choices for everyone - meat lover, weight watcher, vegan and etc.  You won't be disappointed. I recommend their special menu, normal with seasonal ingredients.  Give them a try!!

41.description: Went here for a date before a night out- service was good. Ambiance was average- but that clearly isn't the point of this place. Our food was fantastic- we had once of the specials (Cornish hen) and the burger. Both were amazing. We even ordered dessert- I had the chocolate espresso Creme brûlée and my date had the pecan pie. Both were GREAT. Cocktail menu was majorly lacking- that's my only critique.

52.description: We went here earlier tonight for dinner.  We hadn't been before and decided to try it as part of Restaurant Week.  The R/W menu looked good and seemed like a good value, so we thought we'd try a new place.  Short story:  I don't plan to go back.  There are a lot of great places in Chicago to try that I don't think we need to settle for a place that didn't meet our food/atmosphere/service expectations.   Maybe if I lived around the block, I'd go back, but we don't, and it's not a destination restaurant for us.Now the details:Pros:-Service started out strong.  We were seated immediately and our server was friendly and attentive.-Menu seemed broad enough and the dishes appeared to be interesting - not your typical stuff which is good-Food:  we did the R/W menu, so my husband and I both got the tuna carpaccio to start, I had the Atlantic salmon w/coconut curry sauce for the entree and my husband had the lamb lank.  The "pro" part of the meal was the dessert, a frozen dacquise - it was quite tasty.  The entrees were fine - not a pro or a con.  Salmon was well done but nothing amazing.  My husband enjoyed the lamb, but according to the menu it was supposed to come w/ mashed potatoes and they didn't - while he liked it he didn't feel like he'd want to go back for it.Cons:-Service ended on a sour note.  Our waiter just disappeared.  Knowing we got the R/W menu, and we had dessert, you'd think he'd just bring the check, but we literally sat there for at least 15 minutes while he either disappeared out of the room or only went to the tables near us.  Finally had to call him over and ask for the check.  Frustrating.-Atmosphere wasn't really a pro or a con, but sticking in this section b/c it wasn't great.  There was something a little office building-ish about it, particularly the ceiling tiles.  But if the food/service were good this would not have been something to deter us from returning.-Food:  the tuna carpaccio was not good at all - quite fishy.  Had to eat it with a lot of the jicama to not really taste it.  Unfortunately this was the way the meal started so it was starting out on a disappointing note.-Value:  After our two meals at $33/person, and one glass of wine each, the bill came to $87 before tax.  Unfortunately I didn't feel this restaurant experience (food/service) warranted the price.  Not a good value.Glad others have had a better experience.  To me I enjoy R/W week to try new places, and I feel like restaurants should strive to put their best foot forward, but I think Yoshi failed here.  Bummer.

50.description: My partner and I go to Yoshi's all the time. We have been going there for years. We are always struck by the hospitality of Nabuko and Yoshi. The food is consistently great and interesting. I think that one of the reasons Yoshi's has been a staple of Lakeview is that Yoshi and Nabuko are there every night at the helm. They have also been able to roll with the times. I ate there when they first opened and it was a small dark french restaurant (which was delicious) but as times have changed it has become more of a Japanese/French fusion bistrot. Yoshi's has always been extremely supportive of the LGBT community. We had our Civil Union party there and it was very memorable. The wait staff is always helpful and knowledgeable. Yoshi's is our home away from home.

4.description: What a wonderful treat.  Our first time here, we have wandered by for years and are truly sorry this was the first time we looked at the menu and went inside. Excellent service, perfect food, and an exquisite presentation.  The Japanese Pumpkin Vegan option was as great as it can get!Will be back. Sooner rather than later.

6.description: OMG!!! Is all I can say!! How have I not eaten here!! I've live down the street from Yoshi's for years!!! Tonight I Met some friends for a bday dinner.. We started off with Tuna tartar & oyster shots....1/2 price bottle wines, we had 2 bottles, the soup: corn soup Yyyyuummmmmmmmyyyy!!! The into our entrees!!! I had their Rosemary Chicken-DELISH!!! The bday boy had the 16oz steak, another had snapper & another had the Korean style steak salad... Everyone enjoyed their entrees... We all shared & tasted each dish.. Our mouths & tummies were in HEAVEN!!  Dessert-OMG OMG.... I can't even find words to describe how delicious it was!!! It's pricy but worth every cent!!! Tuesday's are 1/2 price Martinis, Wednesday's 1/2 price bottled wine, Thursday's the have a 3 course meal for $25.00!!!   I will be a regular from here forth... I'm going back tom for more!!!  BON APPETITE!!!!!

22.description: Food is excellent.  Service is impeccable. They really make you feel welcome, pampered and cared for.  Always a great dining experience.

15.description: I'm tempted to go there every day because I live very close.I love their food and staff there are wonderful.

57.description: Twice. Now its a pattern. I believe Yoshi is prejudice against gay couples. My partner and I have been faithful and constant patrons for YEARS.  We have spent many holidays and regular nights and brunches there. So when we wanted to find a place to host our upcoming wedding reception, we naturally thought of Yoshi's.  So not once, but twice, we contacted the Mrs. and asked for a quote for a buy out of the restaurant. Now, I completely get it and understand if they would not want to do this, but after YEARS of spending thousands of dollars there, and being told that Yoshi would get back to us.... Nothing. Silence. Disrespect.   Again, we go there so often that they know us by name when we call, know exactly who we are and what waiter and table we like.  And when I asked them, twice, about a buy out (and we were not looking for a discount mind you) we received absolutely NO call back, even after the owner promised too... twice.   I find it despicable and completely disrespectful. They are in Boistown. Even if they weren't, a call would have been appropriate.  We will NEVER go back there again and highly suggest others in the LGBTA community do not either. Apparently taking our money for drinks is OK, but showing some respect and getting back to us for a gay wedding reception is not.  I would like to point out to Yoshi, that is bordering on legal discrimination.  If you allow it for others, you must allow it for all.  Shame on you

20.description: I went to Yoshi's Cafe after hearing rave reviews from a friend of mine.  What initially peaked my interest was that this restaurant has been around for 30+ years, which say quite a LOT for a restaurant in Chicago.Well, it certainly shows!  From initially placing my reservation to being seated at a comfortable corner table, service was fabulous from start to end.  Everyone from the attentive, informative waiter to the busboy that continuously filled our water glasses and changed out place settings without being disruptive of conversation, demonstrated quality service in a restaurant that's been in the business for a while.  The food itself was absolutely delicious!  We started off with tuna tartar, which was the best I have ever had.  The waiter told us that appetizer has been on the menu since the restaurant opened and it shows.  I ordered the fish special, the black cod.  This dish was so delectable and just melted in my mouth.  It was easily one of the best fish dishes I have had in a while.  It was cooked in a tomato-based sauce, linguine, and vegetables.  My husband had the burger that we've heard so much about.  His one word was:  Amazing.  It was described as a Wagyu beef burger with a fried green tomato, pickled vegetables, cheddar or brie cheese, and various other ingredients.  It was huge and he gobbled it up, telling me it was easily one of the best burgers he's had in a long time.  It came with a side of truffle fries.We were feeling adventurous and also tried dessert (although I don't know how we managed!).  We ordered the creme brule and had complimentary chocolate mousse as well.  WOW.  No words can really describe the juxtaposition of both amazing desserts.Drinks were a wide selection of wines and a few unique martinis--yum!PLUS Yoshi himself came and stopped by all the tables to see how the guests were enjoying their meals--if that is not service, I don't know what is!  What a great sign of a quality restaurant!All in all, we DEFINETELY will be back!  We had an amazing dinner that I am still thinking about now...

36.description: OMG! Yoshi is more then just a Japanese restaurant! They have different things on their menu. Tired the nectarine & watermelon warm goat cheese salad and their yummie fish tacos! I was going to pass on dessert but when I saw the presentation, I could not pass it up!

14.description: Quality food that's great when someone else is paying for it.

3.description: My Aunt recently gave me a very yummy marinade labeled Fresh Market.  I had assumed that it came from this store.  I was wrong.I did find that this store though small, has incredible prices and a great selection of ethnic groceries.  Vegetables are cheap, but hit or miss...you really have to pick carefully.  Meat and cold cuts, I would skip.  Staples however are dirt cheap, I spent a total of $35 for 3 bags of food including organic milk.  Cheap stuff!They have a small hot counter where you can order tacos, burritos, tamales, etc.

1.description: I have been to this store a few times. Hit or miss with products, still some decent values. On this last visit I told by the cashier they do not accept any type of coupons. New to me & i probably will be shopping else where...

2.description: Fresh vegetables that is the most recognizable feature of this market.

0.description: Rosa J. always tries to make grocery-shopping interesting and fun by exploring places around the neighborhoods.  Near the corner of Central and Wrightwood, Fresh Market Place was chosen one.  I've been receiving the DM from here, and prices for fresh produce seem to be pretty legit.  This is a typical mid-sized Hispanic grocery store that carries ingredients used for making Mexican and Latino cuisines.  I'm SO not an expert of cooking, but stuff grows in the trees and on the grounds is what hubby and I consume daily.  Therefore, I would say FMP's strongest department is their agricultural products.  If you're fond of cheese, especially queso fresco, a decent variety of different types of cheese can also be found here.  I was surprised that FMP hasn't had many reviews on Yelp.  Honestly, I recommend those who live close by to check it out.  It's a neighborhood grocery store for residents' convenience, so don't travel ten (10) freakin' miles because you will probably give this place one (1) or two (2) stars for wasting much of your precious time. FMP is also vehicle-friendly and provides sufficient parking.  Otherwise, it's accessible via CTA #85 (Central) bus.

4.description: Excellent service & food !!! Recommended to me by a Mexican friend. Catered from here for a 'taco party' of ~50 people (kids included). Ordered 15# each of Barbacoa (shredded beef) & Carnitas (pork), as well as a tray of red rice (included small amount of veggies & beans). Also picked up 25, 12pcks of corn tortillas (warm, as they are delivered fresh from bakery daily) for only $10 !! Along with red (VERY spicy) & green salsa (very mild but chunky w/avocados included). Everything was spectacular to say the least. Authentic. It was served to a mixed ethnicity crowd, and was a HIT even w/ the kids! Prepared all the taco topping myself (onion,tomato,lettuce,cabbage,sour cream,cilantro,queso fresco crumbled,guac,limes- 15 for $1 there!). You could also order the guac, pico de gallo, etc if you like. The beef was nearly all gone but only 1/4 of the pork, even though it was tasty. I would order less meat & less tortillas next time (unless you want alot of left overs). If you do order the beef, make sure you keep it warm unitl served (over flames/oven), otherwise fat congeals.

0.description: Came here once or twice before for a quick beer run (AKA, a half dozen 24 cases of beer and a few bottles of tequila and rum). I'm not sure how much you can really say about a liquor store, but this one was alright.This Foremost had everything we were looking for (we're pretty simple so that was an easy one), so there were no complaints on not finding something we were looking for.The place itself is pretty average. Good size, not too large that you'll get lost but sizable enough to fit all the goody goodness that we love in alcohol.The service was quite poor when I came here, which is why it receives three stars. First of all the man behind the counter watched us like a hawk as if he immediately decided we were trying to be mischevious; I know I'm a badass but come on now I just want some beer. And when we got to the counter he seemed to have an attitude for some reason. I have bad days too but don't take it out on customers buddy.Overall, it's a liquor store. Walk in, buy your liquor, get out.

1.description: Food is goodStaff atentive & fastyesterday was very busyWe celebrate my friend bdayMargaritas just in pointI try a jibaritos really goodLive musicsee you soonViva mexico !!!!!

9.description: Myself and my wife wanted Mexican food. we went to a place a little further northhowever they were packed!! no place to sit or stand (I wonder why) anyway wedid ask a waitress how long of a wait and they told her about 45mins she didn't want to wait that long. so on the way back home. we saw this place. First thing we noticed was not that many people here at all. we did get seated right away. I happenedto also see the one and only waitress their was busy flirting with two men at another table. she didn't even realize we were there. so had to call her over. ordered  since webeen staring at the menu for quite awhile.so we waited for our order to come which took way too long when it did arrive it was bland at best. tacos were dry. meat was coldmy wife looked at me like we just made a big mistake!! I have to admit the coffee was good. to be perfectly honest when we left we walked across the street we said toone another never again here. I know we will not be going back. service is poor ..food is not good at all.

23.description: yuck! we ordered for delivery and the food was a huge disappointment. I thought since we looked at the website (which have pics of everything) it would be safe. I had a huarchata with carne asada... whatever the shell is made of was rock hard, inedible. I ordered a chicken quesadilla, which came with no chicken, it was basically a ton of gross cheese sandwiched between two 3-inch corn tortillas. The gorditas were sloppy and flavorless. never again!

5.description: I always have called in to this place and there has always been an issue... I only get the menudo from here because they sell it 7 days a week but over the last 2 mos the portions has decreased drastically. Never had the tacos or burritos so I can't rate..

25.description: my ex used to work here and he introduced me TO THE BEST FETTUCINE ALFREDO i have ever tasted in my life. they call it pollo alfredo u can get w or w out veggies. i always get it w out. it is like 10.80 if they deliver and cheaper if u eat there. although u mite get shot cuz of the area. they have ghetto musik nites on thurs w all the u no whos. my ex used to have duck at times cuz of the fites. and the ghettoness but he made 1000 a week so hey delivery boy it is. i have eaten at italian resturants and leonas is pretty good. but absoletly no one beats the alfredo sauce no body so delicious. it is worth the risk or just tell them to deliver they r nuts i live 5 miles away and they delivered wen my dad had our house in franklin park theyd deliver. usually in 45 minutes or less too.  o and they close super late like a 3 or 4 am. do not eat the mexican there u will have a grease attack stick to the seafood and my fav in the whole city the alfredo pasta

12.description: If you're hungry and want something within a reasonable amount of time- do not pick them to deliver. Only pick up. One star is tri much, but so was the time I spent waiting for food.

21.description: Ok restaurant  when you feel like partying  during the week they have  dj tuesdays and kareokee thrusdays I believe.

16.description: HORRIBLE.  It's close to 3 hours and I STILL haven't gotten my order.  I called an hour ago and they said it should be here any minute.  REALLY????  If I could give them 0 stars I freakin would...

17.description: They fucking suck! Just got my food. 5 tacos 2 burritos quesadilla and a hot dog for my baby. My food arrives cold. My quesadilla isn't missing. I call them to inform them that it's missing and the dumb bitch that answers the phone wants to argue with me and tell me they said they sent everything. At this point I'm annoyed. I work at a restaurant as a full time manager. I kiss my customers asses weather they be at fault or us. Yes I snapped. I told her I'd bring the fucking food back and fling it at her ass. I will not order from here again

10.description: In the mood for what you think is gonna be a good time? Well consider it a bad and a waste of time. The only reason I came here was because I there was menu placed right on my front doorstep. I glanced really quickly at the menu, saw $7.95 price tag for margaritas and immediately wanted to go there. Later that same day, I happened to go there on a date...ordered myself a torta dinner and my significant other order a burrito. The food was mediocre. Nothing you can't get somewhere else for cheaper. But the lemon margaritas...since they notified us that was meant for delivery only they poured it into a megatron jumbo sized to-go-cup which of course no one here was complaining because the size of that thing was epic. In all sincerity here though, we were a couple dining in...presentation looked bad but I guess you get what you pay for at this particular location. Anyways, I ordered the advertised margarita showing them the flyer as well as having sent a text message as advertised on the flyer stating that I would receive a free dessert by showing the waitress the sent received text message. Then the waitress went to confirm  to her manager which he said that that was only meant for delivery only...mind you I checked all over the menu flyer beforehand to make sure that it is eligible. No problems here though, because after the waitress talked to her manager and seeming it was our first time there, we got the go ahead. The problem started when waitress never came back to check up on us. Never asked how things were. Customer service was just terrible. We were there stranded when we realized that our waitress had left because her shift was done and she didn't have the decency to tell us. We thought about dining and ditching for a while. That's how terrible it was and we might as well should have. I don't think they would have had a clue. So my bf had to pay up front and I still needed a napkin! I never got my free advertise dessert either!Don't waste your time here. Terrible everything. Nasty smell included.

11.description: Love this place for delivery! Who would think a place that has great Mexican would be so good and cheap!Great tacos,fajitas, tamales, whole deep fried fish and menudo. Delivery menu is huge, but lots of great plate specials, ie mixed tacos etc. they wrap all condiments individually and with care.Got a brochure on my fence , and so glad I gave hem a try!

26.description: I was invited to El Ranchito for a quick sit down and chill time.Upon entry, I was a bit shocked to hear Yung Joc on the system and it was POUNDING. The patrons seemed to be a fair mix of families out for a live dinner scene and groups of the 30+ crowd.As we picked a table and began to warm up to the place, our server came quite promptly with chips and salsas (green chiles made the best). The two servers were being split amongst bar and food throughout the dancefloor as well as the dining room. I presume thats why our first round of drinks ($1 Margaritas on Wednesday) took a bit longer than we wanted to wait, lol. After placing our order, we had enough time to sip through two rounds. My tostada de carne asada was good, but the rest of my party seemed to get the greasier servings of meat. The food and drinks were worth the bill, maybe not the delay, but definitely good for a Wednesday.Oh and, if you're bringing your kids, make sure they get home before it gets too late. There were plenty of F-Bombs being tossed about and alot of "earmuffs" having to be equipped.

22.description: This restaurant use to be good when we first started ordering from them. Now its horrendous. The food is disturbing under cooked some still pretty much frozen. Over an hour wait after ordering. Always screwing up orders forgetting things. Their Costumer Service is also horrendous along with a rude not giving a damn delivery guy! We will NEVER order from them again! I would give them no stars if I could!

0.description: Ordered 2 steak tacos with lettuce, sour cream, cheese and tomatoes. Not good! They taste like nothing!Ordered the super nachos and it's okay. Don't order the sour cream though, it looks like they make it but it tastes like yogurt. Nothing special about the fries or tamale either. Won't be ordering anymore.

20.description: HORRIBLE.  It's close to 3 hours and I STILL haven't gotten my order.  I called an hour ago and they said it should be here any minute.  REALLY????  If I could give them 0 stars I freakin would...

19.description: Terrible.  Ordered from them because they deliver to my hotel and I was craving Mexican.  I ordered through their website and when I tried to confirm the order it prompted me to sign up and create a password which I thought was a bit of a hassle, so I picked up the phone and called to order.  Only, when I ordered my food, all the prices were different than on the website.  When I questioned the price difference the guy was like "I don't know,  I'm telling you the prices"  So I said I'd try to order online.  Hung up the phone and ordered online.  The order took an hour and 10 minutes to arrive.  The man arrived and the bill was for a different amount than i was quoted online.  By a few bucks, in my favor, and I didn't feel like dealing with with so I didn't say anything. I had requested extra cheese, extra sour cream and extra tortillas, and none of those things were in the bag.  The food was super oily, like, there was a POOL of oil at the bottom of the container about a centimeter deep.  So disgusting.

2.description: I've been eating here for about 5 years. The tacos have gotten considerably smaller, they are no longer serving authentic steak meat (tastes something like pork steak) and everytime I call in an order they screw it up. I placed an order for 3 steak tacos with onions, cilantro and cheese. 3 carnitas just cheese and 2 chicken tacos just cheese. They slapped wads of American cheese on all of the tacos along with onions and cilantro on EVERYTHING. Really, AMERICAN CHEESE! Then expected me to drive all the way back to the restaurant to exchange the tacos which I couldn't do because by then I was home with my babies. All I asked for was a $5 credit for the next time I order but the manager refused even though the cook admitted fault. DO NOT EVER EAT HERE!

18.description: I don't know about El Ranchito's dine-in experience but I wouldn't recommend them for delivery. The delivery time was estimated to be 45 minutes but they took about 2 hours. I ordered a salad with out meat or dairy, and specified that dairy includes sour cream, cheese, and possibly any dressing they put on. Considering they categorize themselves as vegetarian friendly in an otherwise non vegetarian friendly part of town, I was expecting my request to be something they're used to.I don't even think my salad was vegetarian, never mind vegan. It had a layer of sour cream all over the top and refried beans all over the bottom. In the center was some lettuce, peas (odd but I kind of liked it), a lot of guacamole, and yellow rice. Yellow rice and refried beans are not usually vegetarian in similar Mexican restaurants, so I worry these were no exception. Even if they were, I'm partial to black beans.They included a lot of extra salsa and other sauces, which was nice. They did not  add cheese or dressing, per request, which was also appreciated.I can forgive  them for the questionable rice/beans (I should have looked into it more before ordering) and even the heap of sour cream, but eating at 9pm as opposed to 7:30pm is no bueno.

13.description: Found this place to be open super late AND they delivered? Sounds like a good deal right? Wrong. Probably never ordering delivery from this place again. I placed my order through Yelp at 2:10 am. Called around 2:55 am to see the status of the delivery and the lady on the phone said "we just received it ten minutes ago." Oh okay...funny because I ordered a while ago. I call back at 3:30ish to see if the driver was close and I'm pretty sure the girl said he was leaving. The driver didn't come until just about 4am. No apology, no recognition of lateness, nothing. I paid over 30$ for late delivery and mostly cold food at that time? Couldn't say I was too happy with El Ranchito. What sucks is that I've heard great things about them but they truly disappointed me as a customer that could have been loyal. Sorry not sorry but your customer service sucks.

4.description: This place is horrible, I will never order from this place. I placed an order thru grubhub and my order was delivered 20 minutes late, all my food was cold and the meat tasted old and the shake that I was looking forward to was disgusting is looked smelled and tasted spoiled. This place is not even worth 1 star! Of and the Manger is extremely rude and denied all of this. By the way we ended up throwing all the food and having to order from a different restaurant.

24.description: i ordered a burrito for like 5 bucks and it was HUGE!!! although its not the greatest mexican food in the city they still deliver until 3 A.M.

6.description: I got the "carne asada plate" and the steak had a fishy taste! Absolutely disgusting. They definitely cooked it were they had cooked fish or something. Their steak tacos are okay nothing special. The service is horrible! Do not come here

15.description: Terrible.  Terrible.  Terrible.   First of all, they messed up my order.   Second, it was cold.  Finally, when I called (GrubHub) to complain they told the guy they wanted the food back which is fine because i didnt plan on eating it but still.  If you are at fault for screwing something up you could at least make the effort to make things right.  Just sayin.   Even the GrubHub rep had a good laugh about them asking for it back. Smh

7.description: In the mood for a burrito?...they got itIn the mood for a jibarito?...they got itIn the mood for some pasta dishes?...they got itLooking for some breakfast?...they got itThe question should be, what don't they offer?!This place has quite an extensive menu. They seem to have EVERYTHING you can think to eat.  I finally gave in and decided to try El Ranchito. I ordered a carne asada burrito to go.  I waited no more than a few minutes when the waitress brought me my burrito. It was a decent size for $7, but it tasted just "ok" I felt the meat was a little too salty, but the refried beans were delicious (so next time I'm getting a veggie burrito).I think I might come back sometime, especially since they have daily drink specials...I mean where else could I get a martini for $2.50 or a Corona for $1.25.

8.description: nasty!! no stars deserved! their drinks are nasty ! they use cheap shit! i could taste it. and the service was horrible. 4 of us and we all got our drinks different times. we had to wave down diffrent waitress every time. we could of left without paying that's how bad they don't attend you. and tip was inclined 15 dollars, they didn't not deserve any.  they don't even check up if we need anything and their attitudes sucks. terrible management! !!! and wayyyyyy over priced for some cheap nasty drinks!!!! to top it of we didn't even get  card. don't go here its really bad.

3.description: If I could give it zero, I would. We ordered 2 chicken tacos and the steak taco dinner. While the steak tacos were not the best; dry and flavorless. The worst part was that one of the chicken tacos had raw chicken in it! We called not asking for our money back but just to inform them, and the young lady on the phone put me on hold, then came back on the line to tell me that it could not be raw bc they cook all the chicken for the tacos in the morning! Um, so not only is there raw chicken in my tacos, but you're also telling me that you don't make them fresh?! Disgusting!!! Needless to say, I will not be ordering from El Ranchito Restaurant again.

14.description: Where should I start? Received their menu from one of their employees walking in to our office with them a couple of weeks ago. Thought I'd give the place a try. Loved that they have such large menu & delivery. I ordered from their website I pulled directly from their menu elranchitorestaurant.com. After spending a couple of minutes looking over all my choices I decided to get one of the lunch combos to try a couple of different things. My order one taco steak, one tostada beef one enchilada chicken, one horchata, one order of chips  & one order of guacamole. delivery time 45 minutes+. I thought OK that's average for most places. They called me almost an hour later telling me they were here. Ummm no your not. Are you at a church? No I am not at a church. Is .....your address? Yes but that is not where your delivery driver is because our address is not a church we are between this street & this street. 10 minutes later lunch arrived. Yes it was cold. driver hands it over & says your total is ..... Wait just a minute that is not the price I was given or confirmed with from your website the receipt he handed me was around $2.00 more. So I called the store & was put on hold multiple times to speak to the one woman who takes care of "take out" orders. While waiting I hand the Driver a large bill to pay for my meal informing him I will only pay the price I was Confirmed at but will send him back with both receipts. He informed me he did not have change for that large of a bill. When I placed the order I added a note requesting that they bring enough change to break it. They obviously ignored that part of the order or their system just doesn't work right. He was nice & walked down the block leaving his wallet as collateral to buy something & break the bill for me. I eventually spoke to someone at the restaurant who informed me that sometimes prices change! Yes but I did not order off of the menu I ordered off of your website where the pricing should be accurate. There was a note when you first log on the website stating a 20% discount would apply to your first order which would be close to the difference but shouldn't they then be aware of that when they are ringing the order up in on site? I ended up paying what I was confirmed & she apologized for the issues. I reheated the Taco, Tostada & Enchilada in our microwave. The rice & beans I skipped because I did try them while they were cold & they didn't really have any flavor. The guac. was OK, the chips were just chips. The taco was good there was a good amount of steak I did pull out a couple of pieces of fat but it wasn't the whole taco so it didn't bother me. The chicken enchilada was a little skimpy compared to the amount of meat on the taco but still had good flavor.
