The place has been open for about 40 years...family owned .If you happen to stop by ....There Italian beef is a must!!!..don't forget to add cheddar cheese to it.Plenty of parking also.

20.description: Best Italian beef I tried beef sandwiches across Chicago and always come back here. Pizza is also very good and Gyros I recommend dinner platter

19.description: Best beef and gyros in my area. Great place, you could never go wrong with Marcos. Great service, good food and fast even on busy days. The best part it is walking distance from my house, which is a good thing.

33.description: Outstanding fast food place. Great whole pizzas or slices. There are a wide variety of items on this menu and I'm sure there is something for everyone. I love the gyros! You can eat in, carry out or have your food delivered. Everyone loves Marco's!

2.description: Rosa J.'s quest on finding the best Italian beef sandwich continued after a trip to the nearby Unique Thrift Store.  I found Marco's via my trusty pillow-mate, the yelp app. (I have to yelp before I go to sleep, each and everyday)!  There's a plenty of parking for customers.  They do accept credit cards.  Yes, it's slightly pricer for the Belmont Central neighborhood standard.  However, I don't think the price for the Italian beef sandwich was ridiculous at all.  For $0.50 more, you will get a small fountain pop and fries.  Of course, there's an extra charge for adding sweet or hot peppers: $0.50 in addition.  If you frequent one of those neighborhood hotdog and sandwich joints, they typically charge $0.50 to $0.75 for that extra add-on.  With that being said, it's a little more than $8 for the entire meal.  Hubby also had a slice of cheese pizza ($2.40).  Well, because he wasn't hungry, he went with this option.  I personally would order something else other than that expensive slice of pizza.  I think Marco's Italian beef sandwich had one of the juiciest beef I've had.  However, it was very messy to eat because they really "immersed" that sandwich like a baptism!  Anyways, the au jus was delicious.  The fries, on the other hand, were alright.  If you're a fan of crinkled fries, then you will have a better praise on those fries.  I think it was worth the trip to explore Marco's.  This place didn't, indeed, disappoint me.

32.description: Marco's is one of those places on my mental list when lunchtime arrives at work.  It's kind of out of the way, but the drive is worth it for their decent food.  Nothing I have ever eaten here has been mindbogglingly delicious, but it satisfies.  Prices are a bit high for this type of fare, but I suspect the higher prices are a way to recoupe after Marco's recently upgraded.  Pizza by the slice is good, cheese fries are as well.  Some of the guys order beefs and they like them; I am not a fan of Italian beef any way you look at it.This place is rather small and the usual clientele can be unsavory and boisterous, so don't come here with your young kids unless they have been raised on Maury Povich and Cops all their short lives and have been desensitized.  For me, it all adds to the atmosphere.  I love this place for that stuff.  Don't know why...kinda just reminds me why I love this city so much.

18.description: I love this place!! The food is incredibly seasoned..in which not many places season their food. If I can give more stars I would!!

13.description: The owner of this place definitely don't care about his customers we have ordered several times from him which this time was a surprise me and my roommates had separated orders we were trying to order on the phone and he got real nasty and arrogant he will not get a dime of my money again

4.description: The customer service is not what it should be. I've had several orders inaccurately prepared with no apologies or remediation. I'm not ordering from this establishment again. When you work hard for your money, you want to feel like your dollars are appreciated.

24.description: I stopped in here and got a couple of slices of pizza and I have to say I was underwhelmed.  It was a very bland experience.  The cheese and toppings were ok, nothing great but ok.  The problem was for my taste preferences the pizza sauce and the crust were not very flavorful.  If it was my place I'd definitely use a different pizza sauce and at the very least brush some garlic butter on the crust.  Personally I prefer pizza crusts that have a nice yeasty flavor, but maybe that wouldn't work for other customers.  Based on the pizza I don't think I'd return.  However, after reading the reviews maybe I will stop in and try their gyro burger or wings since I read good things about them.  If my next experience is either better or worse I'll update my review at that time.

6.description: Wow worst customer service ever experienced !!A trashy environment, with even trashier cashiers. All of the girl cashiers behind the counter seem to think their workplace is a high school lunchroom and not a restaurant. They were texting laughin and i heard ine girl crack a joke about a customer who walked away with his food. Extremely rude&ghetto service. They r going to run that business to the ground because even if the food would have been good(it was also disgusting [got worse recently]) i would have still not came back due to their customer service skills. The beef was flavorless and the meat was old or low quality cuz it felt papery , kind o like paoery beef crumbs not strips.. not a very meaty like texture. Pizza slice had almost no cheese and like 4 sausage pieces on top. The sauce was weird.  Definitely won't come back. If you guys want the best beef/pizza there's a place On Harlem ave and a little south of irving park that has the best, And i mean THE BEST beef and pizza i think its called mr beef. I found them wen i left marcos. Never again am i gona spend a dollar where my business is mocked and not appreciated

22.description: I've eaten here many times due to co-workers but I must say, I'm never fully satisfied. I've always had something not so great going on with my meal. Today I ordered a polish with fries and got the poorest portion of fries. $4.95 and it's like that's what I paid for only a polish. I can go to my preferred places and get more in portion size including better quality for about $3. That's sad, especially in Chicago. My boss ordered wings, asked for hot sauce and never got it. Let's remind you Marco's, wings are usually eaten with HOT SAUCE or a sauce of some sort... Thanks for the loads of ketchup we didn't care for. Sorry but this will be my last time here. Good luck!

15.description: For a fast food place, their food delivers and their service is great and friendly and clean. Huge menu selection but I tend to go for the delicious broasted chicken and try their Italian beef-it's one of the best in their neighborhood!Make sure to order the beef juicy because when in Chicago, that's what we typically do. And if your brave enough, order the hot peppers on the side and add to taste! One down side, is their FF-very disappointing! Reminds me of the frozen ore-Ida crinkle type you buy in your frozen super-market section instead of the usually Chicago type of home-cut FF w/skin on. Overall, a good spot to to try vs the many fast-food chain surrounding it.

7.description: I thought it was a little slow. My fiend asked to use the restroom and was told no. Food was average. Not a place to go for me.

8.description: Marcos beef and pizza has by far one of the best, if not the best Italian beef sandwich in Chicago!!  Try the sandwich juicy with hot peppers.  Excellent crinkle cut french fries, and pizza. Good customer service, very clean qresturant, and quick delivery service. A must try!!!!

30.description: Marco's went all out to increase business they more than double the parking space's, by buying the corner property. Beside that they have the best Gyro's beef, no lamb,cook on a spit fire till crisp. The beef and pizza are very good. and the hot dog's comes with crinkle fries and they have great Broasted chicken. Beside the great Service and much, much more you won't leave Hungry! your sure to come back. P. S. the beef sandwich is packed ! with BEEF! not pre- weighted. The homemade hot peppers are unique your sure to buy more for home .

3.description: Customer service was on point! Josh the cashier suggested to get the italian beef on garlic bread which tasted amazing! I never thought to get it on garic bread , so now I'm always going to order it that way. Def will come back ! Not only was the food great they were fast making my order. Best late night meal !

14.description: Good beef and sausage combo. The beef was good but the sausage was out of this world. Extremely juicy and succulent. Price was a bit high for lunch $11.00 for a sandwich,drink and fries.

3.description: This is a whole in your wall little Mexican restaurant located in a plaza. Nothing fancy by any means.  So I walked in and ordered a tamale of cheese and poblano pepper and a steak taco.  Omg!  It was disgusting!! The taco had an unpleasant smell like the lard it was fried in was old (plus frying in lard is Ewww). The tamale was small and not that great tasting.  Sadly,  I will never be back here.  Thank goodness there's a subway a couple doors down from this establishment.

1.description: This place i came to is on diversey and laramie my husband were hungry and it was past 9:30 most places were closing we were heading to taco burrito king but this was en route and i really didnt want to come because before that place was dingy and dirty looking taco place i think it was las asadas before. Idk but we stopped and when i walked in place was totally diff nice remodeling job! Clean! Waitress as great and food was good ! We had taco and sope gordita dinner, place closes at 11pm and the agua de jicama was good,flan was ok but overall great joint!  I be back!

2.description: I constantly see inferior or fake food ingredients shoved into recipes and served to the unknowing public.  The restaurant misrepresents them, and we the consumers, get stuck with garbage. so  read this: This is  a place that up charges for what the staff at the counter says is "crema" a Mexican cultured sour cream, and on my tacos I got some manufactured garbage that glistened like translucent white motor oil on my food. I inquired in Spanish as to if it was REAL authentic crema, the server replied "yes" Still disbelieving what my senses told me was trash, I asked her I to see what container it comes in, and to bring me the container so I can see for myself before I pay my tab. The lid from a container that she appeared with at my table side was something that even a homeless person would discard: filthy and unfit for touching anything food related. It was like a bad joke from Married with Children! - seriously!I said that wasn't it, and she sauntered off and reappeared with a label torn off a container that said:  "Salad Dressing!"   this product is Clearly Not Crema!!!!! I was so freaking pissed off when I read the ingredients: soybean and/or Palm oil and about 25 other ingredients all man made garbage plus titanium dioxide to make it whiter than me.  Why did you charge me extra for this swill on my taco that was now ruined!  Absolutely atrocious! They then handed me and my friend a bill in which they padded an extra 2.00 for something we never bought! And this was after the server  dropped a piece of torn memo pad paper on the table telling us that was the total!!!! I don't know when restaurants stopped using guest checks, but my friend demanded a real receipt with itemized purchases do we could hold them accountable for not screwing with us! So we paid the new lesser tally and left thoroughly disgusted, and NO tip for being shady and dishonest. All I could say was: "What is this crap?"  and why did you lie to us multiple times? We will NEVER go back here.

9.description: I had to stop in and try this place. Ordered some Pork Tamale in Red Sauce & a Quesadilla with Squash Blossoms (Flor de Calabaza). The food is very good and the staff is very nice and friendly. This will be my go to place for a quick meal after a long busy day.

10.description: The two table salsas are very good. We tried both the red and green pork  tamales and they were fresh, tasty and the quality was excellent.  My wife had the steak  tampiquena and was impressed by the quality of meat and proper seasoning. The tripe tacos were cooked to a nice crisp and sides of rice and beans were seasoned well. The guacamole was fresh and had just the right amount of citrus. I look forward to digging in their menu a bit deeper next time, The Pastor looked awesome spinning on its spit. The place is small, lacks a public bathroom, but it is cheap and is a great authentic taco/tamale place.

4.description: I'm a fan of their tamales. Best tamales I've ever tasted!! I would've given it 5 stars, but when I went to eat, I believe it was a gordita I, got sick. Too much grease! But the tamales are amazing!! We did get tamales that weren't fully cooked once I believe it was a Sunday, but eh I guess because it's always packed on Sundays and they have to make so many of them. That did not and will not stop me from going for more tamales.

6.description: Great lengua burrito. They offer hand made corn tortillas! There is a wide selection if food from caldo, gorditas, burritos, huevos. Always great quality and great service.

12.description: The tamales are GOOD!!!They have a lot of sauce. They also have them toasted.Overall its very cheap and the quality is good and authentic. The do offer chips which is awesome for a Taqueria.It is a bit small, but the food makes you forget it.Portions are a bit small, but at least they are cheap.

5.description: Best Tamales I ever had ! My first time in there and the employees were so sweet and kind helping me choose tamales. I came back a week later to try out the food from the menu and I loved it ! It's my husband's and I favorite spot to go on Thursdays and Saturday !!!! :)

13.description: I went in after I had heard good things about their tamales.  I was not disappointed and now I take some to work almost once a month.  I have also tried other items and their menu and the food is really good - tortillas are hand made!  I will be coming back to explore some more.

11.description: Think twice before odering from this place !!!!they have screw my order three times already they have bad customer service with attitude they have serve me cold tamales.half the order missing not professional at all.My order was over charge after two attempts of delivering my order it was wrong.will never order from this place again.they fucking suck

8.description: There is no better green tamale around!!! Of course, besides mother's...but that goes without saying. But why do we do that, say "that goes without saying"...after we just did! Anywho, I'm rambling. Tamales are awesome, their other food...ok. Oh, and don't sit by the door during the winter, but that goes without saying...

0.description: Deep fried tamales.......   Did you see what I just wrote?  DEEP FU!#ING FRIED TAMALES!!!!!!!  First time I've ever had something so succulent and delicious that I was taken back to my childhood days when I first remember trying the tamales for the first time.  The setting is in LA 1990, 12 year old me who is FOB (Fresh off Boeing) in Ktown LA with my cousins driving around and seeing the LA.  We stop at a small stand and they order some tamales, and them bastards gave me a jalapeno one.  Shit was on fire son!  But it was so good.  The meat, masa and jalapenos were singing in harmony.But yeah, it took me back.  And they open at 430am so I can actually swing by before coming to work.  Great selections on tamales.  HIJO DE LA CHINGADA!  This place is great man.  Once you try the deep fried tamales, you will never look at the tamales the same way ever again.  Apparently, they used to deliver to my work place but they got into an argument with the security and they no longer deliver.  BOOOOOO!!!!DEEP FRIED TAMALES.

7.description: One of the best places I have been for authentic Mexican food. No bells and whistles; just damn good food! Amazing tamales appear to be the house specialty but, the rest of the menu is nothing to be ignored. Fast and friendly service. On my list of go-to places.

12.description: Great store!  Great selection! Great management!Seriously, the ONLY place to go for Mexican groceries & bomb-ass tacos!!!

7.description: I really only come here for there little taqueria they have..  The place is always packed!! So expect to have patience and more patience.  The parking lot to this place is always a big headache at times because the store seems to always be busy, which is a plus since they are a grocery store as well. I've come here on several occasions and the food is always up to par, the steak is never too salty or overly burned.  But be weary that sometimes they do run out of meat such like chicken, but when they have it it is rather good. The price you pay is pretty reasonable, it's a pretty big taco loaded with meat and whatever else you desire on it. The language barrier can be a bit frustrating even for those who speak fluent Spanish! lol so be patient my friends. I've never actually sat and ate there because it's so busy I am quick to just want to get my food and GO!.. there does always seem to be a lady who cleans the tables and counters as quickly as she can so the place isn't a dump.But it's not 5 star either!! lol If you're in the area and what some decent traditional tacos this place is it !

20.description: I've been to the location on Ashland Ave. numerous times for tacos. So when I was nearby this location, I figured I'd stop in for a couple tacos.Not a good idea. A few hours after I ate a couple tacos from this place, I got food poisoning. Took me almost 2 days to get over it. Not good at all. Maybe I got unlucky and got part of a bad batch, but after my experience, I don't think I'll give them a second chance. I'll stick to the tacos at the Ashland Avenue location.

19.description: I have been here multiple time and have always enjoyed their Delicious Tacos and Tortas. I will continue to visit them whenever I am in town. I also like to say that they have a very Beautiful cashier on the Diversey store.

1.description: I I just seen a guy bites his fingernail off and spit it behind the counter where he was cooking my food.Then I finish shopping and have a cart full of groceries and they tell me that I cant have bags. I would have to buy some. I never had to pay for bags in the past. Then the all start laughing like it's funny. The food is way over priced there as it is. I am sorry but I can't eat there anymore. Rude and nasty.

2.description: Fast, quick service and great tacos, burritos and tortas. You can never go wrong here..

9.description: This taqueria/grocery store doesn't get enough love on yelp! Guanajuato has some of the best tacos in the city! Their horchata is very tasty too! They just remodeled the dining area which makes me happy because its a lot more comfortable and the decor is cute without being cheesy. If you are looking to eat some authentic and tasty tacos or tortas, visit Carniceria Guanajuato especially if you don't visit the northwest side of Chicago often!

6.description: There tacos and milanesa tortas are bombs and make up for ok services. Will keep going for all my taco need

18.description: I've been to the location on Ashland Ave. numerous times for tacos. So when I was nearby this location, I figured I'd stop in for a couple tacos.Not a good idea. A few hours after I ate a couple tacos from this place, I got food poisoning. Took me almost 2 days to get over it. Not good at all. Maybe I got unlucky and got part of a bad batch, but after my experience, I don't think I'll give them a second chance. I'll stick to the tacos at the Ashland Avenue location.

10.description: I really like the ambiance of the store. They have nice paintings on the walls. The staff here is very friendly and this is def my favorite place to go shopping for Mexican food. They also have very fresh meat that is cut to ordered and at prices that are very affordable.the lighting in the place is very bright and you can definitely tell that they like to keep the place clean. That is always a big plus.I also like the fact that they have a taco shop inside the grocery store. They offer a  wide variety of produce at cheap prices too!Will def keep going there for my groceries and whenever i want a bite to eat too!

13.description: Just moved from Logan Square, where I had access to Jimenez.  I'm thinking that all is well, since I have a Guanajuato nearby.Went there for the first time last Saturday, and...They're out of two things I'm looking for -- Romaine lettuce and guacamole.  And at 11:30 on Saturday morning!Broccoli (also something I wanted) was an overcast green color.  My wife tells me to give them another chance.  I'm willing, but so far, I'm going to try to make excuses to make a trip to Logan Square to stop at Jimenez.

16.description: I always go here for my taco/torta/burrito fix, its amazing everytime!!!I usually get the Carne Asada it has always been fresh, well seasoned and so tasty....and nothing has disappointed me! I highly recommend this taqueria to anybody traveling into this part of Chicago!

17.description: They have the best carne asada tacos in Chicago. They just need better service

15.description: This review considers the taqueria only.The good: cheap, with even cheaper specials on particular styles of meat such as lomo encebollado.  Not shy with the portions of meat.The bad: gristle, bone.The ugly: the dining area consistently looks like a dozen two-year-olds have dined in there all day, every day.  No surface unsullied by food and beverage.

0.description: This review is for the restaurant inside the grocery store, where they serve tacos, burritos, tortas, and gorditas.  It was feature in one of the older episodes of "Chicago's Best."  I remembered that the carnitas torta Ted Brunson was feeding in his mouth looked irresistible!  I finally paid a visit to this place tonight.  Hubby and I both had the carne asada tortas.  I friendly reminded hubby that the vegetarian options were available, but he seemed to tune out my words and wanted to be a carnivore for the time being.  Those tortas were quite large for $4.85 each.  They were loaded with meat, avocados, and lettuce.  Everything is made-to-order, so waiting is to be expected.  Those tortas were definitely worth the money!  The meat had great flavors, and they didn't skimp on meat, avocados and other ingredients.  I didn't think they take credit cards at the restaurant, but all you need is five (5) bucks to fill up your stomach.  By the way, it would certainly help if you can speak some Spanish.  I speak pretty decent "food Spanish" since I'm a foodie, but hubby did the entire ordering in Spanish.  The orders were called-out in Spanish as well, so be sure to pay attention.  One of many joys of living in Chicago is the adventure of the food scenes.  Honestly, many of them happen in the nondescript neighborhood like Belmont Central/Cragin.  I'm glad that I found another neighborhood gem this evening, and I know there are many more to come as I explore further.

5.description: Inside this small grocery store lies one of the best kept secrets on the northside. Nothing fancy, just great Mexican food. Especially the carne asada tacos! Not a huge selection, but excel in what they do offer. All simple and fast! Careful with the green salsa, very spicy! Jugos de tamarindo, horchata, And flor de Jamaica drinks are on tap and always delicious! Oh and if you catch them on the right week, 99 cent tacos de carnitas!

11.description: The restaurant inside this grocery store has really good chicken tacos. Everything you love about street vendor tacos, quick, cheap and tasty with the added convenience of being able to grab a few groceries while you wait for your lunch/dinner.They also have really great specials during the week. You can get a burrito for only $2.99!

8.description: Amazing how I've forgotten these kind of places have some of the best tacos! Went in for groceries, but came out eating tacos hahaha!! Their pastor and lengua tacos are da bomb!! They really pack the meat in that tasty tortilla! WAY Better than El Gordo's! Although this store is a little overpriced when compared to Mariano's or other grocery stores, they have a large supply of anything Mexican. Go for the food, but if u need simple fruits n veggies for cheap, go elsewhere!

3.description: The whole place should be close for ever. Everything is Too expensive,  all the vegetables are old, the meat tacos have to much fat, personal staff are not friendly. Etc... Etc...

14.description: Best tortas in town!

4.description: Idk what happened here. Last two times i Went here i got steak burritos and they were inedible. Seasoning was god awful and every bite was full of fat. It may be the time i went. It was a different cook this time. Too bad, i loved the burritos but no way im going back anymore.

28.description: Been going here for years...Family owned and very friendly!  By far, the best Chow Mein with pan fried noodles in town (regardless of whether its shrimp or chicken).  They also have the best BBQ Pork and not to greasy Eggrolls.

1.description: Tony's Chinese American Restaurant @ 6347 W Grand Ave in Chicago.  Talk about a hidden gem.  I found it where else on Yelp Rating of 4 1/2 stars.  This place has been at this location for 35 years.  The owners are from Hong Kong.  The husband cooks & the wife works the front endThe irony is my brother in law use to get Chinese food at a place right around the corner on Narraganset & Grand Ave that is no longer in business.  They had very mediocre food.  Tony's Chinese American Restaurant is located a few buildings over on Grand Ave and the dish I ordered Chicken Li Mein was not only delicious, but they served a huge portion.  There were generous portions of chicken which was perfectly seasoned and very tender.  The vegetables in this dish were pea pods, water chestnuts, broccoli, red onions & bean sprouts.  The vegetables were cooked perfectly (not over cooked).  They were still crispy & very fresh.  The Lo Mein noodles had a nice crispiness.  I almost always go to Chinatown for my Chinese foods because of the assortment of different fresh seafood items.  I mean you can't get much fresher then the fish, crab or lobster swimming I the tank before they are scooped out and prepped for your meal.  One criticism I have is the menu lacks any seafood items other then shrimp.I love Yelp because without it I probably would have never found this restaurant.  I intend to see if these are the normal portion sizes the next time I come back

9.description: This is Absolutely our favorite Chinese restaurant!Love their oyster chickenLove their spicy orange chickenLove their Hot and sour soupIn 25 years we have never had a bad meal yet.  Highly recommend

29.description: This place is not bad, tasty crab Rangoon and egg Rolls, Good fried rice and decent sesame chicken. The funny thing is the two best Chinese take out joints in the area are across the street from one another. Nothing special but satisfies my Chinese fix.

23.description: I live in Arlington Hts. And drive 30 minutes for this food. The Mongolian beef is great and they have awesome jumbo shrimp or jumbo chicken fried rice! You gotta try the tiki chicken. Nothing in the burbs matches it!!!

5.description: I absolutely hate Chinese food, but this place is the only Chinese restaurant I will eat at.It is delicious! have been coming here for years, and the quality of food has not changed. The owner is super friendly, and always remembers her loyal customers by name! They also recently renovated the restaurant to a more contemporary look, which makes the place look more approachable. My favorites: -Chicken fried rice -Tiki chicken -Chicken noodle soup

31.description: I absolutely LOVE Tony's!  I don't live anywhere close to this restaurant but after a few miserable attempts at finding decent Chinese food in my Irving Park/Albany Park neighborhood, I have given up and just deal with the 20 minute drive for the best crab rangoon I have ever had.  Truly, the BEST crab rangoon I've ever had.  An order has 6 huge pieces and each is stuffed with cream cheese goodness.  I tend to rotate the same 4-5 dishes from the menu but those favorites are absolutely phenomenal.A few disclaimers: Tony's is a slightly run down establishment, the owner Sue, is always there and when you first meet her, she might seem a bit grumpy but after she has seen you in there a couple of times, she'll remember you and then she treats you like her best friend, and very important to remember, they only accept CASH!

25.description: food is great just dont touch the chineese lady's tea pot she will cut you...and they dont give you enough food plus their lunch specials menu is very limited

12.description: Writing this after my first time here (based on Yelp reviews) and I do have to say it is as good as the reviews say.  So far my favorite Chinese restaurant in the immediate area.  We order the Mayala Chow Fon (I like a mix of as many things as possible, vegetables, noodles, etc. and this fit the bill).  We did carry out and the food was ready when we got there (about 15 or 20 minutes) and still really hot with the packages that we did not open a couple of hours later.  Flavors were really good in the wonton soup with noodles and the Mayala is great!  Delicious, little bit on the spicy side, but a great mix.  I highly recommend them.  Check them out.

21.description: I've been eating here for 7 years now, this is an awesome family establishment. The food is very good and the owners are super friendly. They are newly remodeled with more seating and better lighting. Do yourself a favor and pay them a visit. If I had two more hands I'd give Tony's four thumbs up!

16.description: I was passing through the neighborhood and stopped in because the restaurant looked brand new (it's actually been around for decades and was recently remodeled).  I was with a group of friends and we ordered family style tiki chicken, egg roll appetizers and beef fried rice, peppered beef, Mongolian chicken and Mayala Chow Fon entrees.  All the dishes were very good but the Mayala Chow Fon was remarkable. I've never had it or seen it before but it was the perfect combination of curry crispy wide noodles.  I will be back for more.

17.description: For the first time sitting in at Tony's, the food was great! I had the tiki chicken appetizer and egg roll--both very flavorful! I came with a group of friends and we also ordered malaya chow fon, beef fried rice, peppered beef, and mongolian chicken. We done it up family style and had a taste of each, and every dish was real good. The dish that stuck out the most, cause I've never had it anywhere else before, was the Mayala Chow Fon--mixture of curry and smokiness, and crispy of the pan fried fon noodles. It is definitely a dish I've never seen at any other chinese restaurant and would go back to Tony's just for it!

10.description: This is the best Chinese restaurant in the area.  We ordered the tiki chicken, chow mein, and shrimp fried rice.  The chicken so tender, vegetables so crunchy, and the shrimp humongous.  The service is friendly.  The cook has been cooking Chinese food for 52 years and you can tell.  The flavors compliment each other and nothing overwhelms, just right.  Come on by and become a regular at this mom and pop institution.

11.description: I never thought of Chinese food as comfort food, but this food really hits the spot.If it weren't for yelp, I would have never discovered this place. I read about the owner, Sue, in someone else's review, so I walked in and asked the lady at the counter, "Are you Sue?" She freaked out that someone she had never seen before knew her name.I went for takeout and assistance was great, and because I wanted to make sure certain dishes for my GF were vegetarian, she even someone come out of the kitchen to ask me about food allergies (not an issue with us) and to help me make menu choices. (Please forgive me for my run-on sentence.)I was there for takeout and ordered crab Rangoon, wonton soup, vegetable fried rice, and Jumbo Shrimp Kow.Everything was outstanding,  the dumplings in the wonton soup were cooked to perfection and the jumbo Shrimp Kow was perhaps the best Chinese comfort food dish of my life.

26.description: 4 stars for food but 0 stars for environment.  This has got to be one of the least well managed restaurants in the city.  There's some kind of grease smear on the window leading to the kitchen and you have to step past a bag of salt to go through their entry.  I do in fact love their TIKI chicken dish though.  It's really no different than chicken satay but they use some kind of marinade that adds some sweetness to the chicken and it is perfectly cooked.  I will come back here on occasion but I really wouldn't recommend going out of your way to experience this place due to the strangely high Yelp reviews.

27.description: Been coming here for over 23yrs. While other places have been good, I just can't help but to compare it to Tonys. It's def comfort food. Lunch specials are awesome too. All that delicious food for $5!! It's a done deal!

0.description: Fantastic! Had the combination fried rice (Tony's Special) and two egg roles. I showed up about an hour prior to closing and they were happy to serve me take out, which I thought was incredibly considerate. The food was delicious and had tons of flavor. The portions are huge and the best part is the price! I had a large combination fried rice and two egg roles for $10, which is a steal considering it can easily make two meals. I would recommend this place to anyone interested in great Asian/Chinese food! FYI MUST BE OVER $10 to use credit.

20.description: I've been eating here for at least 8 years.  I've never been disappointed.  Beef or chicken fried rice, Mongolian beef,  sweet and sour chicken, and egg rolls have always been spot on. Newly renovated and clean. Good customer service always.

19.description: Honestly the best Chinese food in the city.  The fried rice is better than anything you'll find in chinatown, but make sure to try the mayala chow fon. Best thing I think I've ever eaten. But honestly everything taste great and the resultant looks great as well. Tonys has a super clean, and modern look which makes it comfortable to dine in.  Really really well done. I'm definitely coming back and traveling the 7 miles it takes me to get there.

2.description: When my favorite Chinese restaurant down the block (Golden Crown) mysteriously closed their doors, I thought I had enjoyed my last plate of fried rice.  I started looking for a new Chinese restaurant that could fulfill my palette,  but every place just left me with disappointment. Then one day a coworker suggested Tony's Chinese and I figured why not.  Well am I glad I did, this place is not only fancier (a great date spot btw) than Golden Crown but the food is just as great if not better.  I've tried the Tony's special spicy fried rice, spicy shrimp fried rice,   the vegetarian chop suey, the eggrolls, and the chicken kung poa. They were delicious, generous portions, and affordable. The staff, I believe are family,  have been polite and will make recommendations if you can't decide what to pick.  I can now say I have food my new favorite Chinese restaurant.

18.description: I have been coming here for years. The egg drop soup is the best! Sure it's not a fancy place to wine and dine, but if you're looking for good Chinese food, I highly recommend this place.

13.description: After our fav Chinese place in the neighborhood suddenly "closed for remodeling", we went in search of a new place. We read all the reviews for restaurants in Belmont Cragin, tried one other and after eating at Tony's, decided we didn't need to look any further.The portion sizes are huge and everything tasted fresh and delicious. We started with soup, the small was the size of a large anywhere else. Then onto the entrées, we went a little crazy and ordered egg foo yung, beef war mein, pork fried rice and egg rolls; it was enough food to feed us for 3 days.  The waitress thought we were ordering too much, but we figured the real test would be to get all of our favorites at one time.  To say we were pleasantly surprised is an understatement. I'm kicking myself thinking I've lived in the neighborhood for 35 years and never even noticed this place.Bottom line, the best Chinese food I can ever remember eating, and I can't  wait to go back and eat again.

4.description: STILL HANDS DOWN my favorite Chinese restaurant! Not only is the food so delicious but the price you pay is extremely affordable too! They also recently remodeled the place which makes it have more of a contemporary feel, overall looks very nice! If you haven't tried Tony's I HIGHLY recommend you do! Tony's is truly a hidden gem!

24.description: I come here about three times a month. I love it here.  Been carrying out since I was like 12 . I'm 24 now. Tho their price have gone up through the years I still go. The owner knows my whole family. Cousins, uncles and even my friends. Stop by its really good.

6.description: I am absolutely the pickiest person when it comes to Chinese food.  I'm always afraid the meat is not authentic, etc.  I dined at Tony's for lunch a couple of days ago.  I then dined for lunch a day after that.  My family fell in love with the Tiki Chicken and egg fried rice.  The mongolian beef was alright, but I don't like my meat textureless.  No go on the super soft beef.  Doesn't matter, I really only like shrimp anyway.  The homemade eggrolls are migthy tasty and not dry like some others.  The emperess chicken nuggets were way too big which made me question it too much so I didn't finish it.  Don't mind me, I'm just paranoid.  Anyway, I am going for lunch today and looking forward to the tiki chicken kabobs and egg fried rice.  Can't beat the price either as well as the speed.

22.description: I have been coming here for years. The egg drop soup is the best! Sure it's not a fancy place to wine and dine, but if you're looking for good Chinese food, I highly recommend this place.

15.description: Very delicious meal. We came up from the west loop to go to Lowe's and wanted to grab dinner. We found Tony's thanks to everyone else's great reviews and we were very impressed by the food and the service. I got the shrimp Koung Po and my boyfriend got this really awesome curry dish with fried flat noodles (the name escapes me right now but others have mentioned it here). With meals like this, usually some part of it is over cooked. Not this place. Every part of the meal was perfect. Every vegetable was cooked just right, even the mushrooms which always come out mushy and with shrinkage in other Chinese dishes I've tried. The dish my boyfriend had was unlike any other I've tried in a Chinese joint as well. Very flavorful and full of texture. The staff were accommodating, friendly and funny. Our waitress really seemed to care about what we thought about the food which made me feel that they take a lot of pride in the place. I will enjoy the next time I have to make the drive to Lowe's thanks to Tony.

7.description: I have two very different experiences from this place. First time I went during the weekday was a great host. Recommend good food and she spoke spanish. She made it a great experience. Oh the food was great too.I went in the weekend and got some staff that felt they really didn't want to be there. I asked a question about the difference in noodles and the hostess look at me like I was dumb. She hardly checked on us. And when I ask her for recommendation she said not sure everyone likes everything. Oh the food tasted different also. I ordered the same thing but I ordered the first time. So I guess it depends on what day you go. Good customer service goes a long way.

8.description: Love this food, it's a little difficult to find but all worth it. Great food, great service,  the same owners and staff been working since I can remember if you are new they might seem rude but that is their character. Very clean restaurant,  good temperature,  calm and great cook that also been there for as long as I can remember. All in a ll you won't be disappointed

30.description: No matter where you live in Chicago or near-west suburban Cook County, Tony's is worth seeking out.  Friends of ours took our son there for won ton soup and he begged us to take him there for his birthday dinner.  While the place is small, they were able to accommodate our party of 12.  We ate family style and the food was the best Chinese food I've ever had, but here's the best part:  our party of 12 ate and ate, and the bill was barely $100!Of course they have the standard egg rolls, won ton soup and crab rangoon (all very tasty), but don't overlook the fried chicken appetizer.  The skin is seasoned with Asian spices, is perfectly cooked and comes to the table screaming hot.I've found in Chicago that when a place looks like a dive but counts city cops among its regular diners, it's serving up some special food.  Tony's proves that point well.

3.description: My family and I love it here! It's our go to spot for Chinese. It always hard to find a good place with fresh food but this is it. We absolutely love the jumbo shrimp fried rice and Mongolian beef. Everything is always so fresh and service is fast.

14.description: My family has been coming here for over 20 years! No matter which meal we order it is always amazing! The staff is always friendly. I can't pick a favorite meal i love it all! You have to go there and try it out!

1.description: They have the best breakfast and reasonable prices the waitresses are very nice and the food is great and price is right

9.description: Steak and eggs are 5 star.......juicy steak & the eggs cooked perfectly.  I like my hash browns on the crispy side so I always ask for them well done and they are always on the spot........Impeccable service.  I only wished I lived closer then I would be there every day!!!!!!!

12.description: I was hesitant to go here because if an IHOP didnt last in that location and i felt like i would be disappointed. It was fantastic, the waitress was friendly and attentive to all our needs. The food was pretty damn good as well. Definitely would go there again. Oliver's is better thanIHOP or Denny's

21.description: I have visited this restaurant twice and I will likely return in the near future.The prices here are very affordable for diner-type food, especially compared to other diners around the city. The staff is also very friendly.We ordered the sirloin steak and eggs special and was delighted that the steak was tender, juicy, and delicious. The coffee was good too.We also ordered a veggie burger and a vegetarian skillet. The veggie burger was delicious. The vegetarian skillet was chock full of veggies, as we had anticipated, but needed a dash of salt and hot sauce to liven it up a bit.My favorite part of the whole experience? The no-frills menu. No pictures, just words and prices. For me, it's a throwback to my childhood when diner menus were only words and numbers. It almost makes me feel at home here.

16.description: Stopped in for a late breakfast (at 1pm, so quite late lol), and ordered the Denver scramble. The food was out rather quickly, it was delicious, and the service was quick and friendly. All in all a good visit, and I will certainly be returning.

17.description: Solid food, service, and prices! I have no complaints only compliments. If you are in the neighborhood you should certainly try this place out.

10.description: Great place. (Took over what used to be IHOP). The hubby and I have ordered carry out twice and I love their chocolate chip pancakes. Today, my ma and I actually dined in. NICE server. She had four other tables, but one couldn't tell. I decided to change my usual order and got the greek skillet. One star deducted, because I wish there were more feta (LOVE me some feta). Mine came with a side of toast. Their bacon deserves a paragraph of its own. It is almost like turkey bacon, but it isnt. It is made to perfection. Not greasy. Crisp. And no fat!!!! I shit you not. LOVE. My ma got the corned beef hash w scrambled eggs, hash browns and white toast. She also got coffee she was pleased with (my ma is VERY picky too, btw). She got a side of bacon as well. All of the above totaled $24 & some change! Not bad for the amount of good they give you. Will definitely be back!!!!!! Keep up the nice work Oliver's!!!

5.description: Come here pretty regularly with my family for breakfast or brunch and this place never fails, what was once a crappy IHOP it is now a great family owned place and it's delicious. I almost always order a skillet because I just love them and it's always freakin good!!  loaded with the works; bacon, sausage, ham , hash browns, cheese, green peppers and a nice fried egg on top :)... Portions are great and the service is good.  The waitress are always friendly and the place is reasonably priced, so skip out on denny's and Ihop and come here!! it's GOOOD!!!

11.description: I went here with my son just so I didn't have to travel farther to ihop. They got a new customer. It's the quality of cozy corner but way cheaper. Breakfast was awesome and tasted great I highly recommend it.

3.description: Drove by this place many times in the past but finally went there this weekend. I tried the eastern skillet and was not impressed. The hashbrown style potatoes tasted like a ton of black pepper. The scrambled egg did not look like it was very well cooked however I still ate it. The chocolate chip pancakes were the best part of the meal...Probably wont go back given there are other breakfast diners in the area that I have enjoyed much more.

0.description: This place is a converted ihop not too updated. There are 10 deep blue booths and 10 table tops.  There is not a lot of parking, which I could see as an issue on busy days.  The prices for things here are very reasonable.I cam on a Saturday at 9:45 am and it was 1/2 full.  There were 2 waitresses a couple of bus boys and the greeter/manager/owner?  The were polite and my coffee never went empty and they did a good job making sure I was taken care of.  The coffee was average. Little individual mori milk 1/2 n 1/2. I had not heard of the brand so I checked and it was a plant out of Franklin park. So kinda nice that it is locally sourced.  The sugar was in packets as was the other sweeteners, which is average, but I am personally not a fan of.  I ordered my standard breakfast biscuits and gravy with 2 eggs over easy and a side of sausage patties.  The biscuits were kinda hard and the whole order was out in less than 10 min so the biscuits were definitely pre cooked.  The gravy was very tasty.  Light in color with chunks of sausage.  The over easy eggs were also cooked to perfection.  The sausage patties were not good.  I was very pleasantly surprised when my waitress noticed that I did not really eat any of the sausage patties, she asked if they were ok.  I said I just did not care for them very much.  I am used to sausage patties being hit or miss, and while I do enjoy writing reviews of places, I tend not to make a fuss if I don't like something.  I figure that the service industry is hard enough without people making a big deal over something that they ordered which they ended up not liking.  When she dropped off my bill, she had noted that the patties were taken off.  The fact that the staff went the extra mile made this go from 3.5 to 4.5, damn yelp and their silly 5 star system.  Way to limiting.  Also note that while I do take notes while I am eating on my cell phone, I do not have the yelp app up, so it is not like they can look and see that I am writing a review.  To be hones, I think I am the only one who reads my reviews, it lets me remember the places that I liked.  Overall, I would probably order something else next time.  Maybe the pancakes, or a chicken fried steak with that gravy on it would probably be amazing.  Eggs were great, gravy was great, service was top notch.

20.description: Love this place! great food and great service.

19.description: I don't get to have a good breakfast through the week, so on the weekends, especially Sundays, I like to go out for a nice breakfast (brunch due to sleeping in, but same difference eh). Upon entering this small establishment, I was not dissatisfied. Decent space, busy on a Sunday of course, and bustling waitresses. However, the bustling about I soon found out was just multiple trips to the expo to ask the cooks where the food was, and that customers had been waiting quite a bit (22 minutes to be exact). I soon met the same fate. I started my review and was soon greeted in Spanish by the hostess which made up for it. I was seated with a nice view of grandmas and outside grandmas, so I decided yes on the coffee. Free refills too so I planned on staying a bit. The waiter was patient while I battled internally between banana pecan pancakes with a side of bacon, or banana pecan waffles with a side of bacon. I went waffles and WOW were they nothin' special. I had all the water I needed to cure a recently acquired ailment, enough coffee in me to make the newspaper back home read thoroughly, and a full belly, how can I complain? I left soon after paying and my day was off to a waffle start.

2.description: Service was slow and unattentive. Food was mediocre and very bland. This chain has really gone downhill in the last few years.

18.description: Food is okay. There was only 3 tables full and 2 waitresses on staff. The food was okay nothing special and prices were a little high for a sandwich.

13.description: I have visited this restaurant twice and I will likely return in the near future.The prices here are very affordable for diner-type food, especially compared to other diners around the city. The staff is also very friendly.We ordered the sirloin steak and eggs special and was delighted that the steak was tender, juicy, and delicious. The coffee was good too.We also ordered a veggie burger and a vegetarian skillet. The veggie burger was delicious. The vegetarian skillet was chock full of veggies, as we had anticipated, but needed a dash of salt and hot sauce to liven it up a bit.My favorite part of the whole experience? The no-frills menu. No pictures, just words and prices. For me, it's a throwback to my childhood when diner menus were only words and numbers. It almost makes me feel at home here.

4.description: It's a bit challenging to find a nice place to eat in this neighborhood, but alas, in the bitter food desert emerges Oliver's Grill.  Very solid diner food and ridiculously friendly service.  Like, over-the-top friendly.  I had a corned beef hash skillet with swiss cheese and two easy over eggs (what?! I'm still in holiday eating mode!)  It was completely delicious and the portion was enormous. It came with a side of pancakes (yes, I ate them too.....shut up!) The pancakes were exactly as decent as they needed to be. I'd give them a 2, really.  Didn't stop me from eating them though.I will definitely visit Oliver's frequently, as I'm in this neighborhood a lot.

6.description: While passing by and looking for a breakfast spot we stumbled upon this place. The service was great. Our waitress was attentive and friendly. The food would have been a four if the mushroomsmushrooms in my Vegetarian skillet were not from a can!!! I feel a bit cheated, I mean who uses canned mushrooms!!!! The inside is a bit rundown and feels as a badly painted stepsister of the IHOP that used to be.

15.description: Had a great lunch at Oliver's Grill today! Four people,  four different entrées, and four empty plates at the end of our meal. Service was great - feels and tastes like home. Definitely going back!

7.description: If you are looking for a cheap, convenient, clean, and friendly diner where the servers get to know you by name, look no further. If I could give them 3.3 stars, I would. Friendly staff and a decent selection in an area unfortunately devoid of great food. Atmosphere - it's a repurposed IHOP, with a slightly different color scheme but otherwise identical. Bit drafty if you sit by the windows.   Seriously, if it's cold, sit in the middle. It's got a parking lot, which is nice for this area. Seems like most of the people there are regulars. Restrooms are cleaner than to be expected at a diner. Service - our waitress was very friendly, totally in line with the rest of the reviews, she made some friendly banter, checked in often. (One might argue a little too often)Food - across the board, no complaints but no commendations. The Athenian omelette was good. French toast and Biscuits and gravy - meh. Not impressed at all. It was all edible, so there's that. Will I return? I won't rule it out.

8.description: Great breakfast  served  here. They offer specials as well . Owner is on duty and makes certain  customers are greeted. Service is great. Hot food and very tasty !

14.description: So glad we decided to try this place for breakfast. Delicious spinach and feta omelet. Not greasy. My love had an egg and ham breakfast with ham off the bone which was moist and tasty. The staff was quite friendly and provided excellent service. The menu had a nice variety of breakfast (my fav) and lunch items that you like to see at a diner. Reasonable prices and a tasty meal = good value. I believe Oliver's is an excellent place to have in the neighborhood.

0.description: I drive to the west side almost everyday for band rehearsals and this is my one stop joint for snacks/drinks. The Indian (I think) owners are wonderful people and they always say hi when I walk in and always offer kind service. One time the owner even came out and hugged me and another friend of mine, you don't see that probably ever anywhere else. Either way, it's wasn't weird, he was just grateful for our continued business I guess. Doesn't look so welcoming from the outside, but you know the saying...

3.description: Favorite chinese restaurant of the area. THE nicest man always answers the phone (the owner?) love their lo mein and my ma always gets their beef and broccoli or chicken and vegetables. Good portion sizes. GREAT fried chicken. I actually ordered a catering sized order of their fried chicken for our wedding shower/house warming party. People were hesitant to try fried chicken from a chinese restaurant. But once they took a bite, they loved it. Love this place.

1.description: Was certainly not disappointed! It was right before closing time and I ordered 2 orange chickens . Could have used more sauce but overall rice was good and the chicken was too! I think this will be my new go to spot! Plus the person who took my order was very nice which doesn't happen very often at Chinese restaurants! Give it a try you might just like it

2.description: This place has by far the best orange chicken i have around this area delivery is fast this will be my go to place for Chinese food wings are really good to

9.description: This is the only place me and my husband order from now. Their portions are huge and unlike other Chinese restaurants near us they give you so much meat instead of filling space with vegetables. Once when we ordered from Grubhub, grubhub screwed up and lost our order. Even though it wasn't china woks fault they personally called me the next morning and delivered us our order for free and apologized. They even remember that my husband is allergic to shrimp and called me back once after ordering to ask if I wanted a different kind of soup because the one I ordered came with shrimp. There is a Chinese restaurant

10.description: Great food, they serve ALOT of it.

4.description: Very friendly staff! Once, he even made recommendations to lower my bill and get more food at the same time. It helps that the food is always delicious too :)

6.description: LOVE THIS PLACE! They're super friendly and the food is amazingly inexpensive. The orange chicken is really good it isn't overly fried. And the rice is also extremely good & It's always freshly cooked. This is my all time favorite go to Chinese food restaurant.

11.description: I was not only highly disappointed in the food here but also got into quite a confrontation. I went with a friend and we both got chicken with rice and veggies. Her chicken was supposed to be grilled but it was such a high ratio of fat that it looked battered - if that makes any sense.When we brought this to the lady's attention she got rude and huffy. I politely but with a look of shock asked her to either remake my friend's dish or to provide something else. She flat out refused. We got into a debate as to what quality chicken is. When it got heated enough the cook had to come out  things calmed down - momentarily. The woman kept making snide comments under her breath until I told her I wasn't talking to her anymore and to shut the F@#%## up. The cook then got upset, possibly understandably, and asked what kind of chicken I'd prefer. At this point both my friend and I were so disturbed by their lack of common sense and acknowledgement that the chicken was of horrible quality that we quit the issue and left. Don't expect quality food here or quality service. SUCKS!

5.description: i love there orange chicken! the breading is so fluffy but you still get a great piece of chicken its not over sauced it has just enough to flavor. The chicken fried rice has actually CHUNKS of White chicken breast! but with that being said i wish the fried rice had a little more veggies i found one pea overall still yummy. Dont even get me started on there crab rangoon! is sooo good! huge and crunchy! to top it off super fast delivery!! i will be ordering from here again.

7.description: Amazing Sesame Chicken! And Crab Rangoon! Worth the drive from where ever you live! Great food and staff is super friendly!!!

8.description: Love their services.  Always friendly and quick. Very reasonable prices too. Highly recommend!

0.description: I am so happy this place is close to me Food is great and the service is excellent. I love their shrimp egg foo young with steamed white rice. They always deliver hot and great food!

1.description: I order coffee and instead I get dark water with cream and sugar. I have been here three times and I will never go back! Don't water down your coffee to save money. You have just lost a customer for the ridiculous business practice of making coffee like water. I'm taking my $1.97 to another DD that makes real coffee.

2.description: i can only give 3 stars overall because during the morning they are amazing but once the morning staff is gone its ghetto kids running the place i have called the manager so many times over issues i have. i literally had of them try and steal my money not kidding watch your cash here

0.description: I don't eat donuts nor do I drink coffee. BUT I feel like I need to share my secret love for their hot lemon teas or green tea. Their teas ROCK!!! Have SO much flavor and are far superior to Starbucks Tazo teas.

1.description: Ewa - I CAN'T thank you enough for the amazing flowers from the bridal bouquet, to the bridesmaids bouquets to the centerpieces.... they were beyond my expectations and just simply GORGEOUS!!!!!! I just wanted to share my experience - as it was one of the MOST amazing experiences I had throughout my wedding. Ewa went above and beyond any florist I know and I literally had no worries - she is the best of the best!!! I wanted a Hawaiian/Tropical Themed wedding... Ewa had the BEST flowers and the BEST price. I had SO many compliments on all of the flowers - I must say they were definitely done with LOVE!!! And not to mention but flown in from Hawaii :) A++++Wedding: 09/13/2014

2.description: High Style flowers did the flowers for my wedding and receiption.  The flower arrangements were amazing.  She listened to exactly what I requested.  All my guests were very impressed.  I would recommend them to anyone for any occasion.

0.description: Eva is fabulous! She has a great talent! She did the flowers for my wedding reception and they were perfect! I gave her very few instructions, and she made my dream wedding a reality. From my bouquet to the center pieces...every flower was perfect! Thank you Eva!

1.description: After my last barber set me up for failure and messed my hair hair up. I drove around for 20 minuets looking for a barber shop. I landed at fresh fades and it was what I was looking for. The staff shook my hand and welcomed me before I got in the the shop. When I walked inside I got a warm welcome from the staff and got a great haircut just the way I wanted it! Overall the staff was hilarious and very friendly. When you go which you should ask for Curly.

0.description: My barber of 15 years was unable to give me a cut, so I went to Fresh Fade and got a cut from Curly. He asked what I wanted and since I normally just sit in the chair with my barber and he knows what I want  I told Curly what I wanted and what number to use, luckily he know he stuff because what I told him to use (a 2 on top) he used a 4, and when I looked at it, it was shorter then I ever had it!!!! I was nervous. Good thing he used a 4, when it was all and done... Curly blew my expectations!!! I thought I was going to have a jacked up cut, but he made it work and hooked me up!!! True barbers can only do that. I haven't had short hair like this in over 20 years and this my friend was a GREAT CUT!!!! I left satisfied, my wife loved it, my kids couldn't stop touching my hair!  I have a new look now! Thanks Curly!!!!

12.description: Come in and see Cindy she's the best, but make sure you call ahead of time to schedule an appt she gets really busy

7.description: After a bad experience with many other spas this one is my favorite in Chicago area! They are friendly and always seem like the customer comes first. Their atmosphere is very loving!

3.description: This was my go to nail salon in the neighborhood but I'm afraid it won't be any longer. First of staff are not friendly, they seem very rushed and annoyed of whatever service you're getting done. They keep telling you about how they are late on their "appointments" do I need to make an appointment from now on or what!? Our wait time was 30 minutes which turned into 45 minutes. Total time in the salon was 1 hour and 30 minutes just for nail color change. Went in for nail color change and the person seemed disturbed by that. Not only did he rush through the process but he did a very messy job. I have bubbles on all my nails and some edges are not painted ( I could have done a better job myself at home.) Costumer service is bad and service overall is bad. If you complain about one thing, the employees argue with you. Don't think I'll be going back to Utopia for any type of service.

1.description: I went into this establishment for a no chip manicure and a pedicure. My feet literally sat in water for 30 minutes while they serviced everyone else. I never received service and they totally ignored me. I will never come back to this business again.

2.description: This was a nice place. I took my mom and my cousin here to celebrate my cousin's birthday. This place was packed, but with good reason as they do a great job. I would have given them a 5 star had they not forgotten we also wanted manicures with our pedicures. We also were there nearly 2 1/2 hrs just for our pedicures. Still they do a good job and I'll be going back and make sure they know I want both to be placed in the rotation.

9.description: I like this place because it has a private parking lot, service is usually quick but on weekends they can get backed up, the only concern I have is that some of the people who work here don't do a great job. I like to be able to walk I to a place and anyone I get do a good job which is not the case here. I had two different people, one for my pedicure and one for my manicure. When my pedicure was done I waited for 20mins for my manicure. I would only use this place as a back up.

18.description: I have gone to Utopia a few times over the last couple months. I've been happy every time and my pink & whites and pedicures look great for three weeks easy. Very nice staff, massage chairs, and reasonable prices, and they always have good tv or movies on :)

10.description: I just left the salon and felt the need to write this review. For a Saturday I know to expect it to be busy which it was, I walked and was greeted. I sat down for probably no more than 10 min- which I have no complaint on that. The only complaint I have was on the man who ended taking care of me, I came in for a no- chip manicure - he did not greet me or said anything to me.. Only to ask what color I wanted. He seemed to get pretty annoyed that the sensory from the UV light machine kept shutting off every time I moved my fingers -which only happen 3 times. He seemed to expect me to know that this machine had a sensor and I shouldn't move at all. He did raise his voice a little and told me to stop moving but when I returned the same attitude back he calmed down. He then in a more calmer tone told me it's a new uv light machine that it sensored not like the timed ones I'm use too but, that would have been nice if he would of mention in the beginning.The nails came out ok not great.  He didn't even bother to ring me up to pay sent someone else.. For a $30 dollar job, I just gave him only $3 for a tip not the usual 20% I give when I received good service.Needless to say I won't return back- there are plenty of nail salon in the area with better service just thought I would try this place .

13.description: Fantastic!! They have great service, very clean and comfortable, modern looking--most importantly, they do a great job!!!

16.description: Great place! I've been seeing them for years and I've never had a complaint.

17.description: Steven is hands down an amazing nail tech. He is always on time and can hold a conversation.  His work speaks for itself!!

15.description: Don't do it!  Don't go here!I had a horrible experience at this nail salon.  A friend of mine came here after work one day to treat ourselves to a mani/pedi.  Our pedicures were fine, nothing to write home about, but okay.  Afterwards, we went to get our nails done.  As the employees began our manicures, we were told that it would only be a little bit more expensive to get a no chip manicure.  We agreed, and they began to work on our nails.  Halfway through, they asked us for another extra fifteen dollars.  We didn't understand why we were being charged extra until they told us that  a no chip manicure was only a few dollars more expensive than a regular manicure, but we'd have to pay full price for the pedicure because  while they had a deal for a manicure/pedicure, but not a no chip manicure/pedicure.  Reluctantly, we handed over more money.  I had never had a no chip manicure before, but the experience seemed rather strange.  The nail polish went on blotchy, and the man kept adding layer after layer, and my nails were looking worse and worse.  At this point, as a result of their slowness and need to work with several people at once, we had been at the salon for well over an hour.  I had expressed the need to finish up the manicure because I needed to pick up my daughter from daycare.  They proceeded, as slowly as ever.  Finally, the man who was working on my nails began to speak in a foreign language with another employee.  He got up and walked away, and she took his place.  She begin scrubbing my nails to try to get the nail polish off.  Then, she took out one of those machines that are used to take off gel nails,and attempted to remove my nail polish with that.  It was very painful and she was taking layers off of my nails!  I continued expressing my need to leave because I had to pick up my daughter for daycare, and at this point, I had been at the salon for over two hours.  She just kept telling me, "one minute."  It was NOT one minute.  Eventually, I had no choice, but to leave.  I was absolutely livid, as they were not able to get the nail polish off of my nails (which I would later have to pay another salon to remove.)In frustration, I asked for my money back.  They would not give it to me.  I paid for a manicure, but I did not get one.  I only thing I got was destroyed nails and frustration.In a city with so many nail salons, do yourself a favor.  Skip this one.

0.description: I've been coming here since 2010; and nobody can replace David, his wife Cindy and staff! Most welcoming people! Always a great time! I've brought over a dozen people here and they fall in love with this place!

5.description: I've been coming here for a few years now and I LOVE this place. I come every 2 weeks for a No Chip Manicure and Pedicure. I've been to plenty other places for a No Chip and it never lasted a week.I only see Cindy here and she does the most amazing job. Since she's being doing my No Chip I can go 2-3 weeks and it still looks new. She also does my eyebrows, perfect every time.The salon is beautiful. They also have the largest selection of No Chip colors that I've ever seen. I always have the hardest time picking what color I want. Great service all around.

11.description: Unpleasant owners who pick and choose their customers. Not very welcoming environment. Appointments don't matter because you'll be waiting another 30-45 min anyways. No hello or Thank You, unless you find Cindy and David in a good mood. Just the honest truth.

8.description: Best nail salon EVER!! Ever since I was introduced to this place by my sister in law I have never gone to a different salon since. Everyone is extremely friendly and what I love about them best is that they take their time with every single client. I loved this place since day one, but what did it for me was the last time I went to them which was about a week ago. I was in a desperate need of getting my nails done as well as my toes. My best friend Monika and I went to the salon at 7:30 when they close at 8. I did not notice that they close so early until I came up to the door. They only had one client they were working on.  Monika and I asked whether it was too late and they said "no" and welcomed us in with open arms. We both got our acrylic nails and toes done and they took their sweet time taking care of us. I felt horrible the whole time because they didn't close until 9 because of us. We kept apologizing and they wouldn't haven't because David (I'm guess he's the owner) said that they do it all the time and have no problem with it. They were so sweet and friendly and you literally feel like you are just hanging out with your friends while in there. The laughs never stop! lol LOVE THEM!!! I recommend them to EVERYONE! They take their time and are friendly. You can tell they care about their customers being happy with their work.

4.description: Went in for a full set with no chip polish. Very clean nice shop using quality products OPI etc...very happy with my new set my tech paid good attention to detail. Prices are fair as well. Will be my go to nail salon when I'm in this area.

14.description: Service awesome! Facility clean, comfyPrice is fantastic! Parking no fuss, theres a parking lotall that is missing is a coffee chain next to it & I'll be in heaven!2015 horrible! What has happened to this once fantastic spot?! No chip CHIPPED with in 2 days, they fixed then the second day after same nail chipped! They said I was doing something, I WAS ON VACATION so no I wasn't even washing dishes! They didn't even bother to redo the nail,

6.description: They are very expensive nice job but. You have to ask what the prices are no flyers or anything. Smh

29.description: One Word to describe the food here: DISGUSTING. Everything was either deep fried to a crispy greasy mess, or undercooked to a soggy mess. Nothing tasted the way it should or had the ingredients that they described on the menu. AND, the best part is I found a hair in my food. It was a very short black hair and they actually told me it could be mine. I have long auburn hair, there is no way it was mine. Never again. I am giving one star only because I have to and because I am thrilled I didn't get food poisoning

42.description: Ordered delivery, the food arrived hot, the order was correct, and the delivery fellow was polite and had change.  I ordered the Lad Nar and it was very good.  I am not a huge fan of thai, so it is hard for me to judge, but I enjoyed this dish more than I have at other places.  The price was right and the portion was large.  The fried tofu was as good as I have had anywhere.  The sticky rice in banana leaves was AWESOME.  Two were more than enough for three of us.  They are big and extremely satisfying (Whoa, that sounds dirty), and have a great coconutty, bananay, vanillay taste.  The meal was enjoyable and me and both my dining partners enjoyed our food.  Total bill was under $30 including 3 entrees, an appetizer (Which was huge) and dessert.

23.description: I've been going to Jasmine Rice for about 3-4 years now. I know they changed owners around 2 years ago, but I didn't see a decline in their delicious food or service. The lunch special is great. You get an entree (I usually get pad thai w/ chicken), a soup, and 2 crab rangoons. The people who work here are really sweet, and although sometimes they are difficult to understand, they always bring great food. The food always comes quickly, warm and it's delicious! The portions are on the bigger side, but it's always nice to have something to take home. The place itself isn't too big, but it's never uncomfortably full or anything like that. There is street parking in front and I believe there's two side streets incredibly close by that you can also park on. I've brought a couple of friends here, and they've all loved it.

8.description: I would highly recommend this place. I ordered the Spicy Basil, which is as the title states, spicy. The waitress gave me an option of 1 through 10 on how spicy I wanted my meal. I said a 6, and it was a very good spice. I also ordered the Thai Ice Tea. The plate size is reasonable for the price. A meal for two will run around 20-40 dollars. However, if that's too high or you just don't feel like spending too much, then consider showing up between 11am and 3pm for the lunch specials. I have not tried any of the lunch specials but other reviewers thought it was worth mentioning. Overall, your looking at a reasonable price establishment, a calm environment, and a satisfied stomach. I highly recommend the Spicy Basil with chicken.

31.description: This place is on my way home from work...so is a convenient place to stop in for some carry out.I'm not sure where the issues with the place being clean come from.  Sure...it hasn't been redecorated in the last decade...and it's more "neighborhood place" than date night...but it's not smelly.  I've never seen any little brown buddies either.  I've also never had a problem with the speed of the service.  It's made to order...so no...it's not as fast as going to Panda Express...but I think my longest wait has been 15 minutes...and that was a pretty complicated order.It only gets four stars because it's GOOD Thai food...but nothing out of the ordinary.  Personally...I'm not a fan of maki rolls with my Thai food...so the fact they serve some sushi is just a testament to the fact the neighborhood doesn't have a sushi place.Anyway...go for casual Thai when you're craving Red Curry...and you're passing by.  Don't go out of your way for it...your neighborhood Thai place is probably exactly the same.

34.description: Order delivery from Jasmine Rice last night in spite of the horrid reviews regarding the cleanliness of the place.  Figured I could pretend I had never read them if I was eating the stuff in my own house.I ordered my food from their website and in spite of the order receipt stating that it would arrive in 30-60 minutes, it arrived in about 25 minutes.  Nice.The food was great.  It tasted freshly cooked, not like something that had been stewing for hours.  I ordered my Pad Thai Medium-Hot and I think I"ll be ordering it Hot next time as it didn't have nearly the kick as most places give with this request.My wife liked her Red Curry dish but commented that the Curry sauce, while more runny than usual, was still pretty good.We did not receive chopsticks and were told by the driver that we need to request them next time.  Not a big deal.While I wasn't overwhelmed by the place, I'll certainly order again and look forward to eating my leftovers!FYI...you have to order a minimum of $23 in food for delivery and they charge $3 for delivery.

16.description: Being in Thailand before, finding good Thai food was hard to find; luckily there's Jasmine Rice. I love this place, it looks a little questionable from the outside specially because of where it's located but its nice and clean from the inside and they have a lot of traditional thai decorations. The food is awesome and prices are fair. Since I've found out about this place I've been eating here weekly and never had a problem. The staff is very friendly too.

13.description: One of my favorite Thai Restaurants!! The food is very good and the place is cozy, it may be small but worth every penny.  I recommend to dine in its much better.  Beef Pad Thai is great I always order it.

11.description: Great Thai food, the veggie egg rolls are divine, the only thing about the place is that its just a little bit on the pricy side

39.description: I woke up late this fine Sunday afternoon and when my husband and our friend in the next room were deliberating over what to do I jumped at the opportunity to suggest FOOD. We typically head over to Jess Cafe when it comes to Thai food but we thought we'd do something different today.Let me tell you, it was a waste of time. We were very hungry and wound up waiting something like 50 minutes for our three meals to come. I'm glad we'd ordered an appetizer--the spring rolls. They were lackluster but helped us not eat the tablecloth while we waited. And waited. And waited.I've never had more bad things to say about a restaurant. Even the water tasted funny and was disgustingly unrefreshing. While waiting we were tortured by the worst music. At first it was funny to joke that our friend was being culturally insensitive because didn't he know everyone listens to second rate boy bands in Thailand? But when the rest of the country ballads and smooth jazz managed to give us all ticks, we'd had enough.When our food came--I had the Pad Kei Mao with vegetables, my husband had the Noodle Supreme with vegetables and our friend had the Bangkok chicken. Our friend was just glad to have some food in front of him finally, but my husband and I were equally unimpressed by our food. Too salty, not spicy, and too small of portions.If you're in the neighborhood, head over to Jess Cafe--they have much of the same on the menu (if not more), plus way faster service, huge portions, and the service is typically fantastic. Way more Bangkok for your buck.

37.description: I have eaten at this place numerous times, I love this place. The chicken panang is fucking amazing. The crab rangoon is fucking amazing.
