I love sitting down at this place and drinking 6 tall boys of PBR and talking to the crazy old man that says panang should be made with weed. I agree with him wholeheartedly. But today was a different day. I was eating and I noticed a cockroach was crawling his happy ass all over the walls and what not. I was kind of high from smoking a bowl earlier but I was certainly not imagining this. This place is fucking filthy and I will never recommend it to anyone, ever. I used to bring all my friends here to show them how good the food was, what a fucking idiot I was. I wish I could rate it zero stars but I guess everyone deserves just a little bit. Fuck 'em. Avoid this place like the plague. I will be.

0.description: I'm glad I came across this gem. My friend and I were looking for a quick and decent thai place and to our surprise, we ended up here ans loved it! The food is authentic, fresh, and delicious. The service was excellent and also very clean.

38.description: I've been a few times - once I walked in to order take-out, it took them a LONG time to get my order together even though the restaurant was almost completely empty, and like the other reviewers have said, they play loud music, lots of 'boy band' type stuff. The sign advertizing they have sushi is what initially drew me in-- I tried the sushi, and yes, they don't serve raw fish, only vegetables and cooked meats. The sushi was mediocre for the price in my opinion.The second time I ate in. The service was a little faster, and I felt my portion was large enough. Both times though the person behind the counter was yelling to the person in the kitchen sporadically throughout the meal.When it all boils down, the place is within walking distance from my house, and the food isn't too terrible, so it has that going for it, but don't go there looking for a fabulous Thai experience. Also, it is a BYOB restaurant.

27.description: Surprised to read some of the negativity on here. Doesn't seem like you can take Kevin G's ridiculous review esp. when he's talking about smoking bowls and seeing cockroaches.Jasmine Rice is a good local thai place. Nothing fancy but the food is pretty good esp. compared to other Thai places I've been to in the city. I've never had a problem with service hte few times I've been there. So it doesn't look fancy like some people have stated but its more of a local place and its not like every Thai place looks fancy....i've seen worse.

32.description: I love this little Thai place! It's quiet so when I go for lunch with a friend we have the place to ourselves. Their lunch specials include a cup of yummy soup and two crab rangoons, for $6.25! Their food is fresh and cooked to order. I can hear them cooking it after I place my order. Try the coconut bubble tea!  I don't know why there are so many negative reviews on here. I will come back here all the time and always bring a friend to try it with me!

44.description: I've only been here for lunch.They have a fantastic lunch special for $6.25!!It includes:a cup of tasty Thai chicken-noodle soup, a choice of an eggroll or spring-roll appetizer,a little cucumber salad,and your choice of about twenty entrees.Very yummy Ginger Chicken, Garlic Chicken,and extremely yummy Curries.It's located in a residential strip of the street, you could miss it if you weren't looking for it.Excellent service.One of my favorite "work" lunch spots.

24.description: My boyfriend and I have never eaten in the actual restaurant, but we order delivery from here once or twice a week, literally. Their food is just delicious, there are no two ways around it. Their curry is the absolute best -- we have tried every kind and each one is as good as the last. My favorite is yellow, my boyfriend's favorite is mussaman.   The pad se-ewe is also really good, very traditional and tasty.Their one delivery driver is a really nice guy, and we always try to tip him well.I'd rate this place 5 stars, except that I think the prices are a LITTLE high, and the portions are a bit small. If they re-worked their prices a bit, I think this place would be perfect as far as Thai delivery.

7.description: Went here for a quick dinner with a friend and it was very peaceful and adorable.The food was very tasty (crab rangoon), and one dish filled my stomach. Though the service is not on fleek.

40.description: Smells like an old wet rag in this place. Crappy service. No deal!

30.description: Come on people! I was on a hunt for some asian type of food and refused to go to three other places on the way home from a sad event. My son loves Thai food. I found this place on my smartphone search.  The place was friendly welcoming. There was NO smell. They were playing some very soothing Japanese type music. We stopped here at about 8:30 p.m. on a Tuesday. The waitress immediately took our order and brought out our food so timely. The place is small but with enough tables. It is not decorated the most modern but very nice and clean. Funny that one thing that I noticed was that it was NOT smelly of that fried sort of oily smell that other places have. My son wasn't feeling too well (moodwise) , so the lady immediately packed our food very nicely and even offered to put his Thai iced coffee in a 'go' cup.I will definitely be back. The food was excellent. The noodle soup, curry beef fried rice and California rolls were perfect.  Fair is fair!

46.description: we like this place, small - very clean and cozy, you forget you're on a busy street. food is great, love the fried rice, pad thai and assorted veggie dish. very good soups. simple, fresh, healthy food.   delivery is quick, quicker than if you eat there (less the point).  usually one little woman catering to all tables, and take out desk.  good on an off night if you have time.  BYOB.

1.description: Terrible! Bad! Bad! Bad!!!Beef cooked in oyster sauce?Pad Thai with no flavor and orange liquid?Owner refused to compensate for the bad food and said "we use 13 year old noodles."

9.description: It was ok. I judge a Thai place by the Pad Thai and it was terrible. Curry rice was ok but definitely too pricy for the low quality that it is.

26.description: Being from out of town we decided to try a different Thai restaurant this time around. We usually go to Yum Thai in Forest Park. Its good solid Thai food, but recently the service has gone downhill.   It's not often that there is free parking in front of a restaurant in Chicago, so I started off with a smile before we even walked in.  The restaurant is small,and quaint. However, two things I noticed immediately upon arrival:   The big screen TV in the front of the restaurant tuned to Nickelodeon....(BIG TURNOFF), and secondly,  the small size of the tables. HmmmThe staff was very friendly (2 points!) and the prices seemed reasonable and in line with other Thai restaurants of equal size. I am perplexed with the need to include Japanese fare on the back side of the menu.     The Tom Yum Soup was not that good....overpoweringly sweet in taste, it lacked the spiciness that I am accustomed to....I'm getting worried that this might be a disaster..but, when my Noodles Supreme #D6 was brought to the table, what it lacked in presentation ,lots of noodles..some beef and a scant few veggies, it made up for in taste. I ordered it 7 out of 10 in "hotness", and it was spot on.     My family ordered the green curry....which they said was good, but nothing special. My daughter ordered Pad Thai. She always orders Pad Thai and never seems to complain (nor rave) about it at any of the many Thai restaurants we've taken her to.     BYOB is a huge reason we come to places like this, and with no insane corkage fee, this place automatically gets another 2 points.The portions did not seem to be what I would expect at a typical Thai restaurant...that is, both my daughter and I finished our meals with no leftovers...I wont hold it against them, maybe we were extra hungry. All in all its a good restaurant, not a great restaurant hence the 3 star rating.

25.description: Been here a couple of times, Its a decent thai place, and its ALWAYS clean. They are also very friendly, i remember the second time I went there with my friends, we got there around 20 minutes after the stop serving lunch specials, but the owner (i think he's the owner) still let us order from that menu, and everything was tasty.

12.description: This used to be my favorite Thai Restaurant, have ordered from this place for years. The food was always great & fresh whether I ate there or had it delivered.Sadly, recent experiences have been so poor that I will no longer  waste or money or time with this restaurant. Bland, seasoned incorrectly, cooked badly (burnt/pan scrapings etc) sparse ingredients, heavy on the onions and little of anything else. Portion sizes are now tiny & no rice provided. Prices are higher & delivery was ridiculous - over an hour & we are only 2 blocks away! Specific items that we have ordered over the years that now are ABYSMAL : Panang curry: sauce was tasty, but portion size was miniscule, you had to seriously search to find the few tiny bits of alleged "chicken" in it  & a few peas & a whole lot of poorly cooked onions. Beef salad: TINY portion (and I mean even tinier than it ever was in the past - ridiculous for the price), very little meat, dressing was straight sugar - and what meat there was appeared to be leftover hamburger -- the lettuce was disgusting, wilted, soggy & old tasting. Tom Ka: broth too sweet - overloaded with SUGAR (again?) , very little chicken or veg in it, again a crapload of poorly cooked onions and no rice provided with it. We also foolishly tried Maki - awful, rice was warm, mushy and unpleasant. Just gross - and expensive, to boot.Very sad to have to give this place a poor rating, after enjoying it in the past, but can no longer recommend it :(

21.description: I have been going to Jasmine Rice for about 3 years now (the new/current owners were already there when I started going). Amazing, friendly service as soon as I walked in. They smiled and asked if I was dining in, and asked to pick any table (sweet!). It's a small, family oriented restaurant. I dine in with my family and I have small children. The owner's daughter is nice enough to bring paper and crayons to another table and invite my daughters over so they can draw and color. My husband and I were able to eat in peace. The food is amazing! Thai food is my favorite type of food outside of my own :-)  I have eaten at many other "Thai" restaurants, and none of them compare to Jasmine Rice. The only Thai restaurant I can say compares or probably a little better, is in a far suburb about 45 minutes away. Jasmine Rice is the best Thai food in this area. We always get the Chicken Basil Fried Rice. The amount is just perfect to fill you up. If you're a small eater, then you might have leftovers. If you're really hungry, I recommend you order an appetizer...my favorite Pot Stickers.  After my meal, I take a Thai Iced Coffee to go...DELICIOUS!!! Oh, I almost forgot! They also give you those delicious guava flavored candies with your check. I'm quite surprised of the negative ratings on here. When we returned for our second time (couple of months later) they remembered us from before! We have been extremely happy with this place, and have recommended it to many of our friends. They went...they loved it! They keep going and now their recommending their friends.I really think you should try it for yourself.

17.description: My favorite place for pad thai chicken and fried rice pineapple

10.description: I do not recommend eating at this restaurant. I ordered a few dishes and everything was so bland and not fresh. It started with the delivery man where he was arguing and cursing at the neighbors because they wanted him to move his vehicle to the side so they could get through. I ordered the crab rangoon, chicken satay, egg rolls, pad thai chicken, thai fried shrimp, chicken teriyaki, and mixed vegetable shrimp. I was not able to taste the difference between any of them other than the teriyaki sauce. It looked as if they scrapped the rice from the bottom of the pot and put it into containers for me. The crab rangoon and egg rolls were old. They were hard, with no taste. I love thai food, but this place is a joke. Sorry Jasmine Rice..

5.description: 3.5 stars: Our go-to neighborhood thai place. The food has been good here but recently they've been skimming on the portions and meats inside the curries. I've eaten here but mostly have called for delivery. There aren't any Thai choices in the area so when we are craving it and can't go far this is where we order. 4-star tasty food but has been declining to 3.5/3 status. To the owners: please try harder with the authenticity of the food. We want to love you and give you 5-stars but you've gotta step up the game! Take sushi off your list and go all out perfecting Thai food in this area!!! I need you to stay around! Best choices: green curry, masaman curry, thai basil fried rice, pad see ewe.

3.description: ordered just their Soups and they were very, very tasty! Not a big fan of the crab rangoons, but they were ok. Delivery was right on time and the price is very good. Will order again.

35.description: The delivery was fast and the driver very polite, but the sauce for the Pad Se-Ewe was bitter not sweet and the chicken was very dry. One star for fast delivery and one star for the Shrimp Rolls which were tasty, but nothing special.

19.description: I've been going to Jasmine Rice for about 3-4 years now. I know they changed owners around 2 years ago, but I didn't see a decline in their delicious food or service. The lunch special is great. You get an entree (I usually get pad thai w/ chicken), a soup, and 2 crab rangoons. The people who work here are really sweet, and although sometimes they are difficult to understand, they always bring great food. The food always comes quickly, warm and it's delicious! The portions are on the bigger side, but it's always nice to have something to take home. The place itself isn't too big, but it's never uncomfortably full or anything like that. There is street parking in front and I believe there's two side streets incredibly close by that you can also park on. I've brought a couple of friends here, and they've all loved it.

28.description: I've ordered so many times here now that I have learned what is best for me to avoid & which dishes to stick with. Also, I pick up my food now, rather than getting it delivered. Nick, the owner, is very friendly & always remembers me when I call in. Never eaten in, but the restaurant is cute, cozy, & looks clean.

45.description: Very good Thai food. I love the different duck options. Shrimp rolls are great. You need to ask for the hot red chili sauce. Delivery is usually prompt.

33.description: I met some friends for dinner there on a Saturday & was a little worried over what to find because of the negative reviews. All I can say is Kevin G. must have been stoned out of his mind. The place was way cleaner than most of the Thai places I've been to in this city. The owners must have finally heard enough people asking for the music to be turned down, because there was some kind of Thai-pop in the background, but it wasn't at all loud.So, what about the food? It was good. I'm not going to rave about it, but I was happy. I had the Mussaman Curry Beef, which was nicely spiced & had good quality, fresh ingredients. The spring rolls were better than average as well. The Thai Iced Coffee was ok. A little weak for my taste, but I'm a hopeless caffeine junky, so your mileage may vary. The portions were generous, but not huge. I was famished & still had a little bit left over.So, is it worth trucking out to Belmont & Narragansett if you live in Rogers Park? Heck no! There are lots of amazing, inexpensive Thai places in town. Opart Thai & Arroy Thai in the Lincoln Square/Ravenswood neighborhood are two of my faves, but if you live on the Northwest side don't let the stoners & posters from  the competition stop you from ordering from Jasmine Rice or dropping in for a good meal.

43.description: Great Food.  I have tried various Thai restaurants and by far this is the best restaurant.  Price is reasonable, food quantity is just perfect.  I recommend you try this restaurant.Thanks,EG

2.description: Ordered the seafood and tofu pad thai, & my boyfriend had the tofu fried rice. A bit pricey, but the food was good nonetheless.

18.description: My first experience was just okay I ordered the Udon  soup w/beef and I thought that it was very plain tasting, a little bland but still good.

41.description: Ok,Weird review. Weird because I haven't eaten here.I wanted to.I mean, i planned to when I drove over there.jasmine rice is a little place on narraganset just south of belmont.It was a good day that day.the sun was out, traffic was light and as luck would have it, i found a parking space right in front of the restaurant.I hopped out of my car, and walked in.with a simple twist of the knob i push the door open.suddenly and without warning im slapped across the face with the smell of old wet dirty rags.the place smells horribly bad.I dismiss it, and wait to be seated.the waitress walks up and asks if im dining in.i say yes and she points to a table and says, 'have a seat"i pull out the rickety old seat and sit down.i have no idea what held that chair together.i can't help but notice that the decor is pretty lackluster and they're blasting country music.  the whole time the waitress is walking around the restaurant yelling over the music keeping a  conversation with someone sitting on the other side of the joint.The stink is getting to me, but i held firm.I figured id try the sushi.I ask what their california roll was and she said it was avacado and cucumber. but that its cooked.huh? i thought."avacado and cucumber?" i asked. "yes" she replied."cooked?" i said with a bewildered tone."yes" she said. "all our sushi is cooked. nothing raw".I said, "oh ok"at that point, the smell, the yelling, the country music, and now the cooked sushi was just too much.I politely gave back the menu and said "well, thanks anyway"and walked out.I've seen some good reviews for jasmine rice online and i remember eating at this place about 10 yrs ago when it was in another location.Don't remember the food though so I can't imagine it was too great but you never know. I mean c'mon Papa johns is flourishing so someone somewhere likes it.as for me, i'll just go somewhere else.

4.description: 1 star because the driver was personable and the food was hot.  Overall the udon noodle soup and crab rangoon were both suspiciously sweet.  Could only stomach a couple of the rangoons and a bite of the soup.  Even the udon noodles were bad.  Soggy outside and rubbery inside with a hint of dish soap.

6.description: This place is very under rated. Very good food and service. It's a hidden gem in the west side of Chicago

22.description: I would highly recommend this place. I ordered the Spicy Basil, which is as the title states, spicy. The waitress gave me an option of 1 through 10 on how spicy I wanted my meal. I said a 6, and it was a very good spice. I also ordered the Thai Ice Tea. The plate size is reasonable for the price. A meal for two will run around 20-40 dollars. However, if that's too high or you just don't feel like spending too much, then consider showing up between 11am and 3pm for the lunch specials. I have not tried any of the lunch specials but other reviewers thought it was worth mentioning. Overall, your looking at a reasonable price establishment, a calm environment, and a satisfied stomach. I highly recommend the Spicy Basil with chicken.

15.description: We have been going here for a long time! We love it! There is better but they are consistent.  Always can get a table, my 8 yr.loves it, everyone it friendly and great thai food!

20.description: My favorite Thai restaurant hands down. Best most authentic Thai food. But since its the real deal, it's not really adapted to American palates as well as other places. I like that type of thing, I tend to eat very spicy and I like strong flavors. Nam sod n pad thai spicy number 8, if you can handle it

36.description: Had I not seen Kevin G's review about cockroaches crawling around in broad daylight, I would've been a weekly regular here to this day. I did, in fact, used to eat here or get take out very frequently when it first opened. Everything I tried was pretty damn good, especially given the fact that it's a random Thai place in the middle of nowhere (as far as dining goes). I was SO thrilled to have good Thai food a few blocks away from me, it seemed like a fuckin' luxury. Great appetizers, spicy noodles, Pad Thai, curries... Just everything, seriously. However, I do have to admit that I stopped coming here ever since I saw that review a few months ago. :( While I feel that tons of restaurants probably have some kind of covert critter/sanitation issue that patrons aren't aware of, I just can't stomach eating somewhere where this issue has surfaced. There's been times I've considered it, but just couldn't bring myself to do it. Rats, sure; cockroaches, ughhh... *suppresses shudder* So, I'm very skeptical now, and its remote location further leads me to question the freshness of the food/cleanliness of the establishment. Which is a shame, since I really did love the shit out of this place.However, if you're more forgiving than I am, I do have to say that they have some really, really great food and I almost wish I never found out what I did, goddamn it. It's the only place you can get your Thai fix for miles around!

14.description: This place is disgusting. I am not a picky eater at all, but my food was inedible. I ordered the Pad Woon Sen (my favorite Thai dish) and it was a pool of oil with a few noodles and some slimy chicken. I took one bite and that was it. It tasted like it was cooked in burnt or dirty oil. The Crab Rangoon was not good either and it came with a chunky sauce. The only part of our order that was actually good was the chicken rice soup. I called to ask for a refund for just the bowl of oil they call pad woon sen. They told me "no, that is the way we cook our food."

3.description: Right by my house.It was about time. The old Vincent's Pizza and Nails place weren't getting much business anyways.. The Rewards card is pointless, spent over 500$.  But I never got the rewards? I think the rewards are coupons at the end of your receipt. Honestly, save your money and go to Walgreens.

1.description: I am waiting at the pharmacy pickup window going on my 15th minute. I had to ring the bell twice just to get them to acknowledge I was here. 10 minutes ago she said she be right with me and I'm still waiting. It's hard to pick up a prescription at lunch when they don't even answer the window. This kind of service NEVER happens at Walgreen's. Why is CVS  so awful? If I didn't have to use them for my insurance I'd leave. Just answered the window at minute  16.

2.description: I go there almost every day and they have lots of things and restock every week to two weeks

5.description: They have everything!! good variety.

6.description: This store is so nice and such a great addition to the neigborhood. I cannot believe the before and after of this property. I would like to personally thank the developers for this transformation...the neighborhood looks better because of the store...now could they do something about the property across the street? Maybe the developers who developed this property can buy the property on the SE corner and do something similar transformation wise.

0.description: The staff is always friendly here when filling prescriptions.  Shout out to Maggie for having the sense to look for a substitute prescription that is covered under my insurance.  She called my doctor and had it switched out for me.  Thanks for going above and beyond.

4.description: Two stars only because it's walking distance from my house.They charge so much more at regular price than Jewel, Walgreens, etc. Hardly any business, ever.

3.description: awesome zapiekanka...the best!

1.description: My Husband is from Poland. He has been telling me about this place for 2 years before we actually went.  Absolutely love coming here. It reminds me so much of the one shop in his town that serves zapiekanka. He gets the vegetarian zapiekanka and I get the chicken knysza. It's a crusty delicious round bread filled with fresh chopped veggies, chicken and a wonderful garlic dressing. Its a hole in the wall restaurant located in busy strip mall with maybe 12 menu items. The clientele is mostly Polish laborers. Must try.

2.description: Holy zapiekanki! This small Polish sandwich shop is as European as it gets! I've had veggie zapiekanki twice and I absolutely love them! It's a pretty busy business strip so expect to not find parking. ***cash only***

5.description: I have been here once and it was okay.It almost reminds me of a local HOT DOG JOINT but instead it is a Polish Restaurant. This is also one of those hole in the wall type of restaurant.Behind the counter one will find two very hard working ladies with little patience. It helps if you know what you want before stepping onto the order window. Trust.There were nice enough.The food was okay but it could be due to my lack of "knowledge" of Polish food. The only things I know about Polish foods are Stuffed Cabbage and Polish Sausage. :-))Need to find more Polish friends. :-))I would have no problem stopping by this restaurant but I do not think I will go out of my way.Happy Eating ...:-))

6.description: This is the ultimate authentic place for Polish street food in Illinois, or even in the whole U.S. It reminds me of a similar eatery in my hometown in Poland. I have tried every single item on the menu and everything was made to perfection. My favorite thing to order from here is the vegetable zapiekanka.   This place just screams home to me! :)

7.description: Knysze are yummy! Zapiekanka very tasty too. I've been going here for over 5 years. The name is odd and hard to find on Yelp. Highly recommended for polish street food on the northwest side of the city.

0.description: Rosa J. has been curious about this place. Unfortunately, the current Yelp page and reviews didn't really help her understand what kind of place this is.  I didn't see "Tasty" on the sign, but this modifier is absolutely accurate to describe the food hubby and I had this evening.  By the way, the prices are quite reasonable: $14 and some change for two (2) orders of cheese/mushroom zapiekanki and one (1) bowl of zurek (soup).  Please have green bills ready because your plastics won't grant any access to the fast, delicious, and economical Polish food here.  What's a "zapiekanka?"  Baguette is the bread as the base.  Depending on what ingredients you want on top, it can be loaded with veggies, mushroom, and cheese.  It's finished off with sprinkles of green onion and drizzle of ketchup-like" sauce.  I LOVED the soup.  The main components were leeks, boiled eggs, and sausages.  It's heartier than the cure-all chicken noodle soup.  I saw the photo of zurek on Yelp and wanted to try it.  Well, great move, Ms. Rosa J.!  The studious Rosa jotted down the other two (2) menu items to try in the future: knysza (pocket bread) and gofry z owocami (waffle with fruit).  There were a few patrons having the waffle topped with fruit.  It appeared appetizing, so I will keep that in mind.  Where's it located?  It's within the commercial plaza south of the Belmont Central free public parking lot.  Their business hours are Mondays to Saturdays, 10am to 9pm (closed on Sundays).  I know I've written longer reviews than this one, yet my i-pad mini has a strong resistance to the Polish language and kept on auto-correcting the technical terms.  I've got to go now to end this struggle!

4.description: I was in the neighborhood and had a taste for some Polish food. Thank goodness the menu was in English but had a small selection. They literally only had like 6-8 items they serve, which is fine with me as it probably would have overwhelmed me. The entrees were all under $10 each. I opted for the order of 6 pierogi's. They had 3 different options, I went with the meat. They smelled wonderful but were really small and were fried . My friend and I split the order, he absolutely loved them as where I thought they were just ok. I might return to try something else, but only if in the area

0.description: Finally a place I can get a nice fade and good shave, The barbers are very nice and funny as hell. The owner is cool. I live in the burbs and it takes me 45 mins to get here.

3.description: Terrible service! I don't understand why people praise mimi so dam much! She messed up my real nails! They had to cut them off... I am beyond upset with the service!   When you ask for a soak off that means soak off!  Mimi said no that the soak dries your skin...I've never had a problem before!  She refused because it took too long and guaranteed that the way she was doing it was best! Chipping away at the gel using nail cutter was not indeed the best way! It was painful!!! I had to walk out! Worst experience ever and very disrespectful to speak another language so that I couldn't understand what she said.  I do not recommend this place whatsoever!

1.description: Really bad experience. Not disinfected and rude. I came in for a pedicure at around 1pm so the salon was not busy at all and I sat waiting to get started for about 15 minutes while the employee just walked around eating. The pedicure tubs were not disinfected properly, after I was done the lady just spritzed with lysol once, definitely not covering the tub entirely, about 1/4 of the tub actually received the lysol. Lastly, the ladies were soooo rude. I gently asked if she could trim a bit shorter and she rudely asked "why, are they not square enough already?!" Horrible place don't waste your time or risk your health.

2.description: I go there all the time. The price is very good, cheapest no chip mani and pedicure I have found! You do have to know which manicurist to use. Some are good at no chip manis, while others are good at full set nails, etc... I go to one lady ( sorry can't remember her name) for my no chip mani and pedi and Mimi for my eyebrows. FYI, they charge $1.00 if you use a credit card- ridiculous...take cash!

5.description: First time here. The place is your typical nail salon; clean and somewhat friendly.What I got: Mani and Pedi ($30)The pedicure was a 9 out of 9. It was relaxing and felt great. She really took her time. My only issue was when she stopped everything she was doing in order to tell a story to her co-worker. Even still, my feet look and feel amazing and I'll definitely be returning for this service.The Mani, however, was disappointing to say the least. She started filing away before I even explained what I wanted. After that, things were going okay until her phone rang. She answered while doing my nails, which is annoying. After the call, she began rushing and the end result was sloppy.  She managed to tame my outrageous cuticles very well and I didn't bleed. My nails were not shaped correctly- instead of the nail hugging the finger, mine tend to grow straight out and slightly upwards. I have gotten my nails "rounded down" in previous manicures without having to specifically ask for it- just not here. Once the manicure was over and my nails were drying, I immediately saw bubbles and one of my nails ended up with a speck of glitter (my color was basic red). My manicurist also immediately went to the back room to continue her phone call. They started chipping the next day.To sum it up:Nice, clean placeSomewhat friendly; not chatty with customers but chatty with each otherDecent pricePedicures are amazingManicures: don't bother!PS- no separate rooms for waxing

6.description: Only get my nails done by Mimi. She's bomb. She always does my nails fast and very nicely!

7.description: ATTITUDE, ATTITUDE, ATTITUDE, ATTITUDE!  I can't stress this enough loves.  It means everything.  And that is the reason I am giving this place 4 stars instead of 5. Now this place is definitely one of my favorite nail places.  And back in the day when they had their older staff around this would had been a 10 star review hands down(pardun the pun).   I saw a few of them there today but unfortunately they were all booked.  I wonder why???!!!  So I got a nail person who did a good pedicure, an average manicure but a very below average personality.  She asked me if I wanted to get my eye brows waxed and I declined solely based on her funky tude.  If it wasn't for the older staff here and the respect I have for them I would had given this place less stars, but why should they suffer because of my encounter with one misguided individual who doesn't understand the importance of customer service.   I will go here again, but I will make sure I specify the person I want, even if I have to wait to get them.  Business people,  wake up!!  The customer service and the attitude of your workers can go a long way in keeping your customers.  And if you are not interested in keeping customers then why are you in business?

8.description: first time here - very nice staff - excellent prices

0.description: first time there on saturday around 2pm figured it was closer to home anddidnt have to pay for parking! i called earlier in advance to know how much they charge forgel fill ins the lady was very nice and sweet.went in and they were a lil busy but got helped asap.the guy that did my nails was very nice and did them super fast!i was surprised because were i used to go the girl would take longeeeeeeeeeeeer.He was very nice did them quick and went and dried them at the little drier stand,i wouldve given it 5 stars but i dont know if it was the top coat or the fan but my nailstook for ever to dry! they were polished wit OPI but still took a while.aside from that im definitely going back!walking distance clean friendly and free parking! :)

4.description: I love this nail salon!! They do a fantastic job with pedicures. My feet are always super smooth. Gets pretty busy on weekends but with such good service its to be expected. Only complaint, I wish they had better nail polish choices. Not feeling their current brands. Essie and more OPI choices would be nice.

12.description: I am from Chicago, and this is the only Pawn shop I go to!!! My wife loves her diamond rolex!!! Better prices than downtown! I sold my iphone for a good price too!!! They are always willing to work on the price.

3.description: I love coming here for my pawn loans and electronic purchases!  Everyone is very nice here and always give you a deal!  Wouldn't dream of going anywhere else!

1.description: I sold my diamond ring after shopping around chicago including a couple places in Jewelers row the guys at Fullerton Pawners paid me the most and were the friendliest.If you want to sell anything check these guys out.

2.description: This place is a complete joke and rip off. Came in to sell a Dewalt machine, and a few other working power tools that were all worth around $600. Was offered a $100, with a snobby attitude.

9.description: Joe is a real good guy and knows his stuff.  I sold a few old electronics and he gave me a really fair deal.  There's also cool stuff for sale in the shop I was browsing while I waited.  Be sure to come here if you're looking for a great pawn shop run by a great guy

10.description: If you need it, Joe has it. Can't beat his prices

4.description: My first time in a pawnshop..and wow..excellent customer service.I was shopping for a laptop and the gentlemen were very professional and knowledgeable in their extensive line of electronics. They helped me select the right laptop for my needs and at a fair price. I highly recommend Fullerton Pawners for anyone looking for quality merchandise at a good value.

6.description: I LOVE THIS PLACE! I've been coming here for years and always get amazing service! Keep up the good work Joe :-) You really are an asset to the city!

15.description: I brought in a ring to sell and they gave me a really good price. All the guys were really nice. Best pawn shop in Chicago!

0.description: Had a great experience here a couple of weeks back :)I had a couple of rings to sell and I wasn't sure what to expect, but Stuart made the whole experience painless for me. In fact, he made my Holiday! Thank you.Great place, amazing customer service and more than fair offers. Will definitely be back!

5.description: I just moved to Chicago and I was in need of a ton of electronics. I was referred to Fullerton Pawners by a friend; I was hesitant at first to go to a pawn shop but I went anyways. I was pleasantly surprised. The 2 guys working there were extremely knowledgeable and friendly.  I was worried because I was a young female and that I might get taken advantage of but, BOY WAS I WRONG. They helped me with what I came in for and did not pressure me to buy things that I didn't need or items that were not in my budget. The merchandise selection was great. I bought a TV and DVD player for a great price. The staff was knowledgeable in all the products and was able to answer all the questions I had without getting frustrated.  I would return in a heartbeat!

13.description: Joe hooked me up with some great deals!  I highly recommend Fullerton Pawners.  This was my first time visiting and I'll definitely be back.

11.description: Main thing is Joe. He is straight forward, willing to bargain an has plenty to offer. Give the guy some time and have a conversation with him... I'm sure you'll walk away with a good deal.

8.description: Unbeatable price, quality and merchandise. Joe can get anything you need (if he doesn't have it already). Can't go wrong with Joe and Fullerton Pawners. They just moved 2 doors down to have more space.I recommend Joe to anyone who is looking for anything period!

14.description: I would highly recommend this pawn shop.  Joe was able to get me a great deal for my Tiffany jewelry.  The customer service is outstanding!

7.description: I walked in and was greeted by the owner, Joe. He was very nice and paid me top dollar for my gold, more than other places I went to in the past! He recently moved locations from a few doors over and the new store is very nice, clean. He also has a lot very cool products for sale!

3.description: Worst place ever!!! Went in to get my eyebrows done, which they normally are pretty good, and came out totally disappointed, I told the lady not to do my eyebrows thin that's exactly what she did. Will not be going again. Super let down.

1.description: I LOVE this place. I've been going here for years, since high school and I'm done w college. Tee is very sweet, Andy is a phenomenal tech. I won't let anyone but Andy touch my nails. I do miss the design tech they had a few years back, Lin, but she went back to school so I can't be angry. (Good for her!) im a huge fan of tees but that definitely has cut the talent and creativity to the design department. I'm still a huge fan, Tee can whip up a great marble design in a crunch.   TIP:don't go on Saturday!

2.description: Tee nails.I give you four stars, because you truly deserve 3.5 stars & I round up. The price is right. The pedicures are solid. The manicure left me wanting more. You won't find OPI or Essie on these shelves, ladies. There's really not much else to say. Except for the super insane nail design skills this team has. It seems that Tee, the owner, is the most popular nail tech for designs. So if I did it, I'd probably try her out.Now that I'm teetering thirty... (And not a fan of how difficult fake nails can be)I stick to my basic mani... But 17 year old Me? All. Over. It. I've met a few people who don't live in the area that have heard of/been to Tee Nails for their designs... So, if you need a Pedi, stop by.If u need a mani, u might wanna think twice.Nail designs? It's Tee time.

9.description: I guess my quest for a new nail salon failed.I walked in around 6pm on a Thursday and this place was packed with people and ALOT of kids. I mean kids everywhere! I told them I needed a fill in. I waited and waited for about 30 minutes before I walked out and left. I don't understand how my friends like this place. It was way to packed. I wouldn't even come here at 11am on a Monday.

10.description: Only go to Andy or Tee (if getting a full set)! They are the owners and both do an amazing job if you need your nails done. Anyone does a good pedi. And the girl who does a lot of the designs that sits by tee is amazing as well. They are known for their nail art so if your into that here's the place to go. Now be warned though it gets crazy in here sometimes. It can get super packed during peak times. Prices are super cheap.

4.description: Since I am doing a no-chip gel polish I will never go there again. They used the rest of the lacquer on my nails and after 2 days they were coming off because they used up the polish that was on the bottom of the bottle and was sticky. The girl that did them for me, suppose to throw the rest of the polish away and put on a new one. When I came back to fix them, they just fixed the bad ones. The good ones, each one of them were coming off day after day. So, I was mad. I payed money and they could not fix them the right way. I am not recommitting them them, they do not care about the client. Also, their faces seem like they are there because they have to not because they want to. A lot of people that work there are not nice.

6.description: They get really packed in the evenings and weekends. You'll probably wait an hour average for your turn, appointment or not. But they're fast, cheap and nice. There aren't a lot of colors to choose from and opi who?

12.description: I had a horrible experience.  My friend purchased a gift certificate for $50.00 for Christmas and when I went to redeem it after my services, the owner claimed that the gift certificate didn't belong to her salon, even though the name on the certificate and envelop clearly had the address on it.  She claimed she's never seen these Christmas gift certificates before.  She actually accused my friend and I of stealing the envelope and printing out the certificate.  She then proceeded to yell and belittle us in front of customers. After 10 minutes she called the police on us which turned out to benefit us.  As we were explaining or dilemma to the officers, one of the officers noticed a booklet of the same certificates we had in our hand.  Lets just say that Tee looked stupid, but still tried to say that we printed them.  The officers said we didn't have to pay and we left.  We will not be going back there EVER and will tell everyone we know what horrible service we had.  Also the no chip manicure I got that day has already chipped...obviously they don't know what they are doing.   BEWARE when spending your money here.

5.description: I always get my gel nails done here and I'm never disappointed. Although it is always packed the wait is worth it. I love how they have a variety of nail art and colors to choose from.

13.description: great place and everyone is very nice. from nails to pedis to getiing eyelash extentions i love it and will continue to go anytime.

11.description: overall i used to like this place. fast service, friendly people but the last time i went i was dissatisfied. the one lady did my nails fast...and i mean super fast. she filed them crooked, i had polish all over my one finger and she cut me. if i ever go back there ill never want her to do my nails. but i guess you get what you pay for.

8.description: I have been going to Tee Nail with my sister in law for about 7 yrs. Middle school through high school and it used be much better! It seems as though they got lazy and lack cleanliness and customer service! the nail techs are rude and they only have one person to do designs. Which drives my sis in law crazy because she always finds pics of cute designs she wants and they can never do. I however usually just get one color so not a prob for me. My thing is usually the pedicure, its always fast and barely get anytime to relax. The chairs are all beat up and have holes in them which they covered with printed duct tape. Very tacky.

0.description: The first time I went to Tee Nails and I was very satisfied with my service. I came with my mom to treat her and myself to a mani and pedi. As soon as we walked in the place they helped us out quickly. Hannah is the lady that did my pedi and full set. I showed her a picture of the type of shape I wanted and she did exactly what I wanted ! This is the first time someone listened to what I wanted. They have a great variety of no chip nail polishes too

7.description: I have been going to tee's since 8 yrs ago or more for gel nails. This year was the first year I had a no chip. I had them done at another place and they lasted 4 weeks. I then tried tee's and they didn't even last one week, they started turning a brown color and chipping. I went back and they told me it was my fault. I had not done anything out of the ordinary. Long story short they didn't want to fix them nor give me my money back, thus never going back there again.

3.description: We ordered a taco dinner, torta dinner, gordita ($2 deal of the day), lg. Jamaica water and a flour tortilla quesadilla. Our bill came out to be $29.88 and it just didn't make sense.As soon as we paid we only received a credit card receipt and not the itemized receipt so we had to ask for it. On there, we saw an odd charge of $4 and a guacamole charge of $5.50. I asked why these charges happened and she said that the $4 was for the quesadilla. On their BIG menu on their wall and table menu, the quesadillas were printed at $1.50 (w/o meat). She said that since it was flour, it had to be $4. Then we went onto the guacamole charge and she said "oh! I didn't charge you for the sope!" (Sope and gordita were on special for $2)So she said ill just gave us $3. In the end she charged us $2.50 for it. And whatever we got back, we left it for tip. Yay me.We recommend you try it there only if you don't mind random ghost charges on your bill and terrible service. We should've gone to Pepe's if we wanted to pay that much. Or chipotle. Unbelievable experience.

1.description: I just left this taco joint with a wonderful experience. I finally made it in today with my wife and we decided to have a pork taco dinner and a chicken taco dinner and must say it was outstanding. The food was made to order,fresh,tasty and affordable. The interior was clean,plenty of seating. Service was excellent . I highly recommend that you come out and give them a try.

2.description: Ehh... Had chorizo torta dinner. It was good value, big portion, ok flavor. The bun was "Italian" American, canned beans, chorizo was ok and decent sauces. BYOB

0.description: Sooooooo good! I had the Carne Asada and Al Pastor  tacos. The steak was good but the pork was fantastic. Best taco I've ever had. It was somewhat sweet like a mole sauce. So good

4.description: Stopped in on a weekend, when they feature menudo and both red and white pozole. I opted for the pozole blanco, and it was fantastic. Made from a combination of chicken and pork, the broth was rich and almost creamy (probably thanks to plenty of marrow).The only other thing I ordered was guacamole, which was underwhelming. Not enough avocado, and too much other stuff.

3.description: Unlike the previous reviewer I didn't get to bask in it's delightful baking smell. I got to taste it for the mere cost of eighty cents and out of a vending machine. These bear claws BLOW! The taste is mechanical, I want a refund. Alas, I purchased mine from a vending machine. I'd successfully avoided vending machine goodies for sometime but this place I'm working at currently hasn't got a convenience store and I was hungry.  Two bites into the bear claw and I lost my appetite.  Within minutes of being outside its package it lost its moistness and became hard.  The taste of the topping is almond maybe? It's overwhelming, smelly and if you look at the ingredients there are far too many glcyerides, sulfites, acids, bleh. 470 calories! Gosh.  Get rid of that nasty topping and then maybe its feasible for eating.

1.description: I bought a package of Lakeside Bakeries Cream Cheese Crumb Cakes and found ants in the cake itself.  I am not exaggerating on this one bit.  I have proof in 2 photos and the package was closed when I purchased it.  They are white ants and I hope that I didn't swallow any.Phil

2.description: Can't say that I've eaten anything from here, but walking past cloverhill from the metra stop unfurls a smell so sweet that it'll give you diabetes.

0.description: I tried the cream cheese crumb cakes. Best gas station cup cakes ever! I would never have expected such a magnificent consistency. I have yet to try another flavor but I hope these guys stay in business, if not just to make those crumb cakes...

4.description: I just moved to the area, and when I drove along Narragansett I kept smelling cinnamon and sugar.  I thought it was churros, because once I saw someone selling them on the street, but I kept smelling them and not seeing them.  Sometimes I even smelled the scent in Oak Park.  So after much online detective work, I feel confident this is the source.  The factory here makes bear claws and cinnamon buns and the like.  Unfortunately none are vegan so I do not partake, but the smell is nice so they get some stars.

1.description: Drove out here at 1pm. OPEN sign on display on locked door, right above HOURS sign that says you're MEANT to be open. Nobody in store to help me with my large order.Very disappointing. Learnt my lesson! CALL FIRST! Pity.

2.description: The owner is weird. He owns the business but keeps it close. You need to call them if you would like to do some shopping at their store. Crazy. I gave 3 stars specifically to the person who works at this place-  leather tailor. He is unbelievable. You only need to explain him once what you want, and he will do a perfect job. The prices are very reasonable buy you have to talk about $$ with the tailor - NOT the owner. If you ask the owner how much you have to pay , he will charge you double.

0.description: This review is specific to the leather repair services which are fantastic, especially if you need to repair or modify motorcycle riding gear.This shop has a tailor who is excellent at leather repairs and modifications.  The old man moves slow, but his work is top notch.  To date, I have had him replace pocket zippers in my motorcycle jacket, replace sleeve straps on my bomber jacket and had him do an addition of a zipper to my motorcycle pants and riding jack that allows me to zip the two together like a one-piece suit when I go riding.  My wife needed to have her riding pants narrowed lengthwise.  He did a phenomenal job.  Her pants looked like they were made for her -- well they have.  The prices were very reasonable.  To replace a pocket zipper was $10, to add a zipper between the pants and the jacket was $20, to narrow my wife's pants was $50.  Bottom line, for all you people that need to tailor your motorcycle riding gear or leather clothes, the tailor at this shop is excellent.

1.description: They can't help themselves, they put raisins in everything, no idea why? My wife even asks before she buys it, if it has raisins and they always say "no" but inevitably you'll find them in bunches in every pastry they make!!!!!!!! So annoying!!!!! So if you enjoy raisins in every bite of your pastry then welcome home!!!

9.description: After dining at El Gordo across the street, I decided to pickup desert at Oak Mill. I wish I could remember what they were called, but the name was in Polish. It was sort of like a chocolate cannoli. They were very good. The chocolate had a good flavor and the pastry was nice a flaky. The only negative would be the price. It was pretty pricey for such a small desert. I may return again, but the price thing could have me hesitating. As everyone else stated, if you park in the lot you better go to the bakery or some other business in the lot. There was a guy sitting in a truck just waiting to boot someone.

23.description: Wow.  This review is strictly for the Paczki alone!  They were SO good.  It was highly recommended by one of the ladies I work with.  I'm really ecstatic that everything here tasted not only fresh, but not too sweet, and not too heavy.  Way good!The shop itself is rather tiny, but the staff was VERY attentive, and the cakes in the displays were gorgeous.  I actually may come back and order a birthday cake here too, based on how good and fresh the Paczki were!***PLEASE NOTE*** if you are parking in their lot, be sure to patronize the stores in the strip mall--the guys are WAITING for you to leave so they can boot you!!

25.description: This is the best way to get people to come to my birthday parties...mention the fact that I will be having oak mill pear cake.  It has lady fingers and raspberry filling, so good and not too sweet.  I have not had any of their other cakes but they look delish as well.

12.description: we came the day after paczki day and they still had paczki. we got two and they were horrible. beautifully shaped and frosted, but dry on the inside, and over $1 each?dreadful.

21.description: This is the best bakery in the world.  Everybody in my family loves their cakes and pastries.  You will feel like your eating a piece of heaven.  Highly recommend!

16.description: Don't  bother with this business!!! We bought a cake there a week after Easter! We cut out one piece from it and noticed it smelled bad and after tasting it we couldn't believde how rancid it was, when we took it back to the store the girls there called the manager and said that this is how it's supposed to taste! The manager was convinced even though she was only on the phone with the employees from the Belmont location and wouldn't refund our money ($23 for a little cake) Believe me its not about the money 3 years ago we ordered a sweet table from them for our wedding and payed $5000! We took the cake home and my mom took it to the Niles location later that day, we were told that the manager was there, they took the cake and her phone number and promised to call her back. It took all week of calling them and trying to follow up! Its Friday and we finally heard from someone, still saying the cake was good and we won't get our money back! Not only they sold us a cake that was BAD but wouldn't give us our money back!!! We'll take our business somwhere else!!

17.description: Awesome! Ordered a 14" round cake for a party. This was enough for 35 people. We chose a custard filling with fresh strawberries. The outside of the cake was done in whipped cream. Everyone loved the design on the cake. The whipped cream work is fantastic. Cake looks like it was done in fondant. Very detailed and professional. The taste of the cake was just as good as the whipped cream work. The cake was gone within 15 minutes. Even people that don't normally eat cake enjoyed the cake. I think this cake was a hit because we choose whipped cream instead of frosting. And we had custard inside instead of frosting. Overall this cake was great, and more than we expected. Good job Oak Mill Bakery.

10.description: Alright, I highly doubt what Natalia A. is claiming, but hey I don't know. Either way I'll eat their cake even if it's fallen on the floor. It's tasty. And not only tasty, they truly have BEAUTIFUL baby shower cakes, wedding cakes, communion cakes (shaped like an open Bible, and it's SO beautiful), really cute birthday cakes (if you want something really simple and you want to save some money go to Jewel but if you want to spend the bakery price you'll get a great bakery cake! Also if you're looking for an affordable LARGE but basic LOOKING cake that tastes like heaven, go to CostCco...)Out of all of their pastries their canollis are WOW WOW WOW quality good. This isn't strictly Polish goodies here but it is a Polish bakery. That actually gives it a little bit of an edge over the competition because they have high quality pastries, friendly service and a larger variety of things to try. We went in once and one of the women gave my younger cousins free cookies. That service and those tasty cookies had us coming back for sure.

5.description: We've ordered cake for our wedding and it was great. Staff was helpful even after we've decided to change the color of our wedding and change flowers. I'd highly recommend them.

11.description: This is for the OMB on BelmontSo I do base almost my entire review on the cake & the icing.  Usually I do this by purchasing cupcakes.  At this place you have to actually purchase 6 cupcakes, they are not individually sold.  Annoying, but they did take the 2 boxes and mix them up so I could get chocolate/chocolate and yellow/butter cream.  Sadly, I did not like the icing at all.  Sort of super whipped shortening, not my favorite ever.  The chocolate cake was ok.I have yet to finish all of the food I purchased but of what I have eaten i will not go out of my way for this place.  The punchki (I know I'm spelling ti wrong, sorry) was chocolate and custard.  The custard was gritty and not very flavorful which is weird b/c the custard in the éclair was good.  we had 2 round kolachkies (yeah yeah spelling) the raspberry was stale but the cheese was good.  The iced sugar cookie was yummy but for 3.95 it was a total rip off.  I KNOW it takes time to deco a cookie but really?The rum ball was really rummy, bonus.  They kind of rummy that makes your tummy warm.  Good for them!The other thing that wasn't so wonderful is that this is a satellite location and it didn't seem like anything was actually made here thus no lovely bakery smell.Maybe I just need to get pear cake?Still have a few things to try but overall I've had better = 2 stars.

22.description: AMAZING BAKERY! Just look at the website to see all the pictures! just eye popping creations to suit every sweet tooth. Moist, delicious cakes, tortes and pastries - I have been to many weddings with their sweet tables... nothing is left at the end!!! Their cakes are super moist and come in a variety of flavors... not the usual pick of vanilla or chocolate and one type of butter creme... I'm talking about i.e  pear cake with glaze (#1 fave!!), raspberry ganache chocolate fudge cake, black forest cherry cake, cappuccino deliciousness... and so many more. The decorations are stunning and the Polish ladies that take care of everything... phenomenal! They have more than one location as well. I recommend it!!!

0.description: The Ambrosia cake (chocolate & hazelnut cake with rasberry) I ordered for my daughters 1st birthday was orgasmic!  It was delicious and I received so many compliments.  Everyone wanted to know where I ordered it from.  They decorated it exactly like the invite.  Success!  The service was great and Sylwia was very helpful.  She was patient with me and explained all the cake flavors in detail.  (FYI - I ordered the 14" for 30-40 ppl for $127.00)I've been going back to Oak Mill ever since.  The other cakes I purchased were Tiramisu and Hazelnut mousse.  Both were delish!  I look forward to special occasions just so I can get a cake from Oak Mill!

20.description: So I pretty much looked like a superstar in front of all our friends for picking out Oak Mill's pear cake for my princess's birthday. Everything they have is absolutely phenomenal. If you're used to getting cakes from Jewel, this will seem expensive, but once you've had a bite, you'll never go back to store-bought cakes. They have numerous locations, most often in Polish neighborhoods... like this one. In fact, they'll greet you in Polish and assume you speak Polish but are happy to help you in English too, of course. The original location in Niles at OAKton and MILwaukee (get it??!?) is probably their largest and has the best variety, but all of their cakes are available at this location.As Erin said, watch out for the parking lot police... I sat in the car once while Yana ran in to order a cake and saw the security guard boot three cars in 10 minutes... yes, they actually attach a boot to your car and it ain't cheap to have them take it off.

19.description: This is the best way to get people to come to my birthday parties...mention the fact that I will be having oak mill pear cake.  It has lady fingers and raspberry filling, so good and not too sweet.  I have not had any of their other cakes but they look delish as well.

2.description: I'm a big fan of their baked goods. I almost always buy my family's birthday cakes here when it's my turn and I have a big family so I'd say I purchase roughly 8-13 full size cakes a year. What I'm not a fan of is their customer service. The older women tending to the counter are incredibly rude and standoffish. They rush you when the place is empty and get annoyed when you ask them to personalize the cakes. Asking simple questions about cakes that don't have visible tags? Forget about it, it's as if you've just terribly offended them. If you don't have people skills you shouldn't be at the counter, ma'am.  The younger girls have a much more approachable demeanor. They make small talk and have always been welcoming. After today's experience I'll be taking my business elsewhere.

18.description: Wow.  This review is strictly for the Paczki alone!  They were SO good.  It was highly recommended by one of the ladies I work with.  I'm really ecstatic that everything here tasted not only fresh, but not too sweet, and not too heavy.  Way good!The shop itself is rather tiny, but the staff was VERY attentive, and the cakes in the displays were gorgeous.  I actually may come back and order a birthday cake here too, based on how good and fresh the Paczki were!***PLEASE NOTE*** if you are parking in their lot, be sure to patronize the stores in the strip mall--the guys are WAITING for you to leave so they can boot you!!

13.description: 3 stars because I've only tried their Paczki's & can I just say.... YUM!  I'll be back on fat Tuesday's! Everything else looks very delicious..... Might indulge in a sweet treat soon

4.description: "You won't find any [in D.C.], so stuff your face with paczkis while you can!"My acquaintance's words echoed through my head as I made my final midwest Paczki Day run.  Since I knew this would be my last shot for a while to have a paczki from a true Polish bakery (D.C. is very international but lacks a cohesive Polish community), I wanted to make it count.  I wanted to get some fancy filled doughnuts from something remote.  Somewhere where the first generation Poles lived.  I ended up in the heart of one of Chicago's most famous Polish communities, Belmont-Cragin...  And immediately walked into a local chain bakery.  One that has a location in Wicker Park (a fact that I only found out after) no less!  Frack my ignorance.I wasn't really bothered by this fact though.  This one definitely seemed authentic as all of the signs were in Polish.  I also wasn't really bothered by the fact that the paczkis were $1.90 (expensive) a piece.  I wasn't really bothered by the fact that the paczkis were smaller than their Avondale counterparts.  I wasn't really bothered that the filling was only in a small, but messy, pocket in the middle of my treat.  I wasn't really bothered that the frosting did not stick to the pastry (because crumbs are fun).  And I definitely wasn't really bothered by the quality of the paczki.  While I've had better, these were sweet and rich enough. What I was really bothered me was how really bothered my stomach was after eating them.  I woke up on Ash Wednesday with my innards feeling like they were on fire.  I didn't blame my Paczki Day plunder at first, I blamed the concurrent Fat Tuesday drinking.  But then I had the last two of my haul with lunch after my brain and guts settled.  Within minutes, I thought I had burst an ulcer.  The pain was unbearable and lasted for six hours.  That is not hyperbole, it's fact.Having eaten paczkis from all over this city, this has never happened before.  In fact, I may have to go to another Polish bakery soon so this is not my last Chicago paczki memory (counting the Pepto and this fact, these were some very expensive paczki).  I need that memory to sustain me for years in the non-Polish hinterlands after all.

24.description: I prefer this bakery to the other Polish bakeries in the area, because it's not nearly as Polish-centric.  OK, don't get me wrong- I like Polish baked treats, but sometimes I want a nice nutty coffee cake, or a fancy little tart or something non-Polish.  Oak Mill's very good for that.  As far as normal Polish stuff, Oak Mill's good for that too- especially good Paczki!Oak Mill has really won me over, despite a couple minor issues: first,  kinda weird hours.  If I get up early on a Sunday should I have to wait until 10AM for my bakery to open?  Next, their fall plum cake isn't sweet enough, and is actually sour.  I take my fall plum cake very seriously, and appreciate when the baker (normally my Mom) takes the care to balance the amount of sugar added to sweeten up the little Italian plums they use without going overboard.  Oak Mill doesn't seem to bother adding any sugar at all- SOUR.  So I avoid the plum cake and stick the stuff they do well.Just FYI, this Oak Mill location is a smaller one and it looks like much of what you'll see is brought in from one of their other, bigger, Oak Mill bakeries in the Chicagoland area.  That hasn't really mattered to me- everything's been fresh anyway, but that might explain the later opening hours as well (waiting for the goods to arrive)?So I want to love this place, but given my picky tastes in baked goods, I can only say that I really like it.  I'd bet I could love one of the other/bigger locations- this one "feels" like a satellite, although the selection's good and it's well staffed.

6.description: I want to be buried with a lady finger pear cake. Drizzled with extra chocolate, please. Just utterly amazing, I have never ever had a better cake in my life. And, I like dessert. A lot. Lot.Years ago, used to make my ex get me one of these cakes when we got in a fight...you know to make up. The lady finger pear cake is better than make up sex. For real....

15.description: I prefer this bakery to the other Polish bakeries in the area, because it's not nearly as Polish-centric.  OK, don't get me wrong- I like Polish baked treats, but sometimes I want a nice nutty coffee cake, or a fancy little tart or something non-Polish.  Oak Mill's very good for that.  As far as normal Polish stuff, Oak Mill's good for that too- especially good Paczki!Oak Mill has really won me over, despite a couple minor issues: first,  kinda weird hours.  If I get up early on a Sunday should I have to wait until 10AM for my bakery to open?  Next, their fall plum cake isn't sweet enough, and is actually sour.  I take my fall plum cake very seriously, and appreciate when the baker (normally my Mom) takes the care to balance the amount of sugar added to sweeten up the little Italian plums they use without going overboard.  Oak Mill doesn't seem to bother adding any sugar at all- SOUR.  So I avoid the plum cake and stick the stuff they do well.Just FYI, this Oak Mill location is a smaller one and it looks like much of what you'll see is brought in from one of their other, bigger, Oak Mill bakeries in the Chicagoland area.  That hasn't really mattered to me- everything's been fresh anyway, but that might explain the later opening hours as well (waiting for the goods to arrive)?So I want to love this place, but given my picky tastes in baked goods, I can only say that I really like it.  I'd bet I could love one of the other/bigger locations- this one "feels" like a satellite, although the selection's good and it's well staffed.

7.description: I remember coming here when it was at its old location (now its a couple blocks down from where it was before) and having pastries and cake all the time!  Surprisingly, I was not a fat child.In any case, I always have a place in my heart for that chocolate cake with the chocolate/strawberry/vanilla cream in it because it's moist and combines the flavors I love.  I should really branch out but that's mainly all I've had and I've loved it for many years, so why change a good thing?

8.description: I stopped in here yesterday to grab a last-minute cake for my daughter's third birthday. This cake was just for a small family dinner and not her party, so I just needed something small. The girl who helped me was nice but pretty much rushed me to choose a cake even though I was literally the only customer there. Once I picked out the cake (one of the smallest ones in the store; about 8" around), I asked if they could put fresh flowers on it with frosting; she said no and instead pulled out old sugar ones to decorate it with. Um, OK, whatever, put it on there. So then she rang me up and it was TWENTY-EIGHT FREAKING DOLLARS for this cake. That fed five people. I just can't.I know I should have asked the price but I legitimately did not think that small of a cake would have cost that much. I feel like they should have their prices a little more displayed.The cake itself was good that day, but after one day of sitting in the fridge, it's pretty dried out and not that great. I wouldn't go back here.

3.description: I have bought 2 cakes from here before. They have MANY cakes ready for you to pick and will personalize it while you wait. The staff is very nice. One cake I bought for a coworker's potluck going away party; it was a mocha cake. The second, was a small cake for my ma's birthday. So very aesthetically beautifully created. Reasonable prices. One star deducted, because I have tasted better. But, would and have come back. Beautiful cakes, good customer service.

14.description: cake looked great, tasted even better BUT for the money I paid I would have wanted many more stawberries.  I wasn't the only one who made a comment.  Cake cost $103.85 and feeds 30

3.description: I went here on may 25th, and should have listened to my gut & red flags. Unfortunately, I listened to my brain & the price tag. The salesman was like a typical cars salesman. He offered a really low price, almost too easily,which is why I caved. While I was paying for the mattress, there was another customer trying to get credit approval. The application had two options. One was 0% interest for 90 days, the other one was 0%interest for 72 months. The customer asked the salesman which was better,the salesman wouldn't tell him. Clearly the customer wanted the 72 months deal,but didn't know how to mark it on the application because of the way it was worded.Where my issue begins with this company---my mattress was supposed to be delivered the next day between 4pm-7pm. Well 7pm rolls around, and no mattress shows. My dad contacts the store,and they say they have to call him back. Instead of getting a call from the store,he gets a call from WI. The driver says he'll show up in 30 mins. But he never shows. Needless to say, the next day I cancelled the transaction, because if they can't deliver a mattress on time and communicate, I don't want to experience having to redeem the warranty. Also,the salesman stated that the restocking fee was only $89 if I didn't like the mattress,but the contract says that it's actually  $149.The last thing that the salesman said to me was, "all I ask is that you tell 3 people about your experience."I'll do him one better and tell everyone I know about Mattress Firm & their F rating on BBB.orgI went to ABT instead and am extremely happy. They price match, free delivery, free return,locally owned and super reliable.

1.description: Chad was very informative and helpful. He made my decision an easy choice. I recommend anyone who's in the market for a bed to visit this store.

2.description: Great explanation of the difference between beds. Really enjoyed the help in purchasing our new bed. Thanks , Tim Dobbin.

5.description: I stopped in there yesterday 9/24/15 and worked with Nick. He was very welcoming and knew the product every well. He was able to point me in the right direction for what I was looking for and was very helpful. I would recommended going to this location they have the best prices and fast delivery if needed.

0.description: Great people here. Chad took very good care of us and with the reassurance he gave us, we knew we made the right decision. Definitely recommend purchasing your next bed here. Thanks again Chad.

4.description: We've been searching mattresses and doing research for a couple months now and all I can say is, we should have came here sooner! Both of the representatives were open, honest and very helpful. We came in and in an hour left with a new purchase feeling happier than ever. I will definitely pass the word along to all our friends and family.

58.description: I wish there was a negative star ranking on Yelp. Two friends and I purchased a Travelzoo deal for a 3-course meal at  D'Cuba. This restaurant has the most horrendous service I have ever (and I do mean EVER) encountered in my 30-something years. We were there for 4 solid hours, the last hour of which we requested to receive our check no fewer than four times. The wait was terrible; we had to ask for our drinks (and aforementioned check) multiple times and at the end of the night 7 tables were waiting for their checks and none of the tables that had already left were cleared. Instead of bringing checks, the staff were locking the front door and turning off the open light. Really? That's your top priority? This was after another table actually went up to the register to receive their check and were told to sit back down, which they did for probably another 30-45 minutes. D'Cuba was a terrible experience - the food was good but not spectacular (although when I actually did get a mojito, I have to admit I enjoyed it. Was it worth the 30 minute wait to get the drink? That would be a resounding "NO"!). Needless to say, I will never return to this restaurant again, nor will my friends.There are way too many fantastic restaurants in Chicago with much better food who actually value their customers' time and their dining experiences. Do not go to D'Cuba!

56.description: I have been there twice the first time I went there with a Travelzoo coupon. We had the crab empanadas which by the way you pay individually for. They are not huge but not too mini either. Not a great deal to me though for just one. The entrees: we had the ropa vieja (shredded beef in sauce) it was good, I had the roasted chicken, the portion was huge both entrees came with white rice, black bean soup, and fried plantain it was great!!! I opted for the cuban rice so no black bean soup, it was still worth it. This deal came with Mojitos which we both agreed were great. We also had 2 chocoflan, it was sweet (in my world that is good) but really the entrees alone are enough. 2nd time around we came back with friends they liked the food too but service was lacking the second time around. We waited a long time for everything. My theory if you go there sit close to the bar best service there, thats where we sat the first time around. The further away you sit from it the worse the service gets. My theory from watching as the people at front got served faster the second time around!I would definitely go back but sit closer to the front! lol

29.description: I love this place. My partner and I go there at least once per month. The food is great. I love their Cuban sandwich and their black beans and white rice are awesome. I knew I was going to like this place the first time that we went and when I asked for hot sauce, they brought out home-made hot sauce. Their hot sauce is spicy hot and has a very good flavor. Recently, I had a few people from work over to my house. I had food catered by D' Cuba and everyone loved it. We did order empanadas and croquettas once. They were nothing out of the ordinary. Their empanadas are somewhat expensive (and small) so I wouldn't recommend them. I have not had any of their alcoholic beverages so I cannot comment on them. They do have real good batidos though. Their service is OK. Could be better.

42.description: Can I just say if you want to wait 45 minutes for a server to come by to take a drink order than this is the place for you.  The whole night there was a fiasco. They served half of our table their entrees and then came back about 10 minutes later to see how everything was still without the rest of the dinners. We had to ask several times if the other entrees were on their way out. Thank god we ordered several pitchers of cocktails I think that was the only reason we were able to find some humor in the whole experience  The food here is decent, not amazing and not bad but so not worth the wait.

23.description: Tripped in here after doctors appt. Totally unassuming from outside and clean homey interior. Don't bother with appetizers or extra bread...cause the entrees are HUGE. Really good authentic Cuban meal at reasonable price. The price is actually cheap considering you will take rest home for next day lunch.

47.description: By far the best I have had!  I have been a fan of Osmin Chef/Owner food since his first location on Chicago Avenue.  He takes the time and pride to make the best dishes. I will let you know some items do take a little longer to prepare because it is all fresh and made to order. So if you want fast food this is not the place it is quality food!My two favorites are the Chicken Fajitas and Ropa Vieja. I will kill for those meat empanadas as an appetizer.  Oh my God they are good. I usually get the beef, however the seafood and chicken are also good. Team it up with a salad and that is a whole mean in itself.The ambiance is cute, the music is festive. As a restaurant owner myself  I appreciate the fact that Osmin makes every effort to come out of the kitchen when he is not busy to greet his guests.  It does get busy at peak times so please keep this in mind as your servers try very hard to make sure you get good service!I wish D Cuba was closer, I was saddened that Osmin is no longer at the Chicago Avenue restaurant he opened, however I will make it a point to visit D' Cuba as much as possible. Great job guys!

8.description: They have redeemed themselves so I must be fair and update my review. Today, for lunch they did not have the lunch special ready, so I requested ropa vieja for the same price and the manager granted it. Now, that's great customer service on behalf of the server and manager. Mojitos are always delicious accompanied by one of the best empanadas I've ever had...Emapanadas de cangrejo (crab...REAL crab). Love it with their homemade hot sauce/salsa and warm garlic bread. This place beats 90 Miles any day. I'll get to that review another day! Buen provecho!

31.description: First know that i am not easily impressed and hard to please because o am an amazing cook myself!! D'Cuba is Absolutely AMAZING and have yet to find better in the Midwest!!! Better than 90 Miles in Chicago! We ordered so much food and drinks and could not believe how cheap our bill was! The service was great, atmosphere was lively, clean and simply delightfulThat food was so good!!! Let's take the kids for our birthday???! LOVED this place!! Do YUMMMMYYYY!!
