We will be back cause we've found a pretty close Restaraunt comparable to Miami!!! So affordable which is awesome cause we have a huge family!!! Our favorites: sangria, empanadas, croquets, papas rellinos, Cuban midnight sandwich, skirt steak, rice with black beans to DIE FOR!!!

34.description: Honestly... I am confused by some of the low ratings. This place has the best Cuban food in the city (PERIOD). It might night be the fanciest Cuban restaurant, I've been to several... my husband is Cuban. No, their staff is not over the top but they are attentive. We both agree the food here is consistently DELICIOUS. The yucca in garlic sauce is an absolute must have. Orders are big the price is right. I love the fried pork chunks dish which comes with black beans and white rice. Ropa Vieja... YUM! Congri... YUM! And their Mojitos... double YUM! If you know good Cuban food you'll keep coming back!

16.description: I came here because I bought a Travelzoo voucher. I will not be coming back.We drove up to the place and it looked like a hole in the wall and it had only 2 occupied tables on a Saturday night. We were even hesitant to walk in!We had a new waitress that was very very attentive, and helped us make our choices... We ordered 2 homemade sangrias, D' Cuba combination ( 2 personas incluye 2 croquetas de jamon o pollo. 1 empanada (no cangrejo) 1 papa rellena, 4 tostones y yuca frita ), El Típico (Grilled pork, Black Cuban rice and yuca w/mojo), Ropa vieja / Old Clothes (Shredded beef in tomato sauce with onion, green and red peppers, Flan de vanilla (vanilla custard)Sangrias: filled with fresh fruit and was actually very goodD'Cuba combination appetizer: the sausage looking thing was okay, dry and eh. The tostones were pretty good, but still pretty darn dry. The potato ball thing was actually pretty good! The puff thing we didn't even try.. It just didn't look appetizing.El Tipico: the pork pieces were half fat and half meat... I had to cut off a loooot of my meat, it was soooo much fat! Wtf? The rice wasn't bad, the meat in it was a bit overdone. The yaca w/mojo was pretty disgusting..mooshy, flavorless, just ick.Ropa vieja: the translation of the name of the dish for sure describes the taste of this whole dish! Old clothes! The meat was not chewable, my bf felt like a cow endlessly chewing the first piece of meat he tried! He gave me a small piece to try and I was chewing for a long time! The rice was very very dry.. The whole dish was not edible so pretty much the whole dish was not touched.. Wait no. He ate the grilled peppers!Flan de vanilla: after a couple of tries neither the bf nor I wanted to touch it, sweet, but slimy (I know it usually is but it was not edible slimy) . Just not good.The servers were very friendly, but that didn't help the bad food. If you see a travelzoo, groupon, etc, offer for this place, pass it up, you are better off spending your money elsewhere!

13.description: I ordered the breaded chicken,($13)it came with a decent size of rice, small cup of beans and 3 pieces of maduros. The chicken was huge, I probably ate 1/4. I probably would've ate more if it wasn't lacking seasoning. The crust on it was different than what I'm used to as well. The rice was ok, same with maduros, I've had better. The beans were delicious though! I also ordered the yuca frita $4 and a banana shake $3.50. The yuca was ehh, like eating cardboard. The shake was pretty good. The place has a mix of good and not so good, I ordered from grub hub and ended up spending $29 for delivery bc it had a minimum order limit of $20.. I feel like I paid too much for food that wasn't that great.. Bummer

11.description: What can I say about D Cuba?  I read the review here on Yelp and noticed one of my friends Carlos had done a review on this restaurant.  I wanted a nice Latin restaurant to take my mom on mothers day.  The places in Humboldt park are good, but the atmosphere around the places were not the best.  So I took a chance and took my wife and mom to D Cuba.  Absolutely Amazing!  It was the perfect mothers day dinner I could've asked for.  The waiters greeted us with top notch professionalism.  The ambiance was just what I wanted for mom.  Latin feel, nice Latin music.  We ordered our food from the great choices on the menu and when they arrived they were absolutely delicious.  I had the Lechon Asado and it was juicy and tasty.  Mom went with the Jibarito and loved it.  My wife had a steak and loved it!!! The waiters were courteous and attentive.  They kind of left us for a while towards the end, but that's because a slew of people arrived after us and they were busy.  Highly recommend this place

39.description: Search no more: the best Mojito in town is right here and you can enjoy it in a classy ambiance. It was pretty quiet the afternoon we came for some light repast, there was only one server but she was quite attentive and managed the few occupied tables pretty well. We only had chicken empanada, mojito and flan de coco but they were enough for me to put it on my favorite places to visit. I will definitely try this place again (further reviews to follow). For the meantime, why don't you visit and enjoy the ambiance, the really good mojito and snack like I did.

37.description: Went here for a birthday party and the food was great.  Good cuban cuisine.   The restaurant itself is small but the food is as close as to mom's cooking as it can get.

0.description: Authentic Cuban food at really good prices. One of the best Cuban restaraunt in the city.

38.description: This place is just ok.  Everything was more or less bland and greasy. The sangria was amazing though!!! chairs were wobbly, service was very slow even though they weren't really busy. The sound of a blender would always fill small restaurant so it is hard to hear the person you are talking to.  It was nice to go to with a groupon, or any other voucher, but prob otherwise wont make the trip for it.

51.description: Ok so i purchased a Travelzoo deal for this restaurant and it was the greatest decision ever!! The food was completely amazing!!!!!! Im still drooling thinking about their coconut flan. There mojitos were exactly perfect just like a mojito should taste, none of that artificial flavor. The shrimp ceviche was tooo die for. I had to literally force myself to stop eating so that i would have room for my steak. When my t-bone arrived it was cooked to perfection. The meat was soo tender i didnt even need a steak nice and marinated so perfectly my tastebuds were dancing. That entree also came with garlic shrimp which were perfect. they had the garlic flavor but it wasnt overkill.  All in all it was one of the best meals ive had in a long time. Its a little bit of a ways to travel without a car but definately worth it.   I cant wait for my next trip back there!!! yummmm

27.description: I love this place - has to be the BEST cuban restaurant in the city.  Me and my friend started with the Mixed Green Salad and it was yummy.  Then for our main dishes - I had the Masas De Puerco Fritas which are the BEST I have EVER had and my friend had their Ropa Vieja and RAVED about it!  While service is a little slow the staff is very nice.  Plus they make up for slow service with GREAT affordable and yummy food!

32.description: I gave the location a 3 because the service was slow as molasses.  We've been there when it's a full house and then during the week recently.  With only 3 tables of four there, it was still slow.  My water not being timely refilled and having to ask three times for water.  And no hot sauce at all, anywhere in the restaurant, I thought that was just ODD.  The server was more interested in watching the TV in the main dining room and eating the leftovers from the bread baskets. The service has not changed from the last time I was there over a year ago. The food is good, no doubt, but the service needs to improve, timing on food and table service. I will say that the food was nice and hot and delicious!

54.description: It's so nice to finally have a nice latin restaurant in the area that isn't necessarily a dive.  Don't get me wrong... some of those other "dives" have decent food, but sometimes you just want to enjoy your meal at a nice place with table service.  While D'Cuba isn't a huge restaurant, it is rather classy.  You don't have to be all dressed up for it but, if you are, you won't feel uncomfortable.The food is quite good.  I've gone several times with my entire family.  Everyone has ordered something different and has always been satisfied with their Cuban dish.  Actually, we've ordered so many items that I can't really narrow it down... it's all been good.  I haven't heard any complaints.  In fact, my mom came home one day with the strangest compliment for them... she loved their water!!  She kept raving about how good it was.  She even asked the server and I guess they serve some type of filtered water.  It was just funny to hear my mom rave about a restaurant's water... goes to show that even the little things count.Today we went with my Travelzoo coupon (similar to a Groupon deal) and everything went super-smooth.  The server seemed to have it down to a science.  The mojitos that came with the deal were huge.  Honestly, I didn't care for it (but then again I don't really care for any mojito), but my mom loved hers.  I believe our server was also the bartender.  Talk about a multi-tasker!!I'll definitely be back with or without another coupon.  Love it!

48.description: If I could give this a 3-1/2 stars I would. I went here because its in my neighborhood and a friend HIGHLY recommended it. The wait was Long, but I figured it was because I overheard some people were coming in with coupons. There was just ONE waitress and what seemed to be an employee/manager? sitting at a table with a laptop. I figured they didn't expect to have so many people come in on a weekday, so dealt with the wait because the food was good. I am now debating on whether I want to purchase a Groupon being offered now, since Ive heard horror stories about the bad service from other people I know....In Limbo

44.description: I was there the same night as Evelyn.  It must be an off night. No way this place got so many good reviews with slow and neglectful service.  I disagree, the waitress was doing her best.  True no one was helping her and yes that is the restaurants problem and someone should have came out of the kitchen to make sure the people were tended to.  Our dinner took over 2 1/2 hours because of the slow service.  The food warrants 3.5-4 stars.  My pork was tasty, the potato balls with meat (basically shepards pie in a ball) were yummy.  My mango shake once i got after ordering 45 min ago was good too.  They just need to speed up the food service and make sure they are properly staffed.  I would give it another try but if it is as bad as that night, I will walk out too.

24.description: Amazing food! Appetizer for 4, el Tipico & El Habanero was an excellent dinner choice. Large portions & great Drinks!

7.description: Excellant service fast.  Very pleasant and polite atmosphere.  Very admirable service

49.description: This place is AMAZING!!! It's really far from where I live, but I bought a Travelzoo.com coupon and went there to check it out.  The food was awesome!  The service was fine but the food was delicious.  As a matter of fact, it's so good that I bought the coupon again from Travelzoo.com.  It's just that good!  :)  The coupon comes with two drinks as well.

40.description: this place is kind of a hole in the wall but we were surprised by the fantastic food! it took a while for us to get a waitress to our table and bring us water but it looked like she was by herself so i guess i understand. we had a restaurant.com voucher and we ordered all types of food. we had the yuca frita, guava & cheese empanada, house salad, fried chicken and pork chops. all of our food was excellent! the fried chicken had garlic all over it which gave it much flavor. the pork chops had cooked onions on them & they were soooo delicious! my friends and i enjoyed each others company and had a great feast! we would definitely come back to this place & tell other peeps about it cuz it's just that good!

53.description: Great fantastic food - an absolute hidden gem.  The service was great, the food was tasty and delicious!!! Would definitely be back very soon!

30.description: Looks like they have 2 different listings.  I'll repost here too.Wow. Way to turn a decent dining experience 180 degrees.   Management and staff make it easy not to want to come back.We found this place thru Restaurant.com, so we changed our plans and came here instead of La Parrilla on Irving Park.  We dined on a Friday night.  Place was empty except for the waitress and her friend.  No one rushed over, apparently a great conversation was taking place.   When the staff finally came over, I was greeted, and asked if this was my first time here.  "Yep" I replied. My wife and I ordered Mojitos.  Not bad, but made with sprite, so we didn't order a second.   I love tostones, and my wife loves empanadas.  They had both on the menu, but for the price, we could get the platter, which included both, plus a fried potato/meat ball, yuca fries, and ham and cheese Croquettes.   All fried, but all was tasty with the 2 dipping sauces.   We ordered the apps, since we needed to meet our purchase price minimum to take advantage of the restaurant.com deal.We then ordered two of the 'Chef's Favorites'  El Habanero & the El Tipico. The Habenero was just M'eh, having the same meat that was in the fried potato ball, so we were over it pretty quickly.   The Tipioco was just that, Typical...nothing out of this world, but it did the trick and we were stuffed.Price was good, plenty of food.    Ambiance - none.  There was no one in there on a Friday nite.  2 other couples showed up to dine while we were there, and someone came in to set up a keyboard near the door.   No one ever played, perhaps things get happenin' after 9pm?   Now, here's the whammy that precludes us from wanting to return.When we got the tab, we presented the Restaurant.com to our server.  She seemed confused, and went in back for a moment.   She came back, stating "we don't accept these".   What ?  We responded that we just purchased it this week.  She continued " Management doesn't like the new process/ownership....mutter mutter, mumble..."  I pulled up the live listing on my iPhone to show her the Rest.com was still available that moment.   She didn't care.  My wife stated that they should have a sign on the door or something.  (note- This was over 2 weeks ago, and the rest.com is still available online today).    We could care less on the reasons management doesn't like rest.com.  If it's up, honor it!I responded that the rest.com was the only reason we even came in here, and by the looks of it, they need all the customers that they can get since it was a ghost town.   I proclaimed "You've just drove away new customers.  We like to dine out, consider ourselves 'foodies' and we love sharing new places with our friends and family. I emailed management, but as I expected, I got no response.   So, take heed in dining here.

46.description: I cannot believe what just happened! I went here tonight w/ my husband and arrived to a full house and found one waitress who was also the hostess (not that she even attempted to greet us), the bartender, & the bus boy. It was about 7:30pm and there were 6 tables including us and one very large group. About 20 minutes in, she comes to take our order. Mid sentence she walks away saying the kitchen is calling her. A family of 4 walks in right around the time we make our order. They stand at  the door kind of clueless since there is no one around and finally sit at one of the open tables. We ordered tostones in what is now 30 minutes. a long while later, I see her give them to the table that got there when we ordered. I mention to her that we've been waiting for ours for quite some time. Just as a woman at the table next to us grabs one,  the waitress (w/out a word) snatches the plate from that table, walks to the bar, puts it down, grabs something else then brings my husband and I those same tostones!!!! What in the world??!!!!!!! Then she tried to tell us they were different ones when she was in my field of vision the entire time!  When I told her I didn't want those tostones the other family had already dug into, she attempted to say it was a different order and that they were making the other table a new batch. HUH??? That made no sense whatsoever. I canceled the toston order entirely since I knew I'd end up with the same batch either way. She gave me an attitude as I canceled! If You can't handle the crowds, why do all these groupon or whatever promotion you're running?!! I could have cut her some slack for being so busy but that was just disgusting and did not sit well with me. Terrible!  About an hour in at this point, (the other table has not yet received their "new" tostones yet either), they walk out. My husband and I followed. That's why restaurants fail so quickly, garbage management!  Never again! Oh, then i get home to an email from Restaurant dot Com saying "thank you for using your coupon"! I never got it back from her after giving it to her upon ordering and they had the nerve to cash it!!!!!! (SMH)

1.description: Yesssss!!!! Just found my new Cuban spot. Absolutely amazing and I ordered delivery. Ropa vieja was incredibly moist, tender, and tasty. The jibarito with pork was also great; I may try the beef next time. The Cuban sampler with yucca frita and empanada are just like my mom makes. And finally the chicken noodle soup is perfect for an upset stomach when your sick. Platanos and rice were spot on.

55.description: A friend of mine took me here after work one day.  I have to say I was impressed with the family oriented vibe of this place.  I had broiled chicken with rice and beans and baked Yuca with garlic sauce (delicioso).  Would definitely come here again.

9.description: Five stars for the food, authentic & delicious Cuban food that comes with a very decent price. My parents were born and raised and Cuba and hail this place as the most authentic Cuban spot they've found in Chicago. The service, in our experience, has been attentive and friendly.However, the location is pretty lackluster and, thus, the place is also usually pretty dead. In another location this place may fare better, but it's also a great hidden gem within the otherwise barren neighborhood.

26.description: This is a 3.5 star review based on a 3 from the husband and a 4 from me.  We came in on a Saturday night around 6:30 or so and were surprised that there weren't more people there.  We ordered the sampler plate for two which came with 4 tostones, 1 empanada (beef) 2 croquettas (1 chicken and 1 ham) and a ground beef potato ball.  All was delicious and we were excited for the main meals.  One note - it does take a while to get served - indicating they are really cooking this stuff to order, which is good!Husband went with the baked pork chops - 2 huge pork chops about an inch thick arrived along with black beans and rice and plantains.  I went with the breaded skirt steak and the cuban rice (which just seems like the black beans and white rice mixed up together and heated...) and plantains.  I liked the white rice better, I am afraid, but the steak was good.  Husband did not like that the pork chops were so thick and only made it through one before he was stuffed.  The price point is slightly higher than other places in the area (Senor Pan, for one), so I guess I can see why the place isn't crowded since this area is not going to support a place that charges $12-$15 for a main dish.  I would come back and try the shrimp or red snapper for sure, but I'm not sure the husband will be up for it when he knows he likes other places more.  And, parking is horrible.  There is nothing on Fullerton and the side streets are completely full with the residents who live there - we drove around for ten minutes to find something.

25.description: Enjoyable dining experience overall. We had the appetizer platter for 4.  Loved the empanadas and papas rellenas. Hubby liked the ham croqueta.  I did not. The fried yucca was fried yucca. Can't really go wrong there! Surprisingly the tostones needed salt! Liked the fact that they weren't super thick but they were bland. Maybe it's just me but I tend to soak mine in garlic salt water before frying and salting them afterwards. Thought that's the way it was supposed to be done! Just saying.  But oh, they give you this basket of bread that is so buttery and garlicky and yummy. We attacked it and it was gone in less than 5 minutes. Unfortunately it was just a tease because when we asked for more there was no melted garlicky goodness drizzled over the top! Boo. Anyhow.  My mother inlaw and I had sangria which was ok. Hubby and father inlaw had batidos de mamey which they loved. On to the dinners. We ordered: Shrimp and calamari in salsa Criolla- good; Bistec marinero (T-bone and shrimp with a garlic Criolla sauce)- good; Rabo Encendido-AWESOME (so awesome I felt like snatching it out of my husbands hands); and the Lechon asado-salty but tender. All of the dinners included white rice, black beans, and maduros. The waitress was really friendly and the restaurant and the restroom were clean. All in all we will be back to try other items on the menu. Probably sooner rather than later. That bread! OH!

12.description: Love this place!  Both the cuban sandwich and ropa veija are amazing.

59.description: Came here with a travelzoo special. $29 for an appetizer, 2 entrees, 2 desserts, and 2 mojitos.Appetizer: shrimp ceviche w/ fried plaintains - a smart idea serving it with fried plaintains, but there wasn't enough for the big bowl of ceviche. The ceviche was extremely sour and that's all I tasted.Entree 1: me, pallomilla encebollada (steak and grilled onions) - love that it came with a lot of grilled onions, however, the steak was a bit rough, has decent flavor though.Entree 2: bf, carne asada (grilled skirt steak) - hmmmMmmmm this was cooked to perfection. Medium rare at its finest! Very flavorful, but it would be nice if the onions were also grilled instead of raw. (Definitely will ask for grill onions next time!)Dessert 1: tres leche cake - super sweetDessert 2: coco flan - this is very good, more on the dense sideMojitos: they were wayyyy too minty. I understand that's what mojitos are made of, but when you are choking on the mint than there definitely is too much! We didn't want to throw it out so we chugged it. Eckkk it didn't taste good with our food.Overall, a decent place, but if I came here without a special coupon I wouldn't order certain things.

21.description: What can I say about D Cuba?  I read the review here on Yelp and noticed one of my friends Carlos had done a review on this restaurant.  I wanted a nice Latin restaurant to take my mom on mothers day.  The places in Humboldt park are good, but the atmosphere around the places were not the best.  So I took a chance and took my wife and mom to D Cuba.  Absolutely Amazing!  It was the perfect mothers day dinner I could've asked for.  The waiters greeted us with top notch professionalism.  The ambiance was just what I wanted for mom.  Latin feel, nice Latin music.  We ordered our food from the great choices on the menu and when they arrived they were absolutely delicious.  I had the Lechon Asado and it was juicy and tasty.  Mom went with the Jibarito and loved it.  My wife had a steak and loved it!!! The waiters were courteous and attentive.  They kind of left us for a while towards the end, but that's because a slew of people arrived after us and they were busy.  Highly recommend this place

17.description: The service was pretty decent. We went in the middle of Saturday, it wasn't crowded, the waitress was pleasant. The food took some time, but I figured it was made to order. The food was fresh, tasty, authentic and just delicious. My 5yr old loved his meal all the same, we are Caribbean so he is use to eating rice, beans, etc. They don't have a children's menu.  I definitely will be back to try something else.

10.description: Ok...I said I'd follow up with a review...5 stars! I love this place! We had the rope vieja and the lechon. Everything was cooked and seasoned to perfection. The drinks were spot on and very reasonable. We had no issues with the service despite it being a somewhat busy night. I ate at many cuban restaurants down in Florida and this tops most. Highly recommend.

5.description: The food is not worth the wait!! Customer service is awful!We arrived at the establishment a little after 12:00 p.m. We informed the waitress we were on our lunch hour and asked if our order could be expedited.There were only two other people in the restaurant when we arrived.We ordered tostones, and two jibarito sandwiches, plus one additional sandwich to go. Not a very complicated order.The couple that was seated when we arrived received their meal shortly after we were seated. So, it stands to reason that no other guests were waiting to be served.It was understood that it was noon, typically a busy time for restaurants. We saw only 1 carry out order picked up during the time we were there, just in case we were thinking that there were a great number of orders for carry out, which would account for the delay in getting our food. If that was the case, we were never informed.It took 57 minutes for our order to arrive and it was missing one sandwich. We then had to quickly ask the server to wrap the order to go. It took an additional 10 minutes for the order to be completed.. and the waitress handed me the bag so I could wrap up my own order. There was no apology, no I'm sorry for the delay, not a word. I love the food, but will think twice before ever visiting D'Cuba again, additionally, I will advise others to steer clear as well!

3.description: The food is great, but I always second guess whether or not I want to get food from here because they're EXTREMELY SLOW. Take out takes just as long.I've been here several times and I have yet to understand why it takes them so long to bring you your food. Granted, there's only ever one waiter/waitress, but the times that I've been here the place has been pretty empty, so why it takes a good hour to be served remains a mystery.If D'cuba didn't have such a ridiculous wait time, I wouldn't think twice about giving them 5 stars. The food is that good.Bottom line: if you're in search of awesome authentic Cuban cuisine, this is the place to go. However, if a quick bite is what you need, look elsewhere.Ps. They no longer serve alcohol, but it is BYOB. $5 cork fee.

35.description: My boyfriend and I came here on a Travelzoo coupon and two things happened:1) We stuffed our faces to the point where, after proverbially unbottoning my top pants button, I wished I had another one to unbutton2) Knew we had to tell our friends all about itOf all the Cuban food I've ever had, the food here had the best flavor for the best value (even if we'd paid full price). I've eaten at fancy Cuban places and holes-in the wall, and this was somewhere in between. The decor feels very dated and very rather unmatched to the tasty morsels you're about to eat, but that's not really the reason you make the trek out west to this place. It really is about the food, of which we had zero gripes.The chicken empanadas and chicken croquetas (chicken seemed to be the only option available that night, but did not disappoint) were perfectly cooked, the marinated meat in the empanada being especially flavorful. I ordered the whole red snapper ("Are you sure? It still has eyes," warned the waitress. I loved it.) was remarkable, entirely moist, crispy, and expertly prepared. My boyfriend's ropa vieja was the ropa vieja I had always hoped to find: not dry, not overpowered by the olive flavor, and well-balanced with its spices. His side of yuca with garlic sauce was phenomenal and my side of black beans and rice was solid, but barely touched on account of my mouth practically shutting things down for the evening.Also remarkable, the sangria: among the only properly-made sangrias I've had in this city, where the white wine actually complimented the fruit. And the flan. Holy crap, the flan. Every bite a gooey, delicate burst of vanilla with the creaminess you rarely find in such custards these days. This was no afterthought dessert. This felt like someone's secret recipe. I made room for it and I was hooked.It's a bit of a trek, and not exactly in a neighborhood with ambiance, but worth it for folks for whom quality preparation is more important than the print on the curtains you'll be staring at.

19.description: Classic Cuban fare. Simple family-run atmosphere. Terribly slow service. We waited an hour after ordering for our entrees to be served, but everything was fresh and clearly made to order. Mojitos are meh. Tasted like Sprite.

28.description: Their Masas De Puerco Fritas was one of the best outside of Cuba. I'm saying this after I have tried many other Cuban restaurant around the country.Black beans & rice also rocks. Just awesome. I had been their twice, and was never disappointed by their food. Although their service could be improved a bit, hey, after you eat great tasting food, anything is alright.Recommended.

45.description: I came here once with my boyfriend because we were craving Cuban food.  We ordered two cafes con leche, a cuban and a steak sandwich.  That's all.  We waited for about an hour and we only received our cafe because we reminded the waitress that we had been waiting for a while.  Well, about  5 other groups came in after us and got their food before us.  My bf and I were sitting there, with our stomachs rumbling and not getting any attention from the waitress.  By then we were pissed so we just told the waitress that we had to go and if she could please cancel our order.  When we had arrived there was only one table besides us.  Once we were leaving there was about 5 full tables and everybody was getting their food.  The waitress was very nonchalant about us cancelling our orders, she didn't seem to care that we had been there before everybody and not gotten our food.  We ordered two sandwiches, a fairly simple meal compared to everybody around us getting ceviches, tostones, steaks, etc.  The chef walked out of the kitchen and was having lively conversations with some of the groups.  Dude, seriously where is our food?  I walked out of there mad and hungry!  What a bad combination.Fix your customer service D' Cuba! Your staff should be working with a sense of urgency and should be understanding of their customers.  I work in the food business as well, and I know it can be hectic at times but your restaurant wasn't even that busy the day I went.

33.description: There I was standing face-to-face with the mother of all appetites: the beau and I were ravenous. Our desire to eat something far beyond the greasy Chinese food down the street or the lackluster "Mexican" place around the corner outweighed any immediate need to consider going elsewhere.Then there she was: D'Cuba.I bought a restaurants.com gift certificate to use with our meal. However, I would have come here without it regardless. The prices are just right and the food...God, the food.I believe my boyfriend and I got a chicken empenada, a steak fajita, a whole chicken (forgot the name), a Pina Colada that was to die for, and complimentary beans and rice. After the certificate ws applied, we paid roughly $30. It. Was. Amazing. I have no idea what they put in those beans -- possibly crack -- but they were the best black beans of my life. The service was a bit slow but well worth the wait. It's in a very random area that is a little hard to get to, especially since I was taking public transportation from the south side. BUT, that does not discount the fantabulousness of the food here. I am planning on going back this weekend. My stomach cannot wait!

43.description: I came here because I bought a Travelzoo voucher. I will not be coming back.We drove up to the place and it looked like a hole in the wall and it had only 2 occupied tables on a Saturday night. We were even hesitant to walk in!We had a new waitress that was very very attentive, and helped us make our choices... We ordered 2 homemade sangrias, D' Cuba combination ( 2 personas incluye 2 croquetas de jamon o pollo. 1 empanada (no cangrejo) 1 papa rellena, 4 tostones y yuca frita ), El Típico (Grilled pork, Black Cuban rice and yuca w/mojo), Ropa vieja / Old Clothes (Shredded beef in tomato sauce with onion, green and red peppers, Flan de vanilla (vanilla custard)Sangrias: filled with fresh fruit and was actually very goodD'Cuba combination appetizer: the sausage looking thing was okay, dry and eh. The tostones were pretty good, but still pretty darn dry. The potato ball thing was actually pretty good! The puff thing we didn't even try.. It just didn't look appetizing.El Tipico: the pork pieces were half fat and half meat... I had to cut off a loooot of my meat, it was soooo much fat! Wtf? The rice wasn't bad, the meat in it was a bit overdone. The yaca w/mojo was pretty disgusting..mooshy, flavorless, just ick.Ropa vieja: the translation of the name of the dish for sure describes the taste of this whole dish! Old clothes! The meat was not chewable, my bf felt like a cow endlessly chewing the first piece of meat he tried! He gave me a small piece to try and I was chewing for a long time! The rice was very very dry.. The whole dish was not edible so pretty much the whole dish was not touched.. Wait no. He ate the grilled peppers!Flan de vanilla: after a couple of tries neither the bf nor I wanted to touch it, sweet, but slimy (I know it usually is but it was not edible slimy) . Just not good.The servers were very friendly, but that didn't help the bad food. If you see a travelzoo, groupon, etc, offer for this place, pass it up, you are better off spending your money elsewhere!

2.description: I really want to give them 5 stars but I deducted 2 stars for the poor ventilation and slow service. The food is amazing but waiting an hour for pork chop will make you think twice if you want to go back & wait one hour for your food. I would probably call ahead of time to order food before being seated. Overall, the food is delicious!!

18.description: Came here with a travelzoo special. $29 for an appetizer, 2 entrees, 2 desserts, and 2 mojitos.Appetizer: shrimp ceviche w/ fried plaintains - a smart idea serving it with fried plaintains, but there wasn't enough for the big bowl of ceviche. The ceviche was extremely sour and that's all I tasted.Entree 1: me, pallomilla encebollada (steak and grilled onions) - love that it came with a lot of grilled onions, however, the steak was a bit rough, has decent flavor though.Entree 2: bf, carne asada (grilled skirt steak) - hmmmMmmmm this was cooked to perfection. Medium rare at its finest! Very flavorful, but it would be nice if the onions were also grilled instead of raw. (Definitely will ask for grill onions next time!)Dessert 1: tres leche cake - super sweetDessert 2: coco flan - this is very good, more on the dense sideMojitos: they were wayyyy too minty. I understand that's what mojitos are made of, but when you are choking on the mint than there definitely is too much! We didn't want to throw it out so we chugged it. Eckkk it didn't taste good with our food.Overall, a decent place, but if I came here without a special coupon I wouldn't order certain things.

41.description: Good food.  Great svc.  My favorite is the tostones relleno con lechon.  To die for!

52.description: We went here on the 2nd to last day of a Travelzoo deal so there was a Kitchen Nightmares moment.  You know, the service is great until it got busy and then completely fell apart.  But I forgive mostly because of the food but also because the guy who waited on us did take the time to talk to us, help us decide etc.It was interesting to see people sit so long that you could tell they were angry until they took a bite of food and.....smiles!To begin the mojito was one of the best.  I can't explain why other than it was perfectly balanced and so delicious! And this is going to sound weird but we couldn't get enough of the bread that they put on the table. The black beans and rice that came with the meal.  Outstanding!!  The beans were smokey and the rice just sucked up all of that sauce.  We had shrimp ceviche which reminded me of a refreshing version of what you get when you order shrimp cocktail in mexico.  Minus the avocado.I had more shrimp for dinner.  The sauce was like it had beer in it.  Really interesting.  My boyfriend had steak which I could tell he liked b/c he didn't speak during dinner :)For our dessert I had the coconut flan which may have started out a little too sweet but I ate it all.  He had the guava empanada which were good but not great.  My boyfriend's dad is from Cuba.  When he's visiting from FL we are definitely taking him here.  This is hands down the best Cuban food that we've tried in the city.

50.description: I wish this place was closer to my house! I went there to have a lunch with a friend of mine, and oh my! I love those banana chips, they are very yumi and the mojito was amazing.  The meat was well cooked, and of course as a true Brazilian I have high expectations for rice and beans and this place met them perfectly! I loved the seasoning, the atmosphere, the people working there are very nice as well. Thumbs up, and again, i wish they were closer to me so I could go eat there at least once a week!!! :D

4.description: If I could give them NO stars, I would.I call before and they tell me that they don't take reservations but tables are available for a party of 5. I show up no tables are available they say it's a 30 min wait. While waiting they seat a party of 15 that was waiting. After about 15 minutes of waiting they tell me that there is a party of 8 waiting before me, but they left and will be back later. Oh no! How unprofessional can they get!! They should have told me when I first came in that there was a party of 15 & a party of 8 waiting before me, not after waiting 15 minutes! I will NEVER go back!! I'm in the industry so I'm normally very understanding and patient, but they were just wrong!

6.description: This place is a true gem. The ambiance is fun, clean and beautiful. The food is delicious, fresh and well presented. The prices are very reasonable. I ate the best sandwich I've had in a long time, you have to try the Jibarito! If you ever have the opportunity you should go to D'Cuba. Cheers,Jacob

22.description: This place has the best Jibaritos I have tasted in Chicago not to forget the  coffee is completely delicious.  It's nice to have a restaurant in the area were you can actually sit and enjoy the food and the experience.

15.description: Use to be our go to place for MANY family celebrations.  No more.  Service has declined and they no longer serve their amazing  mango margaritas only byob.

57.description: "Did you grab the leftovers?""No, did you?""No, do you want to go back?""Meh."This sums up the quality of food at D'Cuba.  The waitress was terrible, never so much as smiled when we thanked her repeatedly for our food.  While the appetizer was tasty (tostones with roasted pork) the food got consistently worse throughout the evening.  Hubs said his chicken fajitas tasted just like a La Choy frozen stir fry meal.  His dessert (guava with cheese) was overly sweetened, syrupy guava FROM A CAN with slices of chihuahua cheese.  Hisf frozen margarita, while very strong, was a very awkward blend of blended and on the rocks, meaning there were HUGE chunks of ice throughout.  My steak and shrimp fajitas were much the same, tasted kinda frozen.  I got the coconut cake for dessert, which was very good but had buttercream frosting, which didn't seem right to me.  In fact, there is a lot about this place that just doesn't seem quite right.  For all the restaurants in Chicago, I don't see why we would make a return visit to D'Cuba.

20.description: It doesn't get better than this! Amazing! Truly authentic Cuban like you would find in rural Cuba or Miami Beach. Owner/chef was born in Cuba. It is like having your Cuban mother making you authentic, home cooked meals in the kitchen.

36.description: I enjoyed my experience at D'Cuba. I went on a Saturday evening and the place was packed. It's a small restaurant so the seating was a little tight. But the service and food were really good and I would definitely go back.

14.description: Solid cuban restaurant.  Good empanadas...crab one delicious.  Black beans were fantastic and ropa Vieja was tremendous.  Picadillo was like moms..great homemade flavor. Service Better at Paladar otherwise would have been a five.

0.description: Well what can I say about this place aside that is full of adult beverages.  If your looking for wine,  vodka, beer, etc you are bound to find it here. I came in recently in search of a gift for a friend who enjoys a good wine with her dinner and this place was convienent as it is located in the Plaza and there is ample parking.  I got a red wine for about $10 and my friend told me it was good. The store is clean and well organized.

3.description: Their mangonadas are pretty good. I love how they have a variety of different ice cream flavored to choose from. As well as topping for their homemade yogurt. The only thing I dislike is that some of the workers are not friendly at all. And they give the smallest portions ever! The stuff is already a bit pricey and they still try to rip you off. And beware of the cashier! She over charges and doesn't give a receipt. I'd rather go to another place that sell the exact same thing with larger portions and better customer service.

1.description: Everything taste good, Fresh and delicious. Portions can be a little better. The reason I didnt give a 5 star rating is because they never open on time and I have found sometimes they also close earlier than the time posted.

2.description: This place is amazing, we found it with my co-workers when we needed our yogurt fix. It is always very clean, and they serve the most delicious home made yogurt ever, they have delicious juices, The tortas or sandwiches are also very good, and I also like how generous they are with their servings. The only thing that I dislike is that they dont open on time. I really recommend this place if you want super fresh fruit and delicious home made yogurt.

0.description: Best ice cream shop in the area! Great variety and selection. You must try the tortas!

4.description: I was recently craving some ice cream and came across this nearby gem. I originally wanted a sundae but leaned towards a mangonada (mango ice cream, chamoy, and fruit) and let me tell you it was amazing!!! I also took some paletas home to share with my family and they were delighted by the paletas. Awesome spot! Definitely coming back! :D

1.description: I love Mexican food, just not here. First off,  I found the service to be unprofessional as the staff members were so into their convo and I knew they saw me standing there. That should have been the first indication that I should have left before I placed my order, but I was really hungry and on a lunch time crunch. I ordered a chicken burrito, side order of rice, and an hocata. After they dragged to make my lunch I just took it to work. It smelled great but tasted horrible. The chicken was over salted ,as was the rice. I ended up taking only a couple of bites then trashing it, what a disapooitment. Overall, I'd say save your money unless your trying to get high blood pressure.

2.description: Went here for lunch and was minorly confused when I arrived that they might not be open yet.  The staff who was sitting at a table in the empty place assured me that they were and so I decided to give it a try.  I was expecting the menu to mostly be Mexican chicken dishes but the only chicken dish I saw was a 1/2 or full chicken.  The rest of the menu were more expensive seafood options which I was not looking for as a quick lunch break for work.  Since I had chicken on the mind, I got a half chicken with an assortment of sides. The amount of food that I was given between the chicken, sides, and complimentary chips and ceviche was enough to feed 3-4 people.  Which I'm not complaining about at all since I love to pound food at lunch.The actual taste of the food was nothing notable at all and I actually did not feel quite right in the stomach for about 5 days afterwards which was suprising since that has not happened to me before.  I was the only customer the entire time so the atmosphere was strangely quiet and not a place I would be interested in going to even if I wanted to check out the seafood menu.

0.description: I tried take-out once and thought the chicken asada dinner was pretty great, with a big grilled jalapeño and really, really good thick tortillas.Grilled chicken does take a little time to cook, I like the reviewer complaining that it smelled like grilled chicken in there, that was probably... the chickens on the grill. If you don't like the smell of chickens being grilled, enjoy your Taco Bell.So last night we went back to try eating there. The atmosphere isn't great... it's drafty (the owner?/manager? was wearing a parka inside) and they were blasting ranchero videos and a hispanic talk show on the big-screen TV. But the service is friendly and the food is great. we got a basket of fresh tostadas with good salsa, and a plate of lime-cilantro sauce and ceviche. I ordered their odd-looking pollo asado quesadilla as an appetizer, and it was the best quesadilla I've ever had. I have no idea what they do to it, but I'm pretty sure it's not good for your arteries.The pollo asado was great again, and my wife got a giant plate of camarones diablo, (spicy shrimp). She said she just wanted to drink the leftover sauce when she was done. They're somehow related to the fancier mexican seafood place Las Islas Marias (which I've heard mixed things about) so they serve mostly seafood dishes, and chicken and carne asada, that's pretty much it. I don't like seafood much, but I'll eat that chicken anytime.You can BYO beer and wine, too, good to know for next time.
